This O
report O
documents O
the O
program O
and O
the O
outcomes O
of O
Dagstuhl O
Seminar O
15512 O

“ O
Debating O
Technologies O

The O
seminar O
brought O
together O
leading O
researchers O
from O
computational O
linguistics O
, O
information O
retrieval O
, O
semantic O
web O
, O
and O
database O
communities O
to O
discuss O
the O
possibilities O
, O
implications O
, O
and O
necessary O
actions O
for O
the O
establishment O
of O
a O
new O
interdisciplinary O
research O
community O
around O
debating O
technologies O
. O

31 O
participants O
from O
22 O
different O
institutions O
took O
part O
in O
16 O
sessions O
that O
included O
34 O
talks O
, O
13 O
themed O
discussions O
, O
three O
system O
demonstrations O
, O
and O
a O
hands O
- O
on O
“ O
unshared O
” O
task O
. O

Seminar O
December O
13–18 O
, O
2015 O
http O
www.dagstuhl.de/15512 O
1998 O

-DOCSTART- O

Ranking O
model O
construction O
is O
an O
important O
topic O
in O
information O
retrieval O
and O
web O
mining O
. O

Recently O
, O
many O
approaches O
based O
on O
the O
idea O
of O
x201C;learning O
to O
rank&#x201D O
; O
have O
been O
proposed O
for O
this O
task O
and O
most O
of O
them O
attempt O
to O
score O
all O
documents O
of O
different O
queries O
by O
resorting O
to O
a O
single O
function O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
distributional O
similarity O
measure O
for O
query O
- O
dependent O
ranking O
. O

In O
the O
query O
- O
dependent O
ranking O
framework O
, O
an O
individual O
ranking O
model O
is O
constructed O
for O
each O
training O
query O
with O
associated O
documents O
. O

When O
a O
new O
query O
is O
asked O
, O
the O
documents O
retrieved O
for O
the O
new O
query O
are O
ranked O
according O
to O
the O
scores O
determined O
by O
a O
joint O
ranking O
model O
which O
is O
combined O
from O
the O
individual O
models O
of O
similar O
training O
queries O
. O

The O
distributional O
similarity O
measure O
is O
used O
to O
calculate O
the O
similarities O
between O
queries O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
our O
method O
is O
more O
effective O
than O
other O
approaches O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Using O
context O
to O
improve O
retrieval O
performance O
is O
a O
current O
challenge O
within O
the O
discipline O
and O
presents O
a O
major O
challenge O
to O
the O
research O
community O
. O

In O
this O
thesis O
, O
the O
context O
of O
documents O
formed O
via O
semantic O
associations O
is O
utilized O
within O
the O
Language O
Modeling O
( O
LM O
) O
approach O
for O
< O
i O
> O
ad O
hoc</i O

> O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Users O
of O
commercial O
legal O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
systems O
often O
want O
argument O
retrieval O
( O
AR O
retrieving O
not O
merely O
sentences O
with O
highlighted O
terms O
, O
but O
arguments O
and O
argument O
- O
related O
information O
. O

Using O
a O
corpus O
of O
argumentannotated O
legal O
cases O
, O
we O
conducted O
a O
baseline O
study O
of O
current O
legal O
IR O
systems O
in O
responding O
to O
standard O
queries O
. O

We O
identify O
ways O
in O
which O
they O
can O
not O
meet O
the O
need O
for O
AR O
and O
illustrate O
how O
additional O
argument O
- O
relevant O
information O
could O
address O
some O
of O
those O
inadequacies O
. O

We O
conclude O
by O
indicating O
our O
approach O
to O
developing O
an O
AR O
system O
to O
retrieve O
arguments O
from O
legal O
decisions O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
chapter O
provides O
a O
survey O
of O
the O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
in O
the O
field O
of O
Visual O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
VIR O
) O
systems O
, O
particularly O
Content O
- O
Based O
Visual O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
CBVIR O
) O
systems O
. O

It O
presents O
the O
main O
concepts O
and O
system O
design O
issues O
, O
reviews O
many O
research O
prototypes O
and O
commercial O
solutions O
currently O
available O
and O
points O
out O
promising O
research O
directions O
in O
this O
area O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
PIKM O
2012 O
workshop O
is O
the O
5th O
of O
its O
kind O
after O
4 O
successful O
PhD O
workshops O
at O
ACM O
CIKM O
. O

This O
PhD O
workshop O
invites O
papers O
that O
describe O
the O
Ph.D. O
dissertation O
proposals O
of O
doctoral O
students O
in O
any O
of O
the O
CIKM O
areas O
: O
databases O
, O
information O
retrieval O
, O
data O
mining O
and O
knowledge O
management O
. O

Interdisciplinary O
work O
across O
these O
tracks O
is O
particularly O
encouraged O
. O

This O
year O
PIKM O
has O
received O
around O
25 O
submissions O
from O
over O
12 O
countries O
across O
the O
globe O
, O
among O
which O
10 O
have O
been O
accepted O
as O
full O
papers O
for O
oral O
presentation O
while O
4 O
have O
been O
accepted O
as O
short O
ones O
for O
poster O
presentation O
. O

The O
selection O
has O
been O
conducted O
based O
on O
reviews O
submitted O
by O
an O
expert O
team O
comprising O
21 O
PC O
members O
spanning O
12 O
countries O
and O
6 O
continents O
with O
a O
good O
balance O
of O
industry O
and O
academia O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
and O
figurative O
language O
processing O
( O
FLP O
) O
could O
scarcely O
be O
more O
different O
in O
their O
treatment O
of O
language O
and O
meaning O
. O

IR O
views O
language O
as O
an O
open O
- O
ended O
set O
of O
mostly O
stable O
signs O
with O
which O
texts O
can O
be O
indexed O
and O
retrieved O
, O
focusing O
more O
on O
a O
text O
’s O
potential O
relevance O
than O
its O
potential O
meaning O
. O

In O
contrast O
, O
FLP O
views O
language O
as O
a O
system O
of O
unstable O
signs O
that O
can O
be O
used O
to O
talk O
about O
the O
world O
in O
creative O
new O
ways O
. O

There O
is O
another O
key O
difference O
: O
IR O
is O
practical O
, O
scalable O
and O
robust O
, O
and O
in O
daily O
use O
by O
millions O
of O
casual O
users O
. O

FLP O
is O
neither O
scalable O
nor O
robust O
, O
and O
not O
yet O
practical O
enough O
to O
migrate O
beyond O
the O
lab O
. O

This O
paper O
thus O
presents O
a O
mutually O
beneficial O
hybrid O
of O
IR O
and O
FLP O
, O
one O
that O
enriches O
IR O
with O
new O
operators O
to O
enable O
the O
non O
- O
literal O
retrieval O
of O
creative O
expressions O
, O
and O
which O
also O
transplants O
FLP O
into O
a O
robust O
, O
scalable O
framework O
in O
which O
practical O
applications O
of O
linguistic O
creativity O
can O
be O
implemented O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

GiveALink.org O
is O
a O
social O
bookmarking O
site O
where O
users O
may O
donate O
and O
view O
their O
personal O
bookmark O
files O
online O
securely O
. O

The O
bookmarks O
are O
analyzed O
to O
build O
a O
new O
generation O
of O
intelligent O
information O
retrieval O
techniques O
to O
recommend O
, O
search O
, O
and O
personalize O
the O
Web O
. O

GiveALink O
does O
not O
use O
tags O
, O
content O
, O
or O
links O
in O
the O
submitted O
Web O
pages O
. O

Instead O
we O
present O
a O
semantic O
similarity O
measure O
for O
URLs O
that O
takes O
advantage O
both O
of O
the O
hierarchical O
structure O
in O
the O
bookmark O
files O
of O
individual O
users O
, O
and O
of O
collaborative O
filtering O
across O
users O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
we O
build O
a O
recommendation O
and O
search O
engine O
from O
ranking O
algorithms O
based O
on O
popularity O
and O
novelty O
measures O
extracted O
from O
the O
similarity O
- O
induced O
network O
. O

Search O
results O
can O
be O
personalized O
using O
the O
bookmarks O
submitted O
by O
a O
user O
. O

We O
evaluate O
a O
subset O
of O
the O
proposed O
ranking O
measures O
by O
conducting O
a O
study O
with O
human O
subjects O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
work O
presents O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
technique O
based O
on O
algorithmic O
information O
theory O
( O
using O
the O
normalized O
compression O
distance O
statistical O
data O
outlier O
detection O
, O
and O
a O
novel O
database O
structure O
. O

The O
paper O
shows O
how O
they O
all O
can O
be O
integrated O
to O
retrieve O
information O
from O
generic O
databases O
using O
long O
text O
- O
based O
queries O
. O

Two O
important O
problems O
are O
addressed O
. O

On O
the O
one O
hand O
, O
we O
analyze O
and O
tyr O
to O
solve O
the O
detection O
of O
a O
particular O
case O
of O
false O
positives O
: O
when O
the O
distance O
among O
two O
documents O
is O
outlyingly O
low O
but O
there O
is O
not O
actual O
similarity O
. O

On O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
way O
to O
structure O
the O
database O
such O
that O
the O
similarity O
distance O
estimation O
scales O
well O
with O
the O
length O
of O
the O
size O
of O
the O
query O
. O

All O
design O
choices O
are O
justified O
with O
an O
experimental O
evaluation O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
practice O
the O
most O
advanced O
field O
of O
quantum O
information O
science O
is O
quantum O
cryptography O
. O

The O
best O
known O
example O
of O
quantum O
cryptography O
is O
quantum O
key O
distribution O
( O
QKD O
) O
which O
offers O
an O
information O
- O
theoretically O
secure O
solution O
to O
the O
key O
exchange O
problem O
. O

There O
are O
QKD O
protocols O
which O
rely O
on O
a O
quantum O
channel O
that O
is O
able O
to O
transmit O
single O
photons O
. O

This O
can O
be O
implemented O
by O
using O
very O
low O
- O
power O
coherent O
light O
field O
, O
where O
values O
of O
bits O
are O
encoded O
into O
the O
polarization O
state O
of O
photons O
. O

Therefore O
, O
it O
is O
important O
to O
know O
the O
photon O
number O
distribution O
of O
the O
light O
source O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
the O
reconstruction O
of O
photon O
statistics O
for O
different O
pulsed O
light O
sources O
radiating O
at O
850 O
nm O
( O
a O
common O
choice O
for O
free O
space O
quantum O
communication O
using O
only O
a O
single O
on O
- O
off O
photon O
counting O
detector O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
methodological O
approach O
to O
achieve O
the O
elicited O
research O
objectives O
is O
presented O
in O
this O
study O
. O

The O
study O
will O
employ O
an O
experimental O
methodology O
involving O
testing O
of O
algorithms O
to O
identify O
the O
suitable O
algorithm O
for O
an O
optimized O
process O
of O
information O
retrieval O
. O

The O
algorithm O
that O
presents O
a O
better O
precision O
in O
the O
personalized O
IR O
in O
web O
log O
mining O
represents O
the O
core O
value O
of O
the O
architecture O
that O
this O
study O
presents O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
the O
WIRE O
( O
Web O
Information O
Retrieval O
Environment O
) O
project O
and O
focus O
on O
some O
details O
of O
its O
crawler O
component O
. O

The O
WIRE O
crawler O
is O
a O
scalable O
, O
highly O
configurable O
, O
high O
performance O
, O
open O
- O
source O
Web O
crawler O
which O
we O
have O
used O
to O
study O
the O
characteristics O
of O
large O
Web O
collections O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Question O
classification O
is O
a O
key O
task O
in O
many O
question O
answering O
applications O
. O

Nearly O
all O
previous O
work O
on O
question O
classification O
has O
used O
machine O
learning O
and O
knowledge O
- O
based O
methods O
. O

This O
working O
note O
presents O
an O
embedding O
based O
Bag O
- O
ofWords O
method O
and O
Recurrent O
Neural O
Network O
to O
achieve O
an O
automatic O
question O
classification O
in O
the O
code O
- O
mixed O
BengaliEnglish O
text O
. O

We O
build O
two O
systems O
that O
classify O
questions O
mostly O
at O
the O
sentence O
level O
. O

We O
used O
a O
recurrent O
neural O
network O
for O
extracting O
features O
from O
the O
questions O
and O
Logistic O
regression O
for O
classification O
. O

We O
conduct O
experiments O
on O
Mixed O
Script O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
MSIR O
) O
Task O
1 O
dataset O
at O
FIRE2016 O
. O

The O
experimental O
result O
shows O
that O
the O
proposed O
method O
is O
appropriate O
for O
the O
question O
classification O
task O
. O

Concepts O

systems O
~ O
Clustering O
and O
classification O
Information O
systems O
~ O
Question O
answering O
Computing O
methodologies O
~ O

latent O
representations O

-DOCSTART- O

There O
is O
a O
growing O
realisation O
that O
relevant O
information O
will O
be O
accessible O
increasingly O
across O
media O
and O
genres O
, O
across O
languages O
and O
across O
modalities O
. O

The O
retrieval O
of O
such O
information O
will O
depend O
on O
time O
, O
place O
, O
history O
of O
interaction O
, O
task O
in O
hand O
, O
and O
a O
range O
of O
other O
factors O
that O
are O
not O
given O
explicitly O
but O
are O
implicit O
in O
the O
interaction O
and O
ambient O
environment O
, O
namely O
the O
< O
i O
> O
context</i O
IR O
research O
is O
now O
conducted O
in O
multimedia O
, O
multi O
- O
lingual O
, O
and O
multi O
- O
modal O
environments O
but O
largely O
out O
of O
context O
( O

Jarvelin O
& O
amp O
; O
Ingwersen O
, O
2004 O
; O
Ingwersen O
& O
amp O
; O
Jarvelin O
, O
forthcoming O
However O
, O
such O
contextual O
data O
can O
be O
used O
effectively O
to O
constrain O
retrieval O
of O
information O
thereby O
reducing O
the O
complexity O
of O
the O
retrieval O
process O
. O

To O
achieve O
this O
, O
context O
models O
for O
different O
modalities O
will O
need O
to O
be O
developed O
so O
that O
they O
can O
be O
deployed O
effectively O
to O
enhance O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

Thus O
truly O
context O
- O
aware O
and O
-dependent O
retrieval O
will O
become O
feasible O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
have O
been O
in O
a O
web O
information O
stage O
, O
by O
new O
information O
management O
technologies O
, O
we O
can O
get O
better O
agricultural O
development O
. O

The O
paper O
introduces O
the O
research O
work O
on O
agricultural O
thesaurus O
and O
ontology O
; O
it O
could O
improve O
the O
agricultural O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Main O
work O
include O
to O
convert O
Chinese O
Agricultural O
Thesaurus O
( O
CAT O
) O
to O
the O
agricultural O
ontology O
, O
this O
can O
use O
traditional O
domain O
knowledge O
directly O
; O
research O
on O
the O
thesauri O
mapping O
between O
different O
languages O
, O
this O
can O
be O
help O
to O
develop O
cross O
languages O
search O
engine O
, O
and O
improve O
the O
ontologies O
mapping O
research O
; O
Based O
on O
all O
these O
works O
, O
the O
paper O
plans O
to O
develop O
cross O
languages O
search O
engine O
to O
index O
and O
search O
web O
information O
. O

retrieval O
models O
have O

for O

, O

to O
a O

body O
of O

. O

, O

briefly O
review O
this O
body O
of O
literature O
along O
with O
a O
discussion O
of O
some O
recent O
trends O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Dealing O
with O
verbose O
( O
or O
long O
) O
queries O
poses O
a O
new O
challenge O
for O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Selecting O
a O
subset O
of O
the O
original O
query O
( O
a O
" O
sub O
- O
query O
has O
been O
shown O
to O
be O
an O
effective O
method O
for O
improving O
these O
queries O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
the O
distribution O
of O
sub O
- O
queries O
subset O
distribution O
is O
formally O
modeled O
within O
a O
well O
- O
grounded O
framework O
. O

Specifically O
, O
sub O
- O
query O
selection O
is O
considered O
as O
a O
sequential O
labeling O
problem O
, O
where O
each O
query O
word O
in O
a O
verbose O
query O
is O
assigned O
a O
label O
of O
" O
keep O
" O
or O
" O
do O
n't O
keep O
A O
novel O
Conditional O
Random O
Field O
model O
is O
proposed O
to O
generate O
the O
distribution O
of O
sub O
- O
queries O
. O

This O
model O
captures O
the O
local O
and O
global O
dependencies O
between O
query O
words O
and O
directly O
optimizes O
the O
expected O
retrieval O
performance O
on O
a O
training O
set O
. O

The O
experiments O
, O
based O
on O
different O
retrieval O
models O
and O
performance O
measures O
, O
show O
that O
the O
proposed O
model O
can O
generate O
high O
- O
quality O
sub O
- O
query O
distributions O
and O
can O
significantly O
outperform O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
techniques O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Proximity O
- O
based O
term O
dependencies O
have O
been O
proposed O
and O
used O
in O
a O
variety O
of O
effective O
retrieval O
models O
. O

The O
execution O
of O
these O
dependency O
models O
is O
commonly O
supported O
through O
the O
use O
of O
positional O
inverted O
indexes O
. O

However O
, O
few O
of O
these O
models O
detail O
how O
instances O
of O
proximate O
terms O
should O
be O
extracted O
from O
the O
lists O
of O
positional O
data O
. O

In O
this O
study O
, O
we O
investigate O
three O
algorithms O
for O
the O
extraction O
of O
windows O
that O
span O
a O
range O
of O
assumptions O
about O
the O
reuse O
of O
terms O
in O
multiple O
window O
instances O
. O

We O
observe O
that O
computed O
collection O
statistics O
of O
unordered O
windows O
are O
significantly O
affected O
by O
the O
choice O
of O
algorithm O
. O

We O
also O
observe O
that O
retrieval O
efficiency O
and O
effectiveness O
of O
a O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
dependence O
model O
are O
not O
significantly O
affected O
by O
the O
selection O
of O
window O
extraction O
algorithm O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Scoring O
documents O
with O
learning O
- O
to O
- O
rank O
( O
LtR O
) O
models O
based O
on O
large O
ensembles O
of O
regression O
trees O
is O
currently O
deemed O
one O
of O
the O
best O
solutions O
to O
effectively O
rank O
query O
results O
to O
be O
returned O
by O
large O
scale O
Information O
Retrieval O
systems O
. O

This O
paper O
investigates O
the O
opportunities O
given O
by O
SIMD O
capabilities O
of O
modern O
CPUs O
to O
the O
end O
of O
efficiently O
evaluating O
regression O
trees O
ensembles O
. O

We O
propose O
V O
- O
QuickScorer O
( O
vQS O
which O
exploits O
SIMD O
extensions O
to O
vectorize O
the O
document O
scoring O
, O
i.e O
to O
perform O
the O
ensemble O
traversal O
by O
evaluating O
multiple O
documents O
simultaneously O
. O

We O
provide O
a O
comprehensive O
evaluation O
of O
vQS O
against O
the O
state O
of O
the O
art O
on O
three O
publicly O
available O
datasets O
. O

Experiments O
show O
that O
vQS O
provides O
speed O
- O
ups O
up O
to O
a O
factor O
of O
3.2x O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
attraction O
of O
hundreds O
of O
millions O
of O
web O
searches O
per O
day O
provides O
significant O
incentive O
for O
many O
content O
providers O
to O
do O
whatever O
is O
necessary O
to O
rank O
highly O
in O
search O
engine O
results O
, O
while O
search O
engine O
providers O
want O
to O
provide O
the O
most O
accurate O
results O
. O

The O
conflicting O
goals O
of O
search O
and O
content O
providers O
are O
adversarial O
, O
and O
the O
use O
of O
techniques O
that O
push O
rankings O
higher O
than O
they O
belong O
is O
often O
called O
search O
engine O
spam O
. O

Such O
methods O
typically O
include O
textual O
as O
well O
as O
link O
- O
based O
techniques O
, O
or O
their O
combination O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
our O
microblog O
realtime O
filtering O
system O
developed O
and O
submitted O
for O
the O
Text O
Retrieval O
Conference O
( O
TREC O
2015 O
) O
microblog O
track O
. O

We O
submitted O
six O
runs O
for O
two O
tasks O
related O
to O
real O
- O
time O
filtering O
by O
using O
various O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
and O
Machine O
Learning O
( O
ML O
) O
techniques O
to O
analyze O
the O
Twitter O
sample O
live O
stream O
and O
match O
relevant O
tweets O
corresponding O
to O
specific O
user O
interest O
profiles O
. O

Evaluation O
results O
demonstrate O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
our O
approach O
as O
we O
achieved O
3 O
of O
the O
top O
7 O
best O
scores O
among O
automatic O
submissions O
across O
all O
participants O
and O
obtained O
the O
best O
( O
or O
close O
to O
best O
) O
scores O
in O
more O
than O
25 O
% O
of O
the O
evaluated O
topics O
for O
the O
real O
- O
time O
mobile O
push O
notification O
task O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
yellow O
pages O
service O
of O
GTE O
SuperPages O
enables O
Web O
users O
to O
flexibly O
search O
through O
liitings O
of O
11 O
million O
businesses O
in O
over O
17000 O
categories O
. O

To O
achieve O
the O
flexibility O
desired O
it O
uses O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
engine O
to O
search O
through O
complex O
listing O
objects O
. O

The O
objects O
themselves O
are O
stored O
in O
an O
object O
database O
. O

The O
use O
of O
the O
IR O
engine O
enables O
us O
to O
create O
an O
index O
that O
spans O
all O
the O
components O
of O
a O
complex O
object O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
web O
search O
, O
understanding O
the O
user O
intent O
plays O
an O
important O
role O
in O
improving O
search O
experience O
of O
the O
end O
users O
. O

Such O
an O
intent O
can O
be O
represented O
by O
the O
categories O
which O
the O
user O
query O
belongs O
to O
. O

In O
this O
work O
, O
we O
propose O
an O
information O
retrieval O
based O
approach O
to O
query O
categorization O
with O
an O
emphasis O
on O
learning O
category O
rankings O
. O

To O
carry O
out O
categorization O
we O
first O
represent O
a O
category O
by O
web O
documents O
( O
from O
Open O
Directory O
Project O
) O
that O
describe O
the O
semantics O
of O
the O
category O
. O

Then O
, O
we O
learn O
the O
category O
rankings O
for O
the O
queries O
using O
' O
learning O
to O
rank O
' O
techniques O
. O

To O
show O
that O
the O
results O
obtained O
are O
consistent O
and O
do O
not O
vary O
across O
datasets O
, O
we O
evaluate O
our O
approach O
on O
two O
datasets O
including O
the O
publicly O
available O
KDD O
Cup O
dataset O
. O

We O
report O
an O
overall O
improvement O
of O
20 O
% O
on O
all O
evaluation O
metrics O
( O
precision O
, O
recall O
and O
F O
- O
measure O
) O
over O
two O
baselines O
: O
a O
text O
categorization O
baseline O
and O
an O
unsupervised O
IR O
baseline O
. O

This O
study O
used O
citation O
analysis O
method O
to O
identify O
the O
40 O
classics O
published O
in O
the O
Journal O
of O
the O
American O
Society O
for O
Information O
Science O
and O
Technology O
from O
1956 O
to O
2007 O
. O

Yhe O
year O
and O
subject O
distributions O
of O
these O
classic O
references O
reflect O
the O
history O
and O
the O
current O
status O
of O
information O
science O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
current O
challenges O
in O
the O
world O
are O
search O
and O
retrieve O
accurate O
information O
from O
the O
massive O
web O
. O

The O
general O
term O
used O
for O
searching O
and O
retrieving O
data O
from O
the O
web O
is O
& O
apos;query&apos O
; O
and O
keyword O
- O
matching O
. O

The O
existing O
structure O
uses O
Personalized O
user O
information O
system O
, O
recommender O
system O
and O
wordnet O
ontology O
. O

The O
Personalized O
user O
information O
system O
used O
to O
increase O
the O
speed O
and O
required O
response O
. O

To O
extract O
user O
likings O
, O
the O
personalized O
user O
information O
system O
explore O
the O
acquirement O
of O
user O
reviews O
by O
supervising O
their O
browsing O
behavior O
. O

In O
Recommender O
system O
the O
people O
rate O
web O
pages O
as O
interesting O
and O
not O
interesting O
and O
it O
responses O
according O
to O
the O
relevant O
feedback O
. O

The O
wordnet O
ontology O
uses O
to O
retrieve O
information O
by O
means O
of O
Synonymy O
, O
Antonymy O
, O
Hyponymy O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
addresses O
the O
task O
of O
providing O
extended O
responses O
to O
questions O
regarding O
specialized O
topics O
. O

This O
task O
is O
an O
amalgam O
of O
information O
retrieval O
, O
topical O
summarization O
, O
and O
Information O
Extraction O
( O
IE O
We O
present O
an O
approach O
which O
draws O
on O
methods O
from O
each O
of O
these O
areas O
, O
and O
compare O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
this O
approach O
with O
a O
query O
- O
focused O
summarization O
approach O
. O

The O
two O
systems O
are O
evaluated O
in O
the O
context O
of O
the O
prosecution O
queries O
like O
those O
in O
the O
DARPA O
GALE O
distillation O
evaluation O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
apply O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
model O
for O
the O
writer O
identification O
task O
. O

A O
set O
of O
local O
features O
is O
defined O
by O
clustering O
the O
graphemes O
produced O
by O
a O
segmentation O
procedure O
. O

Then O
a O
textual O
based O
Information O
Retrieval O
model O
is O
applied O
. O

After O
a O
first O
indexation O
step O
, O
this O
model O
no O
longuer O
requires O
image O
access O
to O
the O
database O
for O
responding O
to O
a O
specific O
query O
, O
thus O
making O
the O
process O
particularly O
effective O
. O

Image O
query O
are O
handwritten O
documents O
projected O
on O
the O
feature O
space O
prior O
to O
the O
retrieval O
of O
the O
suitable O
responses O
. O

The O
method O
is O
tested O
on O
a O
database O
of O
88 O
writers O
and O
proves O
to O
give O
interesting O
results O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
method O
for O
building O
concept O
lattices O
by O
learning O
concepts O
from O
RDF O
annotations O
of O
Web O
documents O
. O

It O
consists O
in O
extracting O
conceptual O
descriptions O
of O
the O
Web O
resources O
from O
the O
RDF O
graph O
gathering O
all O
the O
resource O
annotations O
and O
then O
forming O
concepts O
from O
all O
possible O
subsets O
of O
resources O
each O
such O
subset O
being O
associated O
with O
a O
set O
of O
descriptions O
shared O
by O
the O
resources O
belonging O
to O
it O
. O

The O
concept O
hierarchy O
is O
the O
concept O
lattice O
built O
upon O
a O
context O
built O
from O
the O
power O
context O
family O
representing O
the O
RDF O
graph O
. O

In O
the O
framework O
of O
the O
CoMMA O
European O
IST O
project O
dedicated O
to O
ontologyguided O
Information O
Retrieval O
in O
a O
corporate O
memory O
, O
the O
hierarchy O
of O
the O
so O
learned O
concepts O
will O
enrich O
the O
ontology O
of O
primitive O
concepts O
, O
organize O
the O
documents O
of O
the O
organization O
’s O
Intranet O
and O
then O
improve O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

The O
RDF O
Model O
is O
close O
to O
the O
Simple O
Conceptual O
Graph O
Model O
; O
our O
method O
can O
be O
thus O
generalized O
to O
Simple O
Conceptual O
Graphs O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

An O
extended O
Boolean O
retrieval O
strategy O
has O
previously O
been O
introduced O
in O
which O
the O
individual O
Boolean O
operators O
can O
be O
treated O
more O
or O
less O
strictly O
, O
depending O
on O
the O
perceived O
strength O
of O
association O
of O
the O
query O
terms O
. O

The O
extended O
Boolean O
system O
is O
illustrated O
by O
examples O
and O
evaluation O
output O
is O
used O
to O
demonstrate O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
operations O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
describes O
a O
new O
distinguishing O
type O
attack O
to O
identify O
block O
ciphers O
, O
which O
grounded O
in O
a O
neural O
network O
, O
by O
means O
of O
a O

and O
an O
information O
retrieval O
approach O
, O
from O
patterns O
which O
is O
found O
on O
a O
ciphertexts O
set O
collection O
. O

The O
ideas O
were O
performed O
on O
a O

of O

, O

were O

by O

of O

: O

, O

, O

, O

and O

; O

. O

This O

shows O
the O

of O

and O

were O

, O
which O
allows O
the O
formation O
of O
well O
- O
formed O
and O
well O
- O
defined O
groups O
, O
here O
ciphertexts O
encrypted O
by O
the O
same O
algorithm O
stayed O
close O
to O
each O

. O

Text O
Semantic O
Similarity O
measurement O
is O
a O
new O
and O

growing O
field O
of O
research O
Short O
texts O
” O
are O
typically O
sentence O
length O
but O
are O
not O
required O
to O
be O
grammatically O
correct O
. O

There O
is O
great O
potential O
for O
applying O
these O
measures O
in O
fields O
such O
as O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
Dialogue O
Management O
and O
Question O
Answering O
. O

A O
dataset O
of O
65 O
sentence O
pairs O
, O
with O
similarity O
ratings O
, O
produced O
in O
2006 O
has O
become O
adopted O
as O
a O
de O
facto O

Standard O

. O

the O
2006 O
dataset O
, O

down O
a O
number O
of O

that O
can O
be O

to O
determine O
whether O
a O
dataset O
should O
be O

a O
“ O
Gold O
Standard O
” O
accolade O
and O
illustrates O
its O
use O
as O
a O

. O

for O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
common O
problem O
of O
expert O
combination O
approaches O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
is O
the O
selection O
of O
both O
, O
the O
experts O
to O
be O
combined O
and O
the O
combination O
function O
. O

In O
most O
studies O
the O
experts O
are O
selected O
from O
a O
rather O
small O
set O
of O
candidates O
using O
some O
heuristics O
. O

Thus O
, O
only O
a O
reduced O
number O
of O
possible O
combinations O
is O
considered O
and O
other O
possibly O
better O
solutions O
are O
left O
out O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
the O
use O
of O
genetic O
algorithms O
to O
find O
a O
suboptimal O
combination O
of O
experts O
for O
a O
document O
collection O
. O

Our O
system O
automatically O
determines O
both O
, O
the O
experts O
to O
be O
combined O
and O
the O
parameters O
of O
the O
combination O
function O
. O

We O
test O
and O
evaluate O
the O
approach O
on O
four O
classical O
text O
collections O
. O

The O
results O
show O
that O
the O
learnt O
combination O
strategies O
perform O
better O
than O
any O
of O
the O
individual O
methods O
and O
that O
genetic O
algorithms O
provide O
a O
viable O
method O
to O
learn O
expert O
combinations O
. O

significant O
contextual O
features O
is O
a O
challenging O
task O
in O
the O
development O
of O

retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
systems O
. O

This O
paper O

a O
simple O
method O
to O
facilitate O
such O
a O
task O
by O
looking O
at O
aggregated O
relevance O
judgements O
of O
retrieved O
documents O
. O

Our O
study O
suggested O
that O
the O
agreement O
on O
relevance O
judgements O
can O
indicate O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
retrieved O
documents O
as O
the O
source O
of O
significant O
features O
. O

The O
effect O
of O
< O
i O
> O
highly O
agreed O
documents</i O
> O
gives O
us O
practical O
implication O
for O
the O
design O
of O

models O
in O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
work O
describes O
the O
emerging O
standard O
for O
information O
retrieval O
on O
computational O
grids O
, O
GridIR O
. O

GridIR O
is O
based O
on O
the O
work O
of O
the O
Global O
Grid O
Forum O
and O
offers O
a O
security O
model O
for O
end O
- O
to O
- O
end O
data O
channel O
encryption O
, O
system O
authentication O
, O
and O
logging O
. O

GridIR O
implements O
a O
multi O
- O
tiered O
security O
model O
at O
the O
collection O
, O
query O
and O
datum O
level O
. O

Unlike O
monolithic O
search O
engines O
and O
customized O
small O
- O
scale O
systems O
, O
GridIR O
provides O
a O
standard O
method O
for O
federating O
data O
sets O
with O
multiple O
data O
types O
. O

Each O
of O
the O
data O
sets O
may O
be O
part O
of O
a O
virtual O
organization O
in O
which O
policy O
decisions O
dictate O
what O
data O
items O
may O
be O
shared O
. O

tools O
to O

from O

in O

Current O
text O
indexing O
and O
retrieval O
techniques O
have O
their O
roots O
in O
the O
field O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
where O
the O
task O
is O
to O
extract O
documents O
that O
best O
match O
a O
query O
. O

With O
an O
ever O
increasing O
number O
of O
documents O
available O

to O
the O

access O
through O
the O
Internet O
, O

is O
to O
provide O
users O
with O
concise O
and O

information O
. O

We O
are O
proposing O
here O
a O

, O
yet O
simple O

, O
which O
indexes O
the O
named O
entities O
in O
the O
documents O
, O
such O
as O
to O
improve O
the O
relevance O
of O
documents O
retrieved O
. O

Experiments O
performed O
in O

information O

to O
a O

of O

from O

of O

documents O
by O
a O
factor O
of O
2 O
, O
while O
still O
retrieving O
the O
relevant O
documents O
. O

. O

. O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O

- O

Search O
Assistant O
that O

phrases O
as O
fundamental O
units O
for O

translation O
and O
query O
formulation O
, O
translation O
and O
refinement O
. O

The O
system O
( O
a O
) O
supports O
the O
foreign O
- O
language O
document O
selection O
task O
providing O
a O
cross O
- O
language O
indicative O
summary O
based O
on O
noun O
phrase O
translations O
, O
and O
( O
b O
) O
supports O
query O
formulation O
and O
refinement O
using O
the O
information O
displayed O
in O
the O
cross O
- O
language O
document O
summaries O
. O

Our O
results O
challenge O
two O
implicit O
assumptions O
in O
most O
of O
cross O
- O
language O
Information O
Retrieval O
research O
: O
first O
, O
that O
once O
documents O
in O
the O
target O
language O
are O
found O

Translation O
is O
the O
optimal O

of O

user O
about O
their O
contents O
; O
and O

, O
that O
in O

setting O
the O
optimal O
way O
of O

and O

the O
query O
is O

for O
the O

terms O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Cross O
- O
Language O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
CLIR O
) O
resources O
, O
such O
as O
dictionaries O
and O
parallel O
corpora O
, O
are O
scarce O
for O
special O
domains O
. O

Obtaining O
comparable O
corpora O
automatically O
for O
such O
domains O
could O
be O
an O
answer O
to O
this O
problem O
. O

The O
Web O
, O
with O
its O
vast O
volumes O
of O
data O
, O
offers O
a O
natural O
source O
for O
this O
. O

We O
experimented O
with O
focused O
crawling O
as O
a O
means O
to O
acquire O
comparable O
corpora O
in O
the O
genomics O
domain O
. O

The O
acquired O
corpora O
were O
used O
to O
statistically O
translate O
domain O
- O
specific O
words O
. O

The O
same O
words O
were O
also O
translated O
using O
a O
high O
- O
quality O
, O
but O
non O
- O
genomics O
- O
related O
parallel O
corpus O
, O
which O
fared O
considerably O
worse O
. O

We O
also O
evaluated O
our O
system O
with O
standard O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
experiments O
, O
combining O
statistical O
translation O
using O
the O
Web O
corpora O
with O
dictionary O
- O
based O
translation O
. O

The O
results O
showed O
improvement O
over O
pure O
dictionary O
- O
based O
translation O
. O

Therefore O
, O
mining O
the O
Web O
for O
comparable O
corpora O
seems O
promising O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
considers O
an O
iterative O
user O
centered O
design O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
Systems O
( O
IRS O
An O
iterative O
design O
based O
on O
experimental O
evaluations O
with O
the O
end O
- O
users O
implies O
a O
high O
modifiability O
of O
the O
software O
. O

To O
achieve O
this O
software O
quality O
criterion O
, O
we O
apply O
the O
PAC O
- O
Amodeus O
model O
. O

PAC O
- O
Amodeus O
is O
a O
conceptual O
model O
useful O
for O
devising O
architectures O
driven O
by O
quality O
criteria O
including O
modifiability O
and O
portability O
. O

We O
illustrate O
the O
applicability O
of O
the O
model O
with O
the O
implementation O
of O
an O
IRS O
that O
we O
have O
developed O
: O
TIAPRI O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
work O
, O
we O
describe O
an O
automatic O
entity O
extraction O
system O
for O
social O
media O
content O
in O
English O
as O
part O
of O
our O
participation O
in O
the O
shared O
task O
on O
Entity O
Extraction O
from O
Social O
Media O
Text O
in O
Indian O
Languages O

( O
ESM O
- O
IL O
) O
organized O
by O
Forum O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
Evaluation O
( O
FIRE O
) O
in O
2015 O
. O

Our O
method O
uses O
simple O
features O
such O
as O
window O
of O
words O
, O
capitalization O
, O
dictionary O
word O
, O
part O
of O
speech O
tags O
, O
hashtag O
, O
etc O
. O

The O
performance O
of O
the O
system O
has O
been O
evaluated O
against O
the O
testset O
released O
in O
the O
FIRE O
2015 O
shared O
task O
on O
ESM O
- O
IL O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
encouraging O
performance O
in O
terms O
of O
precision O
, O
recall O
and O
F O
- O
measure O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Twitter O
is O
most O
popular O
microblogging O
site O
. O

It O
provide O
us O
with O
real O
time O
data O
. O

This O
article O
Provide O
survey O
of O
techniques O
for O
retrieving O
information O
from O
twitter O
stream O
. O

This O
techniques O
aim O
is O
finding O
real O
world O
and O
most O
relevant O
information O
with O
respect O
to O
the O
query O
. O

For O
retrieve O
most O
relevant O
information O
used O
query O
expansion O
techniques O
. O

Twitter O
data O
contain O
large O
amount O
of O
information O
. O

Information O
rank O
retrieval O
techniques O
find O
important O
data O
and O
gives O
the O
final O
score O
to O
that O
information O
with O
respect O
to O
user O
interest O
profile O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
recasts O
the O
problem O
of O
feature O
location O
in O
source O
code O
as O
a O
decision O
- O
making O
problem O
in O
the O
presence O
of O
uncertainty O
. O

The O
solution O
to O
the O
problem O
is O
formulated O
as O
a O
combination O
of O
the O
opinions O
of O
different O
experts O
. O

The O
experts O
in O
this O
work O
are O
two O
existing O
techniques O
for O
feature O
location O
: O
a O
scenario O
- O
based O
probabilistic O
ranking O
of O
events O
and O
an O
information O
- O
retrieval O
- O
based O
technique O
that O
uses O
latent O
semantic O
indexing O
. O

The O
combination O
of O
these O
two O
experts O
is O
empirically O
evaluated O
through O
several O
case O
studies O
, O
which O
use O
the O
source O
code O
of O
the O
Mozilla O
Web O
browser O
and O
the O
Eclipse O
integrated O
development O
environment O
. O

The O
results O
show O
that O
the O
combination O
of O
experts O
significantly O
improves O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
feature O
location O
as O
compared O
to O
each O
of O
the O
experts O
used O
independently O


-DOCSTART- O

New O
standards O
in O
document O
representation O
, O
like O
for O
example O
SGML O
, O
XML O
, O
and O
MPEG-7 O
, O
compel O
Information O
Retrieval O
to O
design O
and O
implement O
models O
and O
tools O
to O
index O
, O
retrieve O
and O
present O
documents O
according O
to O
the O
given O
document O
structure O
. O

The O
paper O
presents O
the O
design O
of O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
system O
for O
multimedia O
structured O
documents O
, O
like O
for O
example O
journal O
articles O
, O
e O
- O
books O
, O
and O
MPEG-7 O
videos O
. O

The O
system O
is O
based O
on O
Bayesian O
Networks O
, O
since O
this O
class O
of O
mathematical O
models O
enable O
to O
represent O
and O
quantify O
the O
relations O
between O
the O
structural O
components O
of O
the O
document O
. O

Some O
preliminary O
results O
on O
the O
system O
implementation O
are O
also O
presented O
. O

( O

Die O
klassische O
Aufgabenstellung O
des O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
ist O
durch O
das O

Internet O
für O
jeden O
Nutzer O
begreifbar O
geworden O
, O
denn O
es O
gehört O
mittlerweile O
zur O
Alltagserfahrung O
, O
dass O
die O
prinzipielle O
Verfügbarkeit O
von O
Information O
keineswegs O
gleichbedeutend O
damit O
ist O
, O
dass O
diese O
auch O
mit O
vertretbarem O
Aufwand O
gefunden O
werden O
kann O
. O

Das O
Problem O
, O
relevante O
Dokumente O
aus O
einer O
unübersehbaren O
Zahl O
von O
ähnlichem O
, O
aber O
( O
aus O
Sicht O
des O
Suchenden O
) O

herauszufiltern O
, O
ist O
vielschichtig O
und O
wird O
von O
den O
klassischen O
Werkzeugen O
( O
Suchmaschinen O
, O
Katalogen O
) O
nur O
mit O
Einschränkungen O
gemeistert O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Relevance O
- O
Based O
Language O
Models O
are O
an O
effective O
IR O
approach O
which O
explicitly O
introduces O
the O
concept O
of O
relevance O
in O
the O
statistical O
Language O
Modelling O
framework O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

These O
models O
have O
shown O
to O
achieve O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
retrieval O
performance O
in O
the O
pseudo O
relevance O
feedback O
task O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
a O
novel O
adaptation O
of O
this O
language O
modeling O
approach O
to O
rating O
- O
based O
Collaborative O
Filtering O
. O

In O
a O
memory O
- O
based O
approach O
, O
we O
apply O
the O
model O
to O
the O
formation O
of O
user O
neighbourhoods O
, O
and O
the O
generation O
of O
recommendations O
based O
on O
such O
neighbourhoods O
. O

We O
report O
experimental O
results O
where O
our O
method O
outperforms O
other O
standard O
memory O
- O
based O
algorithms O
in O
terms O
of O
ranking O
precision O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
introduces O
a O
novel O
representation O
, O
called O
the O
< O
b O
> O
Info O
Crystal</b>#8482 O
that O
can O
be O
used O
as O
a O
< O
b O
> O
visualization O
tool</b O
> O
as O
well O
as O
a O
< O
b O
> O
visual O
query O
language</b O
> O
to O
help O
users O
search O
for O
information O
. O

The O
InfoCrystal O
visualizes O
all O
the O
possible O
relationships O
among O
N O
concepts O
. O

Users O
can O
assign O
relevance O
weights O
to O
the O
concepts O
and O
use O
thresholding O
to O
select O
relationships O
of O
interest O
. O

The O
InfoCrystal O
allows O
users O
to O
specify O
< O
b O
> O
Boolean</b O
> O
as O
well O
as O
< O
b O
> O
vectorspace</b O
> O
queries O
graphically O
. O

Arbitrarily O
complex O
queries O
can O
be O
created O
by O
using O
the O
InfoCrystals O
as O
building O
blocks O
and O
organizing O
them O
in O
a O
hierarchical O
structure O
. O

The O
InfoCrystal O
enables O
users O
to O
explore O
and O
filter O
information O
in O
a O
flexible O
, O
dynamic O
and O
interactive O
way O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Resource O
selection O
is O
an O
important O
topic O
in O
distributed O
information O
retrieval O
research O
. O

It O
can O
be O
a O
component O
of O
a O
distributed O
information O
retrieval O
task O
and O
can O
also O
serve O
as O
an O
independent O
application O
of O
database O
recommendation O
system O
together O
with O
the O
resource O
representation O
part O
. O

There O
is O
a O
large O
body O
of O
valuable O
prior O
research O
on O
resource O
selection O
but O
very O
little O
has O
studied O
about O
the O
effects O
of O
different O
database O
size O
distributions O
on O
resource O
selection O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
extended O
versions O
of O
two O
well O
- O
known O
resource O
selection O
algorithms O
: O
CORI O
and O
KL O
divergence O
in O
order O
to O
consider O
the O
factors O
of O
database O
size O
distributions O
, O
and O
compare O
them O
with O
the O
lately O
proposed O
Relevant O
Document O
Distribution O
Estimation O
( O
ReDDE O
) O
resource O
selection O
algorithm O
. O

Experiments O
were O
done O
on O
four O
testbeds O
with O
different O
characteristics O
, O
and O
the O
ReDDE O
and O
the O
extended O
KL O
divergence O
resource O
selection O
algorithm O
have O
been O
shown O
to O
be O
more O
robust O
in O
various O
environments O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Enterprise O
search O
differs O
from O
Internet O
search O
in O
many O
ways O
. O

The O
overwhelming O
majority O
of O
information O
in O
an O
enterprise O
is O
unstructured O
. O

Together O
with O
information O
in O
relational O
and O
proprietary O
databases O
, O
these O
documents O
constitute O
the O
enterprise O
information O
ecosystem O
. O

The O
information O
in O
an O
enterprise O
is O
distributed O
. O

A O
centric O
search O
engine O
does O
not O
satisfy O
the O
security O
requirement O
in O
enterprise O
information O
retrieval O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
a O
multi O
- O
agent O
based O
distributed O
secure O
information O
retrieval O
approach O
has O
been O
presented O
. O

In O
this O
approach O
, O
a O
department O
or O
a O
unit O
in O
an O
enterprise O
has O
a O
search O
agent O
, O
so O
, O
the O
department O
can O
keep O
their O
information O
privately O
and O
securely O
. O

A O
role O
based O
access O
control O
strategy O
is O
adapted O
for O
global O
security O
for O
an O
enterprise O
. O

We O
have O
developed O
a O
prototype O
system O
by O
this O
approach O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

An O
Information O
Retrieval O
approach O
to O
the O
prediction O
of O
values O
of O
time O
series O
is O
suggested O
. O

Instead O
of O
trying O
to O
model O
the O
data O
, O
a O
pattern O
is O
searched O
for O
in O
a O
history O
file O
serving O
as O
“ O
text O
and O
relevant O
occurrences O
are O
used O
as O
basis O
for O
extrapolation O
. O

The O
application O
is O
to O
meteorological O
data O
, O
providing O
short O
- O
term O
predictions O
for O
certain O
weather O
features O
. O

The O
experiments O
show O
that O
the O
algorithm O
has O
a O
good O
ability O
of O
predicting O
the O
requested O
information O
, O
and O
that O
the O
predictions O
are O
far O
more O
accurate O
than O
those O
provided O
by O
an O
analytical O
prediction O
procedure O
, O
based O
on O
approximations O
using O
Fourier O
transforms O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
discusses O
field O
research O
in O
an O
interdisciplinary O
public O
health O
organization O
with O
a O
small O
in O
- O
house O
library O
. O

The O
fieldwork O
revealed O
how O
users O
in O
the O
organization O
often O
ignored O
the O
library O
( O
a O
" O
formal O
" O
information O
system O
) O
in O
favor O
of O
" O
informal O
" O
information O
sources O
such O
as O
colleagues O
, O
search O
engines O
, O
and O
personal O
files O
. O

The O
fieldwork O
thereby O
inverted O
a O
design O
problem O
, O
shifting O
the O
focus O
from O
building O
a O
better O
information O
retrieval O
system O
to O
understanding O
and O
supporting O
the O
information O
ecology O
of O
the O
organization O
. O

The O
fieldwork O
demonstrates O
some O
of O
the O
complexities O
of O
information O
use O
in O
practice O
, O
and O
the O
challenge O
of O
designing O
formally O
structured O
information O
systems O
( O
such O
as O
libraries O
) O
that O
match O
how O
users O
employ O
information O
in O
their O
ordinary O
work O
practices O
. O

We O
argue O
that O
future O
design O
efforts O
could O
build O
upon O
users O
natural O
streams O
of O
information O
" O
to O
develop O
more O
effective O
information O
architectures O
and O
capabilities O
for O
supporting O
users O
' O
work O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Multilingual O
translations O
play O
a O
vital O
role O
multilingual O
or O
cross O
- O
lingual O
information O
retrieval O
and O
extraction O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
a O
new O
method O
mine O
translations O
from O
bilingual O
web O
pages O
based O
on O
our O
former O
research O
. O

Two O
new O
features O
are O
introduced O
, O
one O
is O
the O
iterative O
mining O
process O
in O
order O
to O
increase O
the O
number O
of O
translation O
pairs O
; O
the O
other O
is O
the O
filtering O
step O
which O
deletes O
language O
- O
specific O
prefix O
and O
postfix O
in O
hyperlinks O
. O

Experiments O
show O
that O
the O
precision O
has O
been O
greatly O
improved O
due O
to O
the O
filtering O
step O
and O
the O
number O
of O
translation O
pairs O
increased O
after O
six O
iterations O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Duplicated O
information O
in O
today O
's O
Web O
has O
serious O
negative O
impact O
to O
search O
engines O
in O
that O
it O
increases O
the O
size O
of O
the O
index O
and O
results O
in O
low O
efficiency O
for O
Web O
information O
retrieval O
. O

A O
large O
amount O
of O
Web O
content O
duplication O
happens O
at O
block O
level O
in O
addition O
to O
page O
level O
. O

Besides O
, O
when O
searching O
the O
web O
, O
in O
most O
cases O
the O
desired O
information O
is O
located O
at O
the O
center O
block O
of O
a O
page O
. O

Based O
on O
these O
two O
observations O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
block O
level O
duplication O
detection O
algorithm O
, O
and O
index O
center O
blocks O
instead O
of O
entire O
Web O
pages O
for O
Web O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Experiments O
show O
that O
these O
strategies O
can O
effectively O
reduce O
index O
size O
and O
indexing O
time O
without O
sacrificing O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
Web O
information O
retrieval O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
order O
to O
reduce O
the O
dimension O
of O
VSM O
( O
Vector O
Space O
Model O
) O
for O
information O
retrieval O
and O
clustering O
, O
this O
paper O
proposes O
a O
new O
method O
, O
Semantic O
- O
VSM O
, O
which O
uses O
the O
Semantic O
Attribute O
System O
defined O
by O
” O
A O
- O
Japanese O
- O
Lexicon O
” O
instead O
of O
literal O
words O
used O
in O
conventional O
VSM O
. O

The O
attribute O
system O
consists O
of O
a O
tree O
structure O
with O
2,710 O
attributes O
, O
which O
includes O
400 O
thousand O
literal O
words O
. O

Using O
this O
attribute O
system O
, O
the O
generalization O
of O
vector O
elements O
can O
be O
performed O
easily O
based O
on O
upper O
- O
lower O
relationships O
of O
semantic O
attributes O
, O
so O
that O
the O
dimension O
can O
easily O
be O
reduced O
at O
very O
low O
cost O
. O

Synonyms O
are O
automatically O
assessed O
through O
semantic O
attributes O
to O
improve O
the O
recall O
performance O
of O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

Experimental O
results O
applying O
it O
to O
BMIR O
- O
J2 O
database O
of O
5,079 O
newspaper O
articles O
showed O
that O
the O
dimension O
can O
be O
reduced O
from O
2,710 O
to O
300 O
or O
600 O
with O
only O
a O
small O
degradation O
in O
performance O
. O

High O
recall O
performance O
was O
also O
shown O
compared O
with O
conventional O
VSM O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
on O
the O
Internet O
is O
particularly O
challenging O
for O
the O
non O
- O
expert O
user O
seeking O
technical O
information O
with O
specialized O
terminology O
. O

The O
user O
can O
be O
assisted O
during O
the O
required O
search O
tasks O
with O
intelligent O
agent O
technology O
delivered O
through O
a O
decision O
making O
support O
system O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
technology O
and O
its O
application O
to O
suicide O
prevention O
searches O
performed O
for O
the O
National O
Institute O
of O
Mental O
Health O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Metasearch O
and O
data O
- O
fusion O
techniques O
combine O
the O
rank O
lists O
of O
multiple O
document O
retrieval O
systems O
with O
the O
aim O
of O
improving O
search O
coverage O
and O
precision O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
new O
fusion O
method O
that O
partitions O
the O
rank O
lists O
of O
document O
retrieval O
systems O
into O
chunks O
. O

The O
size O
of O
chunks O
grows O
exponentially O
in O
the O
rank O
list O
. O

Using O
a O
small O
number O
of O
training O
queries O
, O
the O
probabilities O
of O
relevance O
of O
documents O
in O
different O
chunks O
are O
approximated O
for O
each O
search O
system O
. O

The O
estimated O
probabilities O
and O
normalized O
document O
scores O
are O
used O
to O
compute O
the O
final O
document O
ranks O
in O
the O
merged O
list O
. O

We O
show O
that O
our O
proposed O
method O
produces O
higher O
average O
precision O
values O
than O
previous O
systems O
across O
a O
range O
of O
testbeds O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

For O
Web O
page O
retrieval O
, O
even O
if O
the O
user O
uses O
the O
same O
keywords O
, O
different O
kinds O
of O
pages O
tend O
to O
be O
mixed O
in O
retrieval O
result O
because O
of O
polysemy O
or O
ambiguity O
of O
words O
. O

We O
already O
proposed O
the O
system O
of O
having O
improved O
the O
problem O
, O
which O
classifies O
retrieval O
result O
to O
groups O
automatically O
according O
to O
page O
contents O
using O
the O
vector O
space O
model O
method O
, O
the O
frequency O
of O
word O
appearance O
and O
the O
fuzzy O
reasoning O
. O

In O
our O
system O
, O
to O
reduce O
dimension O
of O
vector O
space O
, O
index O
words O
are O
selected O
based O
on O
the O
importance O
of O
a O
word O
measuring O
by O
fuzzy O
reasoning O
. O

On O
the O

hand O
, O
TF O
- O
IDF O
is O
often O
used O
as O
a O
measure O
of O
the O
importance O
of O
a O
word O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

Then O
we O
thought O
that O
it O
was O
necessary O
to O
compare O
with O
the O
performances O
of O
TF O
- O
IDF O
and O
fuzzy O
reasoning O
. O

From O
the O
experiments O
, O
we O
confirmed O
that O
similar O
classification O
for O
retrieval O
pages O
in O
terms O
of O
human O
sense O
by O
the O
system O
with O
fuzzy O
reasoning O
rather O
than O
with O
modified O
FT O
- O
IDF O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

At O
the O
core O
of O
any O
information O
retrieval O
system O
is O
its O
method O
for O
ranking O
results O
in O
response O
to O
a O
user O
's O
query O
. O

Geographic O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O

systems O
have O
an O
added O

for O

task O

to O

to O

, O

. O

The O

to O

" O

" O

. O

. O

always O

a O

. O

to O

. O

However O

; O

of O
93.3&#x025 O
; O
from O
our O
results O
. O

This O

in O

-DOCSTART- O

Traditional O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
systems O
are O
designed O
to O
provide O
uniform O
access O
to O
centralized O
corpora O
by O
large O
numbers O
of O
people O
. O

The O
Haystack O
project O
emphasizes O
the O
relationship O
between O
a O
particular O
individual O
and O
his O
corpus O
. O

An O
individual O
's O
own O
haystack O
priviliges O
information O
with O
which O
that O
user O
interacts O
, O
gathers O
data O
about O
those O
interactions O
, O
and O
uses O
this O
metadata O
to O
further O
personalize O
the O
retrieval O
process O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
prototype O
Haystack O
system O
. O

are O
often O
used O
in O
Medical O

. O

Previous O

that O

concept O
matching O
( O

) O

not O
effective O
, O

concept O

. O

Support O

. O

. O

In O

as O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

An O
increasing O
number O
of O
recent O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
make O
use O
of O
ontologies O
to O
help O
the O
users O
clarify O
their O
information O
needs O
and O
come O
up O
with O
semantic O
representations O
of O
documents O
. O

A O
particular O
concern O
here O
is O
the O
integration O
of O
these O

approaches O
with O
traditional O
search O
technology O
. O

The O
research O
presented O
in O

examines O
how O
ontologies O
can O
be O
efficiently O
applied O
to O
large O
- O
scale O

systems O
for O

web O
. O

We O
describe O
how O
these O
systems O
can O
be O
enriched O
with O
adapted O

to O
provide O
both O
an O
in O
- O
depth O
understanding O
of O
the O
user O
's O
needs O

as O

easy O

with O
standard O

- O

. O

The O

are O
adapted O
to O
the O
domain O
terminology O
by O

for O

concept O
. O

Later O
, O

are O
used O
to O
enrich O
a O
provided O
query O
. O

The O

as O

of O
a O

for O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
the O
Semantic O
Web O
information O
would O
be O
retrieved O
, O
processed O
, O
combined O
, O
shared O
and O
reused O
in O
the O
maximum O
automatic O
way O
possible O
. O

Obviously O
, O
such O
procedures O
involve O
a O
high O
degree O
of O
uncertainty O
and O
imprecision O
. O

For O
example O
ontology O
alignment O
or O
information O
retrieval O
are O
rarely O
true O
or O
false O
procedures O
but O
usually O
involve O
confidence O
degrees O
or O
provide O
rankings O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
it O
is O
often O
the O
case O
that O
information O
itself O
is O
imprecise O
and O
vague O
like O
the O
concept O
of O
a O
“ O
tall O
” O
person O
, O
a O
“ O
hot O
” O
place O
and O
many O
more O
. O

In O
order O
to O
be O
able O
to O
represent O
and O
reason O
with O
such O
type O
of O
information O
in O
the O
Semantic O
Web O
( O
SW O
as O
well O
as O

enhance O

applications O
we O
present O
an O
extension O
of O
the O
Description O
Logic O
SHIN O
with O
fuzzy O
set O
theory O
. O

We O
present O
the O
semantics O
as O
well O
as O
detailed O
reasoning O
algorithms O
for O
the O
extended O
language O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Most O
of O
the O
Information O
Retrieval O
Systems O
uses O
counts O
of O
frequencies O
of O
the O
words O
that O
occur O
in O
documents O
. O

Such O
counts O
entail O
the O
need O
of O
normalizing O
these O
terms O
. O

A O
simple O
normalization O
of O
characters O
( O
upper O
/ O
lowercase O
, O
accents O
and O
other O
diacritical O
ones O
) O
seems O
insufficient O
, O
since O
many O
words O
, O
by O
morphologic O
inflection O
or O
derivation O
, O
could O
be O
grouped O
under O
an O
only O
form O
, O
when O
having O
very O
near O
semantic O
mean O
. O

Several O
algorithms O
of O
normalization O
are O
analyzed O
and O
tested O
experimentally O
to O
evaluate O
their O
effectiveness O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Our O
objective O
is O
to O
enhance O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
retrieval O
and O
routing O
operations O
for O
large O
scale O
textbases O
. O

Retrieval O
concerns O
the O
processing O
of O
ad O
hoc O
queries O
against O
a O
static O
document O
collection O
, O
while O
muting O
concerns O
the O
processing O
of O
static O
, O
trained O
queries O
against O
a O
document O
stream O
. O

Both O
may O
be O
viewed O
as O
trying O
to O
rank O
relevant O
answer O
documents O
high O
in O
the O
output O
. O

Our O
text O
processing O
and O
retrieval O
system O
PIRCS O
is O
based O
on O
the O
probabilistic O
model O
and O
extended O
with O
the O
concept O
of O
document O
components O
. O

Components O
are O
regarded O
as O
single O
content O
- O
bearing O
terms O
as O
an O
approximation O
. O

Considering O
documents O
and O
queries O
as O
constituted O
of O
conceptual O
components O
allows O
one O
to O
define O
initial O
term O
weights O
naturally O
, O
to O
make O
use O
of O
nonbinary O
term O
weights O
, O
and O
to O
facilitate O
different O
types O
of O
retrieval O
processes O
. O

The O
approach O
is O
automatic O
, O
based O
mainly O
on O
statistical O
techniques O
, O
and O
is O
generally O
language O
and O
domain O
independent O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
- O
text O
frequency O
- O
weighted O
citation O
counting O
has O
been O
seen O
as O
a O
particularly O
promising O
solution O
to O
the O
wellknown O
problem O
of O
citation O
analysis O
that O
it O
treats O
all O
citations O
equally O
, O
be O
they O
crucial O
to O
the O
citing O
paper O
or O
perfunctory O
. O

But O
what O
is O
a O
good O
weighting O
scheme O
? O

We O
compare O
12 O
different O
in O
- O
text O
citation O
frequencyweighting O
schemes O
in O
the O
field O
of O
library O
and O
information O
science O
( O
LIS O
) O
and O
explore O
author O
citation O
impact O
patterns O
based O
on O
their O
performance O
in O
these O
schemes O
. O

Our O
results O
show O
that O
the O
ranks O
of O
authors O
vary O
widely O
with O
different O
weighting O
schemes O
that O
favor O
or O
are O
biased O
against O
common O
citation O
impact O
patterns— O
substantiated O
, O
applied O
, O
or O
noted O
. O

These O
variations O
separate O
LIS O
authors O
quite O
clearly O
into O
groups O
with O
these O
impact O
patterns O
. O

With O
consensus O
rank O
limits O
, O
the O
hard O
upper O
and O
lower O
bounds O
for O
reasonable O
author O
ranks O
that O
they O
provide O
suggest O
that O
author O
citation O
ranks O
may O
be O
subject O
to O
something O
like O
an O
uncertainty O
principle O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
novel O
method O
that O
performs O
Cross O
Language O
Text O
Categorization O
( O
CLTC O
) O
from O
the O
perspective O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

We O
present O
an O
input O
document O
in O
target O
language O
in O
the O
form O
of O
a O
query O
in O
source O
language O
. O

Then O
we O
retrieve O
the O
training O
documents O
in O
source O
language O
and O
find O
K O
most O
relevant O
results O
. O

At O
last O
, O
we O
use O
the O
class O
labels O
of O
the O
K O
results O
to O
predict O
the O
class O
of O
the O
input O
document O
. O

The O
only O
external O
resource O
required O
by O
our O
method O
is O
a O
bilingual O
dictionary O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
our O
method O
gives O
promising O
performance O
, O
which O
is O
better O
than O
translation O
- O
based O
method O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Despite O
one O
and O
a O
half O
decade O
of O
research O
and O
an O
impressive O
body O
of O
knowledge O
on O
how O
to O
represent O
and O
process O
musical O
audio O
signals O
, O
the O
discipline O
of O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
still O
does O
not O
enjoy O
broad O
recognition O
outside O
of O
computer O
science O
. O

In O
music O
cognition O
and O
neuroscience O
in O
particular O
, O
where O
MIR O
’s O
contribution O
could O
be O
most O
needed O
, O
MIR O
technologies O
are O
scarcely O
ever O
utilized O
— O
when O
they O
’re O
not O
simply O
brushed O
aside O
as O
irrelevant O
. O

This O
, O
we O
contend O
here O
, O
is O
the O
result O
of O
a O
series O
of O
misunderstandings O
between O
the O
two O
fields O
, O
about O
deeply O
different O
methodologies O
and O
assumptions O
that O
are O
not O
often O
made O
explicit O
. O

this O
article O

to O

on O
how O
to O
adapt O
some O
of O
MIR O
’s O
most O

signal O
processing O

, O

procedures O
and O
application O

to O
the O

by O

is O
an O

( O

) O
system O
for O

. O

be O
considered O
a O
baseline O
version O
, O
using O
mainly O
techniques O
from O
the O
area O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O

The O
only O
external O
information O
it O
uses O
besides O
the O
text O
collections O
is O
lexical O
information O
for O
Portuguese O
. O

It O

to O

of O

of O

Cross O
- O

the O

answered O

of O

and O
to O
85 O
answers O
considering O
the O
three O
answers O
that O
could O
be O
returned O
per O

. O

Generally O

IdSay O

are O

factoids O

Ontology O
is O
the O
backbone O
of O
the O
semantic O
web O
and O
can O
overcome O
semantic O
barriers O
. O

A O
domain O
ontology O
provides O
a O
common O
understanding O
of O
the O
knowledge O
of O
a O
particular O
domain O
. O

Information O
Science O
, O
meanwhile O
, O
is O
an O
interdisciplinary O
science O
that O
is O
yet O
to O
be O
defined O
. O

It O
is O
necessary O
to O
develop O
an O
Ontology O
of O
Information O
Science O
( O
OIS O
) O
to O
represent O
the O
knowledge O
in O
the O
field O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
representation O
of O
specific O
domain O
knowledge O
by O
providing O
a O
definition O
, O
scope O
, O
and O
boundaries O
of O
Information O
Science O
( O
IS O
The O
OIS O
has O
fourteen O
facets O
: O
actors O
, O
method O
, O
practice O
, O
studies O
, O
mediate O
, O
kinds O
, O
domains O
, O
resources O
, O
legislation O
, O
philosophy O
and O
theories O
, O
societal O
, O
tools O
, O
time O
and O
space O
. O

The O
methodology O
followed O
is O
Methontology O
, O
which O
is O
based O
on O
the O
IEEE O
standard O
for O
the O
development O
of O
a O
software O
life O
- O
cycle O
process O
. O

The O
paper O
then O
discusses O
the O
OIS O
ontology O
, O
particularly O
its O
structure O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
present O
paper O
describes O
a O
method O
of O
fully O
automated O
cross O
- O
language O
information O
retrieval O
, O
which O
does O
not O
require O
any O
query O
translation O
. O

Namely O
, O
monolingual O
queries O
retrieve O
documents O
from O
a O
multilingual O
collection O
, O
which O
includes O
items O
from O
the O
query O
's O
source O
language O
. O

This O
is O
achieved O
by O
a O
method O
, O
which O
combines O
the O
construction O
of O
a O
multilingual O
semantic O
space O
using O
latent O
semantic O
indexing O
( O
LSI O
) O
and O
the O
clustering O
ability O
of O
self O
- O
organizing O
maps O
( O
SOM O
) O
for O
the O
generation O
of O
multilingual O
semantic O
categories O
. O

Tests O
on O
an O
English O
- O
Greek O
corpus O
reveal O
the O
effectiveness O
and O
robustness O
of O
the O
proposed O
method O
. O

This O
paper O
deals O
with O
a O

for O

and O

. O

( O

. O

In O
this O

our O
work O
on O

grammars O
( O

) O
from O
partially O
bracketed O
corpora O
. O

The O
algorithm O
rst O
fully O
brackets O
the O
corpora O
, O
then O
extracts O
elementary O
trees O
( O
etrees O
and O
nally O
lters O
out O
invalid O
etrees O

linguistic O
knowledge O
. O

to O

, O

will O
not O

a O
big O
impact O
on O
parsing O
. O

The O
growth O
of O
the O
Semantic O
Web O
has O
seen O
a O
rapid O
increase O
in O
the O
amount O
of O

Description O
Framework O
( O

) O
data O
. O

Meanwhile O
, O

for O

to O

of O

. O

In O

- O
based O

information O
query O

RDF O
data O

proposed O
. O

The O
approach O
sets O
up O
a O
keyword O
- O
inverted O
index O
and O
a O
relation O
index O
based O
on O
the O
r O
- O
radius+ O
graph O
and O
searches O
the O
connecting O
nodes O
to O
provide O
an O
answer O
for O
keyword O
query O
. O

Moreover O
, O

approach O
uses O
an O
improved O
scoring O
function O
based O
on O
textual O
relevancy O
and O
relation O
popularity O
and O
supports O
top O
- O
k O
queries O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
the O
proposed O
approach O
can O
achieve O
good O
query O
performance O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Semantic O
search O
has O
been O
one O
of O
the O
motivations O
of O
the O
Semantic O
Web O
since O
it O
was O
envisioned O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
model O
for O
the O
exploitation O
of O
ontology O
- O
based O
KBs O
to O
improve O
search O
over O
large O
document O
repositories O
. O

The O
retrieval O
model O
is O
based O
on O
an O
adaptation O
of O
the O
classic O
vector O
- O
space O
model O
, O
including O
an O
annotation O
weighting O
algorithm O
, O
and O
a O
ranking O
algorithm O
. O

Semantic O
search O
is O
combined O
with O
keyword O
- O
based O
search O
to O
achieve O
tolerance O
to O
KB O
incompleteness O
. O

Our O
proposal O
has O
been O
tested O
on O
corpora O
of O
significant O
size O
, O
showing O
promising O
results O
with O
respect O
to O
keyword O
- O
based O
search O
, O
and O
providing O
ground O
for O
further O
analysis O
and O
research O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

How O
assessors O
and O
end O
users O
judge O
the O
relevance O
of O
images O
has O
been O
studied O
in O
information O
science O
and O
information O
retrieval O
for O
a O
considerable O
time O
. O

The O
criteria O
by O
which O
assessors O
' O
judge O
relevance O
has O
been O
intensively O
studied O
, O
and O
there O
has O
been O
a O
large O
amount O
of O
work O
which O
has O
investigated O
how O
relevance O
judgments O
for O
test O
collections O
can O
be O
more O
cheaply O
generated O
, O
such O
as O
through O
crowd O
sourcing O
. O

Relatively O
little O
work O
has O
investigated O
the O
process O
individual O
assessors O
go O
through O
to O
judge O
the O
relevance O
of O
an O
image O
. O

In O

about O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Many O
practical O
systems O
in O
physics O
, O
biology O
, O
engineering O
, O
and O
information O
science O
exhibit O
impulsive O
dynamical O
behaviors O
due O
to O
abrupt O
changes O
at O
certain O
instants O
during O
the O
dynamical O
processes O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
problems O
of O
stability O
analysis O
and O
robust O

are O
investigated O
for O
switched O

systems O
which O
exist O
impulses O
at O
the O
switching O
instants O
. O

Multiple O
Lyapunov O
techniques O
are O
used O
to O
derive O
sufficient O
conditions O
for O
stability O
in O
probability O
of O
the O
overall O
system O
with O
arbitrary O
switching O
law O
. O

The O
conditions O
are O
in O
linear O
matrix O
inequality O
form O
and O
can O
be O
used O
to O
solve O
the O
problems O
of O
stabilization O
and O
robust O
stabilization O
. O

Frequency O
( O
TF_IDF O
) O
performs O
better O
when O
compared O
to O
few O
recent O
probabilistic O
IR O
models O
. O

The O
experiments O
helped O
to O
identify O
the O
outperforming O
IR O
models O
for O
Gujarati O
Language O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Term O
clustering O
and O
syntactic O
phrase O
formation O
are O
methods O
for O
transforming O
natural O
language O
text O
. O

Both O
have O
had O
only O
mixed O
success O
as O
strategies O
for O
improving O
the O
quality O
of O
text O
representations O
for O
document O
retrieval O
. O

Since O

of O

methods O

, O

to O

. O

In O

of O

These O

from O

of O

that O
corpora O
much O

than O
standard O
information O
retrieval O
test O
collections O
will O
be O
required O
to O
thoroughly O
evaluate O
the O
use O
of O
this O
technique O
. O

Expert O
Finding O
has O
been O

of O

. O

However O

. O

will O

an O

for O
two O
types O
of O

( O

Network O
Sources O
( O

) O

Sources O
( O

for O
experts O
on O

of O

. O

Our O

is O
to O

who O
are O
the O

journalists O
and O

on O

. O

This O

, O

information O
for O

task O
. O

model O
named O

- O

( O

) O

performs O
the O
task O
of O
co O
- O
ranking O
authors O
in O

of O

and O

. O

We O
will O

baselines O
in O

of O
precision O
, O
mean O
average O
precision O
, O
and O
discounted O
cumulative O
gain O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
work O
proposes O
a O
way O
to O
integrate O
an O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
system O
with O
an O
automatic O
speech O
recognition O
( O
ASR O
) O
engine O
to O
support O
natural O
spoken O
queries O
. O

A O
broader O
interaction O
between O
the O
two O
modules O
is O
achieved O
by O
transmitting O
a O
lattice O
of O
terms O
to O
the O
IR O
system O
. O

This O
is O
in O
contrast O
with O
conventional O
systems O
where O
only O
the O
best O
- O
path O
recognition O
output O
is O
transmitted O
. O

Acoustic O
scores O
associated O
with O
the O
term O
- O
lattice O
are O
used O
to O
weigh O
the O
terms O
. O

A O
latent O
semantic O
indexing O
( O
LSI O
) O
scheme O
in O
which O
documents O
and O
terms O
are O
mapped O
to O
a O
single O
reduced O
feature O
- O
space O
with O
400 O
semantic O
components O
is O
used O
. O

The O
conventional O
LSI O
method O
is O
nevertheless O
modified O
to O
allow O
the O
aforementioned O
broader O
interaction O
between O
acoustic O
hypothesis O
and O
semantic O
determination O
. O

The O
results O
show O
that O
the O
proposed O
method O
moderately O
outperforms O
the O
traditional O
approach O
for O
spoken O
queries O
formulated O
as O
casual O
phrases O
. O

the O

of O
online O
information O
has O
made O
the O
process O
of O
accurate O
retrieval O
much O

. O

Providers O
of O
information O

systems O
have O
come O
under O
a O
lot O
of O
pressure O
to O
improve O
their O
techniques O
to O
cater O
for O
the O
modern O
user O
. O

Conventional O
systems O
are O
often O

as O
they O
fail O
to O
understand O
the O
true O
search O

of O
the O

. O

This O
is O

of O

and O

. O

that O

to O

a O

’s O
short O
- O

of O
their O

results O
. O

A O

is O

for O

to O

of O
context O

for O

to O

are O
presented O
in O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

A O
central O
problem O
in O
information O
retrieval O
is O
the O
automated O
classification O
of O
text O
documents O
. O

While O
many O
existing O
methods O
achieve O
good O
levels O
of O
performance O
, O
they O
generally O
require O
levels O
of O
computation O
that O
prevent O
them O
from O
making O
sufficiently O
fast O
decisions O
in O
some O
applied O
setting O
. O

Using O
insights O
gained O
from O
examining O
the O
way O
humans O
make O
fast O
decisions O
when O
classifying O
text O
documents O
, O
two O
new O
text O
classification O
algorithms O
are O
developed O
based O
on O
sequential O
sampling O
processes O
. O

These O
algorithms O
make O
extremely O
fast O
decisions O
, O
because O
they O
need O
to O
examine O
only O
a O
small O
number O
of O
words O
in O
each O
text O
document O
. O

Evaluation O
against O
the O
Reuters-21578 O
collection O
shows O
both O
techniques O
have O
levels O
of O
performance O
that O
approach O
benchmark O
methods O
, O
and O
the O
ability O
of O
one O
of O
the O
classifiers O
to O
produce O
realistic O
measures O
of O
confidence O
in O
its O
decisions O
is O
shown O
to O
be O
useful O
for O
prioritizing O
relevant O
documents O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
the O
results O
of O
the O
State O
University O
of O
New O
York O
at O
Buffalo O
( O

) O
in O

- O

2004 O
. O

For O

. O

for O

. O

monolithic O
method O

- O

methods O

for O

to O

-DOCSTART- O

Name O
Entity O
Recognition O
( O
NER O
) O
is O
an O
important O
process O
used O
for O
several O
type O
of O
applications O
such O
as O
Information O
Extraction O
, O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
Question O
Answering O
, O
text O
clustering O
, O
etc O
. O

It O
is O
intended O
to O
identify O
and O
classify O
name O
entities O
from O
a O
given O
text O
. O

NER O
is O
performed O
by O
using O
a O
rule O
- O
based O
approach O
that O
relies O
on O
human O
intuitive O
or O
machine O
learning O
methods O
such O
as O
Hidden O
Markov O
Model O
( O
HMM O
Maximum O
Entropy O
( O
ME O
and O
Decision O
tree O
( O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
a O
model O
based O
on O
the O
first O
order O
HMM O
to O
recognize O
name O
entity O
in O
the O
Arabic O
language O
. O

The O
model O
is O
based O
on O
stemming O
process O
that O
solves O
Arabic O
's O
inflection O
problem O
and O
ambiguity O
. O

To O
the O
best O
of O
our O
knowledge O
, O
no O

What O
is O

? O

Entropy O
is O

measure O
of O
disorder O
in O

closed O
but O
changing O
system O
, O
a O

which O

can O
only O
be O
transferred O
in O
one O
direction O
from O
an O

. O

The O
higher O
the O

, O
the O
higher O
the O
disorder O
and O
lower O

availability O
of O
the O
system O
's O

to O

. O

in O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
novel O
document O
re O
- O
ranking O
approach O
in O
information O
retrieval O
, O
which O
is O
done O
by O
a O
label O
propagation O
- O
based O
semi O
- O
supervised O
learning O
algorithm O
to O
utilize O
the O
intrinsic O
structure O
underlying O
in O
the O
large O
document O
data O
. O

Since O
no O
labeled O
relevant O
or O
irrelevant O
documents O
are O
generally O
available O
in O
IR O
, O
our O
approach O
tries O
to O
extract O
some O
pseudo O
labeled O
documents O
from O
the O
ranking O
list O
of O
the O
initial O
retrieval O
. O

For O
pseudo O
relevant O
documents O
, O
we O
determine O
a O
cluster O
of O
documents O
from O
the O
top O
ones O
via O
cluster O
validation O
- O
based O
k O
- O
means O
clustering O
; O
for O
pseudo O
irrelevant O
ones O
, O
we O
pick O
a O
set O
of O
documents O
from O
the O
bottom O
ones O
. O

Then O
the O
ranking O
of O
the O
documents O
can O
be O
conducted O
via O
label O
propagation O
. O

Evaluation O
on O
benchmark O
corpora O
shows O
that O
the O
approach O
can O
achieve O
significant O
improvement O
over O
standard O
baselines O
and O
performs O
better O
than O
other O
related O
approaches O
. O

. O

is O

language O

formulations O
exhibit O

over O

language O
statements O

they O
permit O

to O

environment O
without O

training O
and O
without O
using O

. O

output O

however O

to O

the O
good O
terms O

bad O
ones O
. O

of O
the O
terms O
in O

first O
characterized O
in O
terms O
of O
their O
frequency O
distribution O
over O

documents O
of O
a O
collection O
. O

construction O
of O
" O
good O
" O
natural O
language O
vocabularies O
is O
then O
described O
, O
and O
methods O
are O
given O
for O
improving O
the O
vocabulary O
by O
transforming O
terms O
that O
operate O
poorly O
for O
retrieval O
purposes O
into O
better O
ones O
. O

of O

been O

in O

- O

. O

Local O
context O
analysis O
( O
LCA O
) O
is O
an O
automated O
query O
expansion O
method O
that O
adds O
concepts O
to O
the O
original O
query O
based O
on O
the O
initial O
retrieval O
using O
the O
original O
query O
. O

In O
our O
previous O
works O
we O
attempted O
to O
tune O
this O
method O
for O
Farsi O
language O
by O
manipulating O
three O
parameters O
which O
are O
number O
of O
concepts O
used O
for O
query O
expansion O
, O
number O
of O
initially O
retrieved O
documents O
for O
local O
feedback O
and O
number O
of O
passages O
for O
concept O
discovery O
and O
weighting O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
seek O
to O
further O
customize O
this O
method O
for O
Farsi O
information O
retrieval O
. O

To O
compare O
our O
work O
to O
the O
previous O
attempts O
we O
have O
used O
Hamshahri O
collection O
and O
60 O
. O

We O
have O
experimented O
with O
different O
number O
of O
concepts O
and O
have O
also O
changed O
the O
concept O
weighting O
algorithm O
to O
improve O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

Online O
metrics O
measured O
through O
A O
/ O
B O
tests O
have O
become O
the O
gold O
standard O
for O
many O
evaluation O
questions O
. O

But O
can O
we O
get O
the O
same O
results O
as O

/ O
B O
tests O
without O
actually O
fielding O
a O
new O
system O
? O

And O

train O
systems O
to O
optimize O
online O
metrics O
without O
subjecting O
users O
to O
an O
online O
learning O
algorithm O
? O

This O
tutorial O
summarizes O
and O
unifies O
the O
emerging O
body O
of O
methods O
on O
counterfactual O
evaluation O
and O
learning O
. O

These O
counterfactual O
techniques O
provide O
a O
well O
- O
founded O
way O
to O
evaluate O
and O
optimize O
online O
metrics O
by O
exploiting O
logs O
of O
past O
user O
interactions O
. O

In O
particular O
, O

unifies O
the O
causal O
inference O
, O
information O
retrieval O
, O
and O
machine O
learning O
view O
of O
this O
problem O
, O
providing O
the O
basis O
for O
future O
research O
in O
this O
emerging O
area O
of O
great O
potential O
impact O
. O

Supplementary O
material O
and O
resources O
are O
available O
online O

http O

. O
