designed O
with O
three O
objectives O
in O
mind O
. O

The O
first O
was O
to O
keep O
graduate O
students O
abreast O
of O
the O
requirements O
to O
be O
met O
for O
an O
advanced O
degree O
. O

The O
second O
objective O
was O
to O
aid O
the O
Office O
of O
Graduate O
Studies O
and O
the O
Registrar O
in O
certifying O
the O
completion O
of O
requirements O
for O
advanced O
degrees O
. O

Thirdly O
, O
the O
system O
was O
designed O
so O
that O
information O
retrieval O
for O
various O
colleges O
, O
departments O
and O
federal O
agencies O
could O
be O
accomplished O
without O
a O
time O
- O
consuming O
manual O
search O
of O
student O
records O
. O

A O
description O
of O
the O
software O
and O
data O
files O
is O
given O
, O
as O
well O
as O
a O
description O
of O
the O
major O
report O
forms O
produced O
by O
the O
system O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
the O
operation O
of O
the O
system O
will O
be O
briefly O
described O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
the O
2005 O
Miracle O
’s O
team O
approach O
to O
Monolingual O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

The O
goal O
for O
the O
experiments O
in O
this O
year O
was O
twofold O
: O
continue O
testing O
the O
effect O
of O
combination O
approaches O
on O
information O
retrieval O
tasks O
, O
and O
improving O
our O
basic O
processing O
and O
indexing O
tools O
, O
adapting O
them O
to O
new O
languages O
with O
strange O
encoding O
schemes O
. O

The O
starting O
point O
was O
a O
set O
of O
basic O
components O
: O
stemming O
, O
transforming O
, O
filtering O
, O
proper O
nouns O
extracting O
, O
paragraph O
extracting O
, O
and O
pseudo O
- O
relevance O
feedback O
. O

Some O
of O
these O
basic O
components O
were O
used O
in O
different O
combinations O
and O
order O
of O
application O
for O
document O
indexing O
and O
for O
query O
processing O
. O

Second O
order O
combinations O
were O
also O
tested O
, O
by O
averaging O
or O
selective O
combination O
of O
the O
documents O
retrieved O
by O
different O
approaches O
for O
a O
particular O
query O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
issues O
and O
preliminary O
work O
involved O
in O
the O
creation O
of O
an O
information O
retrieval O
system O
that O
will O
manage O
the O
retrieval O
from O
collections O
composed O
of O
both O
speech O
recognised O
and O
ordinary O
text O
documents O
. O

In O
previous O
work O
, O
it O
has O
been O
shown O
that O
because O
of O
recognition O
errors O
, O
ordinary O
documents O
are O
generally O
retrieved O
in O
preference O
to O
recognised O
ones O
. O

Means O
of O
correcting O
or O
eliminating O
the O
observed O
bias O
is O
the O
subject O
of O
this O
paper O
. O

Initial O
ideas O
and O
some O
preliminary O
results O
are O
presented O
. O

General O
Terms O
Measurement O
, O
Experimentation O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Dialogue O
Management O
components O
are O
becoming O
increasingly O
useful O
in O
Natural O
Language O
Information O
Retrieval O
systems O
, O
to O
aid O
users O
find O
information O
they O
require O
. O

These O
components O
need O
to O
be O
evaluated O
, O
both O
intrinsically O
, O
to O
gauge O
development O
approaches O
, O
and O
extrinsically O
to O
measure O
subjective O
performance O
. O

We O
introduce O
a O
Natural O
Language O
Dialogue O
System O
, O
the O
YPA O
, O
developed O
at O
the O
University O
of O
Essex O
, O
that O
accesses O
classified O
directory O
information O
such O
as O
British O
Telecom O
’s O
Yellow O
Pages O
. O

These O
directories O
contain O
much O
useful O
but O
hard O
- O
to O
- O
access O
information O
, O
especially O
in O
the O
free O
text O
in O
semi O
- O
display O
advertisements O
. O

We O
examine O
the O
evaluation O
methodologies O
used O
to O
assess O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
YPA O
during O
development O
, O
both O
from O
users O
and O
technology O
developer O
perspectives O
, O
by O
using O
both O
subjective O
and O
objective O
evaluation O
approaches O
. O

We O
finish O
by O
drawing O
some O
conclusions O
from O
these O
experiments O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
25 O
Annual O
conference O
on O
research O
and O
development O
was O
held O
in O
Tampere O
Hall O
, O
Tampere O
, O
Finland O
. O

In O
all O
, O
2 O
keynote O
talks O
were O
given O
, O
44 O
papers O
presented O
, O
41 O
posters O
delivered O
and O
12 O
demonstrations O
of O
various O
software O
were O
given O
. O

A O
vast O
array O
of O
subjects O
in O
information O
retrieval O
was O
presented O
from O
high O
- O
level O
user O
studies O
to O
theoretical O
aspects O
of O
IR O
to O
implementation O
of O
IR O
systems O
. O

We O
review O

. O

We O
give O

of O
the O
talks O
for O
each O

, O
putting O
those O
sessions O
that O

. O

, O

-DOCSTART- O

Large O
amount O
of O
unstructured O
designed O
information O
is O
difficult O
to O
deal O
with O
. O

Obtaining O
specific O
information O
is O
a O
hard O
mission O
and O
takes O
a O
lot O
of O
time O
. O

Information O
Retrieval O
System O
( O
IR O
) O
is O
a O
way O
to O
solve O
this O
kind O
of O
problem O
. O

IR O
is O
a O
good O
mechanism O
but O
does O
not O
give O
the O
perfect O
solution O
. O

Other O
techniques O
have O
been O
added O
to O
IR O
to O
develop O
the O
result O
. O

One O
of O
the O
techniques O
is O
text O
classification O
. O

Text O
classification O
task O
is O
to O
assign O
a O
document O
to O
one O
or O
more O
category O
. O

It O
could O
be O
done O
manually O
or O
algorithmically O
. O

Text O
classification O
enhances O
the O
output O
of O
this O
process O
by O
reducing O
the O
results O
. O

This O
study O
proved O
that O
text O
classification O
has O
a O
positive O
influence O
on O
Information O
Retrieval O
Systems O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
systems O
contain O
large O
volumes O
of O
text O
, O
and O
currently O
have O
typical O
sizes O
into O
the O
gigabyte O
range O
. O

Inverted O
indexes O
are O
one O
important O
method O
for O
providing O
search O
facilities O
into O
these O
collections O
, O
but O
unless O
compressed O
require O
a O
great O
deal O
of O
space O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
introduce O
a O
new O
method O
for O
compressing O
inverted O
indexes O
that O
yields O
excellent O
compression O
, O
fast O
decoding O
, O
and O
exploits O
clustering O
— O
the O
tendency O
for O
words O
to O
appear O
relatively O
frequently O
in O
some O
parts O
of O
the O
collection O
and O
infrequently O
in O
others O
. O

We O
also O
describe O
two O
other O
quite O
separate O
applications O
for O
the O
same O
compression O
method O
: O
representing O
the O
MTF O
list O
positions O
generated O
by O
the O
Burrows O
- O
Wheeler O
Block O
Sorting O
transformation O
; O
and O
transmitting O
the O
codebook O
for O
semi O
- O
static O
block O
- O
based O
minimum O
- O
redundancy O
coding O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Ranking O
solutions O
is O
an O
important O
issue O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
because O
it O
greatly O
influences O
the O
quality O
of O
results O
. O

In O
this O
context O
, O
keyword O
based O
search O
approaches O
use O
to O
consider O
solutions O
sorting O
as O
least O
step O
of O
the O
overall O
process O
. O

Ranking O
and O
building O
solutions O
are O
completely O
separate O
steps O
running O
autonomously O
. O

This O
may O
penalize O
the O
retrieving O
information O
process O
because O
it O
binds O
to O
order O
all O
found O
matching O
elements O
including O
( O
possible O
) O
irrelevant O
information O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
a O
theoretical O
study O
of O
YAANII O
, O
a O
novel O
technique O
to O
keyword O
based O
search O
over O
semantic O
data O
. O

We O
demonstrate O
how O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
answers O
depends O
not O
so O
much O
on O
the O
quality O
of O
the O
scoring O
metrics O
but O
on O
the O
way O
such O
criteria O
are O
involved O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
involves O
several O
disciplines O
to O
improve O
the O
search O
quality O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
focus O
on O
terminology O
extraction O
which O
includes O
critical O
tasks O
especially O
for O
highly O
ambiguous O
languages O
like O
Arabic O
. O

Properly O
retrieving O
a O
list O
of O
relevant O
terms O
for O
a O
given O
domain O
and O
enrich O
it O
is O
a O
persistent O
problem O
. O

Therefore O
, O
and O
in O
order O
to O
improve O
the O
coverage O
of O
terminology O
extraction O
and O
enrichment O
, O
we O
must O
strengthen O
our O
research O
by O
text O
- O
mining O
technologies O
based O
on O
well O
- O
founded O
methods O
. O

In O
this O
article O
, O
we O
present O
a O
new O
Arabic O
terminology O
extraction O
and O
enrichment O
approach O
which O
exploits O
the O
corpus O
structure O
as O
a O
first O
step O
to O
extract O
a O
minimal O
terminology O
and O
uses O
text O
- O
mining O
techniques O
to O
enrich O
it O
in O
a O
second O
step O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Multimedia O
information O
retrieval O
poses O
both O
technical O
and O
design O
challenges O
beyond O
those O
of O
established O
text O
retrieval O
. O

These O
issues O
extend O
both O
to O
the O
entry O
of O
search O
requests O
, O
system O
interation O
and O
the O
browsing O
of O
retrieved O
content O
, O
and O
the O
methodologies O
and O
techniques O
for O
content O
indexing O
. O

Prototype O
multimedia O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
are O
currently O
being O
developed O
which O
enable O
the O
exploration O
of O
both O
the O
user O
interaction O
and O
technical O
issues O
. O

The O
suitability O
of O
the O
solutions O
developed O
within O
these O
systems O
is O
currently O
being O
explored O
in O
the O
annual O
TRECVID O
evaluation O
workshops O
which O
enable O
researchers O
to O
test O
their O
indexing O
and O
retrieval O
algorithms O
and O
complete O
systems O
on O
common O
tasks O


-DOCSTART- O

Natural O
language O
processing O
techniques O
may O
hold O
a O
tremendous O
potential O
for O
overcoming O
the O
inadequacies O
of O
purely O
quantitative O
methods O
of O
text O
information O
retrieval O
, O
but O
the O
empirical O
evidence O
to O
support O
such O
predictions O
has O
thus O
far O
been O
inadequate O
, O
and O
appropriate O
scale O
evaluations O
have O
been O
slow O
to O
emerge O
. O

In O
this O
chapter O
, O
we O
report O
on O
the O
progress O
of O
the O
Natural O
Language O
Information O
Retrieval O
project O
, O
a O
joint O
effort O
of O
several O
sites O
led O
by O
GE O
Research O
, O
and O
its O
evaluation O
in O
a O
series O
of O
Text O
Retrieval O
Conferences O
( O

) O
conducted O
since O
1992 O
under O
the O

of O

Institute O
of O
Standards O
and O
Technology O
( O

) O
and O
the O
Defense O
Advanced O
Research O
Projects O
Agency O
( O

) O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
introduces O
a O
Japanese O
Named O
Entity O
( O
NE O
) O
corpus O
of O
various O
genres O
. O

We O
annotated O
136 O
documents O
in O
the O
Balanced O
Corpus O
of O
Contemporary O
Written O
Japanese O
( O
BCCWJ O
) O
with O
the O
eight O
types O
of O
NE O
tags O
defined O
by O

and O

Exercise O
. O

The O

consists O
of O
six O
types O
of O

of O
documents O
such O
as O
blogs O
, O

, O
white O
papers O
, O
and O
so O
on O
, O
and O
the O
corpus O
contains O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Domain O
specific O
search O
engines O
( O
DSSE O
) O
are O
gaining O
popularity O
because O
of O
better O
search O
relevance O
and O
domain O
specificity O
. O

The O
growth O
of O
IT O
and O
internet O
led O
to O
increase O
of O
cyber O
attacks O
, O
however O
, O
lack O
of O
DSSE O
for O
Security O
is O
making O
users O
refer O
multiple O
sites O
for O
security O
information O
. O

We O
demonstrate O
SIREN O
, O
a O
search O
engine O
for O
’Information O
and O
Cyber O
Security’ O
with O
subdomain O
coverage O
, O
classification O
and O
site O
credibility O
for O
ranking O
search O
results O
. O

As O
part O
of O
our O
demonstration O
, O
we O
also O
automated O
identification O
of O
seed O
URLs O
( O
34,007 O
) O
and O
related O
child O
URLs O
( O
400,726 O
) O
of O
the O
security O
domain O
using O
Artificial O
Bee O
Colony O
algorithm O
. O

We O
also O
evaluated O
functional O
and O
non O
- O
functional O
parameters O
of O
available O
open O
source O
software O
stack O
that O
can O
be O
used O
for O
building O
other O
DSSEs O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Finding O
meaningful O
phrases O
in O
a O
document O
has O
been O
studied O
in O
various O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
in O
order O
to O
improve O
the O
performance O
. O

Many O
previous O
statistical O
phrase O
- O
finding O
methods O
had O
a O
different O
aim O
such O
as O
document O
classification O
. O

Some O
are O
hybridized O
with O
statistical O
and O
syntactic O
grammatical O
methods O
; O
others O
use O
correlation O
heuristics O
between O
words O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
new O
phrase O
- O
finding O
algorithm O
that O
adds O
correlated O
words O
one O
by O
one O
to O
the O
phrases O
found O
in O
the O
previous O
stage O
, O
maintaining O
high O
correlation O
within O
a O
phrase O
. O

Our O
results O
indicate O
that O
our O
algorithm O
finds O
more O
meaningful O
phrases O
than O
an O
existing O
algorithm O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
the O
previous O
algorithm O
could O
be O
improved O
by O
applying O
different O
correlation O
junctions O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
describes O
Hyper O
- O
G O
, O
a O
new O
hypermedia O
information O
system O
which O
combines O
the O
best O
of O
Gopher O
, O
WAIS O
, O
and O
World O
Wide O
Web O
. O

Hyper O
- O
G O
is O
speci O
cally O
designed O
as O
a O
distributed O
, O
large O
- O
scale O
hypermedia O
information O
system O
supporting O
navigation O
in O
a O
large O
body O
of O
dynamically O
changing O
information O
without O
becoming O
\lost O
in O
hyperspace O
Users O
may O
choose O
a O
hierarchical O
navigation O
paradigm O
, O
click O
on O
hyper O
- O
links O
, O
go O
on O
guided O
tours O
, O
or O
perform O
variable O
- O
scope O
searches O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
Hyper O
- O
G O
from O
the O
user O
's O
perspective O
, O
outlines O
the O
basic O
architecture O
of O
the O
system O
, O
and O
describes O
its O
interaction O
with O
existing O
distributed O
information O
retrieval O
tools O
like O
Gopher O
, O
WAIS O
, O
and O
World O
Wide O
Web O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
the O
field O
of O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
there O
are O
many O
tasks O
that O
are O
not O
only O
difficult O
for O
machines O
to O
solve O
, O
but O
that O
also O
lack O
well O
- O
defined O
answers O
. O

In O
pursuing O
the O
automatic O
recognition O
of O
emotions O
within O
music O
, O
this O
lack O
of O
objectivity O
makes O
it O
difficult O
to O
train O
systems O
that O
rely O
on O
quantified O
labels O
for O
supervised O
machine O
learning O
. O

In O
recent O
years O
, O
researchers O
have O
begun O
to O
harness O
Human O
Computation O
for O
the O
collection O
of O
data O
spanning O
an O
excerpt O
of O
music O

i O
> O
MoodSwings</i O
> O
records O
dynamic O
( O
per O
- O
second O
) O
labels O
of O
players O
' O
mood O
ratings O
of O
music O
, O
in O
keeping O
with O
the O
unique O
time O
- O
varying O
nature O
of O
musical O
mood O
. O

Players O
collaborate O
to O
build O
consensus O
, O
ensuring O
the O
quality O
of O
data O
collected O
. O

We O
present O
an O
analysis O
of O
< O
i O
> O
MoodSwings</i O
> O
labels O
collected O
to O
date O
and O
propose O
several O
modifications O
for O
improving O
both O
the O
quality O
of O
the O
gameplay O
and O
the O
collected O
data O
as O
development O
moves O
forward O
. O

Smoothing O
document O

with O

graph O
is O
a O
new O
and O
effective O
method O
in O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Word O
graph O
can O
naturally O
incorporate O
the O
dependency O
between O
the O
words O
; O
random O
walk O
algorithm O
based O
on O
the O
graph O
can O

used O
to O

the O
weight O
of O
each O
vertex O
. O

to O

document O
's O
k O
nearest O
neighbors O

represent O

words O
in O

its O
k O
nearest O
neighbors O
, O

of O

are O

through O
word O
co O
- O

in O

local O

set O
. O

graph O

can O

document O

. O

Experimental O

that O
our O
proposed O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
Music O
Instrument O
Identification O
research O
is O
an O
important O
and O
difficult O
problem O
in O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O

In O
this O
paper O
an O
algorithm O
based O
on O
flexible O
harmonic O
model O
is O
proposed O
to O
represent O
the O
pitch O
in O
music O
by O
Gaussian O
mixture O
structure O
. O

The O
proposed O
algorithm O
models O
each O
spectral O
envelope O
of O
underlying O
harmonic O
structure O
to O
approximate O
the O
real O
music O
and O
uses O
EM O
algorithm O
to O
estimate O
the O
parameters O
. O

Not O
only O
is O
it O
able O
to O
estimate O
the O
multipitch O
( O
F0 O
) O
but O
it O
also O
takes O
the O
attack O
problem O
( O
a O
kind O
of O
inharmonic O
structure O
at O
the O
beginning O
of O
some O
pitches O
) O
into O
account O
. O

The O
proposed O
algorithm O
makes O
it O
possible O
to O
envisage O
the O
use O
of O
timbre O
features O
derived O
from O
both O
harmonic O
part O
and O
attack O
part O
. O

Musical O
instrument O
recognition O
is O
then O
carried O
out O
by O
using O
SVM O
classifier O
. O

Experiment O
shows O
high O
performance O
of O
the O
proposed O
algorithm O
for O
instrument O
identification O
task O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
the O
participation O
of O
MayoNLPTeam O
in O
the O
2016 O
CLEF O
eHealth O
Information O
Retrieval O
Task O
( O
IR O
Task O
1 O
: O
ad O
- O
hoc O
search O
We O
explored O
a O
Part O
- O
of O
- O
Speech O
( O
POS O
) O
based O
query O
term O
weighting O
approach O
which O
assigns O
different O
weights O
to O
the O
query O
terms O
according O
to O
their O
POS O
categories O
. O

The O
weights O
are O
learned O
by O
defining O
an O
objective O
function O
based O
on O
the O
mean O
average O
precision O
. O

We O
applied O
the O
proposed O
approach O
with O
the O
optimal O
weights O
obtained O
from O
TREC O
2011 O
and O
2012 O
Medical O
Records O
Track O
into O
the O
Query O

model O
( O
Run O
2 O
) O
and O
Markov O
Random O
Field O
( O
MRF O
) O
models O
( O

conventional O
Query O

model O
was O
implemented O
as O
the O
baseline O
( O
Run O
1 O
) O
. O

- O
up O

of O
ACA O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
requirements O
imposed O
on O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
are O
increasing O
steadily O
. O

The O
vast O
number O
of O
documents O
in O
today O
’s O
large O
databases O
and O
especially O
on O
the O
World O
Wide O
Web O
causes O
problems O
when O
searching O
for O
concrete O
information O
. O

It O
is O
difficult O
to O
find O
satisfactory O
information O
that O
accurately O
matches O
user O
information O
needs O
even O
if O
it O
is O
present O
in O
the O
database O
. O

One O
of O
the O
key O
elements O
when O
searching O
the O
web O
is O
proper O
formulation O
of O
user O
queries O
. O

Search O
effectiveness O
can O
be O
seen O
as O
the O
accuracy O
of O
matching O
user O
information O
needs O
against O
the O
retrieved O
information O
. O

As O
step O
towards O
better O
search O
systems O
represents O
personalized O
search O
based O
on O
user O
profiles O
. O

Personalized O
search O
applications O
can O
notably O
contribute O
to O
the O
improvement O
of O
web O
search O
effectiveness O
. O

This O
chapter O
presents O
design O
and O
experiments O
with O
an O
information O
retrieval O
system O
utilizing O
user O
profiles O
, O
fuzzy O
information O
retrieval O
and O
genetic O
algorithms O
for O
improvement O
of O
web O
search O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Introduction O

The O
study O
of O
geographic O
information O
sciences O
emerges O
in O
the O
last O
decade O
as O
an O
exciting O
multidisciplinary O
domain O
, O
spanning O
such O
areas O
as O
cartography O
, O
geography O
, O
remote O
sensing O
, O
image O
processing O
, O
and O
computer O
sciences O
. O

In O
recent O
years O
many O
new O
applications O
of O
GIS O
have O
appeared O
in O
different O
domain O
and O
the O
technology O
continues O
to O
expand O
at O
a O
spectacular O
rate O
. O

This O
advance O
is O
the O
result O
of O
the O
contribution O
of O
several O
disciplines O
such O
as O
computational O
geometry O
, O
spatial O
statistics O
, O
spatial O
cognition O
, O
databases O
, O
and O
computer O
graphics O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
study O
presents O
a O
new O
similarity O
measure O
based O
on O
the O
geometric O
- O
mean O
averaging O
operator O
to O
handle O
the O
similarity O
measure O
problems O
of O
generalized O
fuzzy O
numbers O
. O

Some O
properties O
of O
the O
proposed O
similarity O
measure O
are O
demonstrated O
, O
and O
26 O
sets O
of O
generalized O
fuzzy O
numbers O
are O
used O
to O
compare O
the O
proposed O
method O
with O
existing O
similarity O
measures O
. O

Comparison O
results O
indicate O
that O
the O
proposed O
similarity O
measure O
is O
better O
than O
existing O
methods O
. O

Finally O
, O
the O
proposed O
similarity O
measure O
is O
applied O
to O
propose O
an O
algorithm O
for O
handling O
fuzzy O
- O
number O
information O

problems O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
new O
approach O
to O
information O
retrieval O
from O
non O
- O
structured O
attributes O
in O
databases O
, O
which O
involves O
the O
processing O
of O
text O
attributes O
. O

To O
make O
retrieval O
more O
effective O
, O
frequent O
text O
sequences O
are O
extracted O
and O
mathematically O
represented O
as O
intermediate O
forms O
which O
permit O
a O
clearer O
and O
more O
precise O
definition O
of O
operations O
on O
texts O
. O

These O
intermediate O
forms O
appear O
to O
users O
in O
the O
form O
of O
tag O
clouds O
to O
facilitate O
content O
identification O
, O
exploration O
, O
and O
querying O
. O

In O
this O
sense O
, O
tag O
cloud O
visualization O
is O
a O
simple O
, O
user O
- O
friendly O
visual O
interface O
to O
data O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
theoretical O
model O
for O
the O
representation O
of O
frequent O
text O
sequences O
and O
their O
operations O
as O
well O
as O
a O
general O
procedure O
for O
generating O
tag O
clouds O
from O
text O
attributes O
in O
databases O
. O

The O
tag O
clouds O
thus O
obtained O
were O
compared O
with O
conventional O
tag O
clouds O
composed O
of O
single O
terms O
. O

Our O
study O
showed O
that O
automatically O
generated O
multi O
- O
term O
tag O
clouds O
provide O
better O
results O
than O
mono O
- O
term O
tag O
clouds O
. O

We O
can O
see O

and O

links O
between O

and O

in O

, O

, O

as O
such O
, O

of O

. O

. O

) O

about O
systems O

than O

alone O
. O

Ambiguity O
in O
natural O
language O
has O
an O
effect O
on O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
system O
in O
general O
and O
web O
search O
system O
in O
particular O
. O

Word O
sense O
ambiguity O
is O
the O
reason O
behind O
the O
poor O
performance O
of O
IR O
system O
. O

If O
the O
ambiguous O
words O
are O
correctly O
disambiguated O
then O
IR O
performance O
can O
increase O
. O

WSD O
is O
defined O
as O
the O
task O
of O
identifying O
the O
sense O
of O
word O
in O
textual O
context O
. O

Word O
Sense O
Disambiguation O
( O
WSD O
) O
is O
the O
central O
problem O
of O
language O
processing O
. O

WSD O
improves O
the O
IR O
in O
many O
ways O
. O

Current O
IR O
system O
do O
not O
use O
explicit O
WSD O
and O
rely O
on O
user O
typing O
enough O
content O
in O
the O
query O
to O
only O
retrieve O
documents O
relevant O
to O
the O
intended O
senses O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
an O
algorithm O
for O
efficient O
retrieval O
of O
information O
on O
the O
Web O
according O
to O
user O
’s O
need O
. O

Results O
are O
more O
accurate O
and O
they O
are O
according O
to O
user O
’s O
preference O
. O

ABSTNACT O

. O

We O
present O

- O

( O

) O

. O

. O

The O

-DOCSTART- O

As O
a O
result O
, O

has O

a O
a O

’s O
probably O
ill O
- O

request O
to O

documents O
[ O
3 O

. O

. O

In O

( O
IR O

. O

- O

the O
possible O

of O
words O
and O
character O
n O
- O

. O

of O

with O
uni O
- O
grams O

to O

Chinese O

for O
IR O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Nowadays O
, O
Web O
- O
based O

systems O
, O
such O
as O
web O

or O

. O

Unfortunately O
, O

workers O
currently O

an O
information O
overload O
. O

Thus O
, O
system O
support O
is O
required O
that O
enables O
a O
reduction O
of O
information O
load O
based O

of O
these O
streams O
. O

( O

) O

. O

It O

a O

architecture O
named O
Spectre O
for O

. O

, O

. O

When O
processing O
raw O
documents O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
System O
, O
a O
< O
i O
> O
term O
- O
weighting O
scheme</i O
> O
is O
used O
to O
calculate O
the O
importance O
of O
each O
term O
which O
occurs O
in O
a O
document O
. O

However O
, O
most O
< O
i O
> O
term O
- O
weighting O
schemes</i O
> O
assume O
that O
a O
term O
is O
independent O
of O
the O
other O
terms O
. O

Term O
dependency O
is O
an O
indispensable O
consequence O
of O
language O
use O
[ O
1 O

Therefore O
, O
this O
assumption O
can O
make O
the O
information O
of O
a O
document O
being O
lost O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
new O
approach O
to O
refine O
term O
weights O
of O
documents O
using O
term O
dependencies O
discovered O
from O
a O
set O
of O
documents O
. O

Then O
, O
we O
evaluate O
our O
method O
with O
two O

based O
on O
the O
vector O
space O
model O
[ O
2 O
] O
and O
the O
language O
model O
[ O
3 O
] O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
article O
presents O
a O
method O
of O
constructing O
and O
applying O
a O
cascade O
consisting O
of O
a O
left O
- O
and O
a O
right O
- O
sequential O
nite O
- O
state O
transducer O
, O
T1 O
and O
T2 O
, O
for O
part O
- O
of O
- O
speech O
disambiguation O
. O

In O
the O
process O
of O
POS O
tagging O
, O
every O
word O
is O
rst O
assigned O
a O
unique O
ambiguity O
class O
that O
represents O
the O
set O
of O
alternative O
tags O
that O
this O
word O
can O
occur O
with O
. O

The O
sequence O
of O
the O
ambiguity O
classes O
of O
all O
words O
of O
one O
sentence O
is O
then O
mapped O
by O
T1 O
to O
a O
sequence O
of O
reduced O
ambiguity O
classes O
where O
some O
of O
the O
less O
likely O
tags O
are O
removed O
. O

That O
sequence O
is O
nally O
mapped O
by O
T2 O
to O
a O
sequence O
of O
single O
tags O
. O

Compared O
to O
a O
Hidden O
Markov O
model O
tagger O
, O
this O
transducer O
cascade O
has O
the O
advantage O
of O
signiicantly O
higher O
processing O
speed O
, O
but O
at O
the O
cost O
of O
slightly O
lower O
accuracy O
. O

Applications O
such O
as O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
where O
the O
speed O
can O
be O
more O
important O
than O
accuracy O
, O
could O
beneet O
from O
this O
approach O
. O

The O
main O
challenge O
for O
effective O
web O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
is O
to O
infer O
the O
information O
need O
from O
user O
’s O
query O
and O
retrieve O
relevant O
documents O
. O

The O
precision O
of O
search O
results O
is O
low O
due O
to O
vague O
and O
imprecise O
user O
queries O
and O
hence O
could O
not O
retrieve O
sufficient O
relevant O
documents O
. O

Fuzzy O
set O
based O
query O
expansion O
deals O
with O
imprecise O
and O
vague O
queries O
for O
inferring O
user O
’s O
information O
need O
. O

Trust O
based O
web O
page O
recommendations O
retrieve O
search O
results O
according O
to O
the O
user O
’s O
information O
need O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
an O
algorithm O
is O
designed O
for O
Intelligent O
Information O
Retrieval O
using O
hybrid O
of O
Fuzzy O
set O
and O
Trust O
in O
web O
query O
session O
mining O
to O
perform O
Fuzzy O
query O
expansion O
for O
inferring O
user O
’s O
information O
need O
and O
trust O
is O
used O
for O
recommendation O
of O
web O
pages O
according O
to O
the O
user O
’s O
information O
need O
. O

Experiment O
was O
performed O
on O
the O
data O
set O
collected O
in O
domains O
Academics O
, O
Entertainment O
and O
Sports O
and O
search O
results O
confirm O
the O
improvement O
of O
precision O
. O

of O

unnatural O

. O

of O

to O

from O
a O

of O

. O

. O

key O
phrases O
in O
terms O
of O
concepts O
or O
a O

. O

to O

multiple O

to O

. O

by O

( O

of O

and O
emotions O
. O

analysis O

in O

( O

) O

which O
can O

, O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

How O
to O
assign O
appropriate O
weights O
to O
terms O
is O
one O
of O
the O
critical O
issues O
in O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Many O
term O
weighting O
schemes O
are O
unsupervised O
. O

They O
are O
either O
based O
on O
the O
empirical O
observation O
in O
information O
retrieval O
, O
or O
based O
on O
generative O
approaches O
for O
language O
modeling O
. O

As O
a O
result O
, O
the O
existing O
term O
weighting O
schemes O
are O
usually O
insufficient O
in O
distinguishing O
informative O
words O
from O
the O
uninformative O
ones O
, O
which O
is O
crucial O
to O
the O
performance O
of O
information O
retrieval O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
supervised O
term O
weighting O
schemes O
that O
automatically O
learn O
term O
weights O
based O
on O
the O
correlation O
between O
word O
frequency O
and O
category O
information O
of O
documents O
. O

Empirical O
studies O
with O
the O
ImageCLEF O
dataset O
have O
indicated O
that O
the O
proposed O
methods O
perform O
substantially O
better O
than O
the O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
approaches O
for O
term O
weighting O
and O
other O
alternatives O
that O
exploit O
category O
information O
for O
information O
retrieval O
. O

paper O
describes O
the O
development O
and O

of O
a O
model O

intermediary O
based O
on O
an O
AI O

of O
belief O
revision O
. O

We O
describe O
the O

foundations O
of O
the O
work O
in O
a O
general O
account O
of O
the O
way O
an O
agent O
’s O
beliefs O
and O
intentions O
are O
formed O
and O
modified O
, O
and O
in O
an O
analysis O
of O
the O
functional O
tasks O
an O
intermediary O
has O
to O
carry O
out O
; O
we O
indicate O
the O
specific O
developments O
required O
to O
automate O
and O
integrate O
both O
aspects O
of O
intermediary O
behaviour O
, O
as O
determinants O
of O
interact O
i O
ve O
dialogue O
with O
the O
user O
; O
and O
report O
, O
with O
illustrations O
, O
on O
tests O
and O
findings O
. O

The O
research O
shows O
that O
such O
approaches O
can O
be O
implemented O
in O
an O
essentially O
principled O
manner O
, O
though O
there O
are O
many O
large O
problems O
still O
to O
be O

, O

the O

, O

, O

The O
clinical O
documents O
stored O
in O
a O
textual O
and O
unstructured O
manner O
represent O
a O
precious O
source O
of O
information O
that O
can O
be O
gathered O
by O
exploiting O
Information O
Retrieval O
techniques O
. O

Classification O
algorithms O
, O
and O
their O
composition O
through O
Ensemble O
Methods O
, O
can O
be O
used O
for O
organizing O
this O
huge O
amount O
of O
data O
, O
but O
are O
usually O
tested O
on O
standardized O
corpora O
, O
which O
significantly O
differ O
from O
actual O
clinical O
documents O
that O
can O
be O
found O
in O
a O
modern O
hospital O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
the O
results O
of O
a O
large O
experimental O
analysis O
conducted O
on O
36,000 O
clinical O
documents O
, O
generated O
by O
three O
different O
medical O
Departments O
. O

For O
the O
sake O
of O
this O
investigation O
we O
propose O
a O
new O
classifier O
, O
based O
on O
the O
entropy O
idea O
, O
and O
test O
four O
single O
algorithms O
and O
four O
ensemble O
methods O
. O

The O
experimental O
results O
show O
the O
performance O
of O
selected O
approaches O
in O
a O
real O
- O
world O
environment O
, O
and O
highlights O
the O
impact O
of O
obsolescence O
on O
classification O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
paper O
describes O
a O
named O
entity O
recognition O
system O
for O
Amharic O
, O
an O
under O
- O
resourced O
language O
, O
using O
a O
recurrent O
neural O
network O
, O
a O
bi O
- O
directional O
long O
short O
term O
memory O
model O
to O
identify O
and O
classify O
tokens O
into O
six O
predefined O
classes O
: O
Person O
, O
Location O
, O
Organization O
, O
Time O
, O
Title O
, O
and O
Other O
( O
non O
- O
named O
entity O

tokens O
Word O
vectors O
based O
on O
semantic O
information O
are O
built O
for O
all O
tokens O
using O
an O
unsupervised O
learning O
algorithm O
, O
word2vec O
. O

The O
word O
vectors O
were O
merged O
with O
a O
set O
of O
specifically O
developed O
language O
independent O
features O
and O
together O
fed O
to O
the O
neural O
network O
model O
to O
predict O
the O
classes O
of O
the O
words O
. O

When O
evaluated O
by O
10-fold O
cross O
- O
validation O
, O
the O
created O
Amharic O
named O
entity O
recogniser O
achieved O
good O
average O
precision O
( O
77.2 O
but O
did O
worse O
on O
recall O
( O
63.4 O
for O
a O
69.7 O
% O
F1-score O
. O

- O

. O

. O

of O

systems O
can O
not O
be O

to O

large O
amounts O
of O
information O
to O

profile O
. O

Therefore O
, O
term O

methods O
for O
information O

have O
somewhat O
different O
requirements O
to O
those O
for O
information O

and O

. O

We O
present O

of O
term O

methods O
, O

a O
new O
method O
, O
relative O
document O

, O
designed O
specifically O
for O
information O

. O

The O
best O

methods O

to O

that O
favor O

provided O
by O

user O
, O
over O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Term O
weighting O
schemes O
are O
central O
to O
the O
study O
of O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

This O
article O
proposes O
a O
novel O
TF O
- O
IDF O
term O
weighting O
scheme O
that O
employs O
two O
different O
within O
document O
term O
frequency O
normalizations O
to O
capture O
two O
different O
aspects O
of O
term O
saliency O
. O

One O
component O
of O
the O
term O
frequency O
is O
effective O
for O
short O
queries O
, O
while O
the O
other O
performs O
better O
on O
long O
queries O
. O

The O
final O
weight O
is O
then O
measured O
by O
taking O
a O
weighted O
combination O
of O
these O
components O
, O
which O
is O
determined O
on O
the O
basis O
of O
the O
length O
of O
the O
corresponding O
query O
Experiments O
conducted O
on O
a O
large O
number O
of O
TREC O
news O
and O
web O
collections O
demonstrate O
that O
the O
proposed O
scheme O
almost O
always O
outperforms O
five O
state O
of O
the O
art O
retrieval O
models O
with O
remarkable O
significance O
and O
consistency O
. O

The O
experimental O
results O
also O
show O
that O
the O
proposed O
model O
achieves O
significantly O
better O
precision O
than O
the O
existing O
models O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
model O
for O
optimal O
information O
retrieval O
over O
a O
distributed O
document O
collection O
is O
described O
and O
experimentally O
evaluated O
. O

The O
fusion O
of O
retrieval O
results O
corresponding O
to O
document O
subcollections O
is O
performed O
according O
to O
the O
Probability O
Ranking O
Principle O
. O

Part O
of O
the O
model O
is O
a O
selection O
criterion O
for O
e O
ectively O
limiting O
the O
ranking O
process O
to O
a O
subset O
of O
subcollections O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O

. O

The O

system O
structure O
established O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

half O
- O

evaluation O

to O

. O

We O

- O

, O

- O

methodology O
for O

areas O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
the O
spirit O
of O

’s O
1900 O

, O

would O
seem O
appropriate O
at O
the O

of O
the O
21 O
century O
to O
highlight O
some O
research O
areas O
, O
challenges O
, O
problems O
and O
possible O
directions O
that O
will O
be O
taken O
up O
by O
spatial O
scientists O
in O
the O
coming O
decades O
. O

The O
paper O
covers O
areas O
such O
as O

data O

, O

and O

. O

The O

does O
not O

will O
come O
about O

into O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

We O
present O
nondeterministic O
hypotheses O
learned O
from O
an O
ordinal O
regression O
task O
. O

They O
try O
to O
predict O
the O
true O
rank O
for O
an O
entry O
, O
but O
when O
the O
classification O
is O
uncertain O
the O
hypotheses O
predict O
a O
set O
of O
consecutive O
ranks O
( O
an O
interval O
The O
aim O
is O
to O
keep O
the O
set O
of O
ranks O
as O
small O
as O
possible O
, O
while O
still O
containing O
the O
true O
rank O
. O

The O
justification O
for O
learning O
such O
a O
hypothesis O
is O
based O
on O
a O
real O
world O
problem O
arisen O
in O
breeding O
beef O
cattle O
. O

After O
defining O
a O
family O
of O
loss O
functions O
inspired O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
we O
derive O
an O
algorithm O
for O
minimizing O
them O
. O

The O
algorithm O
is O
based O
on O
posterior O
probabilities O
of O
ranks O
given O
an O
entry O
. O

A O
couple O
of O
implementations O
are O
compared O
: O
one O
based O
on O
a O
multiclass O
SVM O
and O
other O
based O
on O
Gaussian O
processes O
designed O
to O
minimize O
the O
linear O
loss O
in O
ordinal O
regression O
tasks O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Electronic O
discharge O
letters O
are O
in O
many O
cases O
insufficient O
as O
a O
recipe O
for O
further O
treatment O
and O
recovery O
. O

Through O
using O
discharge O
letters O
as O
input O
to O
our O
neural O
network O
based O
information O
retrieval O
system O
Pasent O
, O
we O
have O
been O
able O
to O
provide O
relevant O
medical O
information O
. O

The O
Pasent O
search O
method O
uses O
predefined O
knowledge O
about O
the O
context O
, O
paired O
with O
the O
vocabulary O
of O
the O
input O
document O
, O
to O
compute O
a O
relevance O
measure O
for O
a O
potential O
result O
document O
. O

In O
the O
reported O
experiments O
, O
we O
achieved O
search O
results O
comparable O
to O
the O
tftdf O
method O
without O
building O
specialised O
context O
models O
for O
the O
experiment O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
recent O
years O
biology O
has O
become O
an O
information O
science O
, O
where O
an O
avalanche O
of O
newly O
sequenced O
genomic O
data O
has O
overwhelmed O
our O
existing O
analysis O
and O
mining O
tools O
. O

This O
paper O
addresses O
this O
challenge O
by O
developing O
a O
systematic O
way O
of O
speeding O
up O
a O
broad O
class O
of O
bioinformatics O
algorithms O
using O
commodity O
graphics O
processing O
hardware O
. O

Using O
the O
example O
problem O
of O
analyzing O
DNA O
structural O
variations O
, O
we O
demonstrate O
how O
such O
computations O
can O
be O
significantly O
accelerated O
in O
various O
parallel O
architectures O
, O
yielding O
over O
two O
orders O
of O
magnitude O
speedups O
at O
low O
cost O
and O
with O
relatively O
modest O
programming O
effort O
. O

Our O
implementation O
of O
a O
sliding O
window O
-based O
technique O
on O
the O
GPU O
and O
Cell O
architectures O
seems O
promising O
in O
its O
generality O
and O
extensibility O
to O
other O
problems O
and O
domains O
. O

. O

that O
as O

as O

higher O
relevant O

to O

A O
database O
which O

about O
bacteria O
and O

a O

and O

is O
crucial O
for O

. O

Having O

information O

through O
textual O
resources O
such O
as O

articles O

pages O

, O

, O

among O

. O

of O

. O

for O

on O

, O
utilizes O

. O

of O
traditional O
Irish O

music O
. O

for O

commonly O
employed O
by O
traditional O
musicians O
. O

these O
are O
ornamentation O
the O
long O
note O

and O

. O

paper O

of O

that O
using O
this O
higher O

knowledge O
of O

in O
traditional O

in O

in O

over O
standard O

from O

. O

Similarity O
is O
a O
widely O
used O
concept O
, O
with O
utilizations O
in O
various O
fields O
, O
such O
as O
pattern O
recognition O
, O
case O
- O
based O
reasoning O
, O
image O
processing O
, O
approximate O
reasoning O
, O
machine O
learning O
, O
information O
retrieval O
for O
instance O
. O

There O
exist O
many O
definitions O
of O
similarity O
or O
resemblance O
, O
or O
conversely O
, O
dissimilarity O
or O
distance O
. O

In O
the O
case O
where O
the O
objects O
to O
be O
compared O
are O
not O
defined O
on O
a O
metrical O
universe O
, O
distances O
are O
clearly O
not O
appropriate O
. O

Several O
types O
of O
similarity O
are O
nevertheless O
available O
[ O
1 O
which O
have O
been O
connected O
with O
seminal O
works O
in O
psychology O
[ O
6 O
] O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
is O
presented O
as O
the O
task O
of O
retrieving O
the O
documents O
that O
are O
relevant O
to O
a O
given O
query O
. O

In O
the O
context O
of O
a O
Terminological O
Logic O
( O
TL O
) O
based O
approach O
to O
IR O
, O
this O
amounts O
to O
embodying O
a O
notion O
of O
relevance O
in O
the O
logical O
implication O
relation O
of O
the O
chosen O
TL O
. O

Among O
the O
many O
possible O
readings O
of O
the O
term O
“ O
relevance O
the O
one O
captured O
by O
relevance O
logic O
, O
and O
in O
particular O
by O
first O
- O
order O
tautological O
entailment O
, O
can O
be O
viewed O
as O
a O
promising O
source O
of O
inspiration O
, O
to O
the O
end O
of O
incorporating O
a O
logic O
- O
based O
form O
of O
relevance O
in O
the O
inference O
mechanism O
of O
TLs O
. O

The O
aim O
of O
this O
paper O
is O
to O
present O
a O
Relevant O
Terminological O
Logic O
, O
while O
maintaining O
the O
desired O
“ O
relevance O
” O
flavour O
of O
relevance O
logics O
, O
which O
could O
be O
considered O
as O
a O
base O
towards O
a O
suitable O
document O
description O
logic O
for O
IR O
purposes O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
enhances O
some O
of O
the O
main O
aspects O
of O
a O
system O
which O
converses O
in O
Portuguese O
to O
provide O
a O
library O
service O
covering O
the O
field O
of O
Artificial O
Intelligence O
. O

Its O
central O
feature O
is O
the O
use O
of O
logic O
as O
a O
single O
uniform O
language O
for O
knowledge O
and O
data O
representation O
, O

information O
retrieval O
and O
linguistic O
analysis O
. O

The O
objective O
of O
designing O
this O
system O
was O

development O
of O
a O
feasible O
method O
for O
consulting O
and O
creating O
data O
bases O
in O
natural O
Portuguese O
. O

The O
system O
is O
implemented O
in O

, O
a O
programming O
language O
essentially O
identical O
in O
syntax O
and O
semantics O
to O
a O
subset O
of O
predicate O
calculus O
in O
clausal O
form O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Cross O
Lingual O
Word O
Semantic O
( O
CLWS O
) O
similarity O
is O
defined O
as O
a O
task O
to O
find O
the O
semantic O
similarity O
between O
two O
words O
across O
languages O
. O

Semantic O
similarity O
has O
been O
very O
popular O
in O
computing O
the O
similarity O
between O
two O
words O
in O
same O
language O
. O

CLWS O
similarity O
will O
prove O
to O
be O
very O
effective O
in O
the O
area O
of O
Cross O
Lingual O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
Machine O
Translation O
, O
Cross O
Lingual O
Word O
Sense O
Disambiguation O
, O
etc O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
discuss O
a O
system O
that O
is O
developed O
to O
compute O
CLWS O
similarity O
of O
words O
between O
two O
languages O
, O
where O
one O
language O
is O
treated O
as O
resourceful O
and O
other O
is O
resource O
scarce O
. O

The O
system O
is O
developed O
using O
WordNet O
. O

The O
intuition O
behind O
this O
system O
is O
that O
, O
two O
words O
are O
semantically O
similar O
if O
their O
senses O
are O
similar O
to O
each O
other O
. O

The O
system O
is O
tested O
for O
English O
and O
Hindi O
with O
the O
accuracy O
60.5 O
% O
precision@1 O
and O
72.91 O
% O
precision@3 O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
current O
grid O
information O
retrieval O
commonly O
uses O
the O
method O
based O
on O
keywords O
, O
and O
the O
retrieval O
method O
depends O
on O
the O
keywords O
that O
match O
their O
participation O
in O
the O
external O
form O
of O
characters O
, O
rather O
than O
the O
concept O
expressed O
by O
their O
neglect O
of O
the O
semantic O
information O
inherent O
in O
the O
word O
. O

It O
brings O
about O
varieties O
of O
problems O
, O
including O
too O
much O
information O
or O
false O
drop O
, O
etc O
. O

Thus O
, O
the O
prevalence O
of O
low O
searching O
efficiency O
existed O
and O
accuracy O
of O
the O
phenomenon O
is O
not O
high O
. O

Ontology O
technology O
which O
is O
combined O
with O
Semantic O
Grid O
platform O
would O
provide O
a O
new O
implement O
method O
to O
the O
intelligent O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Based O
on O
this O
, O
this O
paper O
constructs O
the O
grid O
information O
retrieval O
model O
to O
achieve O
a O
higher O
degree O
of O
matching O
between O
user O
's O
requests O
and O
the O
retrieval O
content O
, O
thereby O
, O
increasing O
the O
recall O
ratio O
and O
precision O
ratio O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Ontology O
provides O
a O
shared O
and O
reusable O
piece O
of O
knowledge O
about O
a O
specific O
domain O
, O
and O
has O
been O
applied O
in O
many O
fields O
, O
such O
as O
semantic O
Web O
, O
e O
- O
commerce O
and O
information O
retrieval O
, O
etc O
. O

However O
, O
building O
ontology O
by O
hand O
is O
a O
very O
hard O
and O
error O
- O
prone O
task O
. O

Learning O
ontology O
from O
existing O
resources O
is O
a O
good O
solution O
. O

Because O
relational O
database O
is O
widely O
used O
for O
storing O
data O
and O
OWL O
is O
the O
latest O
standard O
recommended O
by O
W3C O
, O
this O
paper O
proposes O
an O
approach O
of O
learning O
OWL O
ontology O
from O
data O
in O
relational O
database O
. O

Compared O
with O
existing O
methods O
, O
the O
approach O
can O
acquire O
ontology O
from O
relational O
database O
automatically O
by O
using O
a O
group O
of O
learning O
rules O
instead O
of O
using O
a O
middle O
model O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
it O
can O
obtain O
OWL O
ontology O
, O
including O
the O
classes O
, O
properties O
, O
properties O
characteristics O
, O
cardinality O
and O
instances O
, O
while O
none O
of O
existing O
methods O
can O
acquire O
all O
of O
them O
. O

The O
proposed O
learning O
rules O
have O
been O
proven O
to O
be O
correct O
by O
practice O
. O

. O

. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
focus O
on O
one O
of O
the O
most O
challenging O
tasks O
in O
temporal O
information O
retrieval O
: O
detection O
of O
a O
web O
page O
< O
i O
> O
publication O
date O
i O
> O

The O
natural O
approach O
to O
this O
problem O
is O
to O
find O
the O
publication O
date O
in O
the O
HTML O
body O
of O
a O
page O
. O

However O
, O
there O
are O
two O
fundamental O
problems O
with O
this O
approach O
. O

First O
, O
not O
all O
web O
pages O
contain O
the O
publication O
dates O
in O
their O
texts O
. O

Second O
, O

is O
hard O
to O
distinguish O
the O
publication O
date O
among O
all O
the O
dates O
found O
in O
the O
page O
's O

. O

The O
approach O
we O
suggest O
in O
this O
paper O
supplements O
methods O
of O

extraction O
from O
the O
page O

with O
novel O

- O
based O
methods O
of O

. O

Some O
of O

methods O
are O
based O
on O
a O
probabilistic O
model O
of O
the O
Web O
graph O
structure O
evolution O
, O
which O
relies O
on O
the O
publication O

of O
web O
pages O
as O
on O
its O
parameters O
. O

We O
use O
this O
model O
to O
estimate O
the O
publication O
dates O
of O
web O
pages O
: O
based O
only O
on O
the O
link O
structure O
currently O
observed O
, O
we O
perform O
a O
reverse O
engineering O
to O
reveal O
the O
whole O
process O
of O
the O
Web O
's O
evolution O
. O

Today&#8217;s O

provides O
many O

, O

, O

, O

. O

. O

more O

. O

documents O

, O
sim(q O
, O

, O

-DOCSTART- O

A O
Grid O

Retrieval O
( O

) O
simulation O

Million O
Query O
Track O

. O

The O
GOV2 O
collection O
was O

by O

and O

performance O
of O

, O

qrel O
counts O
from O
the O
past O

Terabyte O
Tracks O

to O

of O

. O

simulation O
, O

% O
of O

documents O
. O

IR O

of O

, O

topic O
- O

, O

- O
pref O
, O

Rel@10 O
over O
the O
TREC O
Terabyte O
- O
Track O
topics O
is O
within O
one O
standard O
deviation O
of O
the O
respective O
topic O
- O
averaged O
TREC O
Million O

scores O
. O

AP O
of O

results O

to O

- O

of O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Any O

to O
a O
n O

w O

( O

. O

The O
fast O

of O

technologies O
has O
introduced O
a O
world O
of O
big O
data O
. O

How O
efficiently O
and O
effectively O
to O
retrieve O
the O
information O
from O
the O
ocean O
of O
data O
that O
the O
users O
really O
want O
is O
an O
important O
topic O
. O

Recommendation O
systems O
have O
become O
a O
popular O
approach O
to O
personalized O
information O
retrieval O
. O

On O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
social O
media O
have O
quickly O
entered O
into O
your O
life O
. O

The O
information O
from O

for O

systems O
. O

among O

and O

' O

and O

from O

. O

To O

for O

on O
this O

. O

. O

our O

-DOCSTART- O

For O
bridging O
the O
gap O
between O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
and O
databases O
( O
DB O
this O
article O
focuses O
on O
the O
logical O
view O
. O

We O
claim O
that O
IR O
should O
adopt O
three O
major O
concepts O
from O
DB O
, O
namely O
inference O
, O
vague O
predicates O
and O
expressive O
query O
languages O
. O

By O
regarding O
IR O
as O
uncertain O
inference O
, O
probabilistic O
versions O
of O
relational O
algebra O
and O
Datalog O
yield O
very O
powerful O
inference O
mechanisms O
for O
IR O
as O
well O
as O
allowing O
for O
more O
flexible O
systems O
. O

For O
dealing O
with O
various O
media O
and O
data O
types O
, O
vague O
predicates O
form O
a O
natural O
extension O
of O
text O
retrieval O
methods O
to O
attribute O
values O
, O
thus O
switching O
from O
propositional O
to O
predicate O
logic O
. O

A O
more O
expressive O
IR O
query O
language O
should O
support O
joins O
, O
be O
able O
to O
compute O
aggregated O
results O
, O
and O
allow O
for O
restructuring O
of O
the O
result O
objects O
. O

: O

, O
part O
- O
of O
- O

. O

We O
have O
focused O
on O

and O

( O

Our O

to O

and O

. O

We O
found O
: O
1 O
) O

2 O

that O
more O

in O

- O
of O
- O

in O

, O
and O
3 O
) O
that O

is O
crucial O
to O
assign O
credit O
to O
the O
component O
words O
of O
a O
phrase O
. O

These O

of O
word O

, O
and O

where O

-DOCSTART- O

Retrieving O
information O
from O
heterogeneous O
database O
systems O
involves O
a O
complex O
process O
and O
remains O
a O
challenging O
research O
area O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
cognitively O
- O
guided O
approach O
for O
developing O
an O
information O
retrieval O
agent O
that O
takes O
the O
user O
’s O
information O
request O
, O
identifies O
relevant O
information O
sources O
, O
and O
generates O
a O
multidatabase O
access O
plan O
. O

Our O
work O
is O
distinctive O
in O
that O
agent O
design O
is O
based O
on O
an O
empirical O
study O
of O
how O
human O
experts O
retrieve O
information O
from O
multiple O
, O
heterogeneous O
database O
systems O
. O

To O
improve O
on O
empirically O
observed O
information O
retrieval O
capabilities O
, O
the O
design O
incorporates O
mathematical O
models O
and O
algorithmic O
components O
. O

These O
components O
optimize O
the O
set O
of O
information O
sources O
that O
need O
to O
be O
considered O
to O
respond O
to O
a O
user O
query O
and O
are O
used O
to O
develop O
efficient O
multidatabase O
access O
plans O
. O

This O
agent O
design O
which O
integrates O
cognitive O
and O
mathematical O
models O
has O
been O
implemented O
using O
the O
Soar O
architecture O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Comparing O
strings O
and O
assessing O
their O
similarity O
is O
a O
basic O
operation O
in O
many O
application O
domains O
of O
machine O
learning O
, O
such O
as O
in O
information O
retrieval O
, O
natural O
language O
processing O
and O
bioinformatics O
. O

The O
practitioner O
can O
choose O
from O
a O
large O
variety O
of O
available O
similarity O
measures O
for O
this O
task O
, O
each O
emphasizing O
different O
aspects O
of O
the O
string O
data O
. O

In O
this O
article O
, O
we O
present O
Harry O
, O
a O
small O
tool O
specifically O
designed O
for O
measuring O
the O
similarity O
of O
strings O
. O

Harry O
implements O
over O
20 O
similarity O
measures O
, O
including O
common O
string O
distances O
and O
string O
kernels O
, O
such O
as O
the O
Levenshtein O
distance O
and O
the O
Subsequence O
kernel O
. O

The O
tool O
has O
been O
designed O
with O
efficiency O
in O
mind O
and O
allows O
for O
multi O
- O
threaded O
as O
well O
as O
distributed O
computing O
, O
enabling O
the O
analysis O
of O
large O
data O
sets O
of O
strings O
. O

Harry O
supports O
common O
data O
formats O
and O
thus O
can O
interface O
with O
analysis O
environments O
, O
such O
as O
Matlab O
, O
Pylab O
and O
Weka O
. O

Digital O
libraries O
are O
huge O
and O
complex O
information O
systems O
. O

Digital O
library O
users O
are O
from O
various O
backgrounds O
with O
diversified O
information O
requirements O
. O

Digital O
library O
users O
are O
fed O
up O
with O
the O
information O
overload O
problem O
due O
its O
unsophisticated O
search O
features O
. O

Digital O
libraries O
can O
be O
effectively O
implemented O
by O
addressing O
the O
information O
overload O
problem O
. O

Hence O
, O
this O
paper O

newly O

information O

services O
architecture O
and O
its O
implementation O
details O
to O
enhance O
the O
digital O
library O
users&apos O
; O
search O
experience O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
growth O
of O
digital O
information O
increases O
the O
need O
to O
build O
better O
techniques O
for O
automatically O
storing O
, O
organizing O
and O
retrieving O
it O
. O

Much O
of O
this O
information O
is O
textual O
in O
nature O
and O
existing O
representation O
models O
struggle O
to O
deal O
with O
the O
high O
dimensionality O
of O
the O
resulting O
feature O
space O
. O

Techniques O
like O
latent O
semantic O
indexing O
address O
, O
to O
some O
degree O
, O
the O
problem O
of O
high O
dimensionality O
in O
information O

. O

However O
, O

alternatives O
, O
like O
random O
mapping O
( O
RM O
have O
yet O
to O
be O
completely O
studied O
in O
this O
context O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
show O
that O
despite O

attention O

has O
received O
in O
other O

, O

the O

of O
text O

it O
is O
outperformed O
not O
only O
by O
principal O
component O
analysis O
( O

) O
and O
independent O
component O
analysis O
( O
ICA O
) O
but O
also O
by O
a O
simple O
noise O
reduction O
algorithm O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Web O
services O
are O
accessed O
via O
query O
interfaces O
which O
hide O
databases O
containing O
thousands O
of O
relevant O
information O
. O

User O
’s O
side O
, O
distant O
database O
is O
a O
black O
box O
which O
accepts O
query O
and O
returns O
results O
, O
there O
is O
no O
way O
to O
access O
database O
schema O
which O
reflect O
data O
and O
query O
meanings O
. O

Hence O
, O
web O
services O
are O
very O
autonomous O
. O

Users O
view O
this O
autonomy O
as O
a O
major O
drawback O
because O
they O
need O
often O
to O
combine O
query O
capabilities O
of O
many O
web O
services O
at O
the O
same O
time O
. O

In O
this O
work O
, O
we O
will O
present O
a O
new O
approach O
which O
allows O
users O
to O
benefit O
of O
query O
capabilities O
of O
many O
web O
services O
while O
respecting O
autonomy O
of O
each O
service O
. O

This O
solution O
is O
a O
new O
contribution O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
research O
axe O
and O
has O
proven O
good O
performances O
on O
two O
standard O
datasets O
. O

Retrieval O
Model O
of O
Query O

; O
Query O
Extraction O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
reports O
the O
work O
of O
NTU O
in O
the O
bilingual O
- O
retrieval O
task O
at O
CLEF O
2001 O
. O

In O
this O
experiment O
, O
we O
compared O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
several O
approaches O
in O
Chinese O
- O
English O
cross O
- O
language O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Five O
models O
were O
proposed O
. O

Model O
1 O
used O
co O
- O
occurrence O
information O
in O
the O
target O
language O
to O
disambiguate O
translation O
equivalents O
; O
Model O
2 O
augmented O
restriction O
terms O
to O
the O
original O
queries O
to O
restrict O
the O
use O
of O
query O
terms O
in O
the O
target O
language O
; O
Model O
3 O
used O
a O
Chinese O
- O
English O
WordNet O
to O
translate O
queries O
; O

Model O
4 O
combined O
Model O
3 O
with O
Model O
2 O
; O
Model O
5 O
merged O
the O
queries O
constructed O
by O
Model O
2 O
and O
3 O
. O

This O
report O
describes O
the O
2011 O
Workshop O
on O
Human O
- O
Computer O
Interaction O
and O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

Now O
in O
its O
fifth O
year O
, O
the O
workshop O
was O
held O
in O
October O
, O
in O
Mountain O
View O
, O

. O

The O

, O

, O

a O

. O

The O

this O

We O

-DOCSTART- O

Automatic O
resolution O
of O
Crossword O
Puzzles O
( O
CPs O
) O
heavily O
depends O
on O
the O
quality O
of O
the O
answer O
candidate O
lists O
produced O
by O
a O
retrieval O
system O
for O
each O
clue O
of O
the O
puzzle O
grid O
. O

Previous O
work O
has O
shown O
that O
such O
lists O
can O
be O
generated O
using O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
search O
algorithms O
applied O
to O
the O
databases O
containing O
previously O
solved O
CPs O
and O
reranked O
with O
tree O
kernels O
( O
TKs O
) O
applied O
to O
a O
syntactic O
tree O
representation O
of O
the O
clues O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
create O
a O
labelled O
dataset O
of O
2 O
million O
clues O
on O
which O
we O
apply O
an O
innovative O
Distributional O
Neural O
Network O
( O
DNN O
) O
for O
reranking O
clue O
pairs O
. O

Our O
DNN O
is O
computationally O
efficient O
and O
can O
thus O
take O
advantage O
of O
such O
large O
datasets O
showing O
a O
large O
improvement O
over O
the O
TK O
approach O
, O
when O
the O
latter O
uses O
small O
training O
data O
. O

In O
contrast O
, O
when O
data O
is O
scarce O
, O
TKs O
outperform O
DNNs O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
explores O
the O
role O
of O
information O
retrieval O
in O
answering O
“ O
relationship O
” O
questions O
, O
a O
new O
class O
complex O
information O
needs O
formally O
introduced O
in O
TREC O
2005 O
. O

Since O
information O
retrieval O
is O
often O
an O
integral O
component O
of O
many O
question O
answering O
strategies O
, O
it O
is O
important O
to O
understand O
the O
impact O
of O
different O
termbased O
techniques O
. O

Within O
a O
framework O
of O
sentence O
retrieval O
, O
we O
examine O
three O
factors O
that O
contribute O
to O
question O
answering O
performance O
: O
the O
use O
of O
different O
retrieval O
engines O
, O
relevance O
( O
both O
at O
the O
document O
and O
sentence O
level O
and O
redundancy O
. O

Results O
point O
out O
the O
limitations O
of O
purely O
term O
- O
based O
methods O
to O
this O
challenging O
task O
. O

Nevertheless O
, O
IR O
- O
based O
techniques O
provide O
a O
strong O
baseline O
on O
top O
of O
which O
more O
sophisticated O
language O
processing O
techniques O
can O
be O
deployed O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Music O
genre O
classification O
is O
one O
of O
the O
most O
important O
element O
of O
the O
music O
information O
retrieval O
( O
MIR O
) O
community O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
a O
music O
genre O
classification O
system O
using O
field O
programmable O
gate O
arrays O
( O
FPGA O
) O
and O
dedicated O
DSP O
processors O
. O

The O
proposed O
system O
uses O
FPGA O
based O
acoustic O
feature O
extraction O
of O
mel O
frequency O
cepstral O
coefficients O
( O
MFCC O
) O
and O
dynamic O
time O
warping O
( O
DTW O
) O
based O
classifier O
using O
TMS320C6713 O
floating O
point O
processor O
. O

We O
successfully O
implemented O
MFCC O
extraction O
algorithm O
on O
Spartan O
6 O
FPGA O
clocked O
at O
150 O
MHz O
with O
support O
from O
TMS320C6713 O
floating O
point O
processor O
followed O
by O
DTW O
based O
matching O
engine O
. O

The O
paper O
attempts O
to O
implement O
music O
genre O
classification O
algorithm O
in O
hardware O
, O
yielding O
competitive O
performance O
in O
music O
information O
retrieval O
applications O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
aim O
at O
detecting O
salient O
objects O
in O
unconstrained O
images O
. O

In O
unconstrained O
images O
, O
the O
number O
of O
salient O
objects O
( O
if O
any O
) O
varies O
from O
image O
to O
image O
, O
and O
is O
not O
given O
. O

We O
present O
a O
salient O
object O
detection O
system O
that O
directly O
outputs O
a O
compact O
set O
of O
detection O
windows O
, O
if O
any O
, O
for O
an O
input O
image O
. O

Our O
system O
leverages O
a O
Convolutional O
- O
Neural O
- O
Network O
model O
to O
generate O
location O
proposals O
of O
salient O
objects O
. O

Location O
proposals O
tend O
to O
be O
highly O
overlapping O
and O
noisy O
. O

Based O
on O
the O
Maximum O
a O
Posteriori O
principle O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
novel O
subset O
optimization O
framework O
to O
generate O
a O
compact O
set O
of O
detection O
windows O
out O
of O
noisy O
proposals O
. O

In O
experiments O
, O
we O
show O
that O
our O
subset O
optimization O
formulation O
greatly O
enhances O
the O
performance O
of O
our O
system O
, O
and O
our O
system O
attains O
16 O
- O
34 O
% O
relative O
improvement O
in O
Average O
Precision O
compared O
with O
the O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
on O
three O
challenging O
salient O
object O
datasets O
. O

. O

a O

of O
your O
different O

. O

Many O

with O

always O

, O

A O
new O
model O

Indexing O

Crowdsourcing O
is O
a O
new O
tool O
for O
businesses O
, O
academics O
, O
and O
now O
intelligence O
analysts O
. O

Enabled O
by O
recent O
technology O
, O
crowdsourcing O
allows O
researchers O
to O
harness O
the O
wisdom O
of O
crowds O
and O
provide O
recommendations O
and O
insight O
into O
complex O
problems O
. O

This O
paper O
examines O
the O
potential O
benefits O
and O
limitations O
of O
crowdsourcing O
for O
intelligence O
analysis O
and O
the O
intelligence O
community O
beyond O
its O
primary O
use O
: O

intelligence O
. O

The O
author O
constructs O

model O
and O

to O
existing O

in O

, O

, O

. O

Finally O
, O

offers O

for O

-DOCSTART- O

Structured O
queries O
have O
proven O
to O
be O
an O
effective O
technique O
for O
crosslanguage O
information O
retrieval O
when O
evidence O
about O
translation O
probability O
is O
not O
available O
. O

Query O
execution O
time O
is O
adversely O
impacted O
, O
however O
, O
because O
the O
full O
postings O
list O
for O
each O
translation O
is O
used O
in O
the O
computation O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
an O
alternative O
approach O
, O
translation O
- O
based O
indexing O
, O
that O
improves O
query O
- O
time O
efficiency O
by O
integrating O
the O
translation O
and O
indexing O
processes O
. O

Experiment O
results O
demonstrate O
that O
similar O
effectiveness O
can O
be O
achieved O
at O
a O
cost O
in O
indexing O
time O
that O
is O
roughly O
linear O
in O
the O
average O
number O
of O
known O
translations O
for O
each O
term O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
order O
to O
assist O
managers O
in O
implementing O
total O
quality O
management O
( O
TQM O
) O
programs O
in O
dairy O
companies O
, O
an O
integrated O
system O
has O
been O
developed O
. O

Divided O
in O
three O
modules O
, O
it O
combines O
the O
technologies O
of O
multimedia O
and O
artificial O
intelligence O
to O
provide O
support O
in O
the O
form O
of O
hypertext O
tutorials O
, O
dynamic O
information O
retrieval O
and O
expert O
diagnosis O
. O

The O
first O
module O
presents O
tutorials O
on O
TQM O
concepts O
and O
implementation O
processes O
. O

The O
second O
supports O
the O
identification O
of O
control O
items O
for O
a O
variety O
of O
dairy O
product O
processing O
lines O
and O
assists O
managers O
in O
the O
diagnosis O
of O
cleaning O
and O
sanitation O
problems O
, O
also O
referring O
to O
the O
applicable O
legislation O
, O
when O
warranted O
. O

A O
third O
module O
still O
under O
development O
analyses O
current O
quality O
control O
practices O
followed O
by O
users O
. O

Preliminary O
evaluations O
with O
dairy O
company O
managers O
suggest O
a O
strong O
potential O
for O
such O
systems O
in O
increasing O
TQM O
awareness O
and O
adoption O
in O
the O
sector O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

As O
the O
World O
Wide O
Web O
infiltrates O
more O
and O
more O
countries O
, O
banalizing O
network O
, O
interface O
, O
and O
computer O
system O
differences O
which O
have O
impeded O
information O
access O
, O
it O
becomes O
more O
common O
for O
non O
- O
native O
speakers O
to O
explore O
multilingual O
text O
collections O
. O

Beyond O
merely O
accepting O
8-bit O
accented O
characters O
, O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
should O
provide O
help O
in O
searching O
for O
information O
across O
language O
boundaries O
. O

This O
situation O
has O
given O
rise O
to O
a O
new O
research O
area O
called O
Cross O
Language O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
at O
the O
intersection O
of O
Machine O
Translation O
and O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

Though O
sharing O
some O
problems O
in O
both O
of O
these O
areas O
, O
Cross O
Language O
Information O
Retrieval O
poses O
specific O
problems O
, O
three O
of O
which O
are O
described O
in O
this O
chapter O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
System O
is O
very O
complex O
in O
nature O
due O
to O
the O
complex O
interactions O
between O
documents O
and O
queries O
, O
which O
means O
that O
the O
matching O
of O
document O
representations O
and O
query O
representations O
is O
not O
straightforward O
. O

The O
Genetic O
Algorithm O
( O
GA O
) O
is O
widely O
used O
in O
IR O
systems O
to O
improve O
the O
effectiveness O
such O
systems O
. O

This O
study O
uses O
the O
Vector O
Space O
Model O
( O
VSM O
) O
and O
the O
Extended O
Boolean O
Model O
( O
EBM O
) O
to O
compute O
the O
similarities O
between O
queries O
and O
documents O
. O

Two O
fitness O
functions O
are O
proposed O
in O
this O
paper O
: O

One O
as O
fitness O
function O
and O
the O
other O
as O
adaptive O
mutation O
. O

Then O
comparing O
each O
of O
these O
functions O
with O
a O
number O
of O
ratio O
mutations O
that O
have O
been O
introduced O
to O
get O
better O
results O
. O

The O
experimental O
results O
reveal O
that O
the O
proposed O
cosine O
function O
outperformed O
other O
fitness O
models O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

As O
the O
volume O
of O
data O
and O
computational O
requirements O
of O
modern O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
continue O
to O
expand O
, O
it O
is O
inevitable O
that O
parallel O
systems O
will O
be O
necessary O
to O
meet O
these O
demands O
. O

In O
this O
research O
, O
we O
provide O
a O
conceptual O
model O
of O
a O
reconfigurable O
parallel O
information O
retrieval O
system O
in O
a O
multicomputer O
environment O
. O

We O
develop O
strategies O

-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
techniques O
play O
a O
critical O
role O
in O
the O
development O
of O
the O
information O
systems O
. O

Different O
searches O
have O
focused O
on O
the O
way O
of O
improving O
the O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
. O

Query O
expansion O
via O
relevance O
feedback O
is O
a O
good O
technique O
that O
proved O
to O
be O
a O
good O
way O
to O
improve O
the O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

In O

paper O

to O

the O
query O

process O
. O

A O

is O

to O
reformulate O

. O

a O

step O
, O
a O
local O
set O
of O
documents O
is O
built O
from O
the O
retrieved O
result O
. O

In O

a O
co O
- O

analysis O
is O

to O
be O

for O
the O

. O

To O
build O

we O
use O
firstly O
a O
content O
- O
based O
analysis O
. O

It O
is O
a O
similarity O
study O
between O
the O
retrieved O
documents O
and O
the O
query O
. O

The O
second O
method O
combines O
content O
and O
hypertext O
analyses O
to O
achieve O
the O
local O
set O
construction O
. O

The O
TREC O
frame O
is O
used O
to O
evaluate O
the O
proposed O
processes O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Since O
WWW O
encourages O
hypertext O
and O
hypermedia O
document O
authoring O
( O
e.g. O
HTML O
or O
XML O
Web O
authors O
tend O
to O
create O
documents O
that O
are O
composed O
of O
multiple O
pages O
connected O
with O
hyperlinks O
. O

A O
Web O
document O
may O
be O
authored O
in O
multiple O
ways O
, O
such O
as O
( O
1 O
) O
all O
information O
in O
one O
physical O
page O
, O
or O
( O
2 O
) O
a O
main O
page O
and O
the O
related O
information O
in O
separate O
linked O
pages O
. O

Existing O
Web O
search O
engines O
, O
however O
, O
return O
only O
physical O
pages O
containing O
keywords O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
introduce O
the O
concept O
of O
information O
unit O
, O
which O
can O
be O
viewed O
as O
a O
logical O

document O
consisting O
of O
multiple O
physical O
pages O
as O
one O
atomic O
retrieval O
unit O
. O

We O
present O
an O
algorithm O
to O
efficiently O
retrieve O
information O
units O
. O

Our O
algorithm O
can O
perform O
progressive O
query O
processing O
. O

These O
functionalities O
are O
essential O
for O
information O
retrieval O
on O
the O
Web O
and O
a O
large O

database O
. O

We O
also O
present O
experimental O
results O
on O

graphs O
and O

data O
. O

method O
rather O

. O

We O
describe O
and O

, O

knowledge O
transfer O
from O
one O

. O

- O

and O

learning O
in O

processes O
are O
presented O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Having O
in O
mind O
today O
's O
growth O
of O
information O
sources O
, O
both O
in O
terms O
of O
their O
number O
and O
of O
their O
size O
, O
whether O
we O
are O
referring O
to O
the O
Internet O
, O
a O
corporate O
intranet O
, O
or O
a O
library O
information O
retrieval O
system O
, O
we O
can O
say O
that O
manipulating O
information O
is O
not O
a O
trivial O
task O
. O

The O
user O
is O
not O
often O
being O
catered O
for O
in O
distributed O
information O
systems O
. O

He/ O
she O
seems O
to O
be O
interacting O
with O
systems O
that O
do O
not O
recognize O
his O
/ O
her O
uniqueness O
and O
thus O
do O
not O
offer O
an O
individualized O
treatment O
. O

As O
a O
result O
, O
User O
Modeling O
is O
a O
core O
, O
essential O
factor O
in O

. O

We O
present O
here O

of O

information O
that O
is O
not O
available O
, O
a O
situation O
that O
is O
very O
likely O
to O
occur O
due O
to O

of O
relevant O
data O
. O

can O

in O

-DOCSTART- O

As O
retrieval O
systems O
become O
more O
oriented O
towards O
endusers O
, O
there O
is O
an O
increasing O
need O
for O
improved O
methods O
to O
evaluate O
their O
effectiveness O
. O

We O
performed O
a O
task O
- O
oriented O
assessment O
of O
two O
MEDLINE O
searching O
systems O
, O
one O
which O
promotes O
traditional O
Boolean O
searching O
on O
human O
- O
indexed O
thesaurus O
terms O
and O
the O
other O
natural O
language O
searching O
on O
words O
in O
the O
title O
, O
abstract O
, O
and O
indexing O
terms O
. O

Medical O
students O
were O
randomized O
to O
one O
of O
the O
two O
systems O
and O
given O
clinical O
questions O
to O
answer O
. O

The O
students O
were O
able O
to O
use O
each O
system O
successfully O
, O
with O
no O
significant O
differences O
in O
questions O
correctly O
answered O
, O
time O
taken O
, O
relevant O
articles O
retrieved O
, O
or O
user O
satisfaction O
between O
the O
systems O
. O

This O
approach O
to O
evaluation O
was O
successful O
in O
measuring O
effectiveness O
of O
system O
use O
and O
demonstrates O
that O
both O
types O
of O
systems O
can O
be O
used O
equally O
well O
with O
minimal O
training O
. O

In O

system O
, O
the O
query O
is O
the O
bridge O
between O
the O
collection O
database O
and O
the O
user O
. O

With O
query O
operators O
to O
define O
terms O
that O
should O
or O
should O
not O
appear O
in O
result O
documents O
, O
users O
could O
actually O
access O
their O
desired O
documents O
. O

For O
the O
web O
IR O
systems O
, O

matter O
the O

or O

to O
the O

environment O
, O
but O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Ranking O
authors O
is O
vital O
for O
identifying O
a O
researcher O
’s O
impact O
and O
his O
standing O
within O
a O
scientific O
field O
. O

There O
are O
many O
different O
ranking O
methods O
( O
e.g O
citations O
, O
publications O
, O
h O
- O
index O
, O
PageRank O
, O
and O
weighted O
PageRank O
but O
most O
of O
them O
are O
topic O
- O
independent O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
topic O
- O
dependent O
ranks O
based O
on O
the O
combination O
of O
a O
topic O
model O
and O
a O
weighted O
PageRank O
algorithm O
. O

The O
Author O
- O
Conference O
- O
Topic O
( O
ACT O
) O
model O
was O
used O
to O
extract O
topic O
distribution O
of O
individual O
authors O
. O

Two O
ways O
for O
combining O
the O
ACT O
model O
with O
the O
PageRank O
algorithm O
are O
proposed O
: O
simple O
combination O
( O
I_PR O
) O
or O
using O
a O
topic O
distribution O
as O
a O
weighted O
vector O
for O
PageRank O

( O
PR_t O
Information O
retrieval O
was O
chosen O
as O
the O
test O
field O
and O
representative O
authors O
for O
different O
topics O
at O
different O
time O
phases O
were O
identified O
. O

Principal O
Component O
Analysis O
( O
PCA O
) O
was O
applied O
to O
analyze O
the O
ranking O
difference O
between O
I_PR O
and O
PR_t O
. O

The O
majority O
of O
existing O
work O
in O
music O
information O
retrieval O
for O

signals O
has O
followed O
the O
content O
- O
based O
query O
- O
by O
- O
example O
paradigm O
. O

In O
this O
paradigm O
a O
musical O
piece O
is O
used O
as O
a O
query O
and O
the O
result O
is O
a O

of O
other O

pieces O
ranked O
by O
their O

. O

In O
this O

we O
describe O
algorithms O
and O

user O
interfaces O
that O
enable O
novel O
alternative O
ways O
for O

and O

large O
audio O
collections O
. O

Computer O
audition O
algorithms O
are O
used O
to O
extract O
content O
information O
from O
audio O

. O

This O

information O

to O

and O
to O
genereate O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Advances O
in O
web O
technology O
have O
given O
rise O
to O
new O
information O
retrieval O
applications O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
a O
model O
for O
geographical O
region O
search O
and O
call O
this O
class O
of O
query O
similar O
region O
query O
. O

Given O
a O
spatial O
map O
and O
a O
query O
region O
, O
a O
similar O
region O
search O
aims O
to O
find O
the O
top O
- O
k O
most O
similar O
regions O
to O
the O
query O
region O
on O
the O
spatial O
map O
. O

We O
design O
a O
quadtree O
based O
algorithm O
to O
access O
the O
spatial O
map O
at O
different O
resolution O
levels O
. O

The O
proposed O
search O
technique O
utilizes O
a O
filter O
- O
and O
- O
refine O
manner O
to O
prune O
regions O
that O
are O
not O
likely O
to O
be O
part O
of O
the O
top O
- O
k O
results O
, O
and O
refine O
the O
remaining O
regions O
. O

Experimental O
study O
based O
on O
a O
real O
world O
dataset O
verifies O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
proposed O
region O
similarity O
measure O
and O
the O
efficiency O
of O
the O
algorithm O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
model O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
based O
on O
possibilistic O
directed O
networks O
. O

Relations O
documents O
- O
terms O
and O
query O
- O
terms O
are O
modeled O
through O
possibility O
and O
necessity O
measures O
rather O
than O
a O
probability O
measure O
. O

The O
relevance O
value O
for O
the O
document O
given O
the O
query O
is O
measured O
by O
two O
degrees O
: O
the O
necessity O
and O
the O
possibility O
. O

More O
precisely O
, O
the O
user O
’s O
query O
triggers O
a O
propagation O
process O
to O
retrieve O
necessarily O
or O
at O
least O
possibly O
relevant O
documents O
. O

The O
possibility O
degree O
is O
convenient O
to O
filter O
documents O
out O
from O
the O
response O
( O
retrieved O
documents O
) O
and O
the O
necessity O
degree O
is O
useful O
for O
document O
relevance O
confirmation O
. O

Separating O
these O
notions O
may O
account O
for O
the O
imprecision O
pervading O
the O
retrieval O
process O
. O

Experiments O
carried O
out O
on O
a O
sub O
- O
collection O
of O
CLEF O
, O
namely O
LeMonde O
1994 O
, O
a O
French O
newspapers O
collection O
, O
showed O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
model O
. O

de O
recherche O
d’information O
, O

Possibilistes O
, O
Pertinence O
, O
Théorie O
des O

’s O

to O

Queryby O
- O

/ O
Humming(QBSH O
) O
task O
of O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
eXchange(MIREX O
) O
2006 O
. O

As O

do O

the O

sub O
- O
task O

- O

- O

a O

Alignment(RA O
) O

between O

. O

We O

employ O
the O

. O

Finally O

give O
the O

of O
the O
presented O
system O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Music O
genre O
classification O
is O
a O
challenging O
task O
in O
the O
field O
of O
music O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Existing O
approaches O
usually O
attempt O
to O
extract O
features O
only O
from O
acoustic O
aspect O
. O

However O
, O
spectrogram O
also O
provides O
useful O
information O
because O
it O
describes O
the O
temporal O
change O
of O
energy O
distribution O
over O
frequency O
bins O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
the O
use O
of O
Gabor O
filters O
to O
generate O
effective O
visual O
features O
that O
can O
capture O
the O
characteristics O
of O
a O
spectrogram&#x0A1 O
x0A6;s O
texture O
patterns O
. O

On O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
acoustic O
features O
are O
extracted O
using O
universal O
background O
model O
and O
maximum O
a O
posteriori O
adaptation O
. O

Based O
on O
these O
two O
types O
of O
features O
, O
we O
then O
employ O
SVM O
to O
perform O
the O
final O
classification O
task O
. O

Experimental O
results O
demonstrate O
that O
combining O
visual O
and O
acoustic O
features O
can O
achieve O
satisfactory O
classification O
accuracy O
on O
two O
widely O
used O
datasets O
. O

The O
cycle O
of O
abstraction O
- O
reconstruction O
, O
which O
occurs O
as O
a O
fundamental O
principle O
in O
the O
development O
of O
culture O
and O
in O
cognitive O
processes O
, O
is O
described O
and O
analyzed O
. O

This O
approach O
leads O
to O
recognition O
of O
boundary O
conditions O
for O
and O
directions O
of O
probable O
development O
of O

. O

is O
shown O
how O
the O
transition O
from O
a O

Japanese O
- O

dictionary O
to O
a O

- O
dimensional O
language O
database O

- O

. O

individual O

of O

- O

based O
upon O
diierent O

to O

underlying O

. O

used O
in O

- O

include O

of O

. O

Several O

of O

for O

- O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Representing O
and O

information O
is O

key O

to O

in O

. O

In O
this O
paper O

address O
more O

- O
based O

problem O

RankBoost O
algorithm O

preferences O

a O
learn O

model O
. O

The O

has O
been O

on O

images O
and O

complete O
TRECVID O
2005 O

- O

. O

The O
results O
show O
that O
our O
approach O
equals O
SVM O
performance O
but O
, O
contrary O
to O
SVM O
, O
is O
parameter O
free O
and O
faster O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

spam O
has O
become O
one O
of O
the O
most O

challenges O
and O
threats O
to O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Text O
mining O
is O
a O
new O
and O

research O
area O
that O
tries O
to O
solve O
the O

overload O
problem O
by O
using O
techniques O
from O
machine O
learning O
, O
natural O
language O
processing O
( O
NLP O
data O
mining O
, O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
and O
knowledge O
management O
. O

Text O
mining O
involves O
the O
pre O
- O
processing O
of O
document O
collections O
such O
as O
information O
extraction O
, O
term O
extraction O
, O
text O
categorization O
, O
and O
storage O
of O
intermediate O
representations O
. O

The O
techniques O
that O
are O
used O
to O
analyse O
these O
intermediate O
representations O
such O
as O
clustering O
, O
distribution O
analysis O
, O
association O
rules O
and O
visualisation O
of O
the O
results O
. O

The O
Laboratory O
for O
Information O
and O

Systems O
( O

) O

for O
research O

in O
systems O
, O
communication O
, O
networks O
, O
optimization O
, O
control O
, O

processing O
. O

LIDS O
emphasizes O
pursuit O
of O
basic O
knowledge O
as O
the O
foundation O
for O
innovation O
. O

While O

research O
related O
to O
information O
science O
, O

has O
also O
initiated O

on O

and O

with O
computer O
scientists O
and O
hardware O
engineers O
to O
broaden O
perspectives O
in O
the O
research O
, O

, O

, O
and O
tests O
of O
systems O
such O
as O
networks O
and O

- O
vehicles O
. O

of O

, O
