-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
one O
part O
of O
a O
broad O
research O
project O
entitled O
' O
Activity O
- O
Based O
Information O
Retrieval O
AIR O
) O
which O
is O
being O
carried O
out O
at O
EuroPARC O
. O

The O
basic O
hypothesis O
of O
this O
project O
is O
that O
if O
contextual O
data O
about O
human O
activities O
can O
be O
automatically O
captured O
and O
later O
presented O
as O
recognisable O
descriptions O
of O
past O
episodes O
, O
then O
human O
memory O
of O
those O
past O
episodes O
can O
be O
improved O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
an O
application O
called O
Pepys O
, O
designed O
to O
yield O
descriptions O
of O
episodes O
based O
on O
automatically O
collected O
location O
data O
. O

The O
program O
pays O
particular O
attention O
to O
meetings O
and O
other O
episodes O
involving O
two O
or O
more O
people O
. O

The O
episodes O
are O
presented O
to O
the O
user O
as O
a O
diary O
generated O
at O
the O
end O
of O
each O
day O
and O
distributed O
by O
electronic O
mail O
. O

The O
paper O
also O
discusses O
the O
methods O
used O
to O
assess O
the O
accuracy O
of O
the O
descriptions O
generated O
by O
the O
recogniser O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
concerns O
the O
problem O
of O
retrieving O
those O
documents O
from O
a O
given O
document O
- O
base O
that O
are O
likely O
to O
be O
relevant O
to O
a O
certain O
information O
need O
. O

In O
1971 O
, O
Cooper O
introduced O
an O
objective O
part O
of O
the O
relevance O
relation O
termed O
logical O
relevance O
[ O
5 O
We O
call O
this O
relation O
“ O
aboutness O

Underlying O
every O
IR O
model O
is O
a O
theory O
that O
defines O
the O
notion O
of O
aboutness O
. O

Such O
a O
theory O
could O
be O
implicit O
or O
explicit O
in O
the O
model O
. O

In O
this O
article O
, O
we O
will O
present O
a O
meta O
- O
theory O
for O
studying O
information O
retrieval O
. O

A O
meta O
- O
theory O
should O
offer O
the O
possibility O
to O
axiomatise O
the O
aboutness O
relation O
of O
every O
IR O
model O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
MPEG O
Query O
Format O
( O
MPQF O
) O
which O
MPEG O
Group O
is O
developing O
is O
to O
standardize O
query O
interface O
for O
XML O
- O
based O
multimedia O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

MPQF O
provides O
query O
types O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
Data O
Retrieval O
over O
XML O
Database O
in O
the O
current O
draft O
. O

As O
more O
and O
more O
multimedia O
metadata O
modeled O
with O
semantic O
ontology O
like O
RDFS O
and O
OWL O
are O

in O
the O
Knowledge O
Base O
, O
there O
is O
a O
requirement O
for O
querying O
multimedia O
information O
over O
Knowledge O
- O
Based O
system O
. O

In O

necessary O

( O

type O
) O

Knowledge O
- O
Based O
Multimedia O
Information O

based O
on O
Knowledge O
Query O
and O
Manipulation O
Language O
( O

) O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Technological O
advances O
are O
driving O
statistics O
beyond O
mathematical O
philosophy O
and O
beyond O
computer O
- O
aided O
empiricism O
towards O
experimentally O
supported O
information O
science O
. O

Interplay O
between O
falsifiable O
theory O
and O
reproducible O
experiment O
is O
the O
essence O
of O
experimental O
statistics O
. O

A O
distinguishing O
goal O
of O
statistics O
is O
quantification O
of O
uncertainty O
in O
data O
- O
analyses O
through O
risk O
estimation O
and O
confidence O
sets O
. O

Numerical O
experiments O
with O
superefficient O
estimators O
for O
the O
mean O
vector O
in O
the O
one O
- O
way O
layout O

— O
estimators O
based O
on O
adaptive O
monotone O
shrinkage O
and O
on O
adaptive O
soft O
thresholding O
— O
illustrate O
how O
experimental O
statistics O
conditions O
minimax O
risk O
comparisons O
from O
theoretical O
statistics O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Data O
Mining O
is O
the O
process O
of O
identifying O
patterns O
in O
large O
sets O
of O
data O
. O

Text O
mining O
is O
the O
discovery O
of O
interesting O
knowledge O
in O
text O
documents O
. O

Many O
data O
mining O
techniques O
have O
been O
proposed O
for O
mining O
useful O
patterns O
in O
text O
documents O
. O

It O
is O
a O
challenging O
issue O
to O
find O
accurate O
knowledge O
( O
or O
features O
) O
in O
text O
documents O
to O
help O
users O
to O
find O
what O
they O
want O
. O

In O
existing O
, O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
provided O
many O
term O
- O
based O
methods O
to O
solve O
this O
challenge O
. O

The O
term O
- O
based O
methods O
suffer O
from O
the O
problems O
of O
polysemy O
and O
synonymy O
. O

The O
polysemy O
means O
a O
word O
has O
multiple O
meanings O
, O
and O
synonymy O
is O
multiple O
words O
having O
the O
same O
meaning O
. O

In O
proposed O
system O
we O
want O
to O
use O
pattern O
( O
or O
phrase)-based O
approaches O
should O
perform O
better O
than O
the O
termbased O
ones O
. O

The O
proposed O
approach O
can O
improve O
the O
accuracy O
of O
evaluating O
term O
weights O
because O
discovered O
patterns O
are O
more O
specific O
than O
whole O
documents O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Content O
- O
based O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
involves O
low O
- O
level O
feature O
extraction O
and O
utilize O
similarity O
search O
methods O
applied O
either O
in O
the O
feature O
space O
or O
in O
derived O
higher O
- O
level O
semantic O
spaces O
. O

These O
methods O
assume O
that O
similarity O
is O
measured O
by O
accounting O
only O
the O
degree O
in O
which O
two O
entities O
are O
related O
, O
ignoring O
the O
hesitancy O
introduced O
by O
the O
degree O
in O
which O
they O
are O
unrelated O
. O

Aiming O
at O
semantically O
relevant O
IR O
from O
cultural O
databases O
, O
this O
paper O
proposes O
a O
novel O
intuitionistic O
fuzzy O
clustering O
scheme O
based O
on O
intuitive O
features O
and O
a O
similarity O
defined O
over O
higher O
- O
level O
patterns O
. O

We O
study O
the O
K O
- O
armed O
dueling O
bandit O
problem O
which O
is O
a O
variation O
of O

classical O
Multi O
- O
Armed O
Bandit O
( O

) O

only O

feedback O
about O
the O
selected O
pairs O
of O

. O

We O
propose O
an O
efficient O
algorithm O
called O
Relative O
Exponential O
- O
weight O
algorithm O
for O
Exploration O
and O
Exploitation O
( O
REX3 O
) O
to O
handle O
the O
adversarial O
utility O
- O
based O
formulation O
of O
this O
problem O
. O

We O
prove O
a O
finite O
time O
expected O
regret O
upper O
bound O
of O
order O
O O
K O
ln(K)T O
for O
this O
algorithm O
and O
a O
general O
lower O
bound O
of O
order O
Ω O
KT O

At O
the O
end O
, O
we O
provide O
experimental O
results O
using O
real O
data O
from O
information O
retrieval O
applications O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Methods O
of O
deep O
neural O
networks O
( O
DNNs O
) O
have O
recently O
demonstrated O
superior O
performance O
on O
a O
number O
of O
natural O
language O
processing O
tasks O
. O

However O
, O
in O
most O
previous O
work O
, O
the O
models O
are O
learned O
based O
on O
either O
unsupervised O
objectives O
, O
which O
does O
not O
directly O
optimize O
the O
desired O
task O
, O
or O
singletask O
supervised O
objectives O
, O
which O
often O
suffer O
from O
insufficient O
training O
data O
. O

We O
develop O
a O
multi O
- O
task O
DNN O
for O
learning O
representations O
across O
multiple O
tasks O
, O
not O
only O
leveraging O
large O
amounts O
of O
cross O
- O
task O
data O
, O
but O
also O
benefiting O
from O
a O
regularization O
effect O
that O
leads O
to O
more O
general O
representations O
to O
help O
tasks O
in O
new O
domains O
. O

Our O
multi O
- O
task O
DNN O
approach O
combines O
tasks O
of O
multiple O
- O
domain O
classification O
( O
for O
query O
classification O
) O
and O
information O
retrieval O
( O
ranking O
for O
web O
search O
and O
demonstrates O
significant O
gains O
over O
strong O
baselines O
in O
a O
comprehensive O
set O
of O
domain O
adaptation O
. O

on O

sets O
, O

theory O

of O

retrieval O

" O

keywords O
, O

. O

. O

. O

We O

of O
abating O
. O

This O
growth O
has O
led O
to O
a O
new O
problem O
: O
with O
so O
much O
scientific O
data O
at O
hand O
, O
stored O
in O
thousands O
of O
datasets O
, O
how O
can O
scientists O
find O
the O
datasets O
most O
relevant O
to O
their O
research O
interests O
? O

We O
have O
addressed O
this O
problem O
by O
adapting O
Information O
Retrieval O
techniques O
, O
developed O
for O
searching O
text O
documents O
, O
into O
the O
world O
of O
( O
primarily O
numeric O
) O
scientific O
data O
. O

We O
propose O
an O
approach O
that O
uses O
a O
blend O
of O
automated O
and O
x201C;semi O
- O
curated&#x201D O
; O
methods O
to O
extract O
metadata O
from O
large O
archives O
of O
scientific O
data O
, O
then O
evaluates O
ranked O
searches O
over O
this O
metadata O
. O

We O
describe O
a O
challenge O
identified O
during O
an O
implementation O
of O
our O
approach O
: O
the O
large O
and O
expanding O
list O
of O
environmental O
variables O
captured O
by O
the O
archive O
do O
not O
match O
the O
list O
of O
environmental O
variables O
in O
the O
minds O
of O
the O
scientists O
. O

We O
briefly O
characterize O
the O
problem O
and O
describe O
our O
initial O
thoughts O
on O
resolving O
it O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
and O
analyze O
a O
scheme O
by O
which O
a O
many O
- O
particle O
system O
can O
be O
prepared O
in O
highly O
entangled O
wave O
- O
packet O
states O
. O

One O
of O
the O
particles O
is O
prepared O
initially O
in O
a O
quantum O
superposition O
of O
multiple O
coherent O
states O
and O
then O
coupled O
via O
a O
quadratic O
interaction O
Hamiltonian O
to O
a O
number O
of O
other O
particles O
. O

The O
system O
evolves O
into O
a O
highly O
entangled O
wave O
- O
packet O
state O
. O

An O
appropriate O
measure O
of O
this O
time O
- O
dependent O
entanglement O
is O
given O
. O

This O
scheme O
is O
applicable O
to O
a O
number O
of O
systems O
of O
interest O
in O
quantum O
- O
information O
science O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
article O
summarizes O
the O
approach O
developed O
for O
TREC O
2016 O
Clinical O
Decision O
Support O
Track O
. O

In O
order O
to O
address O
the O
daunting O
challenge O
of O
retrieval O
of O
biomedical O
articles O
for O
answering O
clinical O
questions O
, O
an O
information O
retrieval O
methodology O
was O
developed O
that O
combines O
pseudo O
- O
relevance O
feedback O
, O
semantic O
query O
expansion O
and O
document O
similarity O
measures O
based O
on O
unsupervised O
word O
embeddings O
. O

The O
individual O
relevance O
metrics O
were O
combined O
through O
a O
supervised O
learning O
-to O
- O
rank O
model O
based O
on O
gradient O
boosting O
to O
maximize O
the O
normalized O
discounted O
cumulative O
gain O
( O
nDCG O
Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
document O
distance O
measures O
derived O
from O
unsupervised O
word O
embeddings O
contribute O
to O
significant O
ranking O
improvements O
when O
combined O
with O
traditional O
document O
retrieval O
approaches O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

TheWEBSOM O
is O
a O
method O
developed O
originally O
at O
Helsinki O
University O
of O
Technology O
for O
analyzing O
and O
visualizing O
large O
document O
collections O
[ O
1 O
, O
4 O

In O
the O
WEBSOM O
method O
, O
the O
self O
- O
organizing O
map O
algorithm O
[ O
3 O
] O
is O
used O
to O
automatically O
organize O
collections O
of O
documents O
on O
a O
map O
to O
enable O
easy O
exploration O
and O
search O
of O
the O
collection O
. O

Map O
regions O
that O
are O
close O
to O
each O
other O
contain O
similar O
documents O
. O

The O
main O
objectives O
in O
developing O
the O
WEBSOM O
method O
has O
been O
to O
o O
er O
a O
method O
for O
exploring O
text O
collections O
that O
is O
di O
erent O
from O
the O
queryresult O
approach O
, O
enabling O
the O
user O
to O
get O
an O
overall O
view O
to O
the O
document O
collection O
. O

Moreover O
, O
there O
are O
no O
principled O
limits O
on O
the O
type O
of O
text O
material O
that O
the O
method O
can O
handle O
. O

Visualization O
of O
search O
results O
is O
an O
essential O
step O
in O
the O
Information O
Retrieval O
process O
. O

Indeed O
Information O
User O
Interfaces O
are O
used O
as O
a O
link O
between O
users O
and O
Information O
Retrieval O
Systems O
, O
and O
so O
they O
enable O
to O
give O
sense O
to O
the O
results O
for O
users O
. O

Due O
to O
the O
importance O
that O
takes O
visualization O
of O
search O
results O
, O
many O
interfaces O
( O
which O
can O
be O
textual O
, O
in O
2D O
or O
in O
3D O
) O
have O
been O
proposed O
in O
the O
last O
decade O
. O

However O
, O
although O
some O
evaluations O
of O
these O
interfaces O
were O
proposed O
, O
they O
are O
too O
rare O
and O
not O
really O
interpretable O
( O
and O
comparable O
) O
due O
to O
the O
big O
heterogeneity O
of O
systems O
and O
due O
to O
the O
absence O
of O
an O
evaluation O
framework O
. O

So O
, O
in O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
to O
define O
a O
set O
of O
criteria O
which O
take O
users O
, O
tasks O
and O
system O
into O
account O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Text O
retrieval O
using O
Latent O
Semantic O
Indexing O
( O
LSI O
) O
with O
truncated O
Singular O
Value O
Decomposition O
( O
SVD O
) O
has O
been O
intensively O
studied O
in O
recent O
years O
. O

However O
, O
the O
expensive O
complexity O
involved O
in O
computing O
truncated O
SVD O
constitutes O
a O
major O
drawback O
of O
the O
LSI O
method O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
demonstrate O
how O
matrix O
rank O
approximation O
can O
influence O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

Besides O
, O
we O
present O
an O
implementation O
of O
the O
LSI O
method O
based O
on O
an O
eigenvalue O
analysis O
for O
rank O
approximation O
without O
computing O
truncated O
SVD O
, O
along O
with O
its O
computational O
details O
. O

Significant O
improvements O
in O
computational O
time O
while O
maintaining O
retrieval O
accuracy O
are O
observed O
over O
the O
tested O
document O
collections O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Word O
sense O
disambiguation O
( O
WSD O
) O
is O
described O
as O
the O
job O
of O
searching O
the O
sense O
of O
a O
word O
in O
a O
situation O
. O

WSD O
is O
a O
core O
problem O
in O
many O
tasks O
related O
to O
language O
processing O
. O

It O
is O
aggravated O
by O
make O
use O
of O
in O
several O
critical O
utilization O
like O
Part O
- O
of O
- O
Speech O
tagging O
, O
Machine O
Translation O
, O
Information O
retrieval O
, O
etc O
. O

Different O
topics O
such O
as O
ambiguity O
, O
evaluation O
, O
scalability O
and O
diversity O
cause O
challenges O
to O
results O
of O

. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
have O
discussed O
about O
some O
issues O
related O
to O
WSD O
and O
some O
WSD O
methods O
like O
knowledge O
- O
based O
, O
supervised O
, O
unsupervised O
and O
semi O
supervised O
. O

We O
introduce O
and O
validate O

techniques O
to O

that O

of O
test O
- O
collection O

precision O
( O

) O

) O

. O

of O

for O

-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
an O
approach O
to O
Distributed O
Information O
Retrieval O
based O
on O
the O
periodic O
and O
incremental O
centralisation O
of O
full O
- O
text O
indices O
of O
widely O
dispersed O
and O
autonomously O
managed O
content O
sources O
. O

Inspired O
by O
the O
success O
of O
the O
Open O
Archive O
Initiative O
’s O
protocol O
for O
metadata O
harvesting O
, O
the O
approach O
occupies O
middle O
ground O
between O
i O
) O
the O
crawling O
of O
content O
, O
and O
( O
ii O
) O
the O
distribution O
of O
retrieval O
. O

As O
in O
crawling O
, O
some O
data O
moves O
towards O
the O
retrieval O
process O
, O
but O
it O
is O
statistics O
about O
the O
content O
rather O
than O
content O
itself O
. O

As O
in O
distributed O
retrieval O
, O
some O
processing O
is O
distributed O
along O
with O
the O
data O
, O
but O
it O
is O
indexing O
rather O
than O
retrieval O
itself O
. O

We O
show O
that O
the O
approach O
retains O
the O
good O
properties O
of O
centralised O
retrieval O
without O
renouncing O
to O
cost O
- O
effective O
resource O
pooling O
. O

We O
discuss O
the O
requirements O
associated O
with O
the O
approach O
and O
identify O
two O
strategies O
to O
deploy O
it O
on O
top O
of O
the O
OAI O
infrastructure O
. O

consider O
the O
task O
of O

online O
information O
in O
mobile O
environments O
. O

. O

Geographic O
information O
science O
increasingly O
meets O
cognitive O
science O
, O
as O
comprehending O
( O
i.e. O
perceiving O
and O
conceptualising O
) O
spatial O
characteristics O
induces O
spatial O
cognition O
and O
behaviour O
. O

However O
, O
the O
widely O
deployed O
models O
of O
space O
fail O
in O

for O
those O

. O

In O

, O
the O
present O
work O
aims O
at O
relating O
human O

of O

to O
the O

in O

an O

human O

. O

This O

is O
to O
be O
captured O
using O
a O

. O

Though O

is O

, O

methods O
with O
which O

is O
created O
are O

and O
resource O
- O
consuming O
. O

Here O
, O
the O
retained O
solution O
is O
to O
infer O
as O
much O
land O
use O
information O
from O
topology O
as O
possible O
. O

as O
a O
relevant O
dimension O
of O
retrieval O
quality O
is O
receiving O
increasing O
attention O
in O

Retrieval O
and O

Systems O
( O

) O
fields O
. O

The O
problem O
has O
nonetheless O
been O
approached O
under O
different O
views O
and O

in O

and O

, O

to O
different O
models O
, O

, O
and O
metrics O
, O
with O
little O
convergence O
between O

fields O
. O

metrics O
, O

and O
principles O
from O
ad O
- O
hoc O
IR O

of O

profile O

. O

As O
a O

approach O

are O
automatically O
extracted O
from O
latent O
item O
features O
. O

Empirical O
results O
support O
the O
proposed O
approach O
and O
provide O
further O
insights O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Sentiment O
analysis O
research O
has O
acquired O
a O
growing O
importance O
due O
to O
its O
applications O
in O
several O
different O
fields O
. O

A O
large O
number O
of O
companies O
have O
included O
the O
analysis O
of O
opinions O
and O
sentiments O
of O
costumers O
as O
a O
part O
of O
their O
mission O
. O

Therefore O
, O
the O
analysis O
and O
automatic O
classification O
of O
large O
corpora O
of O
documents O
in O
natural O
language O
, O
based O
on O
the O
conveyed O
feelings O
and O
emotions O
, O
has O
become O
a O
crucial O
issue O
for O
text O
mining O
purposes O
. O

This O
chapter O
aims O
to O
relate O
the O
sentimentbased O
characterization O
inferred O
from O
books O
with O
the O
distribution O
of O
emotions O
within O
the O
same O
texts O
. O

The O
main O
result O
consists O
in O
a O
method O
to O
compare O
and O
classify O
texts O
based O
on O
the O
feelings O
expressed O
within O
the O
narrative O
trend O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
Latent O
Semantic O
Indexing O
( O
LSI O
a O
collection O
of O
documents O
is O
often O
pre O
- O
processed O
to O
form O
a O
sparse O
term O
- O
document O
matrix O
, O
followed O
by O
a O
computation O
of O
a O
low O
- O
rank O
approximation O
to O
the O
data O
matrix O
. O

A O
multilevel O
framework O
based O
on O
hypergraph O
coarsening O
is O
presented O
which O
exploits O
the O
hypergraph O
that O
is O
canonically O
associated O
with O
the O
sparse O
term O
- O
document O
matrix O
representing O
the O
data O
. O

The O
main O
goal O
is O
to O
reduce O
the O
cost O
of O
the O
matrix O
approximation O
without O
sacrificing O
accuracy O
. O

Because O
coarsening O
by O
multilevel O
hypergraph O
techniques O
is O
a O
form O
of O
clustering O
, O
the O
proposed O
approach O
can O
be O
regarded O
as O
a O
hybrid O
of O
factorization O
- O
based O
LSI O
and O
clustering O
- O
based O
LSI O
. O

Experimental O
results O
indicate O
that O
our O
method O
achieves O
good O
improvement O
of O
the O
retrieval O
performance O
at O
a O
reduced O
cost O


-DOCSTART- O

Most O
current O
large O
- O
scale O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
are O
impersonal O
, O
allowing O
uniform O
access O
to O
a O
non O
- O
modifiable O
corpus O
of O
information O
. O

The O
Haystack O
project O
is O
a O
personal O
information O
repository O
, O
which O
employs O
artificial O
intelligence O
techniques O
to O
adapt O
to O
the O
needs O
of O
its O
user O
. O

This O
thesis O
outlines O
a O
new O
overall O
design O
for O
Haystack O
. O

The O
design O
includes O
an O
RDFbased O
data O
model O
, O
a O
transaction O
- O
based O
storage O
system O
, O
services O
which O
are O
triggered O
by O
patterns O
in O
the O
data O
, O
a O
kernel O
with O
the O
machinery O
to O
invoke O
and O
execute O
these O
services O
, O
and O
a O
query O
processing O
system O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
the O
thesis O
serves O
as O
a O
valuable O
resource O
to O
future O
Haystack O
researchers O
by O
explaining O
and O
documenting O
the O
fundamental O
ideas O
of O
Haystack O
, O
as O
well O
as O
the O
reasoning O
for O
all O
design O
decisions O
. O

Thesis O
Supervisor O
: O
David O
R. O
Karger O

Title O
: O
Associate O
Professor O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
one O
form O
or O
another O
language O
translation O
is O
a O
necessary O
part O
of O
cross O
- O
lingual O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

Often O
times O
this O
is O
accomplished O
using O
machine O
translation O
systems O
. O

However O
, O
machine O
translation O
systems O
offer O
low O
quality O
for O
their O
high O
costs O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
machine O
translation O
method O
that O
is O
low O
cost O
while O
improving O
translation O
quality O
. O

This O
is O
done O
by O
utilizing O
multiple O
web O
based O
translation O
services O
to O
negate O
the O
high O
cost O
of O
translation O
. O

A O
best O
translation O
is O
chosen O
from O
the O
candidates O
using O
either O
consensus O
translation O
selection O
or O
statistical O
analysis O
. O

Which O
to O
use O
is O
determined O
by O
a O
heuristic O
rule O
that O
takes O
into O
account O
that O
most O
web O
based O
translation O
services O
are O
of O
similar O
quality O
and O
that O
machine O
translation O
still O
produces O
relatively O
poor O
results O
. O

By O
choosing O
the O
best O
translation O
the O
method O
is O
able O
to O
increase O
translation O
quality O
over O
the O
base O
systems O
, O
which O
is O
verified O
by O
the O
experimentation O
. O

( O

) O

information O

/ O

system O
, O

( O

) O

New O
application O
domains O
cause O
today O
's O
database O
sizes O
to O
grow O

, O

great O
demands O
on O
technology O
. O

Data O

facilitates O

( O
like O
distribution O
, O

. O
and O

- O
memory O
computing O
) O

Also O
, O

might O

top O
N. O

. O

Our O

. O

Once O

have O

can O
forget O
the O
data O
distribution O
, O
resulting O
in O
fast O
and O
quite O
good O

estimation O
. O

We O
show O
experimental O
verification O
for O
Zipfian O
distributed O
IR O
databases O
. O

methods O
for O

- O

for O

. O

- O

paper O
presents O
a O

in O

to O

" O

" O

" O

" O

of O

. O

, O

' O

; O

paper O
present O

of O

( O
Dokuz O
Eylul O
University O
Multimedia O
Information O

) O
research O

TREC O
2011 O
Medical O
Records O
track O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
article O
at O
hand O
analyses O
an O
often O
disregarded O
aspect O
of O
design O
science O
research O
that O
is O
how O
design O
knowledge O
is O
actually O
built O
or O
, O
more O
precisely O
, O
how O
new O
design O
knowledge O
is O
discovered O
. O

In O
the O
article O
we O
distinguish O
abductive O
and O
inductive O
forms O
of O
discovery O
. O

We O
describe O
how O
inductive O
and O
abductive O
discoveries O
are O
dealt O
with O
in O
traditional O
science O
and O
how O
these O
two O
forms O
of O
discovery O
have O
been O
discussed O
in O
Information O
Systems O
Design O
Science O
Research O
literature O
. O

By O
means O
of O
a O
case O
study O
we O
specifically O
illustrate O
the O
impact O
of O
a O
chosen O
mode O
of O
discovery O
on O
validity O
, O
utility O
, O
generality O
, O
and O
innovativeness O
of O
a O
problem O
solution O
. O

We O
find O
that O
the O
strength O
of O
inductively O
discovered O
design O
knowledge O
is O
that O
its O
validity O
, O
utility O
, O
and O
generality O
can O
be O
proven O
more O
easily O
than O
that O
of O
abductive O
discoveries O
. O

However O
, O
inductively O
discovered O
design O
knowledge O
often O

from O
a O

Understanding O
how O
people O
interact O
when O
searching O
is O
central O
to O
the O
study O
of O
Interactive O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O

IIR O
Most O
of O
the O
prior O
work O
has O
either O
been O
conceptual O
, O
observational O
or O
empirical O
. O

While O
this O
has O
led O
to O
numerous O
insights O
and O
findings O
regarding O
the O
interaction O
between O
users O
and O
systems O
, O
the O
theory O
has O
lagged O
behind O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
extend O
the O
recently O
proposed O
search O
economic O
theory O
to O
make O
the O
model O
more O
realistic O
. O

We O
then O
derive O
eight O
interaction O
based O
hypotheses O
regarding O
search O
behaviour O
. O

To O
validate O
the O
model O
, O
we O
explore O
whether O
the O
search O
behaviour O
of O
thirty O
- O
six O
participants O
from O
a O
lab O
based O
study O
is O
consistent O
with O
the O
theory O
. O

Our O
analysis O
shows O
that O
observed O
search O
behaviours O
are O
in O
line O
with O
predicted O
search O
behaviours O
and O
that O
it O
is O
possible O
to O
provide O
credible O
explanations O
for O
such O
behaviours O
. O

This O
work O
describes O
a O
concise O
and O
compact O
representation O
of O
search O
behaviour O
providing O
a O
strong O
theoretical O
basis O
for O
future O
IIR O
research O
. O

of O

that O

case O
seems O
to O

its O
own O

. O

As O
a O
result O

systems O
typically O
fall O
behind O
their O

schedule O
and O
have O
many O
bugs O
when O

. O

. O

for O

) O
fill O
for O

. O

a O
run O
- O

package O

in O

IV O
and O

Algol O
. O

has O
been O
used O
to O

three O

( O
two O

Information O
retrieval O
systems O
have O
traditionally O
been O
evaluated O
over O
absolute O
judgments O
of O
relevance O
: O
each O
document O
is O
judged O
for O
relevance O
on O
its O
own O
, O
independent O
of O
other O
documents O
that O
may O
be O
on O
topic O
. O

We O
hypothesize O
that O
preference O
judgments O
of O
the O
form O
“ O

document O
A O
is O
more O
relevant O
than O
document O
B O
” O
are O
easier O
for O
assessors O
to O
make O
than O
absolute O
judgments O
, O
and O
provide O
evidence O
for O
our O
hypothesis O
through O
a O
study O
with O
assessors O
. O

We O
then O
investigate O
methods O
to O
evaluate O
search O
engines O
using O
preference O
judgments O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
we O
show O
that O
by O
using O
inferences O
and O
clever O
selection O
of O
pairs O
to O
judge O
, O
we O
need O
not O
compare O
all O
pairs O
of O
documents O
in O
order O
to O
apply O
evaluation O
methods O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
evaluation O
of O
an O
implication O
by O
Imaging O
is O
a O
logical O
technique O
developed O
in O
the O
framework O
of O
the O
modal O
logic O
. O

Its O
interpretation O
in O
the O
context O
of O
a O
\possible O
worlds O
" O
semantics O
is O
very O
appealing O
for O
IR O
. O

In O
1989 O
, O
Van O
Rijsbergen O
suggested O
its O
use O
for O
solving O
one O
of O
the O
fundamental O
problems O
of O
IR O
logical O
models O
: O
the O
evaluation O
of O
the O
implication O
d O
! O

( O
where O
d O
and O
q O
are O
respectively O
a O
document O
and O
a O
query O
representation O
Since O
then O

others O
have O
tried O
to O
follow O
that O
suggestion O
proposing O
models O
and O
applications O
, O
though O
without O
much O
success O
. O

Most O
of O
these O
approaches O
had O
as O
their O
basic O
assumption O
the O
consideration O
that O
\a O
document O
is O
a O
possible O
world O

an O
approach O
based O
on O
a O
completely O
di O

assumption O
a O
term O

world O

of O
term{term O

-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
a O
search O
method O
for O
detecting O
a O
query O
audio O
signal O
fragment O
in O
long O
audio O
recordings O
. O

The O
query O
signal O
is O
assumed O
to O
be O
captured O
by O
a O
portable O
terminal O
, O
such O
as O
a O
cellular O
phone O
, O
in O
the O
real O
world O
. O

A O
major O
problem O
in O
this O
kind O
of O
search O
is O
that O
the O
features O
of O
the O
query O
sound O
may O
include O
distortions O
due O
to O
terminal O
characteristics O
or O
environment O
noise O
. O

The O
method O
proposed O
here O
comprises O
local O
time O
- O
frequency O
- O
region O
normalization O
and O
robust O
subspace O
spanning O
. O

The O
former O
is O
used O
to O
make O
features O
invariant O
to O
additive O
noise O
and O
frequency O
characteristics O
, O
and O
the O
latter O
to O
choose O
frequency O
bands O
that O
minimize O
the O
effect O
of O
feature O
distortions O
. O

Experiments O
using O
cellular O
phones O
in O
the O
real O
world O
show O
the O
proposed O
method O
is O
effective O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Collaboratively O
created O
online O
encyclopedias O
have O
become O
increasingly O
popular O
. O

Especially O
in O
terms O
of O
completeness O
they O
have O
begun O
to O
surpass O
their O
printed O
counterparts O
. O

Two O
German O
publishers O
of O
traditional O
encyclopedias O
have O
reacted O
to O
this O
challenge O
and O
decided O
to O
merge O
their O
corpora O
to O
create O
a O
single O
more O
complete O
encyclopedia O
. O

The O
crucial O
step O
in O
this O
merge O
process O
is O
the O
alignment O
of O
articles O
. O

We O
have O
developed O
a O
system O
to O
identify O
corresponding O
entries O
from O
different O
encyclopedic O
corpora O
. O

The O
base O
of O
our O
system O
is O
the O
alignment O
algorithm O
which O
incorporates O
various O
techniques O
developed O
in O
the O
field O
of O
information O
retrieval O
. O

We O
have O
evaluated O
the O
system O
on O
four O
real O
- O
world O
encyclopedias O
with O
a O
ground O
truth O
provided O
by O
domain O
experts O
. O

A O
combination O
of O
weighting O
and O
ranking O
techniques O
has O
been O
found O
to O
deliver O
a O
satisfying O
performance O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Natural O
Language O
Generation O
( O
NLG O
) O
focuses O
on O
the O
generation O
of O
written O
texts O
in O
natural O
language O
from O
some O
underlying O
semantic O
representation O
of O
information O
. O

A O
new O
semantic O
representation O
called O
Rich O
Semantic O
Graph O
( O
RSG O
) O
has O
been O
proposed O
to O
be O
used O
as O
an O
intermediate O
representation O
during O
recent O
research O
for O

Language O

applications O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
a O
new O

to O
generate O
an O
English O
text O
from O
RSG O
is O
proposed O
. O

The O
proposed O
model O
can O
be O
exploited O
in O
Text O
Summarization O
, O
Machine O
Translation O
and O
Information O
Retrieval O
applications O
. O

In O
this O
model O
, O
WordNet O
ontology O
is O
used O
to O
generate O
multiple O
texts O
according O
to O
the O
word O
synonyms O
. O

Also O
, O
the O
model O
enables O
users O
to O
determine O
the O
output O
text O
style O
by O
selecting O
one O
of O
two O
writing O
styles O
( O
Cause O
- O
Effect O
and O
Description O
- O
Narration O

Finally O
, O
the O
model O
evaluates O
the O
generated O
texts O
to O
rank O
them O
based O
on O
two O
criteria O
: O
most O
frequently O
used O
words O
and O
discourse O
sentence O
relations O
. O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

retrieval O
, O
and O
intelligently O
designed O
domain O
specific O
ontologies O
achieves O
the O
requirements O
of O
contextual O
and O
semantic O
search O
. O

The O
learning O
capabilities O
resulting O
from O
such O
a O
system O
are O
outlined O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
a O
framework O
for O
ranking O
information O
based O
on O
quality O
, O
relevance O
and O
importance O
, O
and O
argue O
that O
a O
socio O
- O
semantic O
contextual O
approach O
that O
extends O
topicality O
can O
lead O
to O
enhanced O
precision O
in O

retrieval O
. O

We O
use O
Topic O
Maps O
to O
implement O
our O
framework O
, O
and O
discuss O
procedures O
for O
collecting O
the O
pertinent O

for O

the O
resource O

. O

fuzzy O
neural O
network O
approach O
is O
envisioned O
to O
complement O

process O
of O

creation O
. O

The O
Smart O
project O
in O
automatic O
text O
retrieval O
was O
started O
in O
1961 O
. O

It O
is O
the O
oldest O
, O
continuously O
running O
research O
project O
in O
information O
retrieval O
. O

The O
panel O

all O

to O

. O

and O

-DOCSTART- O

Clustering O
techniques O
have O
more O
importance O
in O
data O
mining O
especially O
when O
the O
data O
size O
is O
very O
large O
. O

It O
is O
widely O
used O
in O
the O
fields O
including O
pattern O
recognition O
system O
, O
machine O
learning O
algorithms O
, O
analysis O
of O
images O
, O
information O
retrieval O
and O
bio O
- O
informatics O
. O

Different O
clustering O
algorithms O
are O
available O
such O
as O
Expectation O
Maximization O
( O
EM O
Cobweb O
, O
FarthestFirst O
, O
OPTICS O
, O
SimpleKMeans O
etc O
. O

SimpleKMeans O
clustering O
is O
a O
simple O
clustering O
algorithm O
. O

It O
partitions O
n O
data O
tuples O
into O
k O
groups O
such O
that O
each O
entity O
in O
the O
cluster O
has O
nearest O
mean O
. O

This O
paper O
is O
about O
the O
implementation O
of O
the O
clustering O
techniques O
using O
WEKA O
interface O
. O

This O
paper O
includes O
a O
detailed O
analysis O
of O
various O
clustering O
techniques O
with O
the O
different O
standard O
online O
data O
sets O
. O

Analysis O
is O
based O
on O
the O
multiple O
dimensions O
which O
include O
time O
to O
build O
the O
model O
, O
number O
of O
attributes O
, O
number O
of O
iterations O
, O
number O
of O
clusters O
and O
error O
rate O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

A O
crucial O
piece O
of O
semantic O
web O
development O
is O
the O
creation O
of O
viable O
ontology O
matching O
approaches O
to O
ensure O
interoperability O
in O
a O
wide O
range O
of O
applications O
such O
as O
information O
integration O
and O
semantic O
multimedia O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
a O
new O
approach O
for O
ontology O
matching O
called O
IROM O
( O
Information O
Retrieval O
- O
based O
Ontology O
Matching O
) O
is O
presented O
. O

This O
approach O
derives O
the O
different O
components O
of O
an O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
framework O
based O
on O
the O
information O
provided O
by O
the O
input O
ontologies O
and O
supported O
by O
ontology O
similarity O
measures O
. O

Subsequently O
, O
a O
retrieval O
algorithm O
is O
applied O
to O
determine O
the O
correspondences O
between O
the O
matched O
ontologies O
. O

IROM O
was O
tested O
with O
ontology O
pairs O
taken O
from O
two O
resources O
for O
reference O
ontologies O
, O
OAEI O
and O
FOAM O
. O

The O
evaluation O
shows O
that O
IROM O
is O
competitive O
with O
top O
- O
ranked O
matchers O
on O
the O
benchmark O
test O
at O
OAEI O
campaign O
of O
2009 O
. O

Ground O
truths O
based O
on O
partially O
ordered O
lists O
have O
been O
used O
for O
some O
years O
now O
to O
evaluate O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
systems O
, O
especially O
in O
tasks O
related O
to O
symbolic O

similarity O
. O

However O
, O
there O
has O
been O
practically O
no O
meta O
- O
evaluation O
to O
measure O
or O
improve O
the O

of O
these O
evaluations O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
revise O
the O
methodology O
used O
to O
generate O
these O
ground O
truths O
and O
disclose O
some O
issues O
that O
need O
to O
be O

. O

In O

on O

relevant O
results O
, O
and O
show O
that O

is O
not O
possible O
to O
ensure O
lists O
completely O
consistent O
. O

We O
develop O
a O
measure O
of O
consistency O
based O
on O
Average O
Dynamic O
Recall O
and O
propose O
several O

to O
arrange O
the O
lists O
, O
all O
of O
which O
prove O
to O
be O
more O
consistent O
than O
the O
original O
method O
. O

The O
results O
of O
the O
MIREX O
2005 O
evaluation O
are O
revisited O
using O
these O
alternative O
ground O
truths O
. O

proved O

This O
paper O
presents O
in O
detail O
a O
linguistics O
study O
of O
a O
journalistic O
corpus O
of O
Malay O
describing O
Indonesian O
terrorism O
. O

The O
initial O
raw O
text O
was O
manually O
annotated O
for O
its O
parts O
- O
of O
- O
speech O
. O

It O
is O
the O
first O
corpus O
of O
its O
nature O
ever O
established O
in O
Malaysia O
. O

The O
objective O
of O
this O
research O
is O
to O
conduct O
an O
empirical O
analysis O
of O
the O
actual O
patterns O
of O
use O
in O
journalistic O
texts O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
the O
characteristics O
of O
Malay O
terrorism O
corpus O
which O
include O
the O
properties O
, O
word O
classes O
, O
named O
entities O
and O
word O
occurrences O
. O

The O
results O
of O
this O
work O
are O
given O
purely O
in O
terms O
of O
the O
characteristics O
of O
a O
Malay O
terrorism O
corpus O
. O

The O
results O
are O
highly O
useful O
for O
solving O
larger O
tasks O
in O
the O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
area O
, O
such O
as O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
Information O
Extraction O
, O
in O
the O
area O
of O
terrorism O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
previous O
work O
, O
we O
have O
shown O
that O
using O
terms O
from O
around O
citations O
in O
citing O
papers O
to O
index O
the O
cited O
paper O
, O
in O
addition O
to O
the O
cited O
paper O
's O
own O
terms O
, O
can O
improve O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
. O

Now O
, O
we O
investigate O
how O
to O
select O
text O
from O
around O
the O
citations O
in O
order O
to O
extract O
good O
index O
terms O
. O

We O
compare O
the O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
that O
results O
from O
a O
range O
of O
contexts O
around O
the O
citations O
, O
including O
no O
context O
, O
the O
entire O
citing O
paper O
, O
some O
fixed O
windows O
and O
several O
variations O
with O
linguistic O
motivations O
. O

We O
conclude O
with O
an O
analysis O
of O
the O
benefits O
of O
more O
complex O
, O
linguistically O
motivated O
methods O
for O
extracting O
citation O
index O
terms O
, O
over O
using O
a O
fixed O
window O
of O
terms O
. O

We O
speculate O
that O
there O
might O
be O
some O
advantage O
to O
using O
computational O
linguistic O
techniques O
for O
this O
task O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Optimization O
is O
an O
important O
and O
critical O
step O
in O
the O
data O
mining O
process O
and O
it O
has O
a O
huge O
impact O
on O
the O
success O
of O
a O
data O
mining O
process O
. O

Selecting O
a O
set O
of O
feature O
which O
is O
optimal O
for O
a O
given O
task O
is O
a O
problem O
which O
plays O
an O
important O
role O
in O
a O
wide O
variety O
of O
context O
including O
pattern O
recognition O
, O
adaptive O
control O
and O
machine O
learning O
Clusters O
are O
formed O
of O
the O
reduced O
dataset O
using O
Swarm O
Intelligence O
Technique O
algorithms O
i.e. O
Particle O
Swarm O
Optimization(PSO),Ant O
Colony O
Optimization(ACO),Cluster O
Hypothesis O
is O
verified O
which O
is O
the O
intra O
cluster O
distance O
should O
be O
minimum O
and O
inter O
cluster O
distance O
should O
be O
maximum O
. O

Most O
relevant O
documents O
are O
stored O
i+n O
the O
clusters O
An O
Information O
Retrieval O
System O
is O
used O
for O
retrieval O
of O
data O
from O
the O
clusters O
. O

When O
user O
enters O
a O
query O
from O
a O
Graphical O
User O
Interface O
, O
using O
Information O
Retrieval O
algorithm O
the O
document O
is O
searched O
and O
retrieved O
from O
the O
clusters O
. O

It O
is O
then O
given O
as O
an O
output O
to O
the O
user O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
string O
matching O
algorithms O
have O
broad O
applications O
in O
many O
areas O
of O
computer O
sciences O
. O

These O
areas O
include O
operating O
systems O
, O
information O
retrieval O
, O
editors O
, O
Internet O
searching O
engines O
, O
security O
applications O
and O
biological O
applications O
. O

Two O
important O
factors O
used O
to O
evaluate O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
sequential O
string O
matching O
algorithms O
are O
number O
of O
attempts O
and O
total O
number O
of O
character O
comparisons O
during O
the O
matching O
process O
. O

This O
research O
proposes O
to O
integrate O
the O
good O
properties O
of O
three O
single O
string O
matching O
algorithms O
, O
Quick O
- O
Search O
, O
Zuh O
- O
Takaoka O
and O
Horspool O
, O
to O
produce O
hybrid O
string O
matching O
algorithm O
called O
Maximum O
- O
Shift O
algorithm O
. O

Three O
datasets O
are O
used O
to O
test O
the O
proposed O
algorithm O
, O
which O
are O
, O
DNA O
, O
Protein O
sequence O
and O
English O
text O
. O

The O
hybrid O
algorithm O
, O
Maximum O
- O
Shift O
, O
shows O
efficient O
results O
compared O
to O
four O
string O
matching O
algorithms O
, O
Quick O
- O
Search O
, O
Horspool O
, O
Smith O
and O
Berry O
- O
Ravindran O
, O
in O
terms O
of O
the O
number O
of O
attempts O
and O
the O
total O
number O
of O
character O
comparisons O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Five O
different O
classification O
models O
, O
namely O
RFR_SUM O
, O
CRFs O
, O
Maximum O
Entropy O
, O
SVM O
and O
Semantic O
Similarity O
Model O
, O
are O
employed O
for O
polyphonic O
disambiguation O
. O

Based O
on O
observation O
of O
the O
experiment O
outcome O
of O
these O
models O
, O
an O
additional O
ensemble O
method O
based O
on O
majority O
voting O
is O
proposed O
. O

The O
ensemble O
method O
obtains O
an O
average O
precision O
of O
96.78&#x025 O
which O

" O

" O

; O

an O
[ O
n O
, O

] O

- O

code O

against O

up O
to O

and O
r O

n O
n O
ν O
+ O
1)k+ O
t+2b+ O
r− O
1 O
, O
for O
some O
integer O
ν O
1 O
. O

. O

examined O
. O

. O

this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
collective O
annotation O
model O
supporting O
feedback O
exchange O
through O
discussion O
threads O
. O

Considering O
this O
model O
, O
we O
associate O
annotations O
with O
a O
measure O
of O
the O
sparked O
consensus O
degree O
( O
social O
validation O
this O
allows O
to O
provide O
a O
synthesized O
view O
of O
associated O
discussions O
. O

Finally O
, O
we O
investigate O
how O

systems O
may O
benefit O
from O
the O
proposed O
model O
, O
thus O
taking O

of O
human O
- O
contributed O
highly O
value O
- O

information O
, O
namely O
collective O
annotations O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Internet O
has O
become O
a O
ubiquitous O
access O
to O
information O
. O

Mobile O
smart O
phones O
are O
becoming O
popular O
today O
as O
well O
in O
the O
area O
of O
interactive O
information O
retrieval O
. O

Many O
applications O
are O
developed O
on O
these O
mobile O
intelligent O
machines O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
the O
design O
and O
implementation O
of O
a O
seamless O
distributed O
product O
access O
information O
system O
that O
can O
be O

through O

and/or O
Google O
Android O

phones O
. O

The O
system O
uses O
a O
hybrid O
approach O
of O
master O
- O
slave O
and O
peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
communication O
models O
. O

This O
system O
may O
help O
to O
increase O
business O
activities O
in O
an O
area O
because O
consumers O
can O
access O
to O
more O

about O
products O
that O
they O
are O
interested O
to O
purchase O
anywhere O
with O
Internet O
connection O
and O
any O
time O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
these O
customers O
are O
able O
to O
know O
about O
shops O
that O
sell O
a O
particular O
product O
, O
including O
the O
price O
and O
the O
shops O
addresses O
. O

This O
might O
help O
to O
save O
their O
shops O
hunting O
time O
. O

The O
main O
purpose O
of O
the O
administration O
system O
is O
to O
help O
the O
administrator O
manage O
the O
system O
. O

On O

Abstract O
In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
discuss O
nested O
query O
processing O
in O
a O
distributed O
object O
- O
oriented O
database O
system O
. O

We O
present O
three O
query O
processing O
strategies O
to O
exploit O
parallelism O
in O
a O
distributed O
environment O
. O

Then O
, O
we O
review O
three O
access O
methods O
designed O
for O
centralized O
systems O
and O
discuss O
how O
they O
can O
be O
applied O
to O
the O
distributed O
environment O
. O

Heuristics O
for O
selecting O
attributes O
for O
indexing O
and O
determining O
where O
to O
store O
the O
indexes O
are O
also O
presented O
. O

Finally O
, O
a O
replication O
strategy O
is O
proposed O
for O
the O
path O
dictionary O
method O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

SRS O
is O
a O
widely O
used O
system O
for O
integrating O
biological O
databases O
. O

Currently O
, O
SRS O
relies O
only O
on O
locally O
provided O
copies O
of O
these O
databases O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
a O
mechanism O
that O
also O
allows O
the O
seamless O
integration O
of O
remote O
databases O
. O

To O
this O
end O
, O
our O
proposed O
mechanism O
splits O
the O
existing O
SRS O
functionality O
into O
two O
components O
and O
adds O
a O
third O
component O
that O
enables O
us O
to O
employ O
peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
computing O
techniques O
to O
create O
optimized O
overlay O
- O
networks O
within O
which O
database O
queries O
can O
efficiently O
be O
routed O
. O

As O
an O
additional O
benefit O
, O
this O
mechanism O
also O
reduces O
the O
administration O
effort O
that O
would O
be O
needed O
with O
a O
conventional O
approach O
using O
replicated O
databases O
. O

Index O
terms O
Biological O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
SRS O
, O
Overlay O
- O
network O
Formation O
, O
Peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
Computing O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
structural O
aspects O
of O
the O
unified O
XML O
view O
are O
rigid O
enough O
to O
support O
data O

( O
DR O
) O
queries O
as O
known O
from O
database O
systems O
. O

Over O
the O
past O

years O
, O
increasingly O
powerful O
query O
language O
, O
most O
notably O
the O
recent O
XQuery O
standard O
[ O
2 O
have O
exploited O
this O
fact O
to O
provide O
expressive O
DR O
query O
capabilities O
for O
XML O
. O

On O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
XML O
’s O
structural O
aspects O
are O
transparent O
enough O
to O
treat O
arbitrary O
parts O
of O
the O
XML O
- O
represented O
data O
as O
documents O
. O

Document O
or O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
providing O
one O
of O
the O
most O
important O
capabilities O
for O

text O
- O

documents O
, O
however O
, O
is O
not O
supported O
by O
XQuery O
or O
any O
of O
the O
earlier O
XML O
query O
languages O
so O
far O
. O

Ranking O
is O
an O
essential O
component O
for O
a O
number O
of O
tasks O
, O
such O
as O
information O
retrieval O
and O
collaborative O
filtering O
. O

It O
is O
often O
the O
case O
that O
the O
underlying O
task O
attempts O
to O
maximize O
some O
evaluation O
metric O
, O
such O
as O
mean O
average O
precision O
, O
over O
rankings O
. O

Most O
past O
work O
on O
learning O
how O
to O
rank O
has O
focused O
on O
likelihoodor O
margin O
- O
based O
approaches O
. O

In O
this O
work O
we O
explore O
directly O
maximizing O
rank O
- O
based O
metrics O
, O
which O
are O
a O
family O
of O
metrics O
that O
only O
depend O
on O
the O
order O
of O
ranked O
items O
. O

This O
allows O
us O
to O
maximize O
different O
metrics O
for O
the O
same O
training O
data O
. O

We O
show O
how O
the O
parameter O
space O
of O
linear O
scoring O
functions O
can O
be O
reduced O
to O
a O
multinomial O
manifold O
. O

Parameter O
estimation O
is O
accomplished O
by O
optimizing O
the O
evaluation O
metric O
over O
the O
manifold O
. O

Results O
from O
ad O
hoc O
information O
retrieval O
are O
given O
that O
show O
our O
model O
yields O
significant O
improvements O
in O
effectiveness O
over O
other O
approaches O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Latent O
semantic O
indexing O
( O
LSI O
) O
is O
a O
well O
- O
known O
unsupervised O
approach O
for O
dimensionality O
reduction O
in O
information O
retrieval O
. O

However O
if O
the O
output O
information O
( O
i.e. O
category O
labels O
) O
is O
available O
, O
it O
is O
often O
beneficial O
to O
derive O
the O
indexing O
not O
only O
based O
on O
the O
inputs O
but O
also O
on O
the O
target O
values O
in O
the O
training O
data O
set O
. O

This O
is O
of O
particular O
importance O
in O
applications O
with O
< O
i O
> O
multiple O
labels</i O
in O
which O
each O
document O
can O
belong O
to O
several O
categories O
simultaneously O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
introduce O
the O
multi O
- O
label O
informed O
latent O
semantic O
indexing O
( O
MLSI O
) O
algorithm O
which O
preserves O
the O
information O
of O
inputs O
and O
meanwhile O
captures O
the O
correlations O
between O
the O
multiple O
outputs O
. O

The O
recovered O
" O
latent O
semantics O
" O
thus O
incorporate O
the O
human O
- O
annotated O
category O
information O
and O
can O
be O
used O
to O
greatly O
improve O
the O
prediction O
accuracy O
. O

Empirical O
study O
based O
on O
two O
data O
sets O
, O
Reuters-21578 O
and O
RCV1 O
, O
demonstrates O
very O
encouraging O
results O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
growth O
of O
the O
Web O
and O
other O
Big O
Data O
sources O
lead O
to O
important O
performance O
problems O
for O
large O
- O
scale O
and O
distributed O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

The O
scalability O
and O
efficiency O
of O
such O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
have O
an O
impact O
on O
their O
effectiveness O
, O
eventually O
affecting O
the O
experience O
of O
their O
users O
and O
monetization O
as O
well O
. O

The O
LSDS O
- O
IR'15 O
workshop O
will O
provide O
space O
for O
researchers O
to O
discuss O
the O
existing O
performance O
problems O
in O
the O
context O
of O
large O
- O
scale O
and O
distributed O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
and O
define O
new O
research O
directions O
in O
the O
modern O
Big O
Data O
era O
. O

The O
workshop O
expects O
to O
bring O
together O
information O
retrieval O
practitioners O
from O
the O
industry O
, O
as O
well O
as O
academic O
researchers O
concerned O
with O
any O
aspect O
of O
large O
- O
scale O
and O
distributed O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Web O
crawls O
provide O
valuable O
snapshots O
of O
the O
Web O
which O
enable O
a O
wide O
variety O
of O
research O
, O
be O
it O
distributional O
analysis O
to O
characterize O
Web O
properties O
or O
use O
of O
language O
, O
content O
analysis O
in O
social O
science O
, O
or O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
research O
to O
develop O
and O
evaluate O
effective O
search O
algorithms O
. O

While O

crawls O
exist O
, O

crawls O
are O

, O

and O

. O

To O
remedy O
this O
, O

present O
ArabicWeb16 O
, O
a O
new O

crawl O
of O
roughly O

pages O
with O
significant O
coverage O
of O
dialectal O

as O
well O
as O
Modern O
Standard O
Arabic O
. O

For O

expect O

: O
ad O

, O

, O

, O

search O
, O

, O
entity O
search O
, O
blog O
search O
, O

. O

Combined O

we O

may O
provide O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
investigates O
factors O
influencing O
user O
satisfaction O
in O
information O
retrieval O
. O

It O
is O
evident O
from O
this O
study O
that O
user O
satisfaction O
is O
a O
subjective O
variable O
which O
can O
be O
influenced O
by O
several O
factors O
such O
as O
system O
effectiveness O
, O
user O
effectiveness O
, O
user O
effort O
and O
user O
characteristics O
and O
expectations O
. O

Therefore O
, O
information O
retrieval O
evaluators O
should O
consider O
all O
these O
factors O
in O
obtaining O
user O
satisfaction O
and O
in O
using O
it O
as O
a O
criterion O
of O
system O
effectiveness O
. O

Previous O
studies O
have O
conflicting O
conclusion O
on O
the O
relationship O
between O
user O
satisfaction O
and O
system O
effectiveness O
, O
this O
study O
has O
substantiated O
this O
relationship O
and O
supports O
using O
user O
satisfaction O
as O
a O
criterion O
of O
system O
effectiveness O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
review O
some O
recent O
research O
topics O
by O
Laboratory O
for O
Cognitive O
Modeling O
( O
LKM O
) O
at O
Faculty O
of O
Computer O
and O
Information O
Science O
, O
University O
of O
Ljubljana O
, O
Slovenia O
. O

Classification O
and O
regression O
models O
, O
either O
automatically O
generated O
from O
data O
by O
machine O
learning O
algorithms O
, O
or O
manually O
encoded O
with O
the O
help O
of O
domain O
experts O
, O
are O
daily O
used O
to O
predict O
the O
labels O
of O
new O
instances O
. O

Each O
such O
individual O
prediction O
, O
in O
order O
to O
be O
accepted O
/ O
trusted O
by O
users O
, O
should O
be O
accompanied O
by O
an O
explanation O
of O
the O
prediction O
as O
well O
as O
by O
an O
estimate O
of O
its O
reliability O
. O

In O
LKM O
we O
have O
recently O
developed O
a O
general O
methodology O
for O
explaining O
individual O
predictions O
as O
well O
as O
for O
estimating O
their O
reliability O
. O

Both O
, O
explanation O
and O
reliability O
estimation O
are O
general O
techniques O
, O
independent O
of O
the O
underlying O
model O
and O
provide O
on O
- O
line O
( O
effective O
and O
efficient O
) O
support O
to O
the O
users O
of O
prediction O
models O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
development O
of O
both O
musicologically O
based O
and O
efficient O
music O
information O
retrieval O
metrics O
to O
query O
large O
music O
database O
is O
crucial O
in O
modern O
music O
information O
retrieval O
, O
knowledge O
management O
and O
database O
research O
. O

Graph O
spectral O
representation O
of O
pitch O
class O
sequences O
has O
proved O
to O
outperform O
other O
pitch O
class O
based O
melodic O
similarity O
methods O

Here O
we O
compare O
different O
spectral O
approaches O
to O
structural O
queries O
in O
databases O
of O
symbolic O
music O
, O
which O
exploits O
mathematical O
music O
theory O
results O
to O
improve O
the O
descriptive O
power O
of O
representative O
graphs O

In O
particular O
, O
we O
explore O
graph O
representation O
of O
other O
relevant O
music O
features O
like O
intervals O
. O

The O
experiments O
have O
been O
conducted O
on O
a O
subset O
of O
the O
RISM O
collection O
, O
and O
results O
have O
been O
evaluated O
against O
a O
ground O
truth O
for O
the O
same O
collection O
developed O
for O
the O
MIREX O
competition O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Audio O
key O
finding O
is O
an O
integral O
step O
in O
content O
- O
based O
music O
indexing O
and O
retrieval O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
a O
system O
that O
combines O
ensemble O
learning O
with O
an O
existing O
model O
- O
based O
key O
finding O
algorithm O
: O
the O
Fuzzy O
Analysis O
Center O
of O
Effect O
Generator O
algorithm O
. O

We O
demonstrate O
the O
manner O
in O
which O
AdaBoost O
improves O
the O
accuracy O
of O
FACEG O
using O
a O
dataset O
containing O
2785 O
audio O
excerpts O
of O
real O
performances O
composed O
by O
Bach O
and O
Mozart O
. O

Two O
sets O
of O
experiments O
were O
conducted O
: O
intra O
- O
system O
comparison O
examining O
the O
effect O
of O
different O
settings O
in O
FACEG O
/ O
AdaBoost O
, O
and O
inter O
- O
system O
comparison O
comparing O
FACEG O
/ O
AdaBoost O
with O
the O
key O
finding O
implementation O
in O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
MIR O
) O
toolbox O
. O

When O
FACEG O
is O
executed O
to O
generate O
keys O
at O
multiple O
stopping O
points O
of O
the O
excerpt O
, O
AdaBoost O
with O
multi O
- O
views O
of O
tonal O
information O
improves O
key O
detection O
accuracy O
up O
to O
35 O
% O
on O
the O
challenging O
dataset O
and O
up O
to O
21 O
% O
on O
the O
entire O
dataset O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Looking O
for O
ontology O
in O
a O
search O
engine O
, O
one O
can O
find O
so O
many O
different O
approaches O
that O
it O
can O
be O
difficult O
to O
understand O
which O
field O
of O
research O
the O
subject O
belongs O
to O
and O
how O
it O
can O
be O
useful O
. O

The O
term O
ontology O
is O
employed O
within O
philosophy O
, O
computer O
science O
, O
and O
information O
science O
with O
different O
meanings O
. O

To O
take O
advantage O
of O
what O
ontology O
theories O
have O
to O
offer O
, O
one O
should O
understand O
what O
they O
address O
and O
where O
they O
come O
from O
. O

In O
information O
science O
, O
except O
for O
a O
few O
papers O
, O
there O
is O
no O
initiative O
toward O
clarifying O
what O
ontology O
really O
is O
and O
the O
connections O
that O
it O
fosters O
among O
different O
research O
fields O
. O

This O
article O
provides O
such O
a O
clarification O
. O

We O
begin O
by O
revisiting O
the O
meaning O
of O
the O
term O
in O
its O
original O
field O
, O
philosophy O
, O
to O
reach O
its O
current O
use O
in O
other O
research O
fields O
. O

We O
advocate O
that O
ontology O
is O
a O
genuine O
and O
relevant O
subject O
of O
research O
in O
information O
science O
. O

Finally O
, O
we O
conclude O
by O
offering O
our O
view O
of O
the O
opportunities O
for O
interdisciplinary O
research O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Relevance O
judgments O
are O
often O
the O
most O
expensive O
part O
of O
information O
retrieval O
evaluation O
, O
and O
techniques O
for O
comparing O
retrieval O
systems O
using O
fewer O
relevance O
judgments O
have O
received O
significant O
attention O
in O
recent O
years O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
novel O
system O
comparison O
method O
using O
an O
expectationmaximization O
algorithm O
. O

In O
the O
expectation O
step O
, O
real O
- O
valued O
pseudo O
- O
judgments O
are O
estimated O
from O
a O
set O
of O
system O
results O
. O

In O
the O
maximization O
step O
, O
new O
system O
weights O
are O
learned O
from O
a O
combination O
of O
a O
limited O
number O
of O
actual O
human O
judgments O
and O
system O
pseudo O
- O
judgments O
for O
the O
other O
documents O
. O

The O
method O
can O
work O
without O
any O
human O
judgments O
, O
and O
is O
able O
to O
improve O
its O
accuracy O
by O
incrementally O
adding O
human O
judgments O
. O

Experiments O
using O
TREC O
Ad O
Hoc O
collections O
demonstrate O
strong O
correlations O
with O
system O
rankings O
using O
pooled O
human O
judgments O
, O
and O
comparison O
with O
existing O
baselines O
indicates O
that O
the O
new O
method O
achieves O
the O
same O
comparison O
reliability O
with O
fewer O
human O
judgments O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

There O
are O
two O
important O
research O
topics O
in O
the O
field O
of O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
MIR O
One O
is O
how O
to O
improve O
the O

of O
features O

by O
Shazam O
company O

of O

- O

, O
and O
the O
system O
can O

the O

environment O

. O

a O

the O

of O

in O

and O
accuracy O
. O

( O

) O
schemes O
combine O
di O
erent O
normalization O
techniques O
and O

functions O
. O

Hybrid O
schemes O
provide O
an O
eÆcient O
technique O
to O
improve O
precision O
and O
recall O
( O
see O
e.g O
4 O
This O

. O

of O

algorithm O

the O

. O

The O

generates O

of O

set O
. O

This O
paper O
deals O
with O
Chinese O
, O
English O
and O
Japanese O
multilingual O
information O
retrieval O
( O
MLIR O
Merging O
problem O
in O
distributed O
MLIR O
is O
studied O
. O

The O
prediction O
of O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
is O
used O
to O
determine O
the O
merging O
weight O
of O
each O
intermediate O
run O
. O

The O
translation O
penalty O
and O
collection O
weight O
are O
considered O
to O
improve O
merging O
performance O
. O

Several O
merging O
strategies O
are O
experimented O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
the O
performance O
of O
normalized O
- O
by O
- O
top O
- O
k O
merging O
with O
translation O
penalty O
and O
collection O
weight O
is O
similar O
to O
that O
of O
raw O
- O
score O
merging O
and O
better O
than O
that O
of O
the O
other O
merging O
strategies O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

To O
increase O
retrieval O
e O
ectiveness O
, O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
must O
o O
er O
better O
supports O
to O
users O
in O
their O
information O
seeking O
activities O
. O

To O
achieve O
this O
, O
one O
major O
concern O
is O
to O
obtain O
a O
better O
understanding O
of O
the O
nature O
of O
the O
interaction O
between O
a O
user O
and O
an O
information O
retrieval O
system O
. O

For O
this O
, O
we O
need O
a O
means O
to O
analyse O
the O
interaction O
in O
information O
retrieval O
, O
so O
as O
to O
compare O
the O
interaction O
processes O
within O
and O
across O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

We O
present O
a O
framework O
for O
investigating O
the O
interaction O
between O
users O
and O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

The O
framework O
is O
based O
on O
channel O
theory O
, O
a O
theory O
of O
information O
and O
its O
ow O
, O
which O
provides O
an O
explicit O
ontology O
that O
can O
be O
used O
to O
represent O
any O
aspect O
of O
the O
interaction O
process O
. O

The O
developed O
framework O
allows O
for O
the O
investigation O
of O
the O
interaction O
in O
information O
retrieval O
at O
the O
desired O
level O
of O
abstraction O
. O

We O
use O
the O
framework O
to O
investigate O
the O
interaction O
in O
relevance O
feedback O
and O
standard O
web O
search O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
discuss O
our O
efforts O
in O
Soundscape O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
SIR O
Computational O

is O
a O
key O
research O
component O
in O
the O
Citygram O
Project O
which O
is O
built O
on O
a O
cyber O
- O
physical O
system O
that O
includes O
a O
scalable O
robust O
sensor O
network O
, O
remote O
sensing O
devices O
( O
RSD O
spatio O
- O
acoustic O
visualization O
formats O
, O
as O
well O
as O
software O
tools O
for O
composition O
and O
sonification O
. O

By O
combining O
our O
research O
in O
soundscape O
studies O
, O
which O
includes O
the O
capture O
, O
collection O
, O
analysis O
, O
visualization O
and O
musical O
applications O
of O
spatio O
- O
temporal O
sound O
, O
we O
discuss O
our O
current O
research O
efforts O
that O
aim O
to O
contribute O
towards O
the O
development O
of O
soundscape O
information O
retrieval O
( O
SIR O
This O
includes O
discussion O
of O
soundscape O
descriptors O
, O
soundscape O
taxonomy O
, O
annotation O
, O
and O
data O
analytics O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
we O
discuss O
one O
of O
our O
focal O
research O
agendas O
in O
measuring O
and O
quantifying O
urban O
noise O
pollution O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
Modern O
Mongolian O
, O
a O
content O
word O
can O
be O
inflected O
when O
concatenated O
with O
suffixes O
. O

Identifying O
the O
original O
forms O
of O
content O
words O
is O
crucial O
for O
natural O
language O
processing O
and O
information O
retrieval O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
lemmatization O
method O
for O
Modern O
Mongolian O
and O
apply O
our O
method O
to O
indexing O
for O
information O
retrieval O
. O

We O
use O
technical O
abstracts O
to O
show O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
our O
method O
experimentally O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
World O
Wide O
Web O
is O
an O
unregulated O
communication O
medium O
which O
exhibits O
very O
limited O
means O
of O
quality O
control O
. O

Quality O
assurance O
has O
become O
a O
key O
issue O
for O
many O
information O
retrieval O
services O
on O
the O
Internet O
, O
e.g. O
web O
search O
engines O
. O

This O
paper O
introduces O
some O
quality O
evaluation O
and O
assessment O
methods O
to O
assess O
the O
quality O
of O
web O
pages O
. O

The O
proposed O
quality O
evaluation O
mechanisms O
are O
based O
on O
a O
set O
of O
quality O
criteria O
which O
were O
extracted O
from O
a O
targeted O
user O
survey O
. O

A O
weighted O
algorithmic O
interpretation O
of O
the O
most O
significant O
user O
quoted O
quality O
criteria O
is O
proposed O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
the O
paper O
utilizes O
machine O
learning O
methods O
to O
produce O
a O
prediction O
of O
quality O
for O
web O
pages O
before O
they O
are O
downloaded O
. O

The O
set O
of O
quality O
criteria O
allows O
us O
to O
implement O
a O
web O
search O
engine O
with O
quality O
ranking O
schemes O
, O
leading O
to O
web O
crawlers O
which O
can O
crawl O
directly O
quality O
web O
pages O
. O

The O
proposed O
approaches O
produce O
some O
very O
promising O
results O
on O
a O
sizeable O
web O
repository O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Search O
engines O
have O
become O
the O
most O
popular O
tools O
for O
finding O
information O
on O
the O
Internet O
. O

A O
real O
- O
world O
Semantic O
Web O
application O
can O
benefit O
from O
this O
by O
combining O
its O
features O
with O
some O
features O
from O
search O
engines O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
methods O
for O
indexing O
and O
searching O
a O
populated O
ontology O
by O
using O
an O
information O
retrieval O
tool O
; O
its O
results O
are O
enriched O
with O
inference O
. O

For O
visualization O
purposes O
, O
all O
of O
the O
retrieved O
ontology O
instances O
are O
clustered O
based O
on O
their O
classes O
; O
and O
the O
clusters O
are O
linked O
using O
instance O
properties O
. O

The O
approach O
is O
illustrated O
using O
our O
SWHi O
( O
Semantic O
Web O
for O
History O
) O
prototype O
as O
a O
case O
study O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
abstract O
describes O
the O
tempo O
extraction O
algorithm O
used O
for O
the O
University O
of O
Victoria O
submission O
to O
the O
MIREX O
( O
Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
Exchange O
) O
2005 O
. O

The O
algorithm O
is O
mostly O
based O
on O
self O
- O
similarity O
rather O
than O
onset O
detection O
. O

However O
, O
an O
onset O
detection O
component O
is O
used O
to O
calculate O
the O
phase O
of O
the O
dominant O
periodicities O
. O

Multiple O
frequency O
bands O
are O
calculated O
using O
a O
Discrete O
Wavelet O
Transform O
. O

Subsequently O
the O
envelope O
of O
each O
band O
is O
extracted O
and O
autocorrelation O
is O
used O
to O
find O
the O
dominant O
periodicities O
of O
the O
audio O
signal O
. O

These O
dominant O
periodicities O
are O
accumulated O
into O
a O
Beat O
Histogram O
which O
is O
used O
to O
detect O
the O
primary O
and O
secondary O
tempo O
and O
their O
relative O
strength O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
a O
new O
classification O
system O
called O
ECHO O
. O

This O
system O
is O
based O
on O
a O
principle O
of O
echo O
and O
applied O
to O
document O
classification O
. O

It O
computes O
the O
score O
of O
a O
document O
for O
a O
class O
by O
combining O
a O
bottom O
- O
up O
and O
a O
top O
- O
down O
propagation O
of O
activation O
in O
a O
very O
simple O
neural O
network O
. O

This O
system O
bridges O
a O
gap O
between O
Machine O
Learning O
methods O
and O
Information O
Retrieval O
since O
the O
bottom O
- O
up O
and O
the O
top O
- O
down O
propagations O
can O
be O
seen O
as O
the O
measures O
of O
the O
specificity O
and O
exhaustivity O
which O
underlie O
the O
models O
of O
relevance O
used O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

The O
system O
has O
been O
tested O
on O
the O
Reuters O
21578 O
collection O
and O
in O
the O
context O
of O
an O
international O
challenge O
on O
large O
scale O
hierarchical O
text O
classification O
with O
corpus O
extracted O
from O
Dmoz O
and O
Wikipedia O
. O

Its O
comparison O
with O
other O
classification O
systems O
has O
shown O
its O
efficiency O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
explain O
a O
novel O
technique O
for O
using O
vector O
quantization O
( O
VQ O
) O
for O
large O
scale O
content O
based O
information O
retrieval O
of O
any O
type O
of O
images O
, O
not O
restricted O
to O
the O
compressed O
domain O
. O

The O
main O
problem O
with O
VQ O
is O
the O
size O
of O
the O
source O
vectors O
that O
is O
used O
to O
generate O
the O
global O
codebook O
, O
which O
represents O
all O
images O
in O
the O
database O
. O

We O
have O
proposed O
a O
technique O
, O
where O
the O
local O
codebooks O
are O
generated O
and O
the O
locally O
global O
codebook O
for O
the O
images O
is O
computed O
from O
all O
the O
local O
codebooks O
. O

It O
gives O
better O
image O
quality O
than O
the O
global O
codebook O
. O

This O
incremental O
codebook O
generation O
process O
makes O
the O
index O
scalable O
, O
as O
new O
image O
codebooks O
can O
be O
used O
to O
generate O
the O
locally O
global O
codebook O
easily O
. O

i O
> O
We O
present O
a O
method O
of O
searching O
text O
collections O
that O

advantage O
of O

information O
within O
documents O
and O

searches O
of O

and O

data O
. O

show O
that O

databases O
( O

designed O
for O

data O
along O

dimensions O
, O
are O
effective O
for O
information O
retrieval O
. O

We O

a O
method O
of O
using O
On O
- O
Line O
Analytic O
Processing O
( O
OLAP O
) O
techniques O
on O
a O

collection O
. O

This O
combines O

information O
retrieval O
and O

slicing O
, O

, O
drill O
- O
down O
, O
and O

- O
up O
of O

. O

We O
demonstrate O
use O
of O
a O

for O
searching O
documents O
from O
the O
TREC O
collection O

We O
propose O
a O
novel O

analysis O
approach O
to O

meta O
information O
in O
order O
to O
find O
the O
relationships O
within O
the O
unstructured O
or O
semi O
- O
structured O
document O
/ O
passages O
for O
improving O
genomics O
information O

performance O
. O

First O
, O
we O
make O
use O
of O
the O
auxiliary O
information O
as O
three O
basic O
dimensions O
, O
namely O
" O
temporal O
journal O
and O
" O
author O
The O
reference O
section O
is O
treated O
as O
a O
commensurable O
quantity O
of O
the O
three O
basic O
dimensions O
. O

Then O
, O
the O
sample O
space O
and O
subspaces O
are O
built O
up O
and O
a O

of O
events O

to O

of O

to O

. O

After O

is O
applied O
on O

respectively O
to O

the O

of O
each O
dimension O
. O

Finally O

we O
integrate O
all O
the O
dimension O
networks O
and O
re O
- O
rank O
the O
outputs O
for O
evaluation O
. O

Our O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
authors O
have O
developed O
an O
information O
retrieval O
system O
named O
AIR O
( O
Augmented O
Information O
Retrieval O
system O
which O
might O
be O
one O
of O
the O
most O
efficient O
systems O
for O
very O
large O
document O
databases O
. O

AIR O
can O
store O
the O
document O
data O
compactly O
and O
retrieve O
them O
quickly O
. O

The O
techniques O
bringing O
AIR O
to O
the O
high O
efficiency O
, O
the O
data O
compression O
, O
the O
quick O
keyword O
index O
, O
and O
the O
automatic O
keyword O
selection O
, O
are O
discussed O
. O

These O
techniques O
, O
which O
are O
based O
on O
the O
statistical O
properties O
of O
word O
occurrence O
, O
are O
fairly O
simple O
, O
so O
that O
the O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
employing O
them O
can O
be O
implemented O
with O
ease O
. O

The O
data O
compression O
technique O
reduces O
English O
text O
by O
a O
factor O
of O
4 O
. O

The O
quick O
keyword O
index O
decreases O
the O
average O
number O
of O
disk O
accesses O
to O
retrieve O
a O
keyword O
to O
about O
0.3 O
. O

The O
automatic O
keyword O
selection O
technique O
roughly O
halves O
both O
the O
number O
of O
different O
keywords O
and O
the O
size O
of O
the O
inverted O
file O
with O
only O
2 O
% O
loss O
of O
retrieval O
power O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Continuous O
space O
word O
embedding O
have O
been O
shown O
to O
be O
highly O
effective O
in O
many O
information O
retrieval O
tasks O
. O

Embedding O
representation O
models O
make O
use O
of O
local O
information O
available O
in O
immediately O
surrounding O
words O
to O
project O
nearby O
context O
words O
closer O
in O
the O
embedding O
space O
. O

With O
rising O
multi O
- O
tasking O
nature O
of O
web O
search O
sessions O
, O
users O
often O
try O
to O
accomplish O
different O
tasks O
in O
a O
single O
search O
session O
. O

Consequently O
, O
the O
search O
context O
gets O
polluted O
with O
queries O
from O
different O
unrelated O
tasks O
which O
renders O
the O
context O
heterogeneous O
. O

In O
this O
work O
, O
we O
hypothesize O
that O
task O
information O
provides O
better O
context O
for O
IR O
systems O
to O
learn O
from O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
novel O
task O
context O
embedding O
architecture O
to O
learn O
representation O
of O
queries O
in O
low O
- O
dimensional O
space O
by O
leveraging O
their O
task O
context O
information O
from O
historical O
search O
logs O
using O
neural O
embedding O
models O
. O

In O
addition O
to O
qualitative O
analysis O
, O
we O
empirically O
demonstrate O
the O
benefit O
of O
leveraging O
task O
context O
to O
learn O
query O
representations O
. O

There O
is O
an O
abundance O
of O
systems O
today O
to O
search O
for O
relevant O
patents O
, O
ranging O
from O
free O
ones O
like O
Google O
Patents O
( O
google.com/patents O
) O
to O
subscription O
ones O
like O
Delphion O
( O
delphion.com O

After O
studying O
many O
existing O
systems O
, O
we O
found O
that O
they O
all O
apply O
general O
- O
purpose O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
techniques O
to O
rank O
patents O
. O

We O
argue O
that O
the O
quality O
of O
search O
can O
be O
significantly O
improved O
by O
exploiting O
the O
domain O
semantics O
: O
e.g O
patents O
are O
organized O
into O
classes O
and O
subclasses O
, O
and O
have O
links O
to O
external O
publication O
and O
to O
other O
patents O
. O

Also O
patents O
' O
text O
is O
organized O
into O
various O
sections O
and O
uses O
specific O
legal O
wording O
We O
present O
the O
< O
i O
> O
PatentsSearcher</i O
> O
system O
, O
available O
at O
PatentsSearcher.com O
, O
whose O
key O
contribution O
is O
to O
leverage O
the O
domain O
semantics O
to O
improve O
the O
quality O
of O
discovery O
and O
ranking O
. O

PatentsSearcher O
also O
offers O
other O
novel O
functionalities O
to O
help O
users O
locate O
and O
navigate O
relevant O
and O
important O
patents O
or O
applications O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
describe O
the O
University O
of O
Amsterdam O
’s O
participation O
in O
the O
Cross O
- O
Lingual O
Information O
Retrieval O
task O
at O
NTCIR-5 O
. O

We O
focused O
on O
Chinese O
monolingual O
retrieval O
, O
and O
aimed O
to O
study O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
language O
models O
and O
different O
tokenization O
methods O
for O
Chinese O
. O

Our O
main O
findings O
are O
the O
following O
. O

First O
, O
where O
the O
vector O
space O
model O
excels O
on O
a O
bigram O
index O
, O
the O
language O
model O
performs O
poorly O
. O

Second O
, O
on O
a O
unigram O
index O
, O
the O
language O
model O
is O
very O
effective O
, O
and O
even O
exceeds O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
vector O
space O
model O
on O
the O
bigram O
index O
. O

Third O
, O
and O
at O
a O
more O
technical O
level O
, O
in O
comparison O
to O
word O
- O
based O
langauges O
such O
as O
English O
we O
found O
that O
language O
models O
for O
Chinese O
require O
less O
smoothing O
, O
due O
to O
the O
different O
indexing O
unit O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Several O
studies O
have O
pointed O
out O
the O
need O
for O
accurate O
mid O
- O
level O
representations O
of O
music O
signals O
for O
information O
retrieval O
and O
signal O
processing O
purposes O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
new O
mid O
- O
level O
representation O
based O
on O
the O
decomposition O
of O
a O
signal O
into O
a O
small O
number O
of O
sound O
atoms O
or O
molecules O
bearing O
explicit O
musical O
instrument O
labels O
. O

Each O
atom O
is O
a O
sum O
of O
windowed O
harmonic O
sinusoidal O
partials O
whose O
relative O
amplitudes O
are O
specific O
to O
one O
instrument O
, O
and O
each O
molecule O
consists O
of O
several O
atoms O
from O
the O
same O
instrument O
spanning O
successive O
time O
windows O
. O

We O
design O
efficient O
algorithms O
to O
extract O
the O
most O
prominent O
atoms O
or O
molecules O
and O
investigate O
several O
applications O
of O
this O
representation O
, O
including O
polyphonic O
instrument O
recognition O
and O
music O
visualization O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
1979 O
, O
the O
dean O
of O
Harvard O
Medical O
School O
, O
in O
an O
address O
to O
the O
Council O
of O
Deans O
of O
the O
American O
Association O
of O
Medical O
Colleges O
, O
stated O
that O
there O
were O
two O
key O
areas O
which O
needed O
to O
be O
added O
to O
the O
medical O
school O
curriculum O
: O
medical O
decision O
analysis O
and O
information O
science O
. O

It O
has O
even O
been O
suggested O
that O
computer O
sc O
science O
, O
li O
should O
be O
ii O
medical O
schc O
the O
past O
several O
years O
, O
at O
dozen O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
traditional O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
users O
often O
express O
their O
needs O
using O
simple O
keywords O
, O
because O
this O
is O
the O
most O
simple O
way O
to O
query O
systems O
. O

Queries O
composed O
of O
simple O
keyword O
terms O
are O
also O
very O
used O
in O
structured O
IR O
( O
i.e. O
IR O
on O
structured O
documents O
like O
XML O
documents O
since O
they O
do O
not O
require O
any O
knowledge O
of O
the O
documents O
structure O
. O

However O
, O
such O
queries O
are O
often O
not O
sufficient O
to O
describe O
precisely O
users’ O
needs O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
new O
approach O
of O
Structured O
Relevance O
Feedback O
on O
queries O
composed O
of O
simple O
keywords O
terms O
. O

This O
approach O
allows O
on O
the O
one O
hand O
to O
enrich O
the O
initial O
query O
according O
to O
relevance O
judgements O
, O
and O
on O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
to O
express O
a O
degree O
of O
preference O
for O
each O
keyword O
, O
by O
weighting O
them O
. O

Our O
approach O
is O
based O
on O
a O
combination O
of O
term O
features O
in O
relevant O
elements O
. O

Our O
proposition O
is O
evaluated O
thanks O
to O
the O
INEX O
evaluation O
campaign O
and O
results O
show O
the O
interest O
of O
our O
methods O
. O

MOTS O
- O
CLÉS O
reformulation O
, O
document O
XML O
, O
contexte O
, O
contenu O
, O
RI O
. O

The O
classical O
Probability O
Ranking O
Principle O
( O
PRP O
) O
forms O
the O
theoretical O
basis O
for O
probabilistic O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
models O
, O
which O
are O
dominating O
IR O
theory O
since O
about O
20 O
years O
. O

However O
, O
the O
assumptions O
underlying O
the O
PRP O
often O
do O
not O
hold O
, O
and O
its O
view O
is O
too O
narrow O
for O
interactive O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IIR O

In O
this O
article O
, O
a O
new O
theoretical O
framework O
for O
interactive O
retrieval O
is O
proposed O
: O

The O
basic O
idea O
is O
that O
during O
IIR O
, O
a O
user O
moves O
between O
situations O
. O

In O
each O
situation O
, O
the O
system O
presents O
to O
the O
user O
a O
list O
of O
choices O
, O
about O
which O
s O
/ O
he O
has O
to O
decide O
, O
and O
the O
first O
positive O
decision O
moves O
the O
user O
to O
a O
new O
situation O
. O

Each O
choice O
is O
associated O
with O
a O
number O
of O
cost O
and O
probability O
parameters O
. O

Based O
on O
these O
parameters O
, O
an O
optimum O
ordering O
of O
the O
choices O
can O
the O
derived O
— O
the O
PRP O
for O
IIR O
. O

The O
relationship O
of O
this O
rule O
to O
the O
classical O
PRP O
is O
described O
, O
and O
issues O
of O
further O
research O
are O
pointed O
out O
. O

Spatial O
data O

and O
fusion O
is O
an O
important O
research O
field O
in O
Geographical O
Information O
Science O
. O

The O
key O
of O
integration O
and O
fusion O
of O

data O
lies O
in O
automated O
recognition O
and O
matching O
of O
homonymous O
features O
. O

This O
article O
concludes O
the O

location O
matching O
relationships O
among O
the O
homonymous O
linear O
entities O
. O

Linear O
entity O
matching O
algorithm O
based O
on O
multi O
- O
steps O
buffer O
analysis O
is O
presented O
and O
accomplished O
in O
this O
article O
. O

Sequence O
matching O
strategy O
is O
adopted O
to O
recognize O
homonymous O
linear O
entities O
step O
by O
step O
. O

At O
each O
step O
, O
a O
part O
of O
non O
- O
matching O
linear O
entities O
are O
eliminated O
rapidly O
, O
which O
can O
increase O
the O
match O
speed O
effectively O
. O

In O
the O
end O
, O
a O
test O
and O
analysis O
have O
been O
done O
. O

Two O
different O
kinds O
of O
navigation O
data O
of O
a O
same O
region O
are O
used O
for O
the O
test O
. O

This O
matching O
method O
can O
reach O
satisfactory O
matching O
speed O
and O
efficiency O
. O
