Image O
processing O
and O
pattern O
recognition O
has O
become O
a O
powerful O
technique O
in O
many O
areas O
. O

This O
includes O
Engineering O
, O
Computer O
Science O
, O
Statistics O
, O
Information O
Science O
, O
Physics O
, O
Chemistry O
and O
Medicine O
. O

Anyone O
who O
wants O
to O
extract O
data O
from O
image O
or O
visual O
project O
, O
image O
processing O
is O
required O
. O

Most O
of O
the O
image O
processing O
software O
’s O
are O
able O
to O
process O
two O
dimensional O
images O
alone O
. O

This O
paper O
implements O
three O
basic O
image O
processing O
operations O
namely O
enhancement O
, O
blur O
and O
segmentation O
. O

Each O
of O
the O
operation O
can O
be O
implemented O
using O
a O
variety O
of O
algorithms O
. O

The O
algorithms O
are O
implemented O
using O
and O
their O
performance O
are O
compared O
in O
this O
paper O
. O

The O
proposed O
work O
produces O
better O
result O
of O
3D O
images O
also O
. O

Tnis O
paper O
is O
concernd O
with O
information O
retrieval O
based O
upon O
secondary O
keys O
; O
that O
is O
, O
keys O
which O
can O
not O
in O
general O
uniquely O
identify O
a O
record O
, O

can O

attributes O
of O

associated O
record O
. O

Partial O
- O
match O

deals O
with O
accessing O
and O
reading O
those O
records O
of O
a O
data O
base O
which O
match O
the O
user O
's O
query O

query O
is O
only O

specified O
. O

For O
example O
, O
suppose O
that O
' O
the O
data O
base O
consists O
of O
the O
binary O
words O
1010 O
, O
1110 O
, O
0011 O
, O
1101 O
, O
0010 O
, O
1111 O
. O

The O
response O
to O
query O
1**0 O
where O
is O
a O
do O
n't O
know O
symbol O
is O
the O

of O
records O
with O
keys O
1010 O
or O
1110 O
while O

response O
to O
query O

is O
the O
set O
of O
records O
with O
key O
1101 O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

International O
communication O
and O
multitude O
of O
information O
in O
several O
languages O
require O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
that O
can O
cross O
language O
borders O
. O

Cross O
- O
language O
information O
retrieval O
( O
CLIR O
) O
is O
defined O
as O
the O
retrieval O
of O
documents O
in O
another O
language O
than O
the O
language O
of O
the O
request O
or O
query O
in O
Anurag O
Seetha O
, O
et O
al O

The O
language O
of O
request O
is O
the O
source O
language O
and O
the O
language O
of O
documents O
is O
the O
target O
language O
. O

Among O
several O
approaches O
to O
CLIR O
, O
we O
opted O
for O
the O
method O
of O
translating O
queries O
for O
English O
- O
Hindi O
language O
pair O
based O
on O
a O
bilingual O
dictionary O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
our O
first O
phase O
experiments O
with O
the O
CLIR O
system O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
build O
a O
hybrid O
Web O
- O
based O
metric O
for O
computing O
semantic O
relatedness O
between O
words O
. O

The O
method O
exploits O
page O
counts O
, O
titles O
, O
snippets O
and O
URLs O

returned O
by O
a O
Web O
search O
engine O
. O

Our O
technique O
uses O
traditional O
information O
retrieval O
methods O
and O
is O
enhanced O
by O
page O
- O
count O
- O
based O
similarity O
scores O
which O
are O
integrated O
with O
automatically O
extracted O
lexico O
- O
synantic O
patterns O
from O
titles O
, O
snippets O
and O
URLs O
for O
all O
kinds O
of O
semantically O
related O
words O
provided O
by O
WordNet O
( O
synonyms O
, O
hypernyms O
, O
meronyms O
, O
antonyms O
A O
support O
vector O
machine O
is O
used O
to O
solve O
the O
arising O
regression O
problem O
of O
word O
relatedness O
and O
the O
proposed O
method O
is O
evaluated O
on O
standard O
benchmark O
datasets O
. O

The O
method O
achieves O
an O
overall O
correlation O
of O
0.88 O
, O
which O
is O
the O
highest O
among O
other O
metrics O
up O
to O
date O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
some O
experiments O
which O
use O
meta O
- O
learning O
to O
combine O
families O
of O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
algorithms O
obtained O
by O
varying O
the O
normalizations O
and O
similarity O
functions O
. O

By O
meta O
- O
learning O
, O
we O
mean O
the O
following O
simple O
idea O
: O
a O
family O
of O
IR O
algorithms O
is O
applied O
to O
a O
corpus O
of O
documents O
in O
which O
relevance O
is O
known O
to O
produce O
a O
learning O
set O
. O

A O
machine O
learning O
algorithm O
is O
then O
applied O
to O
this O
data O
set O
to O
produce O
a O
classifier O
which O
combines O
the O
different O
IR O
algorithms O
. O

In O
experiments O
with O
TREC-3 O
data O
, O
we O
could O
significantly O
improve O
precision O
at O
the O
same O
level O
of O
recall O
with O
this O
technique O
. O

Most O
prior O
work O
in O
this O
area O
has O
focused O
on O
combining O
different O
IR O
algorithms O
with O
various O
averaging O
schemes O
or O
has O
used O
a O
fixed O
combining O
function O
. O

The O
combining O
function O
in O
meta O
- O
learning O
is O
a O
statistical O
model O
itself O
which O
in O
general O
depends O
on O
the O
document O
, O
the O
query O
, O
and O
the O
various O
scores O
produced O
by O
the O
different O
component O
IR O
algorithms O
. O

manual O

of O
forum O

and O

Engine O
( O
WISE O
) O
for O

. O

The O
system O

database O

- O

about O
WWW O
resources O
and O
is O
automatically O

, O

. O

The O

to O

for O

, O
and O
to O

about O

. O

to O

nd O

of O

/ O

. O

The O

advanced O

. O

The O

—Locating O
and O
distilling O
the O
valuable O
relevant O
information O
continued O
to O
be O
the O
major O
challenges O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
Systems O
owing O
to O
the O
explosive O
growth O
of O
online O
web O
information O
. O

These O
challenges O
can O
be O
considered O
the O
XML O
Information O
Retrieval O
challenges O
as O
XML O
has O
become O
a O
de O
facto O
standard O
over O
the O
Web O
. O

The O
research O
on O
XML O
IR O
starts O
with O
the O
classical O
IR O
strategies O
customized O
to O
XML O
IR O
. O

Later O
novel O
IR O
strategies O
specific O
to O
XML O
IR O
are O
evolved O
. O

Meanwhile O
literatures O
reveal O
development O
of O
the O
rapid O
and O
intelligent O
IR O
systems O
. O

Despite O
their O
success O
in O
their O
specified O
constrained O
domains O
, O
they O
have O
additional O
limitations O
in O
the O
complex O
information O
space O
. O

The O
effectiveness O
of O
IR O
systems O
is O
thus O
unsolved O
in O
satisfying O
the O
most O
. O

This O
article O
attemptsan O
overview O
of O
earlier O
efforts O
and O
the O
gaps O
in O
XML O
IR O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
increasing O
use O
of O
the O
World O
Wide O
Web O
( O
WWW O
or O
Web O
) O
for O
information O
retrieval O
from O
information O
systems O
has O
raised O
a O
demand O
for O
Web O
to O
database O
interface O
building O
tools O
. O

The O
requirements O
for O
such O
a O
building O
tool O
is O
analysed O
and O
a O
framework O
( O
WebinTool O
) O
for O
rapid O
building O
and O
easy O
maintenance O
of O
Web O
interfaces O
is O
presented O
. O

The O
key O
component O
of O
the O
WebinTool O
is O
an O
interface O
tool O
language O
which O
mainly O
consists O
of O
the O
HTML O
statements O
and O
dedicated O
SQL O
- O
based O
data O
manipulation O
statements O
. O

Using O
this O
language O
, O
a O
variety O
of O
user O
- O
customized O
Web O
interfaces O
can O
be O
created O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
describe O
a O
system O
intended O
to O
help O
report O
writers O
produce O
summaries O
of O
important O
activities O
based O
on O
weekly O
interviews O
with O
members O
of O
a O
project O
. O

A O
key O
element O
of O
this O
system O
is O
to O
learn O
different O
user O
and O
audience O
preferences O
in O
order O
to O
produce O
tailored O
summaries O
. O

The O
system O
learns O
desired O
qualities O
of O
summaries O
based O
on O
observation O
of O
user O
selection O
behavior O
, O
and O
builds O
a O
regression O
- O
based O
model O
using O
item O
features O
as O
parameters O
. O

The O
system O
’s O
assistance O
consists O
of O
presenting O
the O
writer O
with O
a O
successively O
better O
ordered O
list O
of O
items O
from O
which O
to O
choose O
. O

Our O
evaluation O
study O
indicates O
a O
significant O
improvement O
in O
average O
precision O
( O
and O
other O
metrics O
) O
by O
the O
end O
of O
the O
learning O
period O
as O
compared O
to O
baseline O
of O
no O
learning O
. O

We O
also O
describe O
our O
ongoing O
work O
on O
automatic O
feature O
extraction O
to O
make O
this O
approach O
domain O
independent O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Multiple O
objective O
genetic O
algorithms O
( O
MOGA O
) O
are O
heuristics O
that O
have O
seen O
relatively O
little O
use O
in O
geographic O
information O
science O
and O
spatial O
decision O
support O
in O
comparison O
to O
other O
geocomputational O
methods O
, O
despite O
their O
potential O
to O
generate O
robust O
alternative O
options O
for O
decision O
making O
. O

MOGA O
based O
decision O
analysis O
relieves O
the O
burden O
of O
a O
priori O
preference O
specification O
by O
an O
analyst O
, O
but O
the O
resulting O
solution O
set O
is O
potentially O
large O
and O
one O
must O
sift O
through O
many O
feasible O
alternatives O
in O
an O
intelligent O
manner O
. O

Since O
the O
task O
of O
evaluating O
the O
alternatives O
can O
be O
cognitively O
difficult O
there O
is O
a O
need O
for O
visual O
and O
analytic O
approach O
to O
aid O
the O
decision O
option O
selection O
process O
. O

One O
solution O
based O
on O
such O
an O
approach O
and O
proposed O
in O
this O
paper O
is O
the O
integration O
of O
MOGA O
with O
geovisual O
analytic O
tools O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
is O
an O
empirical O
science O
; O
the O
field O
can O
not O
move O
forward O
unless O
there O
are O
means O
of O
evaluating O
the O
innovations O
devised O
by O
researchers O
. O

However O
the O
methodologies O
conceived O
in O
the O
early O
years O
of O
IR O
and O
used O
in O
the O
campaigns O
of O
today O
are O
starting O
to O
show O
their O
age O
and O
new O
research O
is O
emerging O
to O
understand O
how O
to O
overcome O
the O
twin O
challenges O
of O
scale O
and O
diversity O
. O

With O
such O
challenges O
in O
mind O
it O
was O
decided O
to O
hold O
the O
first O
Workshop O
on O
Novel O
Methodologies O
for O
Evaluation O
in O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

The O
workshop O
was O
composed O
of O
two O
invited O
talks O
as O
well O
as O
long O
and O
short O
papers O
covering O
a O
range O
of O
important O
evaluation O
methods O
and O
tools O
. O

The O

was O
chaired O
by O
Mark O
Sanderson O
; O
with O
co O
- O
organization O
from O
Julio O
Gonzalo O
, O
Nicola O

and O
Martin O

. O

User O
modeling O
is O
the O
key O
element O
in O
assisting O
intelligence O
analysts O
to O
meet O
the O
challenge O
of O
gathering O
relevant O
information O
from O
the O
massive O
amounts O
of O
available O
data O
. O

We O
have O
developed O
a O
dynamic O
user O
model O
to O
predict O
the O
analyst O
’s O
intent O
and O
help O
the O
information O
retrieval O
application O
better O
serve O
the O
analyst O
’s O
information O
needs O
. O

In O
order O
to O
justify O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
our O
user O
modeling O
approach O
, O
we O
have O
conducted O
a O
user O
evaluation O
study O
with O
actual O
end O
user O
, O
three O
working O
intelligence O
analysts O
, O
and O
compared O
our O
user O
model O
enhanced O
information O
retrieval O
system O
with O
a O
commercial O
off O
- O
the O
- O
shelf O
system O
, O
the O
Verity O
Query O
Language O
. O

We O
describe O
our O
experimental O
setup O
and O
the O
specific O
metrics O
essential O
to O
evaluate O
user O
modeling O
for O
information O
retrieval O
. O

The O
results O
show O
that O
our O
user O
modeling O
approach O
tracked O
individual O
’s O
interests O
, O
adapted O
to O
their O
individual O
searching O
strategies O
, O
and O
helped O
retrieve O
more O
relevant O
documents O
than O
the O
Verity O
Query O
Language O
system O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
describes O
how O
the O
bootstrap O
approach O
to O
statistics O
can O
be O
applied O
to O
the O
evaluation O
of O
IR O
effectiveness O
metrics O
. O

More O
specifically O
, O
we O
describe O
straightforward O
methods O
for O
comparing O
the O
discriminative O
power O
of O
IR O
metrics O
based O
on O
Bootstrap O
Hypothesis O
Tests O
. O

Unlike O
the O
somewhat O
ad O
hoc O
Swap O
Method O
proposed O
by O
Voorhees O
and O
Buckley O
, O
our O
Bootstrap O
Sensitivity O
Methods O
estimate O
the O
overall O
performance O
difference O
required O
to O
achieve O
a O
given O
confidence O
level O
directly O
from O
Bootstrap O
Hypothesis O
Test O
results O
. O

We O
demonstrate O
the O
usefulness O
of O
our O
methods O
using O
four O
different O
data O
sets O
( O
i.e O
test O
collections O
and O
submitted O
runs O
) O
from O
the O
NTCIR O
CLIR O
track O
series O
for O
comparing O
seven O
IR O
metrics O
, O
including O
those O
that O
can O
handle O
graded O
relevance O
and O
those O
based O
on O
the O
Geometric O
Mean O
. O

We O
also O
show O
that O
the O
Bootstrap O
Sensitivity O
results O
are O
generally O
consistent O
with O
those O
based O
on O
the O
more O
ad O
hoc O
methods O
. O

. O

mainly O

on O

labelling O
and O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Grid O
infrastructures O
are O
in O
operation O
around O
the O
world O
, O
federating O
an O
impressive O
collection O
of O
computational O
resources O
and O
a O
wide O
variety O
of O
application O
software O
. O

In O
this O
context O
, O
it O
is O
important O
to O
establish O
advanced O
software O
discovery O
services O
that O
could O
help O
end O
- O
users O
locate O
software O
components O
suitable O
to O
their O
needs O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
present O
the O
design O
, O
architecture O
and O
implementation O
of O
an O
open O
- O
source O
keyword O
- O
based O
paradigm O
for O
the O
search O
of O
software O
resources O
in O
Grid O
infrastructures O
, O
called O
Minersoft O
. O

A O
key O
goal O
of O
Minersoft O
is O
to O
annotate O
automatically O
all O
the O
software O
resources O
with O
keyword O
- O
rich O
metadata O
. O

Using O
advanced O
Information O
Retrieval O
techniques O
, O
we O
locate O
software O
resources O
with O
respect O
to O
users O
queries O
. O

Experiments O
were O
conducted O
in O
EGEE O
, O
one O
of O
the O
largest O
Grid O
production O
services O
currently O
in O
operation O
. O

Results O
showed O
that O
Minersoft O
successfully O
crawled O
12.3 O
million O
valid O
files O
( O
620 O
GB O
size O
) O
and O
sustained O
, O
in O
most O
sites O
, O
high O
crawling O
rates O
. O

One O
of O
the O
most O
significant O
problems O
which O
inhibits O
further O
developments O
in O
the O
areas O
of O
Knowledge O
Representation O
and O
Artificial O
Intelligence O
is O
a O
problem O
of O
semantic O
alignment O
or O
knowledge O
mapping O
. O

The O
progress O
in O
its O
solution O
will O
be O
greatly O
beneficial O
for O
further O
advances O
of O
information O
retrieval O
, O
ontology O
alignment O
, O

calculation O
, O

, O

language O
processing O
etc O
. O

paper O
the O
concept O
of O
multidimensional O

, O

through O

of O

large O

. O

. O

A O

dialogue O
system O
of O
information O
retrieval O
on O
academic O
documents O
has O
been O
developed O
with O
a O
special O
attention O
to O
reply O
speech O
generation O
. O

In O
order O
to O
realize O
speech O
reply O
with O
its O
prosodic O
features O
properly O
controlled O
to O
express O
dialogue O
focuses O
, O
a O
scheme O
was O
developed O
to O
directly O
generating O
speech O
reply O
from O
reply O
content O
. O

When O
developing O
the O
system O
firstly O
, O
a O
priority O
was O
placed O
on O
the O
automatic O
processing O
, O
and O
prosodic O
focus O
was O
controlled O
by O
rather O
simple O
rules O
( O
original O
rules O
Based O
on O
the O

test O
for O
the O
reply O
speech O
generated O
using O
original O
rules O
, O

rules O
were O
then O
developed O
. O

Through O
the O
further O
listening O
test O
, O
the O
rules O
were O
revised O
and O
called O
the O

rules O
. O

The O

of O

was O

through O
an O

. O

It O
was O
also O
indicated O
that O
there O
existed O
users’ O
preferences O
on O
the O

of O
the O

speech O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
it O
is O
assumed O
that O
a O
user O
interface O
is O
a O
collection O
of O
agents O
that O
assist O
the O
user O
in O
performing O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
tasks O
. O

The O
design O
of O
such O
agents O
requires O
a O
better O
understanding O
of O
IR O
human O
capabilities O
and O
tasks O
. O

User O
queries O
are O
usually O
vague O
and O
incrementally O
refined O
. O

Librarian O
agents O
help O
users O
to O
better O
define O
and O
refine O
their O
queries O
. O

They O
transform O
human O
- O
based O
fuzzy O
queries O
into O
system O
- O
manageable O
queries O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
users O
can O
refine O
queries O
according O
to O
appropriate O
feedback O
. O

A O
first O
attempt O
at O
the O
design O
of O
interface O
agents O
in O
IR O
is O
proposed O
, O
as O
well O
as O
examples O
of O
such O
agents O
. O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Query O
Expansion O
( O
QE O
) O
is O
one O
of O
the O
most O
important O
mechanisms O
in O
the O
Information O
Retrieval O
field O
. O

A O
typical O
short O
Internet O
query O
will O
go O
through O
a O
process O
of O
query O
refinement O
to O
improve O
its O
retrieval O
power O
. O

Most O
of O
the O
existing O
QE O
techniques O
suffer O
from O
retrieval O
performance O
degradation O
due O
to O
imprecise O
choice O
of O
query O

’s O
additive O
terms O
in O
the O
QE O
process O
. O

This O
paper O
, O
introduce O
QE O
mechanism O
involve O
new O
expansion O
process O
that O
guided O
by O
conceptual O
representation O
approach O
using O
Concept O
Mapping O
tool O
for O
expanding O
the O
original O
query O
, O
in O
the O
context O
of O
the O
utilized O
corpus O
. O

Experimental O
results O
, O
using O
the O
MEDLINE O
test O
collection O
data O
, O
show O
the O
effect O
of O
using O
conceptual O
representation O
approach O
via O
linguistic O
and O
domain O
based O
on O
the O
recall O
of O
retrieval O
results O
to O
enhance O
its O
performance O
. O

Index O
Term— O
Concept O
Mapping O
, O
Information O
Retrieval O
, O
Query O
Expansion O
, O
Relevance O
Feedback O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

GorUp O
is O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
system O
that O
provides O
information O
about O
the O
contents O
of O
audio O
broadcast O
news O
in O
Basque O
, O
Spanish O
, O
and O
French O
. O

Since O
the O
resources O
available O
for O
Basque O
in O
general O
, O
and O
for O
this O
task O
in O
particular O
, O
were O
very O
few O
, O
data O
optimization O
methodologies O
had O
to O
be O
applied O
in O
various O
phases O
of O
the O
development O
. O

Moreover O
, O
the O
agglutinative O
nature O
of O
Basque O
required O
the O
use O
of O
morphemes O
and O
other O
sub O
- O
word O
units O
. O

Additionally O
, O
some O
keyword O
spotting O
and O
semantic O
methods O
have O
been O
also O
applied O
in O
the O
system O
in O
order O
to O
retrieve O
information O
properly O
. O

In O
most O
of O
the O
cases O
, O
the O
methods O
employed O
during O
this O
project O
could O
suit O
the O
requirements O
of O
many O
under O
- O
resourced O
languages O
, O
and O
one O
of O
these O
techniques O
could O
be O
the O
ontology O
- O
based O
approach O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
the O
system O
in O
general O
for O
Basque O
and O
emphasizes O
the O
techniques O
employed O
in O
order O
to O
enhance O
the O
system O
using O
a O
semantic O
ontology O
. O

, O

. O

to O

domain O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

We O
study O
a O
new O
task O
, O
proactive O
information O
retrieval O
by O
combining O
implicit O
relevance O
feedback O
and O
collaborative O
filtering O
. O

We O
have O
constructed O
a O
controlled O
experimental O
setting O
, O
a O
prototype O
application O
, O
in O
which O
the O
users O
try O
to O
find O
interesting O
scientific O
articles O
by O
browsing O
their O
titles O
. O

Implicit O
feedback O
is O
inferred O
from O
eye O
movement O
signals O
, O
with O
discriminative O
hidden O
Markov O
models O
estimated O
from O
existing O
data O
in O
which O
explicit O
relevance O
feedback O
is O
available O
. O

Collaborative O
filtering O
is O
carried O
out O
using O
the O
User O
Rating O
Profile O
model O
, O
a O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
probabilistic O
latent O
variable O
model O
, O
computed O
using O
Markov O
Chain O
Monte O
Carlo O
techniques O
. O

For O
new O
document O
titles O
the O
prediction O
accuracy O
with O
eye O
movements O
, O
collaborative O
filtering O
, O
and O
their O
combination O
was O
significantly O
better O
than O
by O
chance O
. O

The O
best O
prediction O
accuracy O
still O
leaves O
room O
for O
improvement O
but O
shows O
that O
proactive O
information O
retrieval O
and O
combination O
of O
many O
sources O
of O
relevance O
feedback O
is O
feasible O
. O

We O
present O
an O
approach O
to O
using O
ontologies O
as O
interlingua O
in O
cross O
- O
language O
information O
retrieval O
in O
the O
medical O
domain O
. O

Our O
approach O
is O
based O
on O
using O
the O
Unified O
Medical O
Language O
System O
( O
UMLS O
) O
as O
the O
primary O
ontology O
. O

Documents O
and O
queries O
are O
annotated O
with O
multiple O
layers O
of O
linguistic O
information O
( O
part O
- O
of O
- O
speech O
tags O
, O
lemmas O
, O
phrase O
chunks O
Based O
on O
this O
we O
identify O
medical O
terms O
and O
semantic O
relations O
between O
them O
and O
map O
them O
to O
their O
position O
in O
the O
ontology O
. O

The O
paper O
describes O
experiments O
in O
monolingual O
and O
cross O
- O
language O
document O
retrieval O
, O
performed O
on O
a O
corpus O
of O
medical O
abstracts O
. O

Results O
show O
that O
semantic O
information O
, O
specifically O
the O
combined O
use O
of O
concepts O
and O
relations O
, O
increases O
the O
precision O
in O
monolingual O
retrieval O
. O

In O
cross O
- O
language O
retrieval O
the O
semantic O
annotation O
outperforms O
machine O
translation O
of O
the O
queries O
, O
but O
the O
best O
results O
are O
achieved O
by O
combining O
a O
similarity O
thesaurus O
with O
the O
semantic O
codes O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Learning O
to O
rank O
is O
becoming O
more O
and O
more O
popular O
in O
machine O
learning O
and O
information O
retrieval O
field O
. O

However O
, O
like O
many O
other O
supervised O
approaches O
, O
one O
of O
the O
main O
problems O
with O
learning O
to O
rank O
is O
lack O
of O
labeled O
data O
. O

Recently O
, O
there O
have O
been O
attempts O
to O
address O
the O
challenges O
in O
active O
sampling O
for O
learning O
to O
rank O
. O

But O
none O
of O
these O
methods O
take O
into O
consideration O
the O
differences O
between O
queries O
In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
novel O
active O
ranking O
framework O
on O
query O
- O
level O
which O
aims O
to O
employ O
different O
ranking O
models O
for O
different O
queries O
. O

Then O
, O
we O
used O
Rank O
SVM O
as O
a O
base O
ranker O
, O
realized O
a O
query O
- O
level O
active O
ranking O
algorithm O
and O
applied O
it O
to O
document O
retrieval O
. O

Experimental O
results O
on O
real O
- O
world O
data O
set O
show O
that O
our O
approach O
can O
reduce O
the O
labeling O
cost O
greatly O
without O
decreasing O
the O
ranking O
accuracy O
. O

various O

for O

. O

to O

content O

, O
and O

use O
of O

know O
- O
how O
obtained O
from O
machine O
- O
readable O
dictionaries O
and O
from O
specially O
constructed O
knowledge O
bases O
. O

A O
particular O

analysis O
methodology O
is O
also O
outlined O
and O
its O
usefulness O
for O
the O

of O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
study O
the O
impact O
of O
introducing O
syntax O
information O
into O
a O
stochastic O
component O
for O
natural O
language O
understanding O
that O
is O
based O
on O
a O
purely O
semantic O
case O
grammar O
formalism O
. O

The O
parser O
operates O
in O
an O
application O
for O
train O
travel O
information O
retrieval O
, O
the O
French O
ARISE O
( O
Automatic O
Railway O
Information O
Systems O
for O
Europe O
) O
task O
. O

This O
application O
supports O
the O
development O
of O
schedule O
inquiry O
services O
by O
telephone O
. O

The O
semantic O
case O
grammar O
has O
been O
chosen O
in O
order O
to O
enhance O
robustness O
facing O
spontaneous O
speech O
effects O
. O

However O
, O
this O
robustness O
is O
likely O
to O
turn O
into O
a O
drawback O
, O
if O
the O
semantic O
analysis O
ignores O
information O
that O
is O
propagated O
by O

relations O
. O

Introducing O
additional O
syntax O
information O
, O
whose O
complexity O
is O
well O
adapted O
to O
the O
size O
of O
the O
stochastic O
model O
, O
may O
disambiguate O
and O
therefore O
improve O
the O
decoding O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

High O
precision O
at O
the O
top O
ranks O
has O
become O
a O
new O
focus O
of O
research O
in O
information O
retrieval O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
the O
multiple O
nested O
ranker O
approach O
that O
improves O
the O
accuracy O
at O
the O
top O
ranks O
by O
iteratively O
re O
- O
ranking O
the O
top O
scoring O
documents O
. O

At O
each O
iteration O
, O
this O
approach O
uses O
the O
RankNet O
learning O
algorithm O
to O
re O
- O
rank O
a O
subset O
of O
the O
results O
. O

This O
splits O
the O
problem O
into O
smaller O
and O
easier O
tasks O
and O
generates O
a O
new O
distribution O
of O
the O
results O
to O
be O
learned O
by O
the O
algorithm O
. O

We O
evaluate O
this O
approach O
using O
different O
settings O
on O
a O
data O
set O
labeled O
with O
several O
degrees O
of O
relevance O
. O

We O
use O
the O
normalized O
discounted O
cumulative O
gain O
( O
NDCG O
) O
to O
measure O
the O
performance O
because O
it O
depends O
not O
only O
on O
the O
position O
but O
also O
on O
the O
relevance O
score O
of O
the O
document O
in O
the O
ranked O
list O
. O

Our O
experiments O
show O
that O
making O
the O
learning O
algorithm O
concentrate O
on O
the O
top O
scoring O
results O
improves O
precision O
at O
the O
top O
ten O
documents O
in O
terms O
of O
the O
NDCG O
score O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
major O
limitation O
of O
most O
existing O
retrieval O
models O
and O
systems O
is O
that O
the O
retrieval O
decision O
is O
made O
based O
solely O
on O
the O
query O
and O
document O
collection O
; O
information O
about O
the O
actual O
user O
and O
search O
context O
is O
largely O
ignored O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
study O
how O
to O
exploit O
implicit O
feedback O
information O
, O
including O
previous O
queries O
and O
clickthrough O
information O
, O
to O
improve O
retrieval O
accuracy O
in O
an O
interactive O
information O
retrieval O
setting O
. O

We O
propose O
several O
context O
- O
sensitive O
retrieval O
algorithms O
based O
on O
statistical O
language O
models O
to O
combine O
the O
preceding O
queries O
and O
clicked O
document O
summaries O
with O
the O
current O
query O
for O
better O
ranking O
of O
documents O
. O

We O
use O
the O
TREC O
AP O
data O
to O
create O
a O
test O
collection O
with O
search O
context O
information O
, O
and O
quantitatively O
evaluate O
our O
models O
using O
this O
test O
set O
. O

Experiment O
results O
show O
that O
using O
implicit O
feedback O
, O
especially O
the O
clicked O
document O
summaries O
, O
can O
improve O
retrieval O
performance O
substantially O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Formal O
concept O
analysis O
( O
FCA O
) O
is O
an O
effective O
tool O
for O
data O
analysis O
and O
knowledge O
discovery O
. O

Concept O
lattice O
, O
which O
is O
derived O
from O
mathematical O
order O
theory O
and O
lattice O
theory O
, O
is O
the O
core O
of O
FCA O
. O

Many O
research O
works O
of O
various O
areas O
show O
that O
concept O
lattices O
structures O
is O
an O
effective O
platform O
for O
data O
mining O
, O
machine O
learning O
, O
information O
retrieval O
, O
software O
engineer O
, O
etc O
. O

This O
paper O
offers O
a O
brief O
overview O
of O
FCA O
and O
proposes O
to O
apply O
FCA O
as O
a O
tool O
for O
analysis O
and O
visualization O
of O
data O
in O
digital O
ecosystem O
, O
and O
also O
discusses O
the O
applications O
of O
data O
mining O
for O
digital O
ecosystem O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
the O
most O
recent O
version O
of O
the O
system O
developed O
by O

SCHEMA O
NoE O
, O
termed O
SCHEMA O
Reference O
System O
, O
is O
presented O
. O

The O
Reference O
System O
adopts O
a O
module O
- O
based O
, O
expandable O
architecture O
, O
with O
well O
defined O
interfaces O
between O
different O
modules O
, O
facilitating O
the O
ongoing O
expansion O
of O
the O
system O
based O
on O
researchers’ O
contributions O
. O

The O
proposed O
system O
employs O
the O
MPEG-7 O
XM O
( O
MPEG-7 O
eXperimentation O
Model O
) O
along O
with O
extensions O
developed O
specifically O
for O
the O
system O
to O
improve O
functionality O
and O
efficiency O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
the O
system O
supports O
high O
level O
descriptors O
and O
content O
- O
based O
indexing O
and O
retrieval O
using O
other O
modalities O
( O
e.g. O
pre O
- O
existing O
keyword O
annotations O
, O
text O
generated O
via O
automatic O
speech O
recognition O
( O
ASR O

2004 O
test O
corpus O

for O

and O

of O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
study O
presents O
an O
N O
- O
gram O
adaptation O
technique O
when O
additional O
text O
data O
for O
the O
adaptation O
do O
not O
exist O
. O

We O
use O
a O
language O
modeling O
approach O
to O
the O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
technique O
to O
collect O
the O
appropriate O
adaptation O
corpus O
from O
baseline O
text O
data O
. O

We O
propose O
to O
use O
a O
dynamic O
interpolation O
coefficient O
to O
merge O
the O
N O
- O
gram O
, O
where O
the O
interpolation O
coefficient O
is O
estimated O
from O
the O
word O
hypotheses O
obtained O
by O
segmenting O
the O
input O
speech O
. O

results O
show O
that O
the O
proposed O

N O
- O
gram O
always O
has O
better O
performance O
than O
the O
background O
Ngram O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
is O
concerned O
with O
documents O
relevant O
to O
a O
user O
’s O
information O
needs O
from O
a O
collection O
of O
documents O
. O

The O
user O
describes O
information O
needs O
with O
a O
query O
which O
consists O
of O
a O
number O
of O
words O
. O

Finding O
weight O
of O
a O
query O
is O
important O
to O
determine O
importance O
of O
a O
query O
. O

Calculating O
term O
importance O
is O
fundamental O
aspect O
of O
most O
information O
retrieval O
approaches O
and O
it O
is O
commonly O
determined O
through O
Term O
FrequencyInverse O
Document O
Frequency O
( O
TF O
- O
IDF O

This O
paper O
proposed O
Concept O
- O
based O
Term O
Weighting O
( O
CBW O
) O
technique O
to O
determine O
the O
term O
importance O
by O
finding O
the O
weight O
of O
a O
query O
. O

WordNet O
ontology O
is O
used O
to O
find O
the O
conceptual O
information O
of O
each O
word O
in O
the O
query O
. O

General O
Terms O
Term O
frequency O

( O
TF O
Inverse O
Document O
Frequency O
( O
IDF O
Vector O
Space O
Model O
, O
Extraction O
Algorithm O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

—Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
is O
concerned O
with O
searching O
and O
retrieving O
information O
within O
the O
documents O
and O
also O
searching O
the O
online O
databases O
and O
internet O
. O

Genetic O
Algorithms O
( O
GA O
) O
are O
robust O
and O
efficient O
search O
and O
optimization O
techniques O
inspired O
by O
the O
Darwin O
's O

Ontology O
is O

of O
a O

domain O
being O

. O

. O

I O
review O
and O
expand O
the O
model O
of O
quantum O
associative O
memory O
that O
I O
have O
recently O
proposed O
. O

In O
this O
model O
binary O
patterns O
of O
n O
bits O
are O
stored O
in O
the O
quantum O
superposition O
of O
the O
appropriate O
subset O
of O
the O
computational O
basis O
of O
n O
qbits O
. O

Information O
can O
be O
retrieved O
by O
performing O
an O
inputdependent O
rotation O
of O
the O
memory O
quantum O
state O
within O
this O
subset O
and O
measuring O
the O
resulting O
state O
. O

The O
amplitudes O
of O
this O
rotated O
memory O
state O
are O
peaked O
on O
those O
stored O
patterns O
which O
are O
closest O
in O
Hamming O
distance O
to O
the O
input O
, O
resulting O
in O
a O
high O
probability O
of O
measuring O
a O
memory O
pattern O
very O
similar O
to O
it O
. O

The O
accuracy O
of O
pattern O
recall O
can O
be O
tuned O
by O
adjusting O
a O
parameter O
playing O
the O
role O
of O
an O
effective O
temperature O
. O

This O
model O
solves O
the O
well O
- O
known O
capacity O
shortage O
problem O
of O
classical O
associative O
memories O
, O
providing O
an O
exponential O
improvement O
in O
capacity O
. O

The O
price O
to O
pay O
is O
the O
probabilistic O
nature O
of O
information O
retrieval O
, O
a O
feature O
that O
, O
however O
, O
this O
model O
shares O
with O
our O
own O
brain O
. O

- O
document O

in O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O

The O
objectives O
of O

experiments O
described O
are O
to O

the O

of O

. O

are O

of O

, O

may O

with O

. O

Many O
approaches O
to O

. O

( O

) O
system O
is O

. O

- O

CLIR O

The O
contemporary O
scenario O
predominated O
by O
information O
and O
knowledge O
perspectives O
indicate O
the O
pressing O
need O
to O
educate O
and O
train O
the O
library O
and O
information O
manpower O
towards O
a O
sustainable O
professional O
competence O
. O

The O
manpower O
of O
today O
will O
meet O
in O
the O
near O
future O
the O
new O
challenges O
and O
the O
onslaught O
of O
the O
impact O
of O
Information O
Technology O
on O
LIS O
envisages O
to O
make O
substantial O
contribution O
to O
the O
ever O
perpetuating O
Information O
Society O
. O

They O
need O
to O
be O
equipped O
in O
this O
context O
with O
necessary O
skills O
and O

to O
satisfy O
the O

level O
, O

and O
evergrowing O
multifarious O

of O
the O
user O
. O

of O

in O
the O

for O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Just O
- O
In O
- O
Time O
Information O
Retrieval O
agents O
proactively O
retrieve O
information O
based O
on O
queries O
that O
are O
implicit O
in O

from O
, O
the O
user O
’s O
current O
context O
, O
such O
as O
the O
blogpost O
she O
is O
writing O
. O

This O
paper O
compares O
five O
heuristics O
by O
which O
queries O
can O
be O
extracted O
from O
a O
user O

’s O
blogpost O
or O
other O
document O
. O

Four O
of O
the O
heuristics O
use O
shallow O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
techniques O
, O
such O
as O
tagging O
and O
chunking O
. O

An O
experimental O
evaluation O
reveals O
that O
most O
of O
them O
perform O
as O
well O
as O
a O
heuristic O
based O
on O
term O
weighting O
. O

In O
particular O
, O
extracting O
noun O
phrases O
after O
chunking O
is O
one O
of O
the O
more O
successful O
heuristics O
and O
can O
have O
lower O
costs O
than O
term O
weighting O
. O

In O
a O
trial O
with O
real O
users O
, O
we O
find O
that O
relevant O
results O
have O
higher O
rank O
when O
we O
use O
implicit O
queries O
produced O
by O
this O
chunking O
heuristic O
than O
when O
we O
use O
explicit O
user O
- O
formulated O
queries O
. O

A O

effect O

( O
DNNs O

. O

Our O

without O

multi O
- O

aspect O
by O
up O
to O
8.8 O
% O
in O
terms O
of O
mean O
average O
precision O
. O

Histogram O
of O

Displacements O
( O

displacement O
in O

votes O
with O
its O

in O

of O

. O

are O

of O
their O
three O

. O

is O
fixedlength O
, O

- O

and O

- O
invariant O
. O

- O
ofthe O
- O

- O

- O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
will O
present O
a O
system O
that O
is O

to O
perform O

information O
retrieval O
actions O
over O
a O
text O
knowledge O
base O
. O

The O
knowledge O
base O
is O
composed O
by O
four O
levels O
: O
Interaction O
, O
Domain O
, O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
Text O
. O

The O
interaction O
level O
is O
responsible O
for O
the O
dialogue O
management O
, O
including O
the O
inference O
of O
attitudes O
. O

The O
domain O
level O
is O
composed O
by O
rules O
encoding O
knowledge O
about O
the O
text O
domain O
. O

The O
information O
retrieval O
level O
includes O
knowledge O
about O
IR O
actions O
over O
sets O
of O
documents O
. O

The O
text O
level O
has O
knowledge O
about O
the O
words O
in O
each O
text O
. O

Cooperation O
is O
achieved O
through O
two O
main O
strategies O
: O
1 O
) O
clustering O
the O
answer O
sets O
of O
documents O
accordingly O
with O
the O
domain O
and O
IR O
- O
level O
knowledge O
; O
2 O
) O
keeping O
the O
context O
of O
the O
interaction O
and O
inferring O
the O
user O
intentions O
. O

Query O
translation O
is O
an O
important O
task O
in O
cross O
- O
language O
information O
retrieval O
( O
CLIR O
) O
aiming O
to O
translate O
queries O
into O
languages O
used O
in O
documents O
. O

The O
purpose O
of O
this O
paper O
is O
to O
investigate O
the O
necessity O
of O
translating O
query O
terms O
, O
which O
might O
differ O
from O
one O
term O
to O
another O
. O

Some O
untranslated O
terms O
cause O
irreparable O
performance O
drop O
while O
others O
do O
not O
. O

We O
propose O
an O
approach O
to O
estimate O
the O
translation O
probability O
of O
a O
query O
term O
, O
which O
helps O
decide O
if O
it O
should O
be O
translated O
or O
not O
. O

The O
approach O
learns O
regression O
and O
classification O
models O
based O
on O
a O
rich O
set O
of O
linguistic O
and O
statistical O
properties O
of O
the O
term O
. O

Experiments O
on O
NTCIR-4 O
and O
NTCIR-5 O
English O
- O
Chinese O
CLIR O
tasks O
demonstrate O
that O
the O
proposed O
approach O
can O
significantly O
improve O
CLIR O
performance O
. O

An O
in O
- O
depth O
analysis O
is O
also O
provided O
for O
discussing O
the O
impact O
of O
untranslated O
out O
- O
of O
- O
vocabulary O
( O
OOV O
) O
query O
terms O
and O
translation O
quality O
of O
non O
- O
OOV O
query O
terms O
on O
CLIR O
performance O
. O

I O

( O

) O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Two O
widely O
used O
criteria O
for O
evaluating O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
are O
, O
respectively O
, O
the O
recall O
and O
the O
precision O
. O

Since O
the O
determination O
of O
these O
measures O
is O
dependent O
on O
a O
distinction O
between O
documents O
which O
are O
relevant O
on O
the O
one O
hand O
, O
and O
documents O
which O
are O
not O
relevant O
on O
the O
other O
to O
a O
given O
query O
set O
, O
it O
has O
sometimes O
been O
claimed O
that O
an O
accurate O
, O
generally O
valid O
evaluation O
can O
not O
be O
based O
on O
recall O
and O
precision O
. O

A O
study O
was O
made O
to O
determine O
the O
effect O
of O
variations O
in O
relevance O
assessments O
on O
the O
average O
recall O
and O
precision O
values O
used O
to O
measure O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
. O

Using O
a O
collection O
of O
1200 O
documents O
in O
information O
science O
for O
test O
purposes O
, O
it O
is O
found O
that O
large O
scale O
differences O
in O
the O
relevance O
assessments O
do O
not O
produce O
significant O
variations O
in O
average O
recall O
and O
precision O
. O

It O
thus O
appears O
that O
properly O
computed O
recall O
and O
precision O
data O
may O
represent O
effectiveness O
indicators O
which O
are O
generally O
valid O
for O
many O
distinct O
user O
classes O
. O

of O

. O

to O

. O

However O
, O

of O

, O

. O

, O
on O
the O

, O

, O

the O

of O

. O

that O

, O

. O

- O
to O
- O

Searching O
& O
amp O
; O

data O

lot O
many O
options O
& O
amp O

choice O
to O

task O

. O

We O

, O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
new O
approach O
to O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
based O
on O
run O
- O
time O
selection O
of O
the O
best O
set O
of O
techniques O
to O
respond O
to O
a O
given O
query O
. O

A O
technique O
is O
selected O
based O
on O
its O
projected O
effectiveness O
with O
respect O
to O
the O
specific O
query O
, O
the O
load O
on O
the O
system O
, O
and O
a O
time O
- O
dependent O
utility O
function O
. O

The O
paper O
examines O
two O
fundamental O
questions O
1 O
) O
can O
the O
selection O
of O
the O
best O
IR O
techniques O
be O
performed O
at O
run O
- O
time O
with O
minimal O
computational O
overhead O
? O

and O
( O
2 O
) O
is O
it O
possible O
to O
construct O
a O
reliable O
probabilistic O
model O
of O
the O
performance O
of O
an O
IR O
technique O
that O
is O
conditioned O
on O
the O
characteristics O
of O
the O
query O
? O

We O
show O
that O
both O
of O
these O
questions O
can O
be O
answered O
positively O
. O

These O
results O
suggest O
a O
new O
system O
design O
that O
carries O
a O
great O
potential O
to O
improve O
the O
quality O
of O
service O
of O
future O
IR O
systems O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
is O
characterized O
as O
the O
basic O
notion O
of O
informatics O
( O
information O
science O
Different O
views O
of O
the O
nature O
of O
information O
are O
presented O
. O

An O
analysis O
of O
information O
definitions O
, O
including O
the O
Stanford O
definition O
, O
is O
given O
. O

On O
the O
basis O
of O
analyzing O
and O
generalizing O
the O
presented O
definitions O
the O
authors O
present O
their O
own O
definition O
of O
information O
. O

Information O
is O
studied O
as O
a O
sign O
using O
the O
concept O
of O
the O
semiotic O
triangle O
. O

The O
problem O
of O
the O
existence O
of O
information O
in O
animate O
and O
inanimate O
nature O
is O
considered O
and O
concrete O
examples O
of O
this O
view O
are O
given O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

There O
are O
enormous O
amounts O
of O
information O
widely O
available O
in O
the O
Intranets O
. O

This O
information O
is O
only O
useful O
if O
data O
can O
be O
retrieved O
in O
an O
accurate O
and O
timely O
manner O
. O

Currently O
, O
Intranet O
search O
engine O
has O
become O
a O
necessity O
due O
to O
lack O
of O
an O
efficient O
way O
to O
disseminate O
useful O
information O
to O
its O
members O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
examine O
the O
importance O
of O
Intranet O
search O
engines O
and O
propose O
D’Galaxy O
as O
the O
search O
engine O
in O
Multimedia O
University O

This O
intranet O
search O
engine O
will O
be O
of O
content O
- O
based O
using O
the O
full O
- O
text O
indexing O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Building O
on O
a O
notion O
of O
keys O
for O
XML O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
novel O
indexing O
scheme O
for O
hierarchical O
data O
that O
is O
based O
not O
only O
on O
the O
structure O
but O
also O
the O
content O
of O
the O
data O
. O

The O
index O
can O
be O
used O
to O
check O
the O
validity O
of O
data O
with O
respect O
to O
a O
set O
of O
key O
specifications O
, O
as O
well O
as O
for O
efficiently O
evaluating O
queries O
and O
updates O
on O
key O
paths O
. O

We O
develop O
algorithms O
for O
the O
construction O
and O
incremental O
maintenance O
of O
the O
indexing O
structure O
, O
and O
study O
the O
complexity O
of O
these O
algorithms O
. O

Finally O
, O
we O
discuss O
how O
our O
indexing O
techniques O
can O
be O
used O
for O
more O
general O
queries O
involving O
key O
paths O
. O

Comments O

of O
Pennsylvania O
Department O
of O

and O

. O

- O
30 O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

MuTaTeD'II O
started O
in O
November O
1999 O
, O
building O
on O
the O
results O
of O
the O
MuTaTeD O
project O
. O

Its O
aim O
is O
to O
design O
and O
implement O
a O
music O
information O
retrieval O
system O
with O
delivery O
/ O
access O
services O
for O
encoded O
music O
. O

The O
prototype O
service O
will O
provide O
a O
user O
friendly O
, O
web O
- O
based O
search O
/ O
browse O
/ O
query O
interface O
to O
access O
musical O
content O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Hierarchic O
document O
clustering O
has O
been O
widely O
applied O
to O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
on O
the O
grounds O
of O
its O
potential O
improved O
effectiveness O
over O
inverted O
file O
search O
. O

However O
, O
previous O
research O
has O
been O
inconclusive O
as O
to O
whether O
clustering O
does O
bring O
improvements O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
take O
the O
view O
that O
if O
hierarchic O
clustering O
is O
applied O
to O
search O
results O
( O
query O
- O
specific O
clustering O
then O
it O
has O
the O
potential O
to O
increase O
the O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
compared O
both O
to O
that O
of O
static O
clustering O
and O
of O
conventional O
inverted O
file O
search O
. O

We O
conducted O
a O
number O
of O
experiments O
using O
five O
document O
collections O
and O
four O
hierarchic O
clustering O
methods O
. O

Our O
results O
show O
that O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
query O
- O
specific O
clustering O
is O
indeed O
higher O
, O
and O
suggest O
that O
there O
is O
scope O
for O
its O
application O
to O
IR O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
aim O
of O
the O
AnHitz O
project O
, O
whose O
participants O
are O
research O
groups O
with O
very O
different O
backgrounds O
, O
is O
to O
carry O
out O
research O
on O
language O
, O
speech O
and O
visual O
technologies O
for O
Basque O
. O

Several O
resources O
, O
tools O
and O
applications O
have O
been O
developed O
in O
AnHitz O
, O
but O
we O
have O
also O
integrated O
many O
of O
these O
into O
a O
prototype O
of O
a O
3D O
virtual O
expert O
on O
science O
and O
technology O
. O

It O
includes O
Question O
Answering O
and O
Cross O
Lingual O
Information O
Retrieval O
systems O
in O
those O
areas O
. O

The O
interaction O
with O
the O
system O
is O
carried O
out O
in O
Basque O
( O
the O
results O
of O
the O
CLIR O
module O
that O
are O
not O
in O
Basque O
are O
translated O
through O
Machine O

) O
and O
is O
speech O
- O
based O
( O
using O
Speech O
Synthesis O
and O
Automatic O
Speech O
Recognition O

The O
prototype O
has O
received O
ample O
media O
coverage O
and O
has O
been O
greatly O
welcomed O
by O
Basque O
society O
. O

The O
system O
has O
been O
evaluated O
by O
50 O
users O
who O
have O
completed O
a O
total O
of O
300 O
tests O
, O
showing O
good O
performance O
and O
acceptance O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

For O
the O
TREC O
2009 O
, O
we O
exhaustively O
classified O
every O
document O
in O
each O
corpus O
, O
using O
machine O
learning O
methods O
that O
had O
previously O
been O
shown O
to O
work O
well O
for O
email O
spam O
[ O
9 O
, O
3 O
We O
treated O
each O
document O
as O
a O
sequence O
of O
bytes O
, O
with O
no O
tokenization O
or O
parsing O
of O
tags O
or O
meta O
- O
information O
. O

This O
approach O
was O
used O
exclusively O
for O
the O
adhoc O
web O
, O
diversity O
and O
relevance O
feedback O
tasks O
, O
as O
well O
as O
to O
the O
batch O
legal O
task O
: O
the O
ClueWeb09 O
and O
Tobacco O
collections O
were O
processed O
end O
- O
to O
- O
end O
and O
never O
indexed O
. O

We O
did O
the O
interactive O
legal O
task O
in O
two O
phases O
: O
first O
, O
we O
used O
interactive O
search O
and O
judging O
to O
find O
a O
large O
and O
diverse O
set O
of O
training O
examples O
; O
then O
we O
used O
active O
learning O
process O
, O
similar O
to O
what O
we O
used O
for O
the O
other O
tasks O
, O
to O
find O
find O
more O
relevant O
documents O
. O

Finally O
, O
we O
fitted O
a O
censored O
( O
i.e. O
truncated O
) O
mixed O
normal O
distribution O
to O
estimate O
recall O
and O
the O
cutoff O
to O
optimize O
F1 O
, O
the O
principal O
effectiveness O
measure O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Querying O
for O
information O
is O
a O
commonality O
between O
databases O
and O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
. O

For O
both O
areas O
, O
there O
are O
a O
variety O
of O
issues O
relative O
to O
representation O
of O
uncertainty O
and O
its O
retrieval O
. O

This O
paper O
reviews O
these O
issues O
for O
both O
types O
of O
systems O
and O
discusses O
potential O
future O
directions O
1997 O
Elsevier O
Science O
B.V. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
describe O
indexing O
and O
retrieval O
techniques O
that O
are O
suited O
to O
perform O
terabyte O
- O
scale O
information O
retrieval O
tasks O
on O
a O
standard O
desktop O
PC O
. O

Starting O
from O
an O
Okapi O
- O
BM25-based O
default O
baseline O
retrieval O
function O
, O
we O
explore O
both O
sides O
of O
the O
effectiveness O
spectrum O
. O

On O
one O
side O
, O
we O
show O
how O
term O
proximity O
can O
be O
integrated O
into O
the O
scoring O
function O
in O
order O
to O
improve O
the O
search O
results O
. O

On O
the O
other O
side O
, O
we O
show O
how O
index O
pruning O
can O
be O
employed O
to O
increase O
retrieval O
efficiency O
at O
the O
cost O
of O
reduced O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
. O

We O
show O
that O
, O
although O
index O
pruning O
can O
harm O
the O
quality O
of O
the O
search O
results O
considerably O
, O
according O
to O
standard O
evaluation O
measures O
, O
the O
actual O
loss O
of O
precision O
, O
according O
to O
other O
measures O
that O
are O
more O
realistic O
for O
the O
given O
task O
, O
is O
rather O
small O
and O
is O
in O
most O
cases O
outweighed O
by O
the O
immense O
efficiency O
gains O
that O
come O
along O
with O
it O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

With O
the O
explosion O
of O
on O
- O
line O
non O
- O
English O
documents O
, O
cross O
language O
information O
retrieval O
( O
CLIR O
) O
systems O
have O
become O
increasingly O
important O
in O
recent O
years O
. O

Moreover O
, O
roles O
of O
individual O
entities O
in O
an O
information O
retrieval O
system O
, O
specially O
a O
cross O
language O
one O
, O
can O
be O
implemented O
as O
distinct O
agents O
. O

Many O
methodologies O
for O
modeling O
the O
multi O
- O
agent O
system O
have O
been O
proposed O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
use O
Tropos O
methodology O
for O
modeling O
a O
Cross O
Language O
Information O
Retrieval O
System O
. O

The O
methodology O
leads O
in O
defining O
four O
different O
classes O
of O
agents O
: O
Personal O
- O
Agent O
, O
User O
- O
Agent O
, O
Translator O
, O
and O
Retrieval O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
evaluation O
based O
on O
the O
pooling O
method O
is O
inherently O
biased O
against O
systems O
that O
did O
not O
contribute O
to O
the O
pool O
of O
judged O
documents O
. O

This O
may O
distort O
the O
results O
obtained O
about O
the O
relative O
quality O
of O
the O
systems O
evaluated O
and O
thus O
lead O
to O
incorrect O
conclusions O
about O
the O
performance O
of O
a O
particular O
ranking O
technique O
We O
examine O
the O
magnitude O
of O
this O
effect O
and O
explore O
how O
it O
can O
be O
countered O
by O
automatically O
building O
an O
unbiased O
set O
of O
judgements O
from O
the O
original O
, O
biased O
judgements O
obtained O
through O
pooling O
. O

We O
compare O
the O
performance O
of O
this O
method O
with O
other O
approaches O
to O
the O
problem O
of O
incomplete O
judgements O
, O
such O
as O
bpref O
, O
and O
show O
that O
the O
proposed O
method O
leads O
to O
higher O
evaluation O
accuracy O
, O
especially O
if O
the O
set O
of O
manual O
judgements O
is O
rich O
in O
documents O
, O
but O
highly O
biased O
against O
some O
systems O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
second O
workshop O
on O
Gamification O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O
took O
place O
at O
ECIR O
2015 O
in O
Vienna O
, O
Austria O
on O
the O
29th O
of O
March O
. O

The O
workshop O
program O
included O
two O
invited O
keynote O
presentations O
, O
seven O
oral O
presentations O
of O
refereed O
papers O
, O
lots O
of O
mini O
discussion O
sessions O
and O
a O
fishbowl O
session O
. O

The O
presentations O
covered O
diverse O
topics O
from O
playing O
around O
with O
an O
eye O
tracker O
to O
a O
game O
with O
IR O
papers O
and O
even O
a O
game O
of O
scientific O
hangman O
, O
generating O
lively O
and O
fun O
discussions O
. O

The O
workshop O
was O
a O
crowdpinion O
experiment O
itself O
, O
gathering O
participants’ O
momentary O
opinions O
via O
an O
Android O
app O
. O

One O
of O
the O
main O
themes O
of O
the O
day O
was O
the O
interplay O
of O
gamification O
aspects O
and O
incentives O
, O
where O
the O
key O
challenge O
is O
to O
align O
player O
motivations O
with O
the O
goal O
of O
the O
task O
. O

Any O
misalignment O
may O
lead O
to O
gamification O
as O
a O
tool O
being O
more O
damaging O
than O
useful O
with O
users’ O
focus O
shifting O
from O
the O
task O
to O
gaming O
the O
system O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Automatic O
learning O
of O
geospatial O
intelligence O
is O
challenging O
due O
to O
the O
complexity O
of O
articulating O
knowledge O
from O
visual O
patterns O
and O
to O
the O
ever O
- O
increasing O
quantities O
of O
image O
data O
generated O
on O
a O
daily O
basis O
. O

In O
this O
setting O
, O
human O
inspection O
and O
annotation O
is O
subjective O
and O
, O
more O
importantly O
, O
impractical O
. O

In O
this O
letter O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
knowledge O
- O
discovery O
algorithm O
that O
uses O
content O
- O
based O
methods O
to O
link O
low O
- O
level O
image O
features O
with O
high O
- O
level O
visual O
semantics O
in O
an O
effort O
to O
automate O
the O
process O
of O
retrieving O
semantically O
similar O
images O
. O

Our O
algorithm O
represents O
geospatial O
images O
by O
using O
a O
high O
- O
dimensional O
feature O
vector O
and O
generates O
a O
set O
of O
association O
rules O
that O
correlate O
semantic O
terms O
with O
visual O
patterns O
represented O
by O
discrete O
feature O
intervals O
. O

We O
also O
provide O
a O
mathematical O
model O
to O
customize O
the O
relevance O
of O
feature O
measurements O
to O
semantic O
assignments O
as O
well O
as O
methods O
of O
querying O
by O
semantics O
and O
by O
example O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
techniques O
play O
vital O
role O
in O
the O
era O
of O
information O
technology O
. O

Inverted O
index O
is O
one O
of O
the O
technique O
to O
retrieve O
the O
information O
/ O
data O
related O
with O
certain O
keyword O
. O

This O
technique O
gives O
faster O
results O
to O
retrieve O
relevant O
document O
from O
billions O
of O
documents O
, O
which O
contains O
specified O
keyword O
. O

In O
order O
to O
support O
wrongly O
spelled O
keyword O
, O
many O
techniques O
have O
been O
proposed O
including O
edit O
distance O
, O
wild O
- O
card O
and O
n O
- O
gram O
. O

The O
n O
- O
gram O
index O
has O
language O
- O
neutral O
and O
errortolerant O
advantage O
. O

However O
, O
it O
has O
a O
drawback O
of O
large O
size O
and O
less O
performance O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
have O
proposed O
NOVEL O
technique O
to O
search O
fuzzy O
keyword O
. O

We O
have O
implemented O
and O
tested O
the O
proposed O
technique O
on O
two O
datasets O
. O

The O
result O
shows O
that O
NOVEL O
technique O
supports O
not O
only O
wrongly O
spelled O
keywords O
, O
but O
also O
reduced O
gram O
size O
by O
40 O
- O
50 O
% O
than O
K O
/ O
n O
- O
gram O
technique O
. O

Therefore O
, O
the O
proposed O
technique O
is O
the O
most O
efficient O
technique O
to O
support O
fuzzy O
keyword O
search O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Most O
of O
the O
Information O
Retrieval O
techniques O
are O
based O
on O
representing O
the O
documents O
using O
the O
traditional O
vector O
space O
model O
i.e. O
bag O
- O
of O
- O
words O
model O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
associations O
among O
words O
in O
the O
documents O
are O
assessed O
and O
it O
is O
expressed O
in O
term O
graph O
model O
to O
represent O
the O
document O
content O
and O
the O
relationship O
among O
the O
keywords O
. O

Most O
modern O
web O
search O
engines O
typically O
employ O
two O
- O
level O
ranking O
strategy O
. O

Firstly O
, O
an O
initial O
list O
of O
documents O
is O
prepared O
using O
a O
low O
- O
quality O
ranking O
function O
with O
consumes O
less O
computation O
. O

Secondly O
, O
initial O
list O
is O
then O
re O
- O
ranked O
by O
machine O
learning O
algorithms O
which O
involve O
expensive O
computation O
. O

This O
paper O
experiments O
the O
second O
level O
of O
ranking O
strategy O
which O
exploits O
term O
graph O
data O
structure O
to O
assess O
the O
importance O
of O
a O
document O
for O
the O
user O
query O
and O
thus O
documents O
are O
re O
- O
ranked O
according O
to O
the O
association O
and O
similarity O
exists O
among O
the O
documents O
. O

The O
proposed O
algorithms O
achieve O
promising O
results O
within O
the O
top O
10 O
search O
results O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
address O
both O
standard O
and O
focused O
retrieval O
tasks O
based O
on O
comprehensible O
language O
models O
and O
interactive O
query O
expansion O
( O
IQE O
Query O
topics O
are O
expanded O
using O
an O
initial O
set O
of O
Multi O
Word O
Terms O
( O
MWTs O
) O
selected O
from O
top O
n O
ranked O
documents O
. O

MWTs O
are O
special O
text O
units O
that O
represent O
domain O
concepts O
and O
objects O
. O

As O
such O
, O
they O
can O
better O
represent O
query O
topics O
than O
ordinary O
phrases O
or O
n O
- O
grams O
. O

We O
tested O
different O
query O
representations O
: O
bag O
- O
of O
- O
words O
, O
phrases O
, O
flat O
list O
of O
MWTs O
, O
subsets O
of O
MWTs O
. O

We O
also O
combined O
the O
initial O
set O
of O
MWTs O
obtained O
in O
an O
IQE O
process O
with O
automatic O
query O
expansion O
( O
AQE O
) O
using O
language O
models O
and O
smoothing O
mechanism O
. O

We O
chose O
as O
baseline O
the O
Indri O
IR O
engine O
based O
on O
the O
language O
model O
using O
Dirichlet O
smoothing O
. O

The O

is O

Enterprise O
track O
( O

) O

; O

2008 O

- O

using O

collection O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

Rankboost O
has O
been O
shown O
to O
be O
an O
effective O
algorithm O
for O
combining O
ranks O
. O

However O
, O
its O
ability O
to O
generalize O
well O
and O
not O
overfit O
is O
directly O
related O
to O
the O
choice O
of O
weak O
learner O
, O
in O
the O
sense O
that O
regularization O
of O
the O
rank O
function O
is O
due O
to O
the O
regularization O
properties O
of O
its O
weak O
learners O
. O

We O
present O
a O

property O
called O
consistency O
in O
preference O
and O

that O
mathematically O
translates O
into O
monotonic O

, O
and O
describe O
a O
new O
weak O
ranking O
learner O
( O
MWGR O
) O
that O
generates O
ranking O
functions O
with O
this O

. O

In O

ranks O
from O
multiple O
face O
recognition O
algorithms O
and O
an O

text O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
, O
rank O
functions O
using O
MWGR O
proved O
superior O
to O
binary O
weak O
learners O
. O

. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
would O
like O
to O
represent O
our O
research O
in O
Natural O
Language O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
NLIR O
) O
system O
using O
grammar O
analysis O
. O

In O
our O
system O
, O
the O
queries O
are O
small O
texts O
of O
description O
in O
natural O
language O
. O

The O
system O
tries O
to O
get O
searching O
conditions O
from O
these O
queries O
by O
grammar O
analyzing O
and O
searches O
for O
the O
expected O
documents O
. O

In O
many O
NLIR O
system O
, O
the O
descriptions O
are O
analyzed O
by O
either O
annotations[5 O
] O
or O
predefined O
patterns[8 O
These O
techniques O
can O
lead O
to O
miss O
- O
understanding O
the O
user O
's O
request O
and O
find O
inappropriate O
results O
. O

Therefore O
, O
the O
research O
in O
NLIR O
system O
focuses O
on O
understanding O
the O
user O
's O
descriptions O
in O
natural O
language O
by O
grammar O
analysis O
technique O
should O
be O
conducted O
to O
make O
found O
results O
more O
accurate O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Vector O
Space O
Model O
( O
VSM O
) O
is O
used O
frequently O
in O
Text O
Classification O
( O
TC O

However O
, O
it O
is O
usually O
produces O
a O
high O
dimensional O
feature O
space O
which O
leads O
to O
huge O
cost O
of O
computation O
and O
storage O
. O

Recently O
, O
statistic O
topic O
model O
plays O
an O
important O
role O
in O
the O
field O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
TC O
and O
Document O
Clustering O
. O

In O
this O
chapter O
, O
we O
try O
to O
use O
a O
kind O
of O
statistic O
model O
— O
Latent O
Dirichlet O
Allocation O
( O
LDA O
) O
Model O
to O
represent O
texts O
and O
construct O
corresponding O
classifier O
. O

We O
expect O
that O
this O
model O
could O
include O
more O
complicated O
semantic O
information O
and O
simultaneously O
reduce O

. O

. O

rapidly O

data O
on O

has O
created O

big O
challenge O
for O

the O
user O
to O
the O
web O
pages O
in O
their O
areas O
of O
interest O
. O

Sentiment O
analysis O
or O
Opinion O
mining O
plays O
an O
important O
role O
in O
finding O
the O
area O
of O
interest O
based O
on O
user O
’s O
previous O
actions O
. O

Social O
networking O
portals O
have O
been O
widely O
used O
for O
expressing O
opinions O
in O
the O
public O
domain O
. O

Text O
based O
sentiment O
classifiers O
often O
prove O
inefficient O
. O

Semantic O
web O
is O
the O
solution O
for O
Searching O
relevant O
information O
from O
huge O
repository O
of O
unstructured O
web O
data O
. O

Semantic O
web O
leads O
the O
idea O
of O
ontology O
as O
background O
knowledge O
represents O
the O
concepts O
and O
the O
relationship O
in O
specialized O
domain O
. O

idea O
behind O
this O

to O
take O
domain O
ontology O
for O

more O
elaborate O

scores O
. O

discuss O
an O
approach O
where O

from O

and O

on O

of O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
model O
based O
two O
- O
dimensional O
object O
recognition O
system O
capable O
of O
performing O
under O
occlusion O
and O
geometric O
transformation O
is O
described O
in O
this O
paper O
. O

The O
system O
is O
based O
on O
the O
concept O
of O
associative O
search O
using O
overlapping O
local O
features O
. O

During O
the O
training O
phase O
, O
the O
local O
features O
are O
hashed O
to O
set O
up O
the O
associations O
between O
the O
features O
and O
models O
. O

In O
the O
recognition O
phase O
, O
the O
same O
hashing O
procedure O
is O
used O
to O
retrieve O
associations O
that O
participate O
in O
a O
voting O
process O
to O
determine O
the O
identity O
of O
the O
shape O
. O

Two O
associative O
retrieval O
techniques O
for O
discrete O
and O
continuous O
features O
, O
respectively O
, O
are O
described O
in O
the O
paper O
. O

The O
performance O
of O
the O
system O
is O
studied O
using O
a O
test O
set O
of O
1,000 O
shapes O
that O
are O
corrupted O
versions O
of O
100 O
models O
in O
the O
shape O
database O
. O

It O
is O
shown O
that O
the O
incorporation O
of O
a O
verification O
phase O
to O
confirm O
the O
retrieved O
associations O
can O
provide O
zero O
error O
performance O
with O
a O
small O
reject O
rate O
. O

( O

-DOCSTART- O

To O
realize O
more O
efficient O
information O
retrieval O
it O
is O
critical O
to O
improve O
the O
user O
’s O
original O
query O
, O
because O
novice O
users O
can O
not O
be O
expected O
to O
formulate O
precise O
and O
effective O
queries O
. O

Queries O
can O
often O
be O
improved O
by O
adding O
extra O
terms O
that O
appear O
in O
relevant O
documents O
but O
which O
were O
not O
included O
in O
the O
original O
query O
. O

This O
is O
called O
query O
expansion O
. O

Query O
refinement O
, O
a O
variant O
of O
query O
expansion O
, O
interactively O
recommends O
new O
terms O
related O
to O
the O
original O
query O
. O

Because O
previous O
research O
did O
not O
offer O
any O
criterion O
to O
guarantee O
optimality O
, O
this O
paper O
proposes O
an O
optimal O
algorithm O
for O
query O
refinement O
with O
reference O
to O
the O
Bayes O
criterion O
. O

The O
ubiquitous O
, O
diverse O
and O
growing O
impact O
of O
digital O
living O
creates O
a O
massive O
amount O
of O
short O
text O
a O
search O
query O
, O
a O
twit O
or O
a O
caption O
. O

Short O
text O
frequently O
presents O
itself O
as O
an O
arbitrary O
combination O
of O
semantically O
unconnected O
words O
. O

Using O

to O

corpora O
of O
such O
texts O
is O
a O
challenging O
task O
. O

A O
large O
body O
of O
research O

in O
this O
area O
, O
but O
in O
this O
paper O

will O

( O

) O
and O
its O
role O
in O
machine O
learning O
for O
shorttext O
and O
non O
- O
topical O
classification O
. O

More O
specifically O
, O
we O
present O
an O
effort O
to O
create O
a O
short O

classification O
framework O
based O
on O
Background O
Knowledge O
. O

We O
propose O
novel O
Information O
Retrieval O
techniques O
to O
construct O
BK O
and O
demonstrate O
the O
advantages O
of O
Automatic O
Query O
Expansion O
( O

) O
vs. O
basic O

. O

of O

Information O
Gathering O
is O
becoming O
a O
tool O
more O
and O
more O
important O
for O
network O
information O
process O
as O
well O
as O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
and O
Information O
Filtering O
( O
IF O
In O
order O
to O
enhance O
the O
ratio O
of O
relevant O
information O
to O
the O
whole O
information O
gathered O
from O
network O
, O
relevance O
estimation O
must O
be O
carried O
out O
in O
the O
course O
of O
gathering O
. O

Information O
Gathering O
Systems O
must O
estimate O
the O
relevance O
of O
document O
content O
to O
be O
gathered O
to O
the O
query O
users O
have O
put O
forward O
just O
before O
actual O
gathering O
actions O
. O

We O
skim O
over O
TFIDF O
algorithm O
and O
in O

to O
make O
up O
for O
its O
drawback O
, O
We O
introduce O
naive O
Bayes+KL O
algorithm O
based O
on O
the O
combination O
of O
naive O
Bayes O
model O
in O
Probabilistic O
Theory O
and O
Kullback O
Leibler O
algorithm O
in O
Information O
Theory O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
this O
kind O
of O
probabilistic O
algorithm O
could O
find O
out O
more O
relevant O
documents O
for O
it O
comes O
more O
close O
to O
semantic O
comprehension O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Polysemous O
words O
have O
more O
than O
one O
possible O
meaning O
, O
thus O
word O
ambiguity O
is O
a O
key O
issue O
for O
the O
systems O
which O
access O
textual O
information O
. O

Computational O
linguistics O
proposes O
two O
main O
methods O
to O
cope O
with O
word O
ambiguity O
: O
sense O
disambiguation O
and O
sense O
discrimination O
Word O
) O

Sense O
Disambiguation O
is O
the O
task O
of O
selecting O
a O
sense O
for O
a O
word O
from O
a O
set O
of O
predefined O
possibilities O
, O
while O
( O
Word O
) O

Sense O
Discrimination O
is O
the O
task O
of O
dividing O
the O
usages O
of O
a O
word O
into O
different O
meanings O
, O
discriminating O
among O
word O
meanings O
based O
on O
information O
found O
in O
unannotated O
corpora O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
strategy O
to O
compare O
disambiguation O
and O
discrimination O
systems O
by O
adopting O
an O
" O
in O
vivo O
" O
evaluation O
in O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
scenario O
. O

The O
goal O
of O
the O
evaluation O
is O
to O
establish O
how O
disambiguation O
and O
discrimination O
bias O
the O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
link O
prediction O
problem O
has O
received O
extensive O
attention O
in O
fields O
such O
as O
sociology O
, O
anthropology O
, O
information O
science O
, O
and O
computer O
science O
. O

In O
many O
practical O
applications O
, O
we O
only O
need O
to O
predict O
the O
potential O
links O
between O
the O
vertices O
of O
interest O
, O
instead O
of O
predicting O
all O
of O
the O
links O
in O
a O
complex O
network O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
fast O
similarity O
based O
approach O
for O
predicting O
the O
links O
related O
to O
a O
given O
node O
. O

We O
construct O
a O
path O
set O
connected O
to O
the O
given O
node O
by O
a O
random O
walk O
. O

The O
similarity O
score O
is O
computed O
within O
a O
small O
sub O
- O
graph O
formed O
by O
the O
path O
set O
connected O
to O
the O
given O
node O
, O
which O
significantly O
reduces O
the O
computation O
time O
. O

By O
choosing O
the O
appropriate O
number O
of O
sampled O
paths O
, O
we O
can O
restrict O
the O
error O
of O
the O
estimated O
similarities O
within O
a O
given O
threshold O
. O

Our O
experimental O
results O
on O
a O
number O
of O
real O
networks O
indicate O
that O
the O
algorithm O
proposed O
in O
this O
paper O
can O
obtain O
accurate O
results O
in O
less O
time O
than O
existing O
methods O
. O

) O

Controlled O
generation O
of O
single O
photons O
is O
one O
of O
the O
current O
interests O
in O
quantum O
optics O
and O
quantum O
information O
science O
. O

Unlike O
classical O
light O
sources O
, O
the O
single O
photon O
sources O
can O
generate O
a O
sequence O
of O
single O
photons O
with O
a O
regular O
time O
interval O
exhibiting O
the O
so O
- O
called O
photon O
anti O
- O
bunching O
, O
which O
is O
an O
important O
subject O
in O
quantum O
optics O
. O

Moreover O
, O
a O
stream O
of O
regular O
- O
spaced O

photons O
can O
serve O
as O
an O
ideal O
carrier O
of O
quantum O
information O
with O

quantum O
information O
encoded O
in O
a O

of O
photon O
numbers O
or O

. O

) O

-DOCSTART- O

Many O
applications O
compute O
aggregate O
functions O
over O
an O
attribute O
( O
or O
set O
of O
attributes O
) O
to O
find O
aggregate O
values O
above O
some O
specified O
threshold O
. O

We O
call O
such O
queries O
iceberg O
queries O
, O
because O
the O
number O
of O
abovethreshold O
results O
is O
often O
very O
small O
( O
the O
tip O
of O
an O
iceberg O
relative O
to O
the O
large O
amount O
of O
input O
data O
( O
the O
iceberg O
Such O
iceberg O
queries O
are O
common O
in O
many O
applications O
, O
including O
data O
warehousing O
, O
information O
- O
retrieval O
, O
market O
basket O
analysis O
in O
data O
mining O
, O
clustering O
and O
copy O
detection O
. O

We O
propose O
efficient O
algorithms O
to O
evaluate O
iceberg O
queries O
using O
very O
little O
memory O
and O
significantly O
fewer O
passes O
over O
data O
, O
when O
compared O
to O
current O
techniques O
that O
use O
sorting O
or O
hashing O
. O

We O
present O
an O
experimental O
case O
study O
using O
over O
three O
gigabytes O
of O
Web O
data O
to O
illustrate O
the O
savings O
obtained O
by O
our O
algorithms O
. O

( O

With O
the O
rapid O
development O
of O
the O
Internet O
and O
great O
capacity O
of O
online O
documents O
, O
information O
retrieval O
has O
become O
an O
active O
research O
topic O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
novel O
information O
retrieval O
algorithm O
based O
on O
query O
expansion O
and O
classification O
. O

The O
algorithm O
is O
induced O
by O
the O
observation O
that O
very O
short O
queries O
with O
the O
traditional O
information O
retrieval O
methods O
often O
have O
low O
precision O
, O
although O
they O
can O
get O
high O
recall O
. O

Our O
approach O
attempts O
to O
catch O
more O
relevant O
documents O
by O
query O
expansion O
and O
text O
classification O
. O

The O
results O
of O
the O
experiments O
show O
that O
the O
algorithm O
we O
proposed O
is O
more O
precise O
and O
efficient O
than O
the O
traditional O
query O
expansion O
methods O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Hypertext O
links O
are O
a O
powerful O
extension O
of O
standard O
information O
retrieval O
techniques O
based O
on O
query O
languages O
. O

However O
, O
the O
generation O
of O
links O
is O
often O
impractical O
due O
to O
large O
manual O
and/or O
computational O
effort O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
analyze O
the O
effects O
of O
two O
main O
approaches O
that O
aim O
at O
a O
restriction O
of O
the O
necessary O
efforts O
: O

The O
direct O
use O
of O
OCR O
- O
processed O
documents O
instead O
of O
manually O
post O
- O
processed O
— O

e. O
corrected O
— O
documents O
and O
the O
use O
of O
shorter O
excerpts O
of O
documents O
instead O
of O
complete O
documents O
. O

For O
our O
tests O
, O
similarity O
links O
were O
computed O
based O
on O
the O
vector O
- O
space O
model O
; O
the O
links O
that O
are O
generated O
based O
on O
unmodified O
OCR O
documents O
and O
excerpts O
of O
documents O
are O
then O
compared O
to O
those O
links O
that O
are O
generated O
based O
on O
complete O
documents O
without O
OCR O
errors O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
introduce O
the O
intuitive O
notion O
of O
trivergence O
of O
probability O
distributions O
( O

This O
notion O
allow O
us O
to O
calculate O
the O
similarity O
among O
triplets O
of O
objects O
. O

For O
this O

, O
we O
can O
use O
the O
well O
known O
measures O
of O
probability O
divergences O
like O
Kullback O
- O
Leibler O
and O
Jensen O
- O
Shannon O
. O

measures O
may O
be O

in O

tasks O
as O

Text O

, O

, O

others O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
recent O
years O
Bayesian O
methods O
have O
become O
widespread O
in O
many O
domains O
including O
computer O
vision O
, O
signal O
processing O
, O
information O
retrieval O
and O
genome O
data O
analysis O
. O

The O
availability O
of O
fast O
computers O
allows O
the O
required O
computations O
to O
be O
performed O
in O
reasonable O
time O
, O
and O
thereby O
makes O
the O
benefits O
of O
a O
Bayesian O
treatment O
accessible O
to O
an O
ever O
broadening O
range O
of O
applications O
. O

In O
this O
tutorial O
we O
give O
an O
overview O
of O
the O
Bayesian O
approach O
to O
pattern O
recognition O
in O
the O
context O
of O
simple O
regression O
and O
classification O
problems O
. O

We O
then O
describe O
in O
detail O
a O
specific O
Bayesian O
model O
for O
regression O
and O
classification O
called O
the O
Relevance O
Vector O
Machine O
. O

This O
overcomes O
many O
of O
the O
limitations O
of O
the O
widely O
used O
Support O
Vector O
Machine O
, O
while O
retaining O
the O
highly O
desirable O
property O
of O
sparseness O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Collaborative O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
CIR O
) O
is O
one O
of O
the O
popular O
social O
- O
based O
IR O
approaches O
. O

A O
CIR O
system O
registers O
the O
previous O
user O
interactions O
to O
response O
to O
the O
subsequent O
user O
queries O
more O
efficiently O
. O

But O
CIR O
suffers O
from O
the O
personalization O
problem O
because O
the O
goals O
and O
the O
characteristics O
of O
two O
users O
may O
be O
different O
; O
so O
when O
they O
send O
the O
same O
query O
to O
a O
CIR O
system O
, O
they O
may O
be O
interested O
in O
two O
different O
lists O
of O
documents O
. O

We O
have O
developed O
a O
personalized O
CIR O
system O
, O
called O
PERCIRS O
, O
to O
solve O
this O
problem O
. O

Selecting O
an O
efficient O
method O
to O
calculate O
the O
similarity O
between O
user O
profiles O
is O
a O
key O
factor O
for O
enhancing O
PERCIRS O
's O
efficiency O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
new O
graph O
- O
based O
method O
for O
user O
profile O
similarity O
calculation O
. O

Finally O
, O
by O
introducing O
an O
evaluation O
method O
, O
we O
will O
show O
that O
this O
new O
method O
is O
more O
efficient O
than O
the O
previous O
methods O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
article O
we O
present O
a O
method O
for O
combining O
different O
information O
retrieval O
models O
in O
order O
to O
increase O
the O
retrieval O
performance O
in O
a O
Speech O
Information O
Retrieval O
task O
. O

The O
formulas O
for O
combining O

models O
are O
tuned O
on O
training O
data O
. O

Then O
the O
system O
is O
evaluated O
on O
test O
data O
. O

The O
task O
is O
particularly O
difficult O
because O
the O
text O
collection O
is O
automatically O
transcribed O
spontaneous O
speech O
, O
with O
many O

errors O
. O

Also O
, O
the O
topics O
are O
real O
information O
needs O
, O
difficult O
to O

. O

Information O

systems O

not O

to O

results O
on O
this O
data O
set O
, O

. O

Arabic O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
information O
explosion O
across O
the O
Internet O
and O
elsewhere O
offers O
access O
to O
an O
increasing O
number O
of O
document O
collections O
. O

Retrieval O
system O
evaluation O
plays O
an O
important O
role O
in O
judging O
the O
efficiency O
and O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
retrieval O
process O
. O

Validating O
the O
performance O
of O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
provides O
assurance O
that O
a O
system O
as O
a O
whole O
is O
likely O
to O
meet O
its O
quantitative O
performance O
goals O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
procedure O
to O
calculate O
the O
response O
time O
early O
in O
the O
life O
cycle O
and O
simulate O
the O
performance O
metrics O
for O
an O
information O
retrieval O
system O
in O
different O
architectures O
namely O
, O
centralized O
and O
distributed O
. O

We O
consider O

Thesaurus O
has O
been O
widely O
used O
in O
many O
applications O
, O
including O
information O
retrieval O
, O
natural O
language O
processing O
, O
and O
question O
answering O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
novel O
approach O
to O
automatically O
constructing O
a O
domain O
- O
specific O
thesaurus O
from O
the O
Web O
using O
link O
structure O
information O
. O

The O
proposed O
approach O
is O
able O
to O
identify O
new O
terms O
and O
reflect O
the O
latest O
relationship O
between O
terms O
as O
the O
Web O
evolves O
. O

First O
, O
a O
set O
of O
high O
quality O
and O
representative O
websites O
of O
a O
specific O
domain O
is O
selected O
. O

After O
filtering O
out O
navigational O
links O
, O
link O
analysis O
is O
applied O
to O
each O
website O
to O
obtain O
its O
content O
structure O
. O

Finally O
, O
the O
thesaurus O
is O
constructed O
by O
merging O
the O
content O
structures O
of O
the O
selected O
websites O
. O

The O
experimental O
results O
on O
automatic O
query O
expansion O
based O
on O
our O
constructed O
thesaurus O
show O
20 O
% O
improvement O
in O
search O
precision O
compared O
to O
the O
baseline O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
system O
for O
authentication O
or O
authorization O
maintains O
log O
data O
which O
records O
when O
someone O
uses O
some O
service O
, O
in O
addition O
to O
personal O
information O
, O
and O
therefore O
privacy O
protection O
for O
such O
a O
system O
is O
mandatory O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
develop O
an O
infrastructure O
system O
which O
provides O
authentication O
and O
authorization O
functions O
to O
multiple O
services O
, O
protecting O
privacy O
of O
users O
of O
the O
services O
. O

After O
deriving O
requirements O
for O
the O
privacy O
protection O
, O
we O
develop O
the O
system O
satisfying O
the O
requirements O
. O

In O
the O
proposed O
system O
, O
because O
information O
is O
divided O
into O
different O
subsystems O
, O
it O
is O
difficult O
for O
such O
a O
subsystem O
to O
identify O
an O
individual O
. O

The O
proposed O
system O
also O
utilizes O
Private O
Information O
Retrieval O
to O
prevent O
a O
subsystem O
identifying O
an O
individual O
who O
request O
an O
authentication O
process O
. O

Information O
Retrieval O
is O
one O
of O
the O
top O
progressive O
research O
field O
in O
computer O
science O
since O
last O
decennium O
. O

Many O

have O

references O
and O
now O
- O
a O
- O
days O
users O
are O
many O

to O

to O
not O
only O
particular O

of O
particular O
direction O
. O

Spatial O

can O

. O

It O

those O

which O

can O
remove O
some O
issues O
and O
challenges O
and O

will O
improve O

and O

. O

Retrieval O
calls O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
most O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
applications O
, O
Euclidean O
distance O
is O
used O
for O
similarity O
measurement O
. O

It O
is O
adequate O
in O
many O
cases O
but O
this O
distance O
metric O
is O
not O
very O
accurate O
when O
there O
exist O
some O
different O
local O
data O
distributions O
in O
the O
database O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
Gaussian O
mixture O
distance O
for O
performing O
accurate O
nearest O
- O
neighbor O
search O
for O
Information O
Retrieval O

Under O
an O
established O
Gaussian O
finite O
mixture O
model O
for O
the O
distribution O
of O
the O
data O
in O
the O
database O
, O
the O
Gaussian O
mixture O
distance O
is O
formulated O
based O
on O
minimizing O
the O
Kullback O
- O
Leibler O
( O
KL O
) O
divergence O
between O
the O
distribution O
of O
the O
retrieval O
data O
and O
the O
data O
in O
database O
. O

We O
compared O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
Gaussian O
mixture O
distance O
with O
the O
well O
- O
known O
Euclidean O
and O
Mahalanobis O
distance O
based O
on O
a O
precision O
performance O
measurement O
. O

Experimental O
results O
demonstrate O
that O
the O
Gaussian O
mixture O
distance O
function O
is O
superior O
in O
the O
others O
for O
different O
types O
of O
testing O
data O
. O

( O

) O

. O

in O

. O

In O

address O

We O
first O

- O

to O

problem O

to O

’s O
