. O

Interestingly O
, O

that O
only O

information O
and O
is O
blind O
to O
the O
intrinsic O
properties O
of O
the O
multimodal O
information O
input O
. O

The O
approach O
is O
tested O
on O
annotated O
images O
and O
on O
the O
complete O
TRECVID O
2005 O
corpus O
and O
compared O
with O
SVM O
- O
based O
fusion O
strategies O
. O

The O
results O
show O
that O
our O
approach O
equals O
SVM O
performance O
but O
, O
contrary O
to O
SVM O
, O
is O
parameter O
free O
and O
faster O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
introduces O
mass O
estimation O
— O
a O
base O
modelling O
mechanism O
that O
can O
be O
employed O
to O
solve O
various O
tasks O
in O
machine O
learning O
. O

We O
present O
the O
theoretical O
basis O
of O
mass O
and O
efficient O
methods O
to O
estimate O
mass O
. O

We O
show O
that O
mass O
estimation O
solves O
problems O
effectively O
in O
tasks O
such O
as O
information O
retrieval O
, O
regression O
and O
anomaly O
detection O
. O

The O
models O
, O
which O
use O
mass O
in O
these O
three O
tasks O
, O
perform O
at O
least O
as O
well O
as O
and O
often O
better O
than O
eight O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
methods O
in O
terms O
of O
task O
- O
specific O
performance O
measures O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
mass O
estimation O
has O
constant O
time O
and O
space O
complexities O
. O

We O
present O
a O
novel O
response O
generation O
system O
that O
can O
be O
trained O
end O
to O
end O
on O
large O
quantities O
of O
unstructured O
Twitter O
conversations O
. O

neural O
network O
architecture O
is O
used O
to O
address O
sparsity O
issues O
that O
arise O
when O
integrating O

information O
into O
classic O
statistical O
models O
, O
allowing O
the O
system O
to O
take O
into O
account O
previous O
dialog O
utterances O
. O

Our O
dynamic O
- O

models O
show O
consistent O
gains O
over O

- O

and O
non O
- O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
Public O
Sector O
produces O
and O
disseminates O
huge O
amounts O
of O
government O
information O
considered O
to O
be O
essential O
not O
only O
for O
its O
proper O
inner O
function O
( O
i.e. O
decision O
making O
processes O
but O
also O
for O
citizen O
transactions O
and O
the O
internal O
market O
. O

However O
, O
the O
access O
to O
government O
information O
is O
limited O
and O
complicated O
due O
to O
the O
lack O
of O
advanced O
information O
systems O
based O
on O
international O
standards O
and O
formats O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
knowledge O
management O
framework O
for O
the O
functional O
improvement O
of O
Government O
Information O
Centres O
, O
which O
efficiently O
controls O
the O
flow O
and O
disposal O
of O
all O
types O
of O
government O
information O
in O
Regional O
Administration O
. O

In O
particular O
the O
implemented O
system O
: O
a O
) O
facilitates O
the O
flow O
of O
information O
within O
multifaceted O
administrative O
channels O
, O
b O
) O
ensures O
thematic O
homogeneity O
and O
interoperability O
for O
accurate O
and O
quality O
data O
/ O
metadata O
exchange O
, O
and O
c O
) O
secures O
efficient O
information O
retrieval O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

the O
paper O
proposes O
RecoProd O
a O
recommender O
system O
which O
uses O
sentiment O
analysis O
techniques O
to O
provide O
the O
best O
products O
for O
the O
customers O
. O

The O
system O
uses O
the O
existing O
product O
reviews O
upon O
which O
sentiment O
classification O
is O
carried O
out O
. O

RecoProd O
consists O
of O
an O
Information O
Retrieval O
component O
which O
extracts O
the O
reviews O
from O
the O
ecommerce O
websites O
using O
the O
product O
names O
as O
queries O
. O

Sentiment O
Analysis O
algorithms O
like O
Naive O
Bayes O
and O
SVM O
are O
used O
to O
categorize O
the O
reviews O
and O
opinion O
scores O
are O
assigned O
to O
the O
reviews O
. O

A O
comparative O
study O
on O
the O
accuracy O
of O
the O
sentiment O
analysis O
algorithms O
used O
is O
also O
carried O
out O
. O

Aspect O
based O
summary O
of O
opinions O
for O
each O
product O
is O
carried O
out O
and O
visually O
compared O
. O

The O
products O
are O
then O
clustered O
and O
the O
optimal O
product O
along O
with O
the O
recommended O
products O
is O
displayed O
to O
the O
user O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
problem O
of O
asymmetric O
information O
in O
electricity O
market O
is O
due O
to O
uncertainty O
in O
determining O
individual O
cost O
functions O
in O
assessing O
the O
participants O
' O
bids O
. O

Individual O
loads O
or O
demand O
functions O
are O
assumed O
to O
be O
known O
to O
all O
participants O
. O

Based O
on O
the O
information O
asymmetry O
, O
it O
is O
proposed O
that O
individual O
generators O
may O
attempt O
to O
optimize O
their O
operating O
profits O
by O
making O
assumptions O
about O
the O
uncertain O
information O
. O

Each O
generator O
selects O
a O
supply O
bid O
curve O
as O
the O
best O
response O
to O
all O
simulated O
bidding O
scenarios O
. O

After O
observing O
the O
actual O
outcomes O
and O
performing O
sensitivity O
analysis O
from O
the O
most O
similar O
bidding O
scenario O
, O
the O
bids O
are O
adjusted O
for O
subsequent O
use O
. O

The O
optimality O
of O
the O
decisions O
may O
need O
to O
be O
altered O
by O
the O
power O
system O
constraints O
. O

The O
objective O
of O
the O
paper O
is O
to O
provide O
a O
possible O
way O
of O
extracting O
information O
from O
the O
bidding O
process O
rather O
than O
analyzing O
the O
strategic O
behavior O
of O
the O
generators O
. O

This O
study O
explores O
the O
benefits O
of O
integrating O
knowledge O
representations O
in O
prior O
art O
patent O
retrieval O
. O

Key O
to O
the O
introduced O
approach O
is O
the O
utilization O
of O
human O
judgment O
available O
in O
the O
form O
of O
classifications O
assigned O
to O
patent O
documents O
. O

The O
paper O
first O
outlines O
in O
detail O
how O
a O
methodology O
for O
the O
extraction O
of O
knowledge O
from O
such O
an O
hierarchical O
classification O
system O
can O
be O
established O
. O

Further O
potential O
ways O
of O
integrating O
this O
knowledge O
with O
existing O
Information O
Retrieval O
paradigms O
in O
a O
scalable O
and O
flexible O
manner O
are O
investigated O
. O

Finally O
based O
on O
these O
integration O
strategies O
the O
effectiveness O
in O
terms O
of O
recall O
and O
precision O
is O
evaluated O
in O
the O
context O
of O
a O
prior O
art O
search O
task O
for O
European O
patents O
. O

As O
a O
result O
of O
this O
evaluation O
it O
can O
be O
established O
that O
in O
general O
the O
proposed O
knowledge O
expansion O
techniques O
are O
particularly O
beneficial O
to O
recall O
and O
, O
with O
respect O
to O
optimizing O
field O
retrieval O
settings O
, O
further O
result O
in O
significant O
precision O
gains O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Bug O
localization O
is O
the O
process O
of O
identifying O
the O
elements O
of O
source O
code O
that O
require O
modification O
to O
fix O
the O
bug O
. O

By O
automating O
the O
task O
of O
bug O
localization O
efficiently O
, O
the O
cost O
of O
software O
can O
also O
be O
reduced O
. O

For O
performing O
bug O
localization O
, O
many O
Information O
Retrieval O
models O
have O
been O
used O
in O
past O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
bug O
localization O
has O
been O
performed O
using O
Pachinko O
Allocation O
Model O
( O
PAM O
PAM O
is O
also O
an O
IR O
model O
, O
which O
falls O
under O
the O
category O
of O
topic O
models O
and O
has O
not O
been O
used O
for O
locating O
bugs O
yet O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
proposed O
PAM O
based O
approach O
for O
bug O
localization O
at O
file O
level O
. O

The O
PAM O
based O
approach O
is O
compared O
with O
LDA O
based O
approach O
and O
it O
has O
been O
shown O
that O
PAM O
based O
bug O
localization O
performs O
better O
as O
compared O
to O
LDA O
based O
bug O
localization O
. O

For O
evaluating O
the O
performance O
of O
PAM O
and O
LDA O
based O
approaches O
, O
the O
datasets O
downloaded O
from O
two O
open O
source O
projects O
, O
i.e. O
Rhino O
and O
ModeShape O
, O
have O
been O
used O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Semantic O
similarity O
models O
are O
a O
series O
of O
mathematical O
models O
for O
computing O
semantic O
similarity O
values O
among O
nodes O
in O
a O
semantic O
net O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
reveal O
the O
paradox O
in O
the O
applications O
of O
these O
semantic O
similarity O
models O
in O
the O
field O
of O
information O
retrieval O
, O
which O
is O
that O
these O
models O
rely O
on O
a O
common O
prerequisite O
the O
words O
of O
a O
user O
query O
must O
correspond O
to O
the O
nodes O
of O
a O
semantic O
net O
. O

In O
certain O
situations O
, O
this O
sort O
of O
correspondence O
can O
not O
be O
carried O
out O
, O
which O
invalidates O
the O
further O
working O
of O
these O
semantic O
similarity O
models O
. O

By O
means O
of O
two O
case O
studies O
, O
we O
analyze O
these O
issues O
. O

In O
addition O
, O
we O
discuss O
some O
possible O
solutions O
in O
order O
to O
address O
these O
issues O
. O

Conclusion O
and O
future O
works O
are O
drawn O
in O
the O
final O
section O
. O

. O

. O

for O

. O

presents O

in O
the O
User O
- O
Centered O

Information O

task O
( O

2 O
) O
at O

CLEF O

2015 O

explored O

on O

UMLS[3 O
and O

on O

put O
emphasis O
on O

and O

recognized O
in O
the O
topic O
text O
by O

. O

This O
run O
achieved O
a O
P@10 O
score O
of O
0.262 O
and O
nDCG@10 O
of O
0.196 O
, O
respectively O
. O

a O

field O
, O

such O
as O

science O

. O

of O

in O

YouTube O
represents O
one O
of O
the O
largest O
scale O
and O
most O
sophisticated O
industrial O
recommendation O
systems O
in O
existence O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
the O
system O
at O
a O
high O
level O
and O
focus O
on O
the O
dramatic O
performance O
improvements O
brought O
by O
deep O
learning O
. O

The O
paper O
is O
split O
according O
to O
the O
classic O

- O
stage O

dichotomy O
: O

we O
detail O
a O
deep O

model O

model O
. O

and O

from O

, O

and O

a O

- O
facing O
impact O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
present O
a O
new O
approach O
based O
on O
neural O
networks O
to O
solve O
the O
merging O
strategy O
problem O
for O
Cross O
- O
Lingual O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
CLIR O

In O
addition O
to O
language O
barrier O
issues O
in O
CLIR O
systems O
, O
how O
to O
merge O
a O
ranked O
list O
that O
contains O
documents O
in O
different O
languages O
from O
several O
text O
collections O
is O
also O
critical O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
merging O
strategy O
based O
on O
competitive O
learning O
to O
obtain O
a O
single O
ranking O
of O
documents O
merging O
the O
individual O
lists O
from O
the O
separate O
retrieved O
documents O
. O

The O
main O
contribution O
of O
the O
paper O
is O
to O
show O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
Learning O
Vector O
Quantization O
( O
LVQ O
) O
algorithm O
in O
solving O
the O
merging O
problem O
. O

In O
order O
to O
investigate O
the O
effects O
of O
varying O
the O
number O
of O
codebook O
vectors O
, O
we O
have O
carried O
out O
several O
experiments O
with O
different O
values O
for O
this O
parameter O
. O

The O
results O
demonstrate O
that O
the O
LVQ O
algorithm O
is O
a O
good O
alternative O
merging O
strategy O
. O

suggest O

as O
the O

of O

( O

not O

” O

- O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Classical O
retrieval O
models O
support O

- O
oriented O
searching O
for O
documents O

a O
set O
of O
words O
as O
data O
model O
. O

However O
, O

and O

want O
to O
consider O
the O
link O
structure O
and O

of O

pure O
content O
. O

on O

for O

to O

of O
documents O
, O
to O

of O
documents O
, O
and O
to O

database O

values O
of O
documents O
. O

The O

to O
find O
a O

function O
which O
yields O

weights O
for O
ranking O
the O
documents O

respect O
to O

of O

. O

of O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

With O

. O

for O

of O

are O
being O

. O

This O
research O
paper O

the O

of O

based O

of O
information O
. O

First O
ontology O
was O

which O
was O
published O
on O
the O

. O

Then O

was O
loaded O
to O

data O

. O

Using O
PHP O
language O
information O
from O
this O

is O
retrieved O
using O
SPARQL O
. O

WAMP O
server O
which O
is O
a O
package O
comprising O
of O
Apache O
, O
MySQL O
and O
PHP O
is O
used O
for O
the O
process O
. O

This O
paper O
demonstrates O
the O
dominant O
nature O
of O
information O
retrieval O
from O
the O
web O
using O
semantic O
technologies O
. O

- O

aim O
at O

to O

. O

, O

for O

. O

. O

concept O
space O
defined O

of O

of O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Recognition O

which O

of O

Collecting O
such O
quantities O
of O
data O

significant O

cost O
owing O
to O
the O

of O

. O

For O

. O

used O

Learning O

from O

. O

Our O

to O

whole O
data O

such O
a O
strategy O
. O

This O
suggests O
that O

techniques O
can O
be O

to O

of O

resources O
for O

. O

. O

. O

Conversely O
, O
context O
is O
proposed O
to O
reduce O
users O
time O
and O
effort O
. O

The O
recognition O
of O
context O
is O
supported O
by O
the O
availability O
of O
embedded O
sensors O
in O
mobile O
devices O
. O

In O
this O

, O
the O

and O

for O

are O
proposed O
. O

The O

- O
in O
- O
time&#x201D O
; O
approach O
is O
exploited O
in O
which O
the O
relevant O
information O
is O

without O

. O

This O
will O

effort O
, O

and O
interaction O
and O
present O
the O
relevant O
information O

and O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
use O
of O
structured O
documents O
following O
XML O
representation O
allows O
us O
to O
create O
content O
and O
structure O
( O
CAS O
) O
queries O
which O
are O
more O
specific O
for O
the O
user O
’s O
needs O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
are O
going O
to O
study O
how O
to O
enrich O
this O
kind O
of O
queries O
with O
the O
user O
feedback O
in O
order O
to O
get O
results O
closer O
to O
their O
needs O
. O

More O
formally O
, O
we O
are O
considering O
how O
to O
perform O
Relevance O
Feedback O
( O
RF O
) O
for O
CAS O
queries O
in O
XML O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

Our O
approach O
maintains O
the O
same O
structural O
constraints O
but O
expands O
the O
content O
of O
the O
queries O
by O
adding O
new O
keywords O
to O
the O
original O
CAS O
query O
. O

These O
new O
terms O
are O
selected O
by O
considering O
their O
presence O
/ O
absence O
in O
the O
jugded O
units O
. O

This O
RF O
method O
is O
integrated O
in O
a O
XML O
- O
based O
search O
engine O
and O
evaluated O
with O
the O
INEX O
2006 O
and O
INEX O
2007 O
collections O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
retrieval O
is O
the O
selection O
of O
documents O
relevant O
to O
a O
query O
. O

Inverted O
index O
is O
the O
conventional O
way O
to O
store O
the O
index O
of O
the O
collection O
. O

Because O
of O
the O
large O
amounts O
of O
data O
, O
compression O
techniques O
are O
commonly O
used O
in O
information O
retrieval O
systems O
to O
reduce O
the O
size O
of O
the O
inverted O
index O
. O

We O
experimentally O
evaluate O
the O
result O
of O
the O
mapping O
of O
such O
techniques O
on O
the O
Compressed O
Sparse O
Row O
( O
CSR O
) O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
Our O
experimental O
results O
, O
using O
some O
of O
these O
compression O
techniques O
such O
Elais O
Gamma O
, O
Golomb O
, O
Interpolative O
, O
and O
fixed O
length O
Byte O
- O
Aligned O
, O
demonstrate O
that O
such O
techniques O
can O
easily O
be O
applied O
to O
compress O
the O
index O
in O
CSR O
IR O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
information O
retrieval O
, O
learning O
to O
rank O
constructs O
a O
machine O
- O
based O
ranking O
model O
which O
given O
a O
query O
, O
sorts O
the O
search O
results O
by O
their O
degree O
of O
relevance O
or O
importance O
to O
the O
query O
. O

Neural O
networks O
have O
been O
successfully O
applied O
to O
this O
problem O
, O
and O
in O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
an O
attention O
- O
based O
deep O
neural O
network O
which O
better O
incorporates O
different O
embeddings O
of O
the O
queries O
and O
search O
results O
with O
an O
attention O
- O
based O
mechanism O
. O

This O
model O
also O
applies O
a O
decoder O
mechanism O
to O
learn O
the O
ranks O
of O
the O
search O
results O
in O
a O
listwise O
fashion O
. O

The O
embeddings O
are O
trained O
with O
convolutional O
neural O
networks O
or O
the O
word2vec O
model O
. O

We O
demonstrate O
the O
performance O
of O
this O
model O
with O
image O
retrieval O
and O
text O
querying O
data O
sets O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

to O

by O

of O

and O

Results O
show O
that O
semantic O
information O
, O
specifically O
the O

of O
concepts O
and O
relations O
, O
increases O
the O
precision O
in O

. O

- O

of O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
presents O
UOWD O
- O
Sharif O
team O
’s O
approach O
for O
XML O
information O
retrieval O
. O

This O
approach O
is O
an O
extension O
of O
PLIR O
which O
is O
an O
experimental O
knowledge O
- O
based O
information O
retrieval O
system O
. O

This O
system O
like O
PLIR O
utilizes O
plausible O
inferences O
to O
first O
infer O
the O
relevance O
of O
sentences O
in O
XML O
documents O
and O
then O
propagates O
the O
relevance O
to O
the O
other O
textual O
units O
in O
the O
document O
tree O
. O

Two O
approaches O
have O
been O
used O
for O
propagation O
of O
confidence O
. O

The O
first O
approach O
labeled O
“ O
propagate O
- O
DS O
” O
first O
propagates O
the O
confidence O
from O
sentences O
to O
upper O
elements O
and O
then O
combines O
these O
evidences O
by O
applying O
Dempster O
- O
Shafer O
theory O
of O
evidence O
to O
estimate O
the O
confidence O
in O
that O
element O
. O

The O
second O
approach O

DS O
- O
propagate O
” O
first O
applies O
the O
Dempster O
- O
Shafer O
theory O
of O
evidence O
to O
combine O
the O
evidences O
and O
then O
propagates O
the O
combined O
confidence O
to O
the O
parent O
element O
. O

The O
second O
approach O
performs O
relatively O
better O
than O
the O
first O
approach O
. O

, O

- O

- O

approach O
to O
the O
model O

problem O
, O
which O
automatically O
selects O
the O
best O
- O
performing O
retrieval O
model O
before O
the O
retrieval O
process O
takes O
place O
. O

In O
this O

, O

are O

according O
to O
their O
statistics O
and O
the O
bestperforming O

model O
is O

to O

. O

closest O
cluster O
to O
the O

, O

model O
associated O
to O

. O

We O
evaluate O
the O

approach O
on O
the O
disk1&2 O
of O
the O
TREC O
collections O
. O

The O

show O
that O
our O
model O
selection O
approach O
achieves O
stable O
performance O
, O
which O
could O
outperform O
the O
use O
of O
the O
optimal O

model O
indifferently O
for O
each O

. O

The O

that O

, O
a O
retrieval O
model O
provides O
consistent O
performance O
for O

to O

same O
cluster O
. O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

When O

with O

scale O

, O

sets O
are O
huge O
and O
very O
often O
not O
obvious O
to O
tackle O
with O
traditional O
approaches O
. O

In O
web O
information O
retrieval O
, O
the O
greater O
the O
number O
of O
documents O
to O
be O
searched O
, O
the O
more O
powerful O
approach O
required O
. O

In O
this O
work O
, O
we O
develop O
document O
search O
processes O
based O
on O
particle O
swarm O
optimization O
and O
show O
that O
they O
improve O
the O
performance O
of O
information O

web O

. O

Two O

and O

are O

for O

. O

and O

. O

on O
all O
the O
others O
in O
terms O
of O

comparable O
quality O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Database O
technology O
offers O
design O
methodologies O
to O
rapidly O
develop O
and O
deploy O
applications O
that O
are O
easy O
to O
understand O
, O
document O
and O
teach O
. O

It O
can O
be O
argued O
that O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
lacks O
equivalent O
methodologies O
. O

This O
poster O
discusses O
a O
generic O
data O
model O
, O
the O
Probabilistic O
Object O
- O
Oriented O
Content O
Model O
, O
that O
facilitates O
solving O
complex O
IR O
tasks O
. O

The O
model O
guides O
how O
data O
and O
queries O
are O
represented O
and O
how O
retrieval O
strategies O
are O
built O
and O
customised O
. O

Application O
/ O
task O
- O
specific O
schemas O
can O
also O
be O
derived O
from O
the O
generic O
model O
. O

This O
eases O
the O
process O
of O
tailoring O
search O
to O
a O
specific O
task O
by O
offering O
a O
layered O
architecture O
and O
well O
- O
defined O
schema O
mappings O
. O

Different O
types O
of O
knowledge O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
first O
proposes O
a O
new O
efficient O
algorithm O
for O
extracting O
similar O
sections O
between O
two O

sequence O
data O
sets O
. O

The O
algorithm O
is O
called O
Relay O
Continuous O

Programming O
: O
Relay O
CDP O
, O
which O
realizes O
fast O
matching O
between O

sections O
in O
the O
reference O
pattern O
and O
the O
input O
speech O
and O
enables O

similar O
sections O
frame O
- O
synchronously O
. O

We O
extend O

CDP O
to O
extract O
repeated O
utterances O
in O
a O
presentation O
speech O
because O
the O
repeated O
utterances O

such O
as O
the O
same O
words O
, O
same O
phrases O
or O
same O
sentences O
, O
are O
assumed O
to O
be O
important O
phrases O
in O
the O
speech O
. O

Those O
repeated O
utterances O
can O
be O
regarded O
as O
some O
labels O
for O
information O
retrieval O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
detail O
of O
Relay O
CDP O
and O
the O
performance O
, O
which O
is O
evaluated O
for O
extracting O
the O
similar O
sections O
between O
two O
speech O
data O
sets O
and O
for O
identifying O
the O
repeated O
utterances O
by O
extracting O
similar O
sections O
in O
a O
presentation O
speech O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

spectrum O
imaging O
has O
received O
much O
attention O
, O
action O
recognition O
in O
infrared O
( O
IR O
) O
videos O
is O
significantly O
less O
explored O
. O

Our O

is O
to O
exploit O
imaging O
data O
in O
this O
modality O
for O
the O
action O

. O

In O

propose O
a O

- O

convolutional O
neural O

the O
discriminative O
code O
layer O
and O

corresponding O
discriminative O

loss O

. O

The O
proposed O

processes O

and O
the O
IR O
- O
based O
optical O
flow O
field O
sequences O
. O

We O

model O

the O

Sports-1 O
M O
action O

( O

) O

We O

( O

, O

state O
- O
of O
- O

- O
art O

-DOCSTART- O

Information O
Retrieval O
in O
large O
digital O
document O
repositories O
is O
at O
the O
same O
time O
a O
hard O
and O
crucial O
task O
. O

While O
the O
primary O
type O
of O
information O
available O
in O
documents O
is O
usually O
text O
, O
images O
play O
a O

important O
role O
because O
they O
pictorially O
describe O
concepts O
that O
are O
dealt O
with O
in O
the O
document O
. O

Unfortunately O
, O
the O
semantic O
gap O
separating O
such O
a O

content O
from O
the O
underlying O
meaning O
is O
very O
wide O
. O

Additionally O
image O
processing O
techniques O
are O
usually O
very O
demanding O
in O
computational O
resources O
. O

Hence O
, O
only O
recently O
the O
area O
of O
Content O
- O
Based O

Retrieval O
has O
gained O
more O
attention O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
describe O
a O
new O
technique O
to O
identify O
known O
objects O
in O
a O
picture O
based O
on O
a O
comparison O
of O
the O
shapes O
to O
known O
models O
. O

The O
comparison O
works O
by O
progressive O
approximations O
to O
save O
computational O
resources O
, O
and O
relies O
on O
novel O
algorithmic O
and O
representational O
solutions O
to O
improve O
preliminary O
shape O
extraction O
. O

reality O

” O

to O

in O
them O
. O

In O
addition O
to O
this O
, O
it O
gives O
the O
opportunity O
to O
interact O
with O
the O
virtual O
environment O
in O
real O
time O
, O
to O
rotate O
the O
objects O
presented O
in O
scene O
and O
observe O
their O
detail O
. O

It O
also O
establishes O
links O
between O
the O
objects O
of O
the O
scene O
and O
any O
database O
and O
allows O
user O
to O
obtain O
additional O
information O
about O
the O
places O
or O
objects O
. O

The O
system O
can O
be O

by O

as O

tool O

will O
help O

in O

( O

, O

) O
of O

. O

for O

-DOCSTART- O

A O
retrodirective O
transponder O
based O
on O
a O
novel O
compact O
phaseconjugating O
mixer O
with O
conversion O
gain O
has O
been O
developed O
. O

The O
active O
circuit O
uses O
one O
port O
for O
both O
incoming O
and O
outgoing O
signals O
, O
enabling O
a O
reduction O
of O
circuit O
size O
, O
and O
the O
balanced O
structure O
provides O
suppression O
of O
undesired O
signals O
. O

By O
using O
a O
modulated O
local O
oscillator O
, O
the O
circuit O
can O
modulate O
the O
received O
signal O
in O
order O
to O
retransmit O
local O
information O
to O
the O
remote O
site O
. O

A O
microstrip O
antenna O
is O
integrated O
with O
the O
phase O
conjugator O
and O
the O
whole O
system O
was O
fabricated O
on O
a O
single O
substrate O
, O
enabling O
a O
one O
- O
card O
system O
. O

A O
four O
- O
element O
prototype O
array O
with O
0 O
5 O
array O
spacing O
demonstrated O
excellent O
measured O
retrodirectivity O
. O

Additionally O
, O
a O
simplified O
binary O
- O
phase O
- O
shift O
- O
keying O
signal O
transmitted O
by O
the O
array O
is O
recovered O
successfully O
at O
the O
source O
location O
, O
demonstrating O
great O
potential O
for O
remote O
tagging O
and O
wireless O
sensor O
applications O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Text O
Categorization O
( O
TC O
also O
known O
as O
Text O
Classification O
, O
is O
the O
task O
of O
automatically O
classifying O
a O
set O
of O
text O
documents O
into O
different O
categories O
from O
a O
predefined O
set O
. O

If O
a O
document O
belongs O
to O
exactly O
one O
of O
the O
categories O
, O
it O
is O
a O
single O
- O
label O
classification O
task O
; O
otherwise O
, O
it O
is O
a O
multi O
- O
label O
classification O
task O
. O

TC O
uses O
several O
tools O
from O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
and O
Machine O
Learning O
( O
ML O
) O
and O
has O
received O
much O
attention O
in O
the O
last O
years O
from O
both O
researchers O
in O
the O
academia O
and O
industry O
developers O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
first O
categorize O
the O
documents O
using O
KNN O
based O
machine O
learning O
approach O
and O
then O
return O
the O
most O
relevant O
documents O
. O

a O

from O
the O

-DOCSTART- O

Language O
modeling O
approaches O
to O
information O
retrieval O
are O
attractive O
and O
promising O
because O
they O
connect O
the O
problem O
of O
retrieval O
with O
that O
of O
language O
model O
estimation O
, O
which O
has O
been O
studied O
extensively O
in O
other O
application O
areas O
such O
as O
speech O
recognition O
. O

The O
basic O
idea O
of O
these O
approaches O
is O
to O
estimate O
a O
language O
model O
for O
each O
document O
, O
and O
then O
rank O
documents O
by O
the O
likelihood O
of O
the O
query O
according O
to O
the O
estimated O
language O
model O
. O

A O
core O
problem O
in O
language O
model O
estimation O
is O
smoothing O
, O
which O
adjusts O
the O
maximum O
likelihood O
estimator O
so O
as O
to O
correct O
the O
inaccuracy O
due O
to O
data O
sparseness O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
study O
the O
problem O
of O
language O
model O
smoothing O
and O
its O
influence O
on O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

We O
examine O
the O
sensitivity O
of O
retrieval O
performance O
to O
the O
smoothing O
parameters O
and O
compare O
several O
popular O
smoothing O
methods O
on O
different O
test O
collection O
. O

is O
need O
for O

systems O

results O
of O

broief O

are O
reported O
here O
. O

. O

The O

, O

- O

to O

< O
i O
> O
post O
hoc</i O
> O

of O

. O

improved O
both O

( O

of O

to O

information O
more O

and O

and O

to O

. O

effort O
is O

of O

( O

to O
perform O
more O
actions O
than O
lower O

. O

( O

. O

differently O
in O

of O

. O

Document O

which O
have O

Bonner O

Rocchio O

, O

against O

. O

> O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

To O
assist O
a O
user O
in O
an O
information O
search O
on O
the O
web O
, O
an O
agent O
needs O
a O
model O
of O
the O
user O
’s O
interests O
and O
mechanisms O
to O
interpret O
queries O
and O
evaluate O
the O
relevance O
of O
documents O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
system O
where O
a O
user O
profile O
is O
built O
from O
a O
personal O
document O
archive O
managed O
by O
the O
user O
and O
a O
task O
context O
is O
computed O
when O
a O
user O
submits O
a O
query O
, O
from O
her O
/ O
his O
profile O
and O
an O
action O
log O
built O
by O
tracking O
the O
user O
’s O
activity O
. O

A O
query O
is O
then O
interpreted O
through O
a O
vocabulary O
learning O
step O
, O
where O
terms O
in O
the O
context O
are O
selected O
, O
and O
a O
query O
learning O
step O
, O
where O
new O
queries O
are O
built O
by O
the O
conjunction O
of O
terms O
of O
the O
initial O
query O
with O
terms O
of O
the O
vocabulary O
. O

First O
results O

and O
future O
directions O
, O
concerning O
the O
relative O
evaluation O
of O
this O
system O
, O
are O
considered O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
aim O
of O
this O
research O
is O
twofold O
. O

On O
the O
one O
hand O
, O
high O
accuracy O
retrieval O
has O
been O
a O
concern O
of O
the O
information O
retrieval O
community O
for O
some O
time O
. O

We O
aim O
to O
investigate O
this O
issue O
via O
data O
fusion O
. O

On O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
correlation O
among O
component O
results O
has O
been O
proven O
to O
be O
harmful O
to O
data O
fusion O
, O
but O
has O
not O
been O
taken O
into O
account O
in O

algorithms O
. O

This O
paper O
reports O
on O
recent O
work O
in O
the O
field O
of O
information O
retrieval O
that O
attempts O
to O
go O
beyond O
the O
overly O
simplified O
approach O
of O
representing O
documents O
and O
queries O
as O
bags O
of O
words O
. O

Simple O
models O
make O
it O
difficult O
to O
accurately O
model O
a O
user O
’s O
information O
need O
. O

The O
model O
presented O
in O
the O
paper O
is O
based O
on O
Markov O
random O
fields O
and O
allows O
almost O
arbitrary O
features O
to O
be O
encoded O
. O

This O
provides O
a O
powerful O
mechanism O
for O
modeling O
many O
of O
the O
implicit O
constraints O
a O
user O
has O
in O
mind O
when O
formulating O
a O
query O
. O

Simple O
instantiations O
of O
the O
model O
that O
consider O
dependencies O
between O
the O
terms O
in O
a O
query O
have O
shown O
to O
significantly O
outperform O
bag O
of O
words O
models O
. O

Further O
extensions O
of O
the O
model O
are O
possible O
to O
incorporate O
even O
more O
complex O
constraints O
based O
other O
domain O
knowledge O
. O

Finally O
, O
we O
describe O
what O
place O
our O
model O
has O
within O
the O
broader O
realm O
of O
artificial O
intelligence O
and O
propose O
several O
open O
questions O
that O
may O
be O
of O
general O
interest O
to O
the O
field O
. O

for O
a O

algorithm O

expected O

( O

the O
matrix O
elements O
) O
of O
the O

. O

. O

Numerical O

-DOCSTART- O

Named O
Entity O
Recognition O
( O
NER O
) O
is O
the O
subtask O
of O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
( O
NLP O
) O
which O
is O
the O
branch O
of O
artificial O
intelligence O
. O

It O
has O
many O
applications O
mainly O
in O
machine O
translation O
, O
text O
to O
speech O
synthesis O
, O
natural O
language O
understanding O
, O
Information O
Extraction O
, O
Information O
retrieval O
, O
question O
answering O
etc O
. O

The O
aim O
of O
NER O
is O
to O
classify O
words O
into O
some O
predefined O
categories O
like O
location O
name O
, O
person O
name O
, O
organization O
name O
, O
date O
, O
time O
etc O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
describe O
the O
Hidden O
Markov O
Model O
( O
HMM O
) O
based O
approach O
of O
machine O
learning O
in O
detail O
to O
identify O
the O
named O
entities O
. O

The O
main O
idea O
behind O
the O
use O
of O
HMM O
model O
for O
building O
NER O
system O
is O
that O
it O
is O
language O
independent O
and O
we O
can O
apply O
this O
system O
for O
any O
language O
domain O
. O

In O
our O
NER O
system O
the O
states O
are O
not O
fixed O
means O
it O
is O
of O
dynamic O
in O
nature O
one O
can O
use O
it O
according O
to O
their O
interest O
. O

The O
corpus O
used O
by O
our O
NER O
system O
is O
also O
not O
domain O
specific O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

GeoFEM O
is O
a O

nite O
element O
analysis O
system O
intended O
for O
multiphysics O
/ O
multi O
- O
scale O
problems O

being O

at O
RIST O
. O

Within O
\Earth O
Simulator O
" O
project O
, O

with O

and O

\Earth O
Simulator O
Since O

. O

. O

be O

to O

problems O
in O
the O
scale O
of O
100 O
million O
degree O
of O
freedoms O
. O

This O
article O
examines O
and O
extends O
the O
logical O
models O
of O
information O
retrieval O
in O
the O
context O
of O
probability O
theory O
. O

The O
fundamental O
notions O
of O
term O
weights O
and O
relevance O
are O
given O
probabilistic O
interpretations O
. O

A O
unified O
framework O
is O
developed O
for O
modeling O
the O
retrieval O
process O
with O
probabilistic O
inference O
. O

This O
new O
approach O
provides O
a O
common O
conceptual O
and O
mathematical O
basis O
for O
many O
retrieval O
models O
, O
such O
as O
the O
Boolean O
, O
fuzzy O
set O
, O
vector O
space O
, O
and O
conventional O
probabilistic O
models O
. O

Within O
this O
framework O
, O
the O
underlying O
assumptions O
employed O
by O
each O
model O
are O
identified O
, O
and O
the O
inherent O
relationships O
between O
these O
models O
are O
analyzed O
. O

Although O
this O
article O
is O
mainly O
a O
theoretical O
analysis O
of O
probabilistic O
inference O
for O
information O
retrieval O
, O
practical O
methods O
for O
estimating O
the O
required O
probabilities O
are O
provided O
by O
simple O
examples O
. O

Document O
representation O
is O
a O
crucial O
step O
in O
any O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
system O
. O

Since O
most O
of O
the O
traditional O
methods O
do O
not O
consider O
much O
of O
semantic O
or O
syntactic O
information O
, O
the O
representation O
becomes O
insufficiently O
informative O
for O
an O
IR O
task O
. O

We O
describe O
a O
novel O
approach O
to O
incorporating O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
( O
NLP O
) O
in O
document O
representation O
for O
addressing O
this O
problem O
. O

Use O
is O
made O
of O
additional O
information O
about O
the O
sentences O
, O
viz O
i O
) O
syntactic O
links O
among O
the O
words O
found O
by O
the O
Link O
Parser O
and O
( O
ii O
) O
heuristically O
determined O
semantic O
attributes O
of O
the O
words O
. O

After O
mapping O
this O
information O
to O
the O
document O
level O
using O
Self O
- O
Organizing O
Map O
( O
SOM O
we O
use O
it O
for O
embellishing O
the O
document O
vectors O
constructed O
by O
the O
TFIDF O
method O
. O

The O
efficacy O
of O
the O
proposed O
method O
is O
established O
by O
showing O
that O
the O
document O
vectors O
( O
i O
) O
have O
higher O
mutual O
information O
content O
and O
( O
ii O
) O
achieve O
better O
class O
separation O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
Retrieval O
methods O
have O
been O
largely O
adopted O
to O
identify O
traceability O
links O
based O
on O
the O
textual O
similarity O
of O
software O
artifacts O
. O

However O
, O
noise O
due O
to O
word O
usage O
in O
software O
artifacts O
might O
negatively O
affect O
the O
recovery O
accuracy O
. O

We O
propose O
the O
use O
of O
smoothing O
filters O
to O
reduce O
the O
effect O
of O
noise O
in O
software O
artifacts O
and O
improve O
the O
performances O
of O
traceability O
recovery O
methods O
. O

An O
empirical O
evaluation O
performed O
on O
two O
repositories O
indicates O
that O
the O
usage O
of O
a O
smoothing O
filter O
is O
able O
to O
significantly O
improve O
the O
performances O
of O
Vector O
Space O
Model O
and O
Latent O
Semantic O
Indexing O
. O

Such O
a O
result O
suggests O
that O
other O
than O
being O
used O
for O
traceability O
recovery O
the O
proposed O
filter O
can O
be O
used O
to O
improve O
performances O
of O
various O
other O
software O
engineering O
approaches O
based O
on O
textual O
analysis O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
describe O
our O
experiments O
carried O
out O
for O
the O
robust O

sense O
disambiguation O
( O
WSD O
) O

of O
the O
CLEF O
2009 O
campaign O
. O

This O
track O
consists O
of O
a O
monolingual O
and O
bilingual O
task O
and O
addresses O
information O
retrieval O
utilizing O
word O
sense O
annotations O
. O

We O
took O
part O
in O
the O
monolingual O
task O
only O
. O

Our O
objective O
was O
twofold O
. O

On O
the O

hand O
, O

to O
increase O
the O
precision O
of O

by O
a O
heuristic O
- O
based O
combination O
of O
the O
annotations O
of O
the O
two O
WSD O
systems O
. O

For O
this O
, O
we O
provide O
an O
extrinsic O
evaluation O
on O
different O
levels O
of O
word O
sense O
accuracy O
. O

On O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
we O
aimed O
at O
combining O
an O
often O
used O
probabilistic O
model O
, O
namely O
the O
Divergence O
From O
Randomness O
BM25 O
model O

( O
DFR O
BM25 O
with O
a O
monolingual O
translation O
- O
based O
model O
. O

Our O
best O
performing O
system O
with O
and O
without O
utilizing O
word O
senses O
ranked O
1st O
overall O
in O
the O
monolingual O
task O
. O

However O
, O
we O
could O
not O
observe O
any O
improvement O
by O
applying O
the O
sense O
annotations O
compared O
to O
the O
retrieval O
settings O
based O
on O
tokens O
or O
lemmas O
only O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

With O
advent O
of O
internet O
, O
there O
has O
been O
tremendous O
surge O
in O
search O
for O
videos O
. O

Research O
suggests O
that O
users O
spend O
a O
lot O
of O
time O
browsing O
: O
viewing O
part O
of O
one O
video O
after O
another O
while O
watching O
only O
a O
few O
of O
the O
videos O
to O
its O
completion O
. O

This O
is O
termed O
as O
seek O
, O
a O
special O
form O
of O
browsing O
repeating O
partial O
viewing O
of O
the O
same O
video O
. O

This O
impacts O
the O
network O
bandwidth O
resulting O
in O
streaming O
issues O
with O
the O
browser O
. O

We O
propose O
to O
devise O
a O
system O
where O
the O
user O
would O
be O
able O
to O
view O
pre O
selected O
video O
sequence O
which O
would O
contain O
parts O
required O
by O
the O
user O
. O

This O
method O
of O
video O
browsing O
would O
be O
significant O
improvement O
over O
the O
traditional O
video O
browsing O
in O
terms O
of O
efficiency O
and O
user O
friendliness O
. O

— O

processing O
, O
frames O
, O

recognition O
, O

indexing O
, O

content O
tags O

Information O
retrieval O
systems O
are O
being O
challenged O
to O
managelarger O
and O
larger O
document O
collections O
. O

In O
an O
effort O
to O
providebetter O
retrieval O
performance O
on O
large O
collections O
, O
moresophisticated O
retrieval O
techniques O
have O
been O
developed O
that O
supportrich O
, O
structured O
queries O
. O

Structured O
queries O
are O
not O
amenable O
topreviously O
proposed O
optimization O
techniques O
. O

Optimizing O
execution O
, O
however O
, O
is O
even O
more O
important O
in O
the O
context O
of O
large O
documentcollections O
. O

We O

a O
new O

which O
we O
have O
implemented O
in O

inference O
network O
- O
basedinformation O

system O
. O

that O
queryevaluation O
time O
can O
be O
reduced O
by O
more O
than O
half O
with O
little O
impacton O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Cross O
- O
modal O
retrieval O
is O
a O
classic O
research O
topic O
in O
multimedia O
information O
retrieval O
. O

The O
traditional O
approaches O
study O
the O
problem O
as O
a O
pairwise O
similarity O
function O
problem O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
consider O
this O
problem O
from O
a O
new O
perspective O
as O
a O
listwise O
ranking O
problem O
and O
propose O
a O
general O
cross O
- O
modal O
ranking O
algorithm O
to O
optimize O
the O
listwise O
ranking O
loss O
with O
a O
low O
rank O
embedding O
, O
which O
we O
call O
Latent O
Semantic O
Cross O
- O
Modal O
Ranking O
( O
LSCMR O

The O
latent O
low O
- O
rank O
embedding O
space O
is O
discriminatively O
learned O
by O
structural O
large O
margin O
learning O
to O
optimize O
for O
certain O
ranking O
criteria O
directly O
. O

We O
evaluate O
LSCMR O
on O
the O
Wikipedia O
and O
NUS O
- O
WIDE O
dataset O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
this O
method O
obtains O
significant O
improvements O
over O
the O
state O
- O
of O
- O
the O
- O
art O
methods O
. O

The O

and O

ngä O
aho O
whakamäori O
- O
ä O
- O
tuhi O
was O
designed O
to O
provide O
single O
head O
- O
word O
translations O
to O
on O
- O
line O
web O
users O
. O

There O
are O
over O
13,000 O
words O

on O
traditional O

sources O
, O
derived O
because O
of O
their O
high O
frequency O
used O
within O

the O

. O

The O

has O
been O
operational O
for O
well O
over O
a O
year O
now O
, O
and O
it O
has O
had O
the O
highest O
web O
traffic O
usage O
in O
the O
Department O
of O
Information O
Science O
. O

files O
were O
generated O
to O
record O
domain O
hits O
and O
language O
translations O
, O
both O
provided O
the O
up O
- O
to O
- O
date O
data O
for O
analysis O
contained O
in O
this O
paper O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
development O
and O

support O

( O

where O

target O
may O

) O

. O

tf O
- O
idf O
and O

for O

. O

Graphical O
models O
have O
been O
applied O
to O
various O
information O
retrieval O
and O
natural O
language O
processing O
tasks O
in O
the O
recent O
literature O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
apply O
a O
probabilistic O
graphical O
model O
for O
answer O
ranking O
in O
question O
answering O
. O

This O
model O
estimates O
the O
joint O
probability O
of O
correctness O
of O
all O
answer O
candidates O
, O
from O
which O
the O
probability O
of O
correctness O
of O
an O
individual O
candidate O
can O
be O
inferred O
. O

The O
joint O
prediction O
model O
can O
estimate O
both O
the O
correctness O
of O
individual O
answers O
as O
well O
as O
their O
correlations O
, O
which O
enables O
a O
list O
of O
accurate O
and O
comprehensive O
answers O
. O

This O
model O
was O
compared O
with O
a O
logistic O
regression O
model O
which O
directly O
estimates O
the O
probability O
of O
correctness O
of O
each O
individual O
answer O
candidate O
. O

An O
extensive O
set O
of O
empirical O
results O
based O
on O
TREC O
questions O
demonstrates O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
joint O
model O
for O
answer O
ranking O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
we O
combine O
the O
joint O
model O
with O
the O
logistic O
regression O
model O
to O
improve O
the O
efficiency O
and O
accuracy O
of O
answer O
ranking O
. O

A O
multimedia O
report O
is O
a O
multimedia O
presentation O
which O
integrates O
data O
returned O
by O
one O
or O
more O
queries O
to O
a O
multimedia O
database O
, O
thus O
extending O
the O
concept O
of O
report O
familiar O
in O
traditional O
structured O
databases O
. O

In O
such O
a O
scenario O
information O
retrieval O
consists O
in O
building O
a O
continuous O
presentation O
in O
which O
the O
retrieved O
data O
are O
located O
, O
connected O
, O
synchronized O
and O
coherently O
presented O
to O
a O
user O
. O

We O
discuss O
modelling O
of O

reports O
in O
terms O
of O
data O
co O
- O
ordination O
and O
synchronization O
, O
based O
on O
a O
synchronization O
model O
we O
have O
defined O
for O
specifying O
complex O
multimedia O
presentations O
. O

As O
in O
a O
report O
the O
user O
can O
browse O
the O
returned O
data O
without O
loosing O
consistency O
, O
in O
a O
multimedia O
report O
moving O
along O
the O
presentation O
time O
requires O
appropriate O
synchronization O
to O
be O
guaranteed O
. O

This O
paper O
reports O
improvement O
of O
indirect O
matching O
, O
which O
is O
a O
fast O
CBMIR O
( O
content O
- O
based O
music O
information O
retrieval O
) O
framework O
proposed O
in O
our O
previous O
study O
. O

Indirect O
matching O
achieves O
fast O
retrieval O
by O
combining O
offline O
search O
with O
representative O
queries O
and O
online O
quick O
similarity O
estimation O
based O
on O
the O
results O
of O
the O
offline O
search O
. O

We O
have O
found O
that O
the O
retrieval O
accuracy O
of O
indirect O
matching O
decreases O
when O
representative O
queries O
have O
little O
variation O
. O

This O
paper O
proposes O
a O
method O
for O
selecting O
representative O
queries O
having O
wide O
variation O
. O

To O
ensure O
wide O
variation O
between O
representative O
queries O
, O
the O
proposed O
method O
combines O
MDS O
( O
multi O
- O
dimensional O
scaling O
) O
and O
Ward O
's O
clustering O
. O

Experimental O
results O
have O
shown O
that O
the O
retrieval O
accuracy O
of O
indirect O
matching O
can O
be O
stabilized O
by O
the O
proposed O
method O
. O

This O
paper O
focuses O
on O
the O
problem O
of O
ranking O
documents O
for O
Geographic O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

It O
aims O
to O
demonstrate O
that O
by O
using O
some O
query O
- O
related O
example O
texts O
it O
is O
possible O
to O
improve O
the O
final O
ranking O
of O
the O
retrieved O
documents O
. O

Experimental O
results O
indicated O
that O
our O
approach O
could O
improve O
the O
MAP O
of O
some O
sets O
of O
retrieved O
documents O
using O
only O
two O
example O
texts O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
probabilistic O
approaches O
to O
information O
retrieval O
, O
the O
occurrence O
of O
a O
query O
term O
in O
a O
document O
contributes O
to O
the O
probability O
that O
the O
document O
will O
be O
judged O
relevant O
. O

It O
is O
typically O
assumed O
that O
the O
weight O
assigned O
to O
a O
query O
term O
should O
be O
based O
on O
the O
expected O
value O
of O
that O
contribution O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
show O
that O
the O
degree O
to O
which O
observable O
document O
features O
such O
as O
term O
frequencies O
are O
expected O
to O
< O
i O
> O
vary</i O
> O
is O
also O
important O
. O

By O
means O
of O
stochastic O
simulation O
, O
we O
show O
that O
increased O
variance O
results O
in O
degraded O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

We O
further O
show O
that O
by O
decreasing O
term O
weights O
in O
the O
presence O
of O
variance O
, O
this O
degradation O
can O
be O
reduced O
. O

Hence O
, O
probabilistic O
models O
of O
information O
retrieval O
must O
take O
into O
account O
not O
only O
the O
expected O
value O
of O
a O
query O
term O
's O
contribution O
but O
also O
the O
variance O
of O
document O
features O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Identifying O
the O
most O
influential O
documents O
in O
a O
corpus O
is O
an O
important O
problem O
in O
many O
fields O
, O
from O
information O
science O
and O
historiography O
to O
text O
summarization O
and O
news O
aggregation O
. O

Unfortunately O
, O
traditional O
bibliometrics O
such O
as O
citations O
are O
often O
not O
available O
. O

We O
propose O
using O
changes O
in O
the O
thematic O
content O
of O
documents O
over O
time O
to O
measure O
the O
importance O
of O
individual O
documents O
within O
the O
collection O
. O

We O
describe O
a O
dynamic O
topic O
model O
for O
both O
quantifying O
and O
qualifying O
the O
impact O
of O
these O
documents O
. O

We O
validate O
the O
model O
by O
analyzing O
three O
large O
corpora O
of O
scientific O
articles O
. O

Our O
measurement O
of O
a O
document O
’s O
impact O
correlates O
significantly O
with O
its O
number O
of O
citations O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

This O

algorithms O
applied O
in O
the O
context O
of O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
First O
, O
a O
motivation O
of O
the O
utility O
of O
soft O
clustering O
approaches O
in O
IR O
is O
discussed O
. O

Then O
, O
an O
outline O
of O
the O
two O
main O
flat O
soft O
approaches O
, O
namely O
probabilistic O
clustering O
and O
fuzzy O
clustering O
, O
is O
described O
. O

Specifically O
, O
the O
expectation O
maximization O
and O
fuzzy O
c O
- O
means O
algorithms O
are O
introduced O
, O
and O
some O
of O
their O
extensions O
defined O
to O
overcome O
their O
main O
drawbacks O
when O
applied O
for O
organizing O
large O
document O
collections O
. O

Finally O
, O
soft O
hierarchical O
clustering O
algorithms O
designed O
for O
generating O
taxonomies O
of O
documents O
are O
introduced O
. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
number O
of O
users O
and O
the O
amount O
of O
information O
available O
has O
exploded O
since O
the O
advent O
of O
the O
World O
Wide O
Web O
( O
WWW O
Most O
of O
Web O
users O
use O
various O
search O
engines O
to O
get O
specific O
information O
. O

A O
key O
factor O
in O
the O
success O
of O
Web O
search O
engines O
are O
their O
ability O
to O
rapidly O
find O
good O
quality O
results O
to O
the O
queries O
that O
are O
based O
on O
specific O
terms O
. O

This O
paper O
aims O
at O
retrieving O
more O
relevant O
documents O
from O
a O
huge O
corpus O
based O
on O
the O
required O
information O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
text O
mining O
framework O
that O
consists O
of O
four O
distinct O
stages O
: O
1 O
. O

Text O
preprocessing O
2 O
. O

Dimensionality O
reduction O
using O
latent O
semantic O
indexing O
3 O
. O

Clustering O
based O
on O
hybrid O
combination O
of O
particle O
swarm O
optimization O
( O
PSO O
) O
and O
k O
- O
means O
algorithm O
4 O
. O

Information O
retrieval O
process O
using O
simulated O
annealing O
( O
SA O
This O
framework O
provides O
more O
relevant O
documents O
to O
the O
user O
and O
reduces O
the O
irrelevant O
documents O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Search O
tools O
are O
essential O
for O
an O
information O
system O
. O

Being O
syntax O
based O
, O
the O
existing O
search O
engines O
have O
a O
number O
of O
limitations O
in O
particular O
their O
difficulty O
in O
returning O
relevant O
results O
. O

Typically O
these O
limitations O
are O
partly O
mitigated O
through O
use O
of O
various O
customised O
techniques O
in O
order O
to O
provide O
the O
best O
possible O
user O
experience O
. O

Unlike O
conventional O
search O
engines O
, O
a O
semantic O
web O
search O
engine O
attaches O
meanings O
to O
key O
words O
. O

One O
of O
the O
biggest O
challenges O
for O
such O
a O
semantic O
search O
engine O
is O
to O
maintain O
the O
standard O
of O
user O
experience O
while O
serving O
its O
purpose O
of O
finding O
relevant O
data O
with O
meanings O
. O

A O
semantic O
search O
tool O
needs O
to O
both O
link O
meanings O
to O
search O
keywords O
and O
be O
able O
to O
efficiently O
retrieve O
information O
. O

The O
purpose O
of O
this O
work O
is O
to O
investigate O
the O
techniques O
that O
can O
be O
used O
for O
efficient O
information O
retrieval O
and O
effective O
user O
experience O
within O
the O
context O
of O
a O
semantic O
search O
engine O
. O

We O
propose O
two O
algorithms O
for O
query O
optimisation O
and O
ontology O
crawler O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

There O
is O
a O
great O
demand O
for O
highly O
accurate O
and O
timely O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O

Extraction O
in O

. O

To O

Notes O

) O

. O

and O

Open O
- O
set O
recognition O
, O
a O
challenging O
problem O
in O
computer O
vision O
, O
is O
concerned O
with O
identification O
or O
verification O
tasks O
where O
queries O
may O
belong O
to O
unknown O
classes O
. O

This O
work O
describes O
a O
fine O
- O
grained O
plant O
identification O
system O
consisting O
of O
an O
ensemble O
of O
deep O
convolutional O
neural O
networks O
, O
within O
an O

- O
set O
identification O
framework O
. O

Two O
wellknown O

architectures O
of O

and O
GoogLeNet O
, O
pretrained O
on O
the O
object O

of O

2012 O
, O
are O
fine O
- O
tuned O
using O
the O
plant O
dataset O
of O

2015 O
. O

Moreover O
, O

is O
finetuned O
using O
plant O
and O
non O
- O
plant O
images O
, O
to O
serve O
for O
rejecting O
samples O
from O
non O
- O
plant O
classes O
. O

Our O
systems O
have O
been O
evaluated O
on O
the O
test O
dataset O
of O
PlantCLEF O
2016 O
by O
the O
campaign O
organizers O
and O
the O
best O
proposed O
model O
has O
achieved O
an O
official O
score O
of O
0.738 O
in O
terms O
of O
the O
mean O
average O
precision O
, O
while O
the O
best O
official O
score O
was O
announced O
to O
be O
0.742 O
. O

. O

and O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Despite O
the O
widespread O
use O
of O
BM25 O
, O
there O
have O
been O
few O
studies O
examining O
its O
effectiveness O
on O
a O
document O
description O
over O
single O
and O
multiple O
field O
combinations O
. O

We O
determine O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
BM25 O
on O
various O
document O
fields O
. O

We O
find O
that O
BM25 O
models O
relevance O
on O
popularity O
fields O
such O
as O
anchor O
text O
and O
query O
click O
information O
no O
better O
than O
a O
linear O
function O
of O
the O
field O
attributes O
. O

We O
also O
find O
query O
click O
information O
to O
be O
the O
single O
most O
important O
field O
for O
retrieval O
. O

In O
response O
, O
we O
develop O
a O
machine O
learning O
approach O
to O
BM25-style O
retrieval O
that O
learns O
, O
using O
LambdaRank O
, O
from O
the O
input O
attributes O
of O
BM25 O
. O

Our O
model O
significantly O
improves O
retrieval O
effectiveness O
over O
BM25 O
and O
BM25F. O
Our O
data O
- O
driven O
approach O
is O
fast O
, O
effective O
, O
avoids O
the O
problem O
of O
parameter O
tuning O
, O
and O
can O
directly O
optimize O
for O
several O
common O
information O
retrieval O
measures O
. O

We O
demonstrate O
the O
advantages O
of O
our O
model O
on O
a O
very O
large O
real O
- O
world O
Web O
data O
collection O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
a O
new O
method O
for O
information O
retrieval O
( O
IR O
The O
main O
goal O
of O
this O
method O
is O
to O
enhance O
the O
core O
IR O
- O
process O
of O
finding O
relevant O
and O
only O
relevant O
documents O
in O
a O
set O
of O
documents O
. O

More O
precisely O
the O
method O
aims O
at O
increasing O
precision O
at O
top O
ranked O
documents O
. O

It O
is O
founded O
on O
previous O
works O
on O
graph O
matching O
and O
acknowledges O
the O
significance O
of O
structural O
similarity O
in O
making O
analogies O
. O

The O
method O
we O
propose O
is O
based O
on O
graph O
vertices O
comparison O
and O
involves O
recursive O
computation O
of O
similarity O
. O

It O
extends O
the O
principle O
stating O
that O
the O
resemblance O
of O
two O
vertices O
can O
be O
computed O
over O
the O
similarities O
of O
the O
vertices O
to O
which O
they O
are O
connected O
and O
takes O
into O
account O
the O
concept O
of O
similarity O
propagation O
within O
a O
graph O
. O

First O
results O
from O
conducted O
experiments O
show O
the O
feasibility O
and O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
our O
approach O
. O

Indeed O
, O
our O
method O
highly O
outperforms O
the O
vector O
- O
based O
cosine O
model O
and O
more O
than O
doubles O
the O
precision O
until O
top O
sixty O
returned O
documents O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Validation O
of O
Remote O
Sensing O
Content O
- O
Based O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
RS O
- O
CBIR O
) O
systems O
requires O
innovative O
strategies O
to O
overcome O
the O
scarcity O
of O
labeled O
data O
. O

CBIR O
systems O
validation O
by O
means O
of O
precision O
/ O
recall O
measures O
based O
on O
either O
, O
user O
’s O
feedback O
or O
a O
- O
priori O
known O
categories O
, O
are O
hard O
to O
apply O
to O
RS O
- O
CBIR O
systems O
. O

We O
propose O
to O
apply O
a O
datadriven O
( O
unsupervised O
) O
quality O
assessment O
strategy O
analogous O
to O
the O
DAMA O
strategy O
applied O
for O
the O
validation O
of O
classification O
methods O
used O
in O
thematic O
mapping O
. O

The O
strategy O
is O
intended O
for O
quality O
assessment O
when O
little O
or O
no O
ground O
truth O
is O
available O
. O

The O
proposed O
strategy O
deals O
with O
the O
RS O
- O
CBIR O
validation O
problem O
by O
giving O
a O
quantitative O
and O
qualitative O
evidence O
of O
the O
relative O
( O
subjective O
) O
quality O
of O
RS O
- O
CBIR O
systems O
without O
a O
- O
priori O
knowledge O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Personalized O
information O
retrieval O
and O
access O
is O
critical O
to O
applications O
in O
the O
medical O
and O
healthcare O
domain O
where O
the O
accuracy O
of O
the O
retrieved O
information O
and O
obtaining O
it O
in O
a O
time O
critical O
situation O
are O
extremely O
important O
. O

Existing O
personalized O
information O
retrieval O
and O
access O
approaches O
in O
the O
medical O
and O
healthcare O
domain O
have O
improved O
in O
the O
last O
decade O
, O
but O
the O
centralized O
system O
design O
principle O
is O
impeding O
their O
ability O
to O
be O
flexible O
and O
adaptive O
to O
changing O
demands O
. O

These O
demands O
arise O
from O
the O
environment O
in O
which O
the O
approaches O
are O
used O
and O
from O
changing O
user O
requirements O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
our O
preliminary O
ideas O
regarding O
a O
new O
component O
- O
based O
design O
philosophy O
for O
personalized O
information O
retrieval O
and O
access O
services O
. O

We O
believe O
this O
paper O
offers O
a O
new O
way O
of O
thinking O
about O
the O
retrieval O
of O
time O
critical O
, O
personalized O
information O
from O
medical O
information O
systems O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

We O
propose O
to O
use O
MapReduce O
to O
quickly O
test O
new O
retrieval O
approaches O
on O
a O
cluster O
of O
machines O
by O
sequentially O
scanning O
all O
documents O
. O

We O
present O
a O
small O
case O
study O
in O
which O
we O
use O
a O
cluster O
of O
15 O
low O
cost O
machines O
to O
search O
a O
web O
crawl O
of O
0.5 O
billion O
pages O
showing O
that O
sequential O
scanning O
is O
a O
viable O
approach O
to O
running O
large O
- O
scale O
information O
retrieval O
experiments O
with O
little O
effort O
. O

The O
code O
is O
available O
to O
other O
researchers O
at O
: O

-DOCSTART- O

This O
paper O
applies O
a O
fuzzy O
ontology O
framework O
to O
information O
retrieval O
system O
for O
enterprise O
management O
information O
system O
. O

The O
framework O
includes O
three O
parts O
: O
concepts O
, O
properties O
of O
concepts O
and O
values O
of O
properties O
, O
in O
which O
property O
's O
value O
can O
be O
either O
standard O
data O
type O
or O
linguistic O
values O
, O
i. O
e. O
fuzzy O
concepts O
. O

The O
fuzzy O
semantic O
query O
expansion O
is O
constructed O
by O
order O
relation O
, O
equivalence O
relation O
, O
inclusion O
relation O
and O
complement O
relation O
between O
fuzzy O
concepts O
defined O
in O
fuzzy O
linguistic O
variable O
ontology O
. O

The O
application O
to O
retrieve O
project O
information O
shows O
that O
the O
framework O
can O
overcome O
the O
localization O
of O
other O
fuzzy O
ontology O
's O
models O
, O
and O
this O
research O
facilitates O
the O
semantic O
retrieval O
of O
enterprise O
management O
information O
through O
fuzzy O
concepts O
on O
the O
Semantic O
Web O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
increase O
of O
voice O
- O
based O
interaction O
has O
changed O
the O
way O
people O
seek O
information O
, O
making O
search O
more O
conversational O
. O

Development O
of O
effective O
conversational O
approaches O
to O
search O
requires O
better O
understanding O
of O
how O
people O
express O
information O
needs O
in O
dialogue O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
the O
creation O
and O
examination O
of O
over O
32 O
K O
spoken O
utterances O
collected O
during O
34 O
hours O
of O
collaborative O
search O
tasks O
. O

The O
contribution O
of O
this O
work O
is O
three O
- O
fold O
. O

First O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
model O
of O
conversational O
information O
needs O
( O
CINs O
) O
based O
on O
a O
synthesis O
of O
relevant O
theories O
in O
Information O
Seeking O
and O
Retrieval O
. O

Second O
, O
we O
show O
several O
behavioural O
patterns O
of O
CINs O

by O
means O
of O

features O

to O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

The O
theory O
of O
concept O
( O
or O
Galois O
) O
lattices O
provides O
a O
natural O
and O
formal O
setting O
in O
which O
to O
discover O
and O
represent O
concept O
hierarchies O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
present O
a O
system O
, O
GALOIS O
, O
which O
is O
able O
to O
determine O
the O
concept O
lattice O
corresponding O
to O
a O
given O
set O
of O
objects O
. O

GALOIS O
is O
incremental O
and O
relatively O
efficient O
, O
the O
time O
complexity O
of O
each O
update O
ranging O
from O
O(n O
) O
to O
O(n2 O
) O
where O
n O
is O
the O
number O
of O
concepts O
in O
the O
lattice O
. O

Unlike O
most O
approaches O
to O
conceptual O
clustering O
, O
GALOIS O
represents O
and O
updates O
all O
possible O
classes O
in O
a O
restricted O
concept O
space O
. O

Therefore O
the O
concept O
hierarchies O
it O
finds O
are O
always O
justified O
and O
are O
not O
sensitive O
to O
object O
ordering O
. O

We O
experimentally O
demonstrate O
, O
using O
several O
machine O
learning O
data O
sets O
, O
that O
GALOIS O
can O
be O
successfully O
used O
for O
class O
discovery O
and O
class O
prediction O
. O

We O
also O
point O
out O
applications O
of O
GALOIS O
in O
fields O
related O
to O
machine O
learning O
( O
i.e O
information O
retrieval O
and O
databases O
) O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Network O
administration O
is O
a O
task O
that O
requires O
experience O
in O
relating O
symptoms O
of O
network O
problems O
with O
possible O
causes O
and O

. O

We O
describe O
the O
design O
of O
a O
system O

more O
specifically O
its O
information O
retrieval O
component O
, O
which O
aims O
to O
retrieve O
articles O
relevant O
to O
a O
given O
problem O
case O
from O
a O
collection O
of O
articles O
describing O
previously O
solved O
problems O
and O
their O
associated O
solutions O
. O

An O
article O
is O
described O
by O
a O
term O
vector O
. O

We O
present O
a O
methodology O
for O
defining O
the O
vocabulary O
and O
preliminary O
results O
for O
assessing O
the O

of O

- O

modifications O
to O
the O

. O

We O
obtain O
vocabulary O
- O
derived O
document O
classes O
from O
a O
self- O
organising O
map O
and O
assess O
vocabulary O
quality O
using O
the O
quality O
of O
classification O
into O
these O
classes O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

A O
source O
of O
potential O
systematic O
errors O
in O
information O
retrieval O
is O
identiied O
and O
discussed O
. O

These O
errors O
occur O
when O
base O
- O
form O
reduction O
is O
applied O
with O
a O
( O
necessarily O
) O
nite O
dictionary O
. O

Formal O
methods O
for O
avoiding O
this O
error O
source O
are O
presented O
, O
along O
with O
some O
practical O
complexities O
met O
in O
its O
implementation O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Geographical O
entities O
often O
appears O
in O
very O
different O
forms O
in O
text O
collections O
, O
such O
as O
when O
a O
foreign O
name O
is O
used O
instead O
of O
the O
English O
one O
, O
or O
when O
the O
citation O
of O
some O
region O
or O
place O
omits O
the O
name O
of O
a O
larger O
geographical O
entity O
containing O
them O
. O

This O
is O
a O
known O
problem O
in O
the O
field O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O

The O
use O
of O
an O
ontology O
like O
WordNet O
can O
help O
in O
addressing O
this O
issue O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
an O
automatic O
method O
to O
expand O
the O
geographical O
terms O
in O
queries O
by O
using O
the O
WordNet O
ontology O
and O
another O
method O
that O
expands O
the O
terms O
during O
the O
indexing O
phase O
. O

The O
proposed O
methods O
exploits O
the O
synonymy O
, O
meronymy O
and O
holonymy O
relationships O
provided O
by O
WordNet O
, O
together O
with O
some O
information O
extracted O
from O
the O
gloss O
. O

Recent O
emerging O
technologies O
such O
as O

and O
the O

Wide O

have O

of O

to O

. O

. O

the O
web O
a O
) O

; O

. O

Web O
is O
loaded O
with O
information O
and O
is O
getting O

with O
data O
each O
passing O

. O

There O
needs O
to O
be O

in O
the O

of O

retrieval O
so O
the O
required O

. O

the O

. O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

A O
key O
problem O
in O
Tor O
’s O
architecture O
is O
that O
it O
requires O
users O
to O
maintain O
a O
global O
view O
of O
the O
system O
, O
which O
will O
become O
costly O
as O
the O
size O
of O
the O
network O
increases O
. O

Several O
peer O
- O
to O
- O
peer O
approaches O
have O
been O
proposed O
in O
order O
to O
alleviate O
the O
scalability O
concerns O
of O
the O
Tor O
network O
, O
but O
they O
are O
only O
able O
to O
provide O
heuristic O
security O
; O
in O
fact O
, O
the O
security O
community O
has O
been O
quite O
successful O
at O
breaking O
the O
state O
of O
the O
art O
systems O
using O
both O
passive O
and O
active O
attacks O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
explore O
new O
primitives O
for O
scalable O
anonymous O
communication O
, O
with O
a O
focus O
on O
providing O
provable O
security O
guarantees O
. O

First O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
new O
approach O
for O
secure O
peer O
- O
topeer O
anonymous O
communication O
based O
on O
a O
reciprocal O
neighbor O
policy O
. O

Secondly O
, O
we O
propose O
PIR O
- O
Tor O
, O
a O
clientserver O
scalable O
architecture O
for O
anonymous O
communications O
based O
on O
Private O
Information O
Retrieval O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
information O
structure O
( O
IS O
) O
model O
is O
used O
in O
information O
economics O
to O
evaluate O
the O
expected O
payoff O
from O
imperfect O
information O
and O
to O
recommend O
an O
optimal O
decision O
strategy O
. O

This O
paper O
applies O
the O
IS O
model O
to O
the O
Information O
Filtering O
( O
IF O
) O
problem O
. O

Using O
the O
suggested O
model O
, O
IF O
systems O
can O
be O
rank O
ordered O
, O
when O
the O
user O
payoff O
matrix O
is O
known O
. O

In O
some O
situations O
the O
ordering O
is O
“ O
strong O
that O
is O
, O
independent O
of O
the O
payoff O
matrix O
. O

The O
relation O
between O
the O
commonly O
used O
precision O
and O
recall O
performance O
measure O
and O
the O
IS O
model O
parameters O
is O
derived O
. O

The O
strong O
relation O
is O
translated O
into O
the O
recall O
precision O
plot O
, O
widely O
used O
in O
the O
Information O
Retrieval O
community O
. O

It O
is O
proved O
that O
there O
is O
a O
relation O
between O
the O
precision O
and O
recall O
parameters O
for O
which O
systems O
can O
be O
rank O
ordered O
, O
using O
the O
Blackwell O
theorem O
, O
regardless O
of O
the O
user O
payoff O
matrix O
. O

Topic O
Areas O
Evaluation O
, O
Performance O
, O
Formal O
Models O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
recent O
years O
, O
Nonnegative O
Matrix O
Factorization O
( O
NMF O
) O
has O
received O
considerable O
interest O
from O
the O
data O
mining O
and O
information O
retrieval O
fields O
. O

NMF O
has O
been O
successfully O
applied O
in O
document O
clustering O
, O
image O
representation O
, O
and O
other O
domains O
. O

This O
study O
proposes O
an O
online O
NMF O
( O
ONMF O
) O
algorithm O
to O
efficiently O
handle O
very O
large O
- O
scale O
and/or O
streaming O
datasets O
. O

Unlike O
conventional O
NMF O
solutions O
which O
require O
the O
entire O
data O
matrix O
to O
reside O
in O
the O
memory O
, O
our O
ONMF O
algorithm O
proceeds O
with O
one O
data O
point O
or O
one O
chunk O
of O
data O
points O
at O
a O
time O
. O

Experiments O
with O
one O
- O
pass O
and O
multi O
- O
pass O
ONMF O
on O
real O
datasets O
are O
presented O
. O

This O
paper O
describes O
an O
on O
- O
going O
effort O
to O
combine O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
and O
Information O
Extraction O
( O
IE O
) O
technologies O
, O
to O
leverage O
the O
benefits O
provided O
by O
both O
approaches O
to O
add O
value O
for O
the O
end O
- O
user O
, O
as O
compared O
with O
IR O
or O
IE O
in O
isolation O
. O

The O
main O
aim O
of O
the O
combined O
system O
is O
to O
pool O
together O
information O
from O
multiple O
sources O
to O
improve O
the O
quality O
of O
results O
. O

On O
one O
hand O
, O
multiple O
mentions O
of O
the O
same O
event O
or O
related O
events O
should O
be O
presented O
in O
a O
coherent O
fashion O
. O

On O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
grouping O
related O
events O
should O
improve O
the O
system O
’s O
confidence O
in O
the O
discovered O
facts O
. O

We O
describe O
our O
approach O
and O
the O
results O
achieved O
in O
the O
project O
to O
date O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
forms O
the O
basis O
of O
many O
information O
management O
tasks O
. O

Information O
management O
itself O
has O
become O
an O
extremely O
important O
area O
as O
the O
amount O
of O
electronically O
available O
information O
increases O
dramatically O
. O

There O
are O
numerous O
methods O
of O
performing O
the O
IR O
task O
both O
by O
utilising O
different O
techniques O
and O
through O
using O
different O
representations O
of O
the O
information O
available O
to O
us O
. O

It O
has O
been O
shown O
that O
some O
algorithms O
outperform O
others O
on O
certain O
tasks O
. O

Combining O
the O
results O
produced O
by O
different O
algorithms O
has O
resulted O
in O
superior O
retrieval O
performance O
and O
this O
has O
become O
an O
important O
research O
area O
. O

This O
paper O
introduces O
a O
probability O
- O
based O
fusion O
technique O
probFuse O
that O
shows O
initial O
promise O
in O
addressing O
this O
question O
. O

It O
also O
compares O
probFuse O
with O
the O
common O
CombMNZ O
data O
fusion O
technique O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

MIREX O
2005 O
is O
the O
second O
evaluation O
of O
algorithms O
related O
to O
music O
information O
retrieval O
( O
MIR O
This O
document O
describes O
our O
submission O
to O
the O
MIREX O
audio O
melody O
extraction O
contest O
addressing O
the O
task O
of O
identifying O
the O
melody O
pitch O
contour O
from O
polyphonic O
musical O
audio O
. O

We O
use O
mainly O
a O
data O
- O
driven O
approach O
implementing O
standard O
audio O
signal O
processing O
techniques O
like O
Fourier O
analysis O
, O
instantaneous O
frequency O
estimation O
and O
sinusoidal O
extraction O
. O

Nevertheless O
, O
some O
high O
level O
knowledge O
is O
applied O
. O

Examples O
of O
such O
knowledge O
include O
perceptually O
motivated O
methods O
( O
psychoacoustics O
, O
auditory O
stream O
segregation O
) O
as O
well O
as O
basic O
voice O
- O
leading O
principles O
. O

The O
result O
of O
the O
Mirex O
2005 O
evaluation O
proves O
that O
our O
algorithm O
performs O
best O
in O
respect O
of O
runtime O
and O
overall O
accuracy O
, O
a O
measure O
which O
combines O
voicing O
detection O
( O
discrimination O
between O
melody O
and O
non O
- O
melody O
parts O
) O
and O
pitch O
estimation O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

This O
research O
hypothesises O
the O

- O
model O
as O
a O

for O

of O

. O

of O

in O
the O
relational O
domain O
, O
with O
the O
challenges O
posed O
by O
information O
retrieval O
applications O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
ability O
to O
accurately O
judge O
the O
semantic O
similarity O
between O
words O
is O
critical O
to O
the O
performance O
of O
several O
applications O
such O
as O
Information O
Retrieval O
and O
Natural O
Language O
Processing O
. O

Therefore O
, O
in O
this O
paper O
we O
propose O
a O
semantic O
similarity O
measure O
that O
uses O
in O
one O
hand O
, O
an O
online O
English O
dictionary O
provided O
by O
the O
Semantic O
Atlas O
project O
of O
the O
French O
National O
Centre O
for O
Scientific O
Research O
( O
CNRS O
) O
and O
on O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
a O
page O
counts O
based O
metric O
returned O
by O

-DOCSTART- O

In O
traditional O
commercial O
environment O
, O
business O
information O
retrieval O
is O
limited O
in O
searching O
scope O
and O
quality O
. O

As O
enterprise O
turns O
to O
electronic O
commerce O
( O
EC O
) O
environment O
, O

quality O
of O
business O

on O

and O

of O

. O

This O

resources O

of O

( O

) O

( O

) O

. O

and O

the O

of O
retrieval O
, O
so O
as O
to O
provide O
valuable O
business O
information O
for O
enterprises O
. O

) O

. O

not O

that O
a O
lot O
of O
valuable O
information O
is O
generated O
during O
such O
events O
. O

Further O
, O
meeting O
information O
can O
be O
a O
valuable O
knowledge O
source O
for O
teaching O
and O
learning O
activities O
, O
e.g. O
it O
can O
support O
trainers O
and O
teachers O
in O
identifying O
emerging O
topics O
for O
vocational O
trainings O
and O
for O
the O
provision O
of O
illustrative O
real O
- O
life O
examples O
. O

Indeed O
, O
staff O
members O
and O
learners O
get O
access O
to O
this O
helpful O
information O
in O
order O
to O
solve O
problems O
and O
improve O
their O
skills O
. O

However O
, O
there O
is O
still O
a O
gap O
in O
order O
to O
integrate O
meeting O
information O
into O
teaching O
and O
learning O
activities O
. O

In O
order O
to O
overcome O
this O
problem O
, O
this O
paper O
focuses O
on O
smart O
meeting O
information O
retrieval O
supporting O
teaching O
and O
learning O
purposes O
in O
companies O
and O
research O
institutions O
. O

of O

. O

. O

. O

for O

. O

-DOCSTART- O

Music O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
MIR O
) O
is O
a O
crucial O
topic O
in O
the O
domain O
of O
information O
retrieval O
. O

According O
to O
major O
characteristics O
of O
music O
, O
Query O
- O
by O
- O
Humming O
system O
retrieves O
interesting O
music O
by O
finding O
melody O
that O
contains O
similar O
or O
equal O
melody O
to O
the O
humming O
query O
. O

Basing O
on O
the O
designed O
fuzzy O
inference O
model O
a O
novel O
Query O
- O
by O
- O
Humming O
/ O
Singing O
system O
is O
proposed O
to O
extract O
pitch O
contour O
information O
from O
WAV O
and O
MIDI O
files O
in O
this O
paper O
. O

To O
verify O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
presented O
work O
, O
the O
MIREX O
QBSH O
Database O
is O
employed O
as O
our O
experimental O
database O
and O
a O
large O
amount O
of O
human O
vocal O
data O
is O
used O
as O
query O
to O
test O
the O
robustness O
of O
MIR O
. O

Then O
, O
the O
Longest O
Common O
Subsequence O
( O
LCS O
) O
is O
served O
as O
an O
approximate O
matching O
algorithm O
to O
identify O
the O
most O
related O
top O
5 O
music O
as O
an O
evaluation O
standard O
for O
the O
system O
. O

Experimental O
results O
show O
that O
the O
proposed O
system O
achieves O
85 O
% O
accuracy O
in O
the O
top O
5 O
retrievals O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
empirical O
nature O
of O
Information O
Retrieval O
( O
IR O
) O
mandates O
strong O
experimental O
practices O
. O

The O
Cranfield O
/ O
TREC O
evaluation O
paradigm O
represents O
a O
keystone O
of O
such O
experimental O
practices O
. O

Within O
this O
paradigm O
, O
the O
generation O
of O
relevance O
judgments O
has O
been O
the O
subject O
of O
intense O
scientific O
investigation O
. O

This O
is O
because O
, O
on O
one O
hand O
, O
consistent O
, O
precise O
and O
numerous O
judgements O
are O
key O
to O
reduce O
evaluation O
uncertainty O
and O
test O
collection O
bias O
; O
on O
the O
other O
hand O
, O
however O
, O
relevance O
judgements O
are O
costly O
to O
collect O
. O

The O
selection O
of O
which O
documents O
to O
judge O
for O
relevance O
( O
known O
as O
pooling O
) O
has O
therefore O
great O
impact O
in O
IR O
evaluation O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
contribute O
a O
set O
of O
8 O
novel O
pooling O
strategies O
based O
on O
retrieval O
fusion O
methods O
. O

We O
show O
that O
the O
choice O
of O
the O
pooling O
strategy O
has O
significant O
effects O
on O
the O
cost O
needed O
to O
obtain O
an O
unbiased O
test O
collection O
; O
we O
also O
identify O
the O
best O
performing O
pooling O
strategy O
according O
to O
three O
evaluation O
measure O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

The O
rapid O
development O
of O
network O
technologies O
has O
seen O
the O
use O
of O
network O
as O
a O
media O
for O
file O
storage O
and O
sharing O
. O

Files O
stored O
on O
network O
are O
expected O
to O
be O
shared O
in O
a O
safe O
and O
effective O
manner O
. O

Most O
recent O
researches O
on O
secure O
network O
storage O
focus O
solely O
on O
security O
and O
give O
little O
concern O
to O
support O
for O
information O
retrieval O
and O
in O
turn O
information O
sharing O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
novel O
network O
storage O
model O
which O
integrates O
techniques O
in O
compression O
, O
encryption O
and O
information O
retrieval O
. O

It O
effectively O
satisfies O
the O
concern O
for O
both O
security O
and O
sharing O
. O

Its O
performance O
is O
also O
demonstrated O
via O
experiments O
on O
a O
prototype O
system O
. O

Most O

on O

analysis O
of O

, O

a O
cube O
by O

a O

of O

Work O

of O

to O

. O

to O

. O

( O

Positive O
design O
leads O
to O
positive O
change O
in O
our O
society O
. O

In O
most O
cases O
, O
discussions O
focus O
on O
those O
who O
receive O
the O
design O
. O

However O
, O
positive O
design O
may O
also O
have O
a O
positive O
, O
but O
often O
overlooked O
, O
effect O
on O
the O
designers O
themselves O
. O

Learning O
about O
difficulties O
others O
face O
and O
developing O
solutions O
is O
a O
benefit O
that O
can O
contribute O
to O
individual O
designers’ O
education O
and O
general O
sense O
of O
well O
- O
being O
. O

Having O
a O
broader O
understanding O
of O
alternative O
views O
and O
lifestyles O
makes O
one O
a O
better O
person O
. O

In O

, O

design O
may O

the O

field O
of O

science O
by O
improving O
its O

to O
renew O
itself O
and O
attract O
new O
, O

. O


-DOCSTART- O

Term O
weighting O
methods O
have O
been O
shown O
to O
give O
significant O
increases O
in O
information O
retrieval O
performance O
. O

The O
presence O
of O
pronomial O
references O
in O
documents O
reduces O
the O
term O
frequencies O
of O
associated O
words O
with O
a O
consequent O
effect O
on O
term O
weights O
and O
information O
retrieval O
behaviour O
. O

This O
investigation O
explores O
the O
impact O
on O
information O
retrieval O
performance O
of O
broad O
coverage O
automatic O
pronoun O
resolution O
. O

Results O
indicate O
that O
this O
approach O
has O
potential O
to O
improve O
both O
precision O
at O
fixed O
cutoff O
levels O
and O
average O
precision O
. O

Philosophy O
of O
information O
is O
a O
relatively O
new O
endeavor O
. O

In O
the O

of O
information O
reality O
, O

analyses O
a O
group O
of O
classical O
philosophical O
problems O
such O
as O
the O
principles O
, O
origins O
and O
structures O
of O

the O

of O
existence O
, O
the O

of O
mind O
, O

structures O
of O
language O
and O
meaning O
, O
the O
principles O
of O
logical O
reasoning O
and O
critical O
thinking O
, O
theories O
of O
truth O
, O
and O
ethical O
issues O
( O
e.g O
Floridi O
2002 O
, O
2004a O
, O

science O
is O

. O

of O

, O

-DOCSTART- O

Large O
collections O
of O
full O
- O
text O
documents O
are O
now O
commonly O
used O
in O
automated O
information O
retrieval O
. O

When O
the O
stored O
document O
texts O
are O
long O
, O
the O
retrieval O
of O
complete O
documents O
may O
not O
be O
in O
the O
users O
' O
best O
interest O
. O

In O
such O
circumstance O
, O
efficient O
and O
effective O
retrieval O
results O
may O
be O
obtained O
by O
using O
passage O
retrieval O
strategies O
designed O
to O
retrieve O
text O
excerpts O
of O
varying O
size O
in O
response O
to O
statements O
of O
user O
interest O
. O

New O
approaches O
are O
described O
in O
this O
study O
for O
implementing O
selective O
passage O
retrieval O
systems O
, O
and O
identifying O
text O
passages O
responsive O
to O
particular O
user O
needs O
. O

An O
automated O
encyclopedia O
search O
system O
is O
used O
to O
evaluate O
the O
usefulness O
of O
the O
proposed O
methods O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

In O
this O
report O
, O
we O
describe O
a O
practical O
relevance O
ranking O
procedure O
, O
as O
it O
