evidence O
in O
newspaper O
documents O
, O
and O
measure O
its O
impact O
on O
geographic O
information O
retrieval O
by O
evaluating O
the O
performance O
of O
a O
retrieval O
system O
using O
the O
GeoCLEF O
evaluation O
data O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

XML O
allows O
users O
to O
define O
elements O
using O
arbitrary O
words O
and O
organize O
them O
in O
a O
nested O
structure O
. O

These O
features O
of O
XML O
offer O
both O
challenges O
and O
opportunities O
in O
information O
retrieval O
, O
document O
management O
, O
and O
data O
mining O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
we O
propose O
a O
new O
methodology O
for O
preparing O
XML O
documents O
for O
quantitative O
determination O
of O
similarity O
between O
XML O
documents O
by O
taking O
account O
of O
XML O
semantics O
( O
i.e O
meanings O
of O
the O
elements O
and O
nested O
structures O
of O
XML O
documents O
Accurate O
quantitative O
determination O
of O
similarity O
between O
XML O
documents O
provides O
an O
important O
basis O
for O
a O
variety O
of O
applications O
of O
XML O
document O
mining O
and O
processing O
. O

Experiments O
with O
XML O
documents O
show O
that O
our O
methodology O
provides O
a O
50 O
- O
1 O
00 O
% O
improvement O
in O
determining O
similarity O
, O
over O
the O
traditional O
vector O
- O
space O
model O
that O
considers O
only O
term O
- O
frequency O
and O
100 O
% O
accuracy O
in O
identibins O
the O
category O
of O
each O
document O
from O
an O
on O
- O
line O
bookstore O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

World O
Wide O
Web O
( O
WWW O
) O
is O
information O
rich O
environment O
. O

The O
access O
and O
document O
posted O
on O
WWW O
has O
rapidly O
grown O
since O
it O
was O
popularized O
in O
1990s O
. O

The O
abundance O
of O
information O
on O
WWW O
cause O
information O
overload O
problem O
, O
where O
users O
find O
hard O
to O
filter O
and O
select O
information O
return O
by O
the O
search O
system O
. O

Moreover O
, O
the O
growth O
of O
new O
inexperienced O
users O
creates O
new O
challenges O
for O
information O
retrieval O
researchers O
. O

It O
has O
become O
increasingly O
difficult O
for O
these O
users O
to O
find O
relevant O
documents O
that O
satisfying O
their O
information O
need O
. O

This O
problem O
is O
due O
to O
the O
fact O
that O
this O
category O
of O
user O
is O
unable O
to O
express O
his O
exact O
need O
of O
information O
which O
leads O
to O
the O
use O
of O
inappropriate O
keywords O
or O
queries O
. O

This O
paper O
presents O
a O
study O
of O
the O
user O
searching O
behavior O
on O
query O
formulation O
. O

In O
this O
paper O
, O
query O
formulation O
is O
divided O
into O
two O
categories O
; O
breadth O
and O
depth O
query O
strategies O
. O

The O
findings O
of O
this O
study O
show O
that O
breadth O
query O
strategy O
is O
the O
most O
popular O
strategy O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Fuzzy O
logic O
has O
been O
recognized O
as O
a O
useful O
approach O
for O
information O
retrieval O
. O

It O
helps O
identify O
partially O
matched O
documents O
for O
a O
given O
query O
so O
that O
ranking O
the O
relevant O
documents O
becomes O
straightforward O
. O

Unfortunately O
, O
research O
on O
fuzzy O
information O
retrieval O
only O
focuses O
on O
the O
estimation O
of O
relevancy O
of O
the O
retrieved O
documents O
, O
but O
lacks O
the O
estimation O
of O
imprecise O
probability O
of O
obtaining O
such O
relevant O
documents O
. O

This O
paper O
makes O
an O
attempt O
to O
the O
latter O
. O

It O
extends O
the O
fuzzy O
probability O
( O
FP O
) O
calculation O
method O
proposed O
by O
Huang O
and O
Shi O
to O
an O
enhanced O
FP O
calculation O
method O
. O

Furthermore O
, O
it O
proposes O
a O
novel O
FP O
calculation O
method O
. O

An O
example O
is O
provided O
to O
illustrate O
the O
use O
of O
fuzzy O
probability O
estimation O
. O


-DOCSTART- O

Several O
methods O
have O
been O
proposed O
to O
evaluate O
queries O
over O
a O
native O
XML O
DBMS O
, O
where O
the O
queries O
specify O
both O
path O
and O
keyword O
constraints O
. O

These O
broadly O
consist O
of O
graph O
traversal O
approaches O
, O
optimized O
with O
auxiliary O
structures O
known O
as O
structure O
indexes O
; O
and O
approaches O
based O
on O
information O
- O
retrieval O
style O
inverted O
lists O
. O

We O
propose O
a O
strategy O
that O
combines O
the O
two O
forms O
of O
auxiliary O
indexes O
, O
and O
a O
query O
evaluation O
algorithm O
for O
branching O
path O
expressions O
based O
on O
this O
strategy O
. O

Our O
technique O
is O
general O
and O
applicable O
for O
a O
wide O
range O
of O
choices O
of O
structure O
indexes O
and O
inverted O
list O
join O
algorithms O
. O

Our O
experiments O
over O
the O
Niagara O
XML O
DBMS O
show O
the O
benefit O
of O
integrating O
the O
two O
forms O
of O
indexes O
. O

We O
also O
consider O
algorithmic O
issues O
in O
evaluating O
path O
expression O
queries O
when O
the O
notion O
of O
relevance O
ranking O
is O
incorporated O
. O

By O
integrating O
the O
above O
techniques O
with O
the O
Threshold O
Algorithm O
proposed O
by O
Fagin O
et O
al O
we O
obtain O
instance O
optimal O
algorithms O
to O
push O
down O
top O
k O
computation O
. O
